79/*
80 * Old Vim variables such as "v:version" are also available without the "v:".
81 * Also in functions. We need a special hashtable for them.
82 */
83static hashtab_T compat_hashtab;

85/// Used for checking if local variables or arguments used in a lambda.
86bool_Bool *eval_lavars_used = NULL((void*)0);

88/*
89 * Array to hold the hashtab with variables local to each sourced script.
90 * Each item holds a variable (nameless) that points to the dict_T.
91 */
92typedef struct {
93 ScopeDictDictItem sv_var;
94 dict_T sv_dict;
95} scriptvar_T;
96
97static garray_T ga_scripts = {0, 0, sizeof(scriptvar_T *), 4, NULL((void*)0)};
98#define SCRIPT_SV(id)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1]) (((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1])
99#define SCRIPT_VARS(id)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1])->sv_dict
.dv_hashtab) (SCRIPT_SV(id)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1])->sv_dict.dv_hashtab)

106/*
107 * Info used by a ":for" loop.
108 */
109typedef struct {
110 int fi_semicolon; // TRUE if ending in '; var]'
111 int fi_varcount; // nr of variables in the list
112 listwatch_T fi_lw; // keep an eye on the item used.
113 list_T *fi_list; // list being used
114} forinfo_T;
115
116// values for vv_flags:
117#define VV_COMPAT1 1 // compatible, also used without "v:"
118#define VV_RO2 2 // read-only
119#define VV_RO_SBX4 4 // read-only in the sandbox
120
121#define VV(idx, name, type, flags) \
122 [idx] = { \
123 .vv_name = name, \
124 .vv_di = { \
125 .di_tv = { .v_type = type }, \
126 .di_flags = 0, \
127 .di_key = { 0 }, \
128 }, \
129 .vv_flags = flags, \
130 }
131
132// Array to hold the value of v: variables.
133// The value is in a dictitem, so that it can also be used in the v: scope.
134// The reason to use this table anyway is for very quick access to the
135// variables with the VV_ defines.
136static struct vimvar {
137 char *vv_name; ///< Name of the variable, without v:.
138 TV_DICTITEM_STRUCT(17)struct { typval_T di_tv; uint8_t di_flags; char_u di_key[17];
} vv_di; ///< Value and name for key (max 16 chars).
139 char vv_flags; ///< Flags: #VV_COMPAT, #VV_RO, #VV_RO_SBX.
140} vimvars[] =
141{
142 // VV_ tails differing from upcased string literals:
143 // VV_CC_FROM "charconvert_from"
144 // VV_CC_TO "charconvert_to"
145 // VV_SEND_SERVER "servername"
146 // VV_REG "register"
147 // VV_OP "operator"
148 VV(VV_COUNT, "count", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
149 VV(VV_COUNT1, "count1", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
150 VV(VV_PREVCOUNT, "prevcount", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
151 VV(VV_ERRMSG, "errmsg", VAR_STRING, 0),
152 VV(VV_WARNINGMSG, "warningmsg", VAR_STRING, 0),
153 VV(VV_STATUSMSG, "statusmsg", VAR_STRING, 0),
154 VV(VV_SHELL_ERROR, "shell_error", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
155 VV(VV_THIS_SESSION, "this_session", VAR_STRING, 0),
156 VV(VV_VERSION, "version", VAR_NUMBER, VV_COMPAT1+VV_RO2),
157 VV(VV_LNUM, "lnum", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO_SBX4),
158 VV(VV_TERMRESPONSE, "termresponse", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
159 VV(VV_FNAME, "fname", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
160 VV(VV_LANG, "lang", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
161 VV(VV_LC_TIME, "lc_time", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
162 VV(VV_CTYPE, "ctype", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
163 VV(VV_CC_FROM, "charconvert_from", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
164 VV(VV_CC_TO, "charconvert_to", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
165 VV(VV_FNAME_IN, "fname_in", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
166 VV(VV_FNAME_OUT, "fname_out", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
167 VV(VV_FNAME_NEW, "fname_new", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
168 VV(VV_FNAME_DIFF, "fname_diff", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
169 VV(VV_CMDARG, "cmdarg", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
170 VV(VV_FOLDSTART, "foldstart", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO_SBX4),
171 VV(VV_FOLDEND, "foldend", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO_SBX4),
172 VV(VV_FOLDDASHES, "folddashes", VAR_STRING, VV_RO_SBX4),
173 VV(VV_FOLDLEVEL, "foldlevel", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO_SBX4),
174 VV(VV_PROGNAME, "progname", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
175 VV(VV_SEND_SERVER, "servername", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
176 VV(VV_DYING, "dying", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
177 VV(VV_EXCEPTION, "exception", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
178 VV(VV_THROWPOINT, "throwpoint", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
179 VV(VV_REG, "register", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
180 VV(VV_CMDBANG, "cmdbang", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
181 VV(VV_INSERTMODE, "insertmode", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
182 VV(VV_VAL, "val", VAR_UNKNOWN, VV_RO2),
183 VV(VV_KEY, "key", VAR_UNKNOWN, VV_RO2),
184 VV(VV_PROFILING, "profiling", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
185 VV(VV_FCS_REASON, "fcs_reason", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
186 VV(VV_FCS_CHOICE, "fcs_choice", VAR_STRING, 0),
187 VV(VV_BEVAL_BUFNR, "beval_bufnr", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),

209 VV(VV_OPTION_NEW, "option_new", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
210 VV(VV_OPTION_OLD, "option_old", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
211 VV(VV_OPTION_TYPE, "option_type", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
212 VV(VV_ERRORS, "errors", VAR_LIST, 0),
213 VV(VV_FALSE, "false", VAR_BOOL, VV_RO2),
214 VV(VV_TRUE, "true", VAR_BOOL, VV_RO2),
215 VV(VV_NULL, "null", VAR_SPECIAL, VV_RO2),
216 VV(VV_VIM_DID_ENTER, "vim_did_enter", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
217 VV(VV_TESTING, "testing", VAR_NUMBER, 0),
218 VV(VV_TYPE_NUMBER, "t_number", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
219 VV(VV_TYPE_STRING, "t_string", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
220 VV(VV_TYPE_FUNC, "t_func", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
221 VV(VV_TYPE_LIST, "t_list", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
222 VV(VV_TYPE_DICT, "t_dict", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
223 VV(VV_TYPE_FLOAT, "t_float", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
224 VV(VV_TYPE_BOOL, "t_bool", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
225 VV(VV_EVENT, "event", VAR_DICT, VV_RO2),
226 VV(VV_ECHOSPACE, "echospace", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
227 VV(VV_ARGV, "argv", VAR_LIST, VV_RO2),
228 VV(VV_EXITING, "exiting", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
229 // Neovim
230 VV(VV_STDERR, "stderr", VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO2),
231 VV(VV_MSGPACK_TYPES, "msgpack_types", VAR_DICT, VV_RO2),
232 VV(VV__NULL_STRING, "_null_string", VAR_STRING, VV_RO2),
233 VV(VV__NULL_LIST, "_null_list", VAR_LIST, VV_RO2),

235 VV(VV_LUA, "lua", VAR_PARTIAL, VV_RO2),
236};
237#undef VV

239// shorthand
240#define vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type vv_di.di_tv.v_type
241#define vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number
242#define vv_boolvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_bool vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_bool
243#define vv_specialvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_special vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_special
244#define vv_floatvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_float vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_float
245#define vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string
246#define vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list
247#define vv_dictvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_dict vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_dict
248#define vv_partialvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_partial vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_partial

263static uint64_t last_timer_id = 1;
264static PMap(uint64_t)Map_uint64_t_ptr_t *timers = NULL((void*)0);

266static const char *const msgpack_type_names[] = {
267 [kMPNil] = "nil",
268 [kMPBoolean] = "boolean",
269 [kMPInteger] = "integer",
270 [kMPFloat] = "float",
271 [kMPString] = "string",
272 [kMPBinary] = "binary",
273 [kMPArray] = "array",
274 [kMPMap] = "map",
275 [kMPExt] = "ext",
276};
277const list_T *eval_msgpack_type_lists[] = {
278 [kMPNil] = NULL((void*)0),
279 [kMPBoolean] = NULL((void*)0),
280 [kMPInteger] = NULL((void*)0),
281 [kMPFloat] = NULL((void*)0),
282 [kMPString] = NULL((void*)0),
283 [kMPBinary] = NULL((void*)0),
284 [kMPArray] = NULL((void*)0),
285 [kMPMap] = NULL((void*)0),
286 [kMPExt] = NULL((void*)0),
287};
288
289// Return "n1" divided by "n2", taking care of dividing by zero.
290varnumber_T num_divide(varnumber_T n1, varnumber_T n2)
291 FUNC_ATTR_CONST FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
292{
293 varnumber_T result;
294
295 if (n2 == 0) { // give an error message?
296 if (n1 == 0) {
297 result = VARNUMBER_MIN(-9223372036854775807L -1); // similar to NaN
298 } else if (n1 < 0) {
299 result = -VARNUMBER_MAX(9223372036854775807L);
300 } else {
301 result = VARNUMBER_MAX(9223372036854775807L);
302 }
303 } else {
304 result = n1 / n2;
305 }
306
307 return result;
308}
309
310// Return "n1" modulus "n2", taking care of dividing by zero.
311varnumber_T num_modulus(varnumber_T n1, varnumber_T n2)
312 FUNC_ATTR_CONST FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
313{
314 // Give an error when n2 is 0?
315 return (n2 == 0) ? 0 : (n1 % n2);
316}
317
318/*
319 * Initialize the global and v: variables.
320 */
321void eval_init(void)
322{
323 vimvars[VV_VERSION].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = VIM_VERSION_100(8 * 100 + 0);
324
325 timers = pmap_new(uint64_t)map_uint64_t_ptr_t_new();
326 struct vimvar *p;
327
328 init_var_dict(&globvardict, &globvars_var, VAR_DEF_SCOPE);
329 init_var_dict(&vimvardict, &vimvars_var, VAR_SCOPE);
330 vimvardict.dv_lock = VAR_FIXED;
331 hash_init(&compat_hashtab);
332 func_init();
333
334 for (size_t i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(vimvars)((sizeof(vimvars)/sizeof((vimvars)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(
vimvars) % sizeof((vimvars)[0]))))); i++) {
335 p = &vimvars[i];
336 assert(STRLEN(p->vv_name) <= 16)((void) sizeof ((strlen((char *)(p->vv_name)) <= 16) ? 1
: 0), __extension__ ({ if (strlen((char *)(p->vv_name)) <=
16) ; else __assert_fail ("STRLEN(p->vv_name) <= 16", "../src/nvim/eval.c"
, 336, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
337 STRCPY(p->vv_di.di_key, p->vv_name)strcpy((char *)(p->vv_di.di_key), (char *)(p->vv_name));
338 if (p->vv_flags & VV_RO2)
339 p->vv_di.di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO | DI_FLAGS_FIX;
340 else if (p->vv_flags & VV_RO_SBX4)
341 p->vv_di.di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO_SBX | DI_FLAGS_FIX;
342 else
343 p->vv_di.di_flags = DI_FLAGS_FIX;
344
345 // add to v: scope dict, unless the value is not always available
346 if (p->vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
347 hash_add(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, p->vv_di.di_key);
348 }
349 if (p->vv_flags & VV_COMPAT1) {
350 // add to compat scope dict
351 hash_add(&compat_hashtab, p->vv_di.di_key);
352 }
353 }
354 vimvars[VV_VERSION].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = VIM_VERSION_100(8 * 100 + 0);
355
356 dict_T *const msgpack_types_dict = tv_dict_alloc();
357 for (size_t i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(msgpack_type_names)((sizeof(msgpack_type_names)/sizeof((msgpack_type_names)[0]))
/ ((size_t)(!(sizeof(msgpack_type_names) % sizeof((msgpack_type_names
)[0]))))); i++) {
358 list_T *const type_list = tv_list_alloc(0);
359 tv_list_set_lock(type_list, VAR_FIXED);
360 tv_list_ref(type_list);
361 dictitem_T *const di = tv_dict_item_alloc(msgpack_type_names[i]);
362 di->di_flags |= DI_FLAGS_RO|DI_FLAGS_FIX;
363 di->di_tv = (typval_T) {
364 .v_type = VAR_LIST,
365 .vval = { .v_list = type_list, },
366 };
367 eval_msgpack_type_lists[i] = type_list;
368 if (tv_dict_add(msgpack_types_dict, di) == FAIL0) {
369 // There must not be duplicate items in this dictionary by definition.
370 abort();
371 }
372 }
373 msgpack_types_dict->dv_lock = VAR_FIXED;
374
375 set_vim_var_dict(VV_MSGPACK_TYPES, msgpack_types_dict);
376 set_vim_var_dict(VV_COMPLETED_ITEM, tv_dict_alloc());
377
378 dict_T *v_event = tv_dict_alloc();
379 v_event->dv_lock = VAR_FIXED;
380 set_vim_var_dict(VV_EVENT, v_event);
381 set_vim_var_list(VV_ERRORS, tv_list_alloc(kListLenUnknown));
382 set_vim_var_nr(VV_STDERR, CHAN_STDERR2);
383 set_vim_var_nr(VV_SEARCHFORWARD, 1L);
384 set_vim_var_nr(VV_HLSEARCH, 1L);
385 set_vim_var_nr(VV_COUNT1, 1);
386 set_vim_var_nr(VV_TYPE_NUMBER, VAR_TYPE_NUMBER0);
387 set_vim_var_nr(VV_TYPE_STRING, VAR_TYPE_STRING1);
388 set_vim_var_nr(VV_TYPE_FUNC, VAR_TYPE_FUNC2);
389 set_vim_var_nr(VV_TYPE_LIST, VAR_TYPE_LIST3);
390 set_vim_var_nr(VV_TYPE_DICT, VAR_TYPE_DICT4);
391 set_vim_var_nr(VV_TYPE_FLOAT, VAR_TYPE_FLOAT5);
392 set_vim_var_nr(VV_TYPE_BOOL, VAR_TYPE_BOOL6);
393
394 set_vim_var_bool(VV_FALSE, kBoolVarFalse);
395 set_vim_var_bool(VV_TRUE, kBoolVarTrue);
396 set_vim_var_special(VV_NULL, kSpecialVarNull);
397 set_vim_var_special(VV_EXITING, kSpecialVarNull);
398
399 set_vim_var_nr(VV_ECHOSPACE, sc_col - 1);
400
401 vimvars[VV_LUA].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_PARTIAL;
402 vvlua_partial = xcalloc(1, sizeof(partial_T));
403 vimvars[VV_LUA].vv_partialvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_partial = vvlua_partial;
404 // this value shouldn't be printed, but if it is, do not crash
405 vvlua_partial->pt_name = xmallocz(0);
406 vvlua_partial->pt_refcount++;
407
408 set_reg_var(0); // default for v:register is not 0 but '"'
409}
410
411#if defined(EXITFREE)
412void eval_clear(void)
413{
414 struct vimvar *p;
415
416 for (size_t i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(vimvars)((sizeof(vimvars)/sizeof((vimvars)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(
vimvars) % sizeof((vimvars)[0]))))); i++) {
417 p = &vimvars[i];
418 if (p->vv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING) {
419 XFREE_CLEAR(p->vv_str)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(p->vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string
); xfree(*ptr_); *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (
0);
420 } else if (p->vv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_LIST) {
421 tv_list_unref(p->vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list);
422 p->vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list = NULL((void*)0);
423 }
424 }
425 hash_clear(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab);
426 hash_init(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab); // garbage_collect() will access it
427 hash_clear(&compat_hashtab);
428
429 free_scriptnames();
430 free_locales();
431
432 // global variables
433 vars_clear(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab);
434
435 // autoloaded script names
436 ga_clear_strings(&ga_loaded);
437
438 /* Script-local variables. First clear all the variables and in a second
439 * loop free the scriptvar_T, because a variable in one script might hold
440 * a reference to the whole scope of another script. */
441 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i)
442 vars_clear(&SCRIPT_VARS(i)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1])->sv_dict.
dv_hashtab));
443 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i)
444 xfree(SCRIPT_SV(i)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1]));
445 ga_clear(&ga_scripts);
446
447 // unreferenced lists and dicts
448 (void)garbage_collect(false0);
449
450 // functions not garbage collected
451 free_all_functions();
452}
453
454#endif
455
456/*
457 * Set an internal variable to a string value. Creates the variable if it does
458 * not already exist.
459 */
460void set_internal_string_var(const char *name, char_u *value)
461 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1)
462{
463 typval_T tv = {
464 .v_type = VAR_STRING,
465 .vval.v_string = value,
466 };
467
468 set_var(name, strlen(name), &tv, true1);
469}
470
471static lval_T *redir_lval = NULL((void*)0);
472static garray_T redir_ga; // Only valid when redir_lval is not NULL.
473static char_u *redir_endp = NULL((void*)0);
474static char_u *redir_varname = NULL((void*)0);
475
476/*
477 * Start recording command output to a variable
478 * Returns OK if successfully completed the setup. FAIL otherwise.
479 */
480int
481var_redir_start(
482 char_u *name,
483 int append // append to an existing variable
484)
485{
486 int save_emsg;
487 int err;
488 typval_T tv;
489
490 // Catch a bad name early.
491 if (!eval_isnamec1(*name)) {
492 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
493 return FAIL0;
494 }
495
496 // Make a copy of the name, it is used in redir_lval until redir ends.
497 redir_varname = vim_strsave(name);
498
499 redir_lval = xcalloc(1, sizeof(lval_T));
500
501 // The output is stored in growarray "redir_ga" until redirection ends.
502 ga_init(&redir_ga, (int)sizeof(char), 500);
503
504 // Parse the variable name (can be a dict or list entry).
505 redir_endp = (char_u *)get_lval(redir_varname, NULL((void*)0), redir_lval, false0, false0,
506 0, FNE_CHECK_START2);
507 if (redir_endp == NULL((void*)0) || redir_lval->ll_name == NULL((void*)0)
508 || *redir_endp != NUL'\000') {
509 clear_lval(redir_lval);
510 if (redir_endp != NULL((void*)0) && *redir_endp != NUL'\000') {
511 // Trailing characters are present after the variable name
512 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
513 } else {
514 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
515 }
516 redir_endp = NULL((void*)0); // don't store a value, only cleanup
517 var_redir_stop();
518 return FAIL0;
519 }
520
521 /* check if we can write to the variable: set it to or append an empty
522 * string */
523 save_emsg = did_emsg;
524 did_emsg = FALSE0;
525 tv.v_type = VAR_STRING;
526 tv.vval.v_string = (char_u *)"";
527 if (append) {
528 set_var_lval(redir_lval, redir_endp, &tv, true1, false0, ".");
529 } else {
530 set_var_lval(redir_lval, redir_endp, &tv, true1, false0, "=");
531 }
532 clear_lval(redir_lval);
533 err = did_emsg;
534 did_emsg |= save_emsg;
535 if (err) {
536 redir_endp = NULL((void*)0); // don't store a value, only cleanup
537 var_redir_stop();
538 return FAIL0;
539 }
540
541 return OK1;
542}
543
544/*
545 * Append "value[value_len]" to the variable set by var_redir_start().
546 * The actual appending is postponed until redirection ends, because the value
547 * appended may in fact be the string we write to, changing it may cause freed
548 * memory to be used:
549 * :redir => foo
550 * :let foo
551 * :redir END
552 */
553void var_redir_str(char_u *value, int value_len)
554{
555 int len;
556
557 if (redir_lval == NULL((void*)0))
558 return;
559
560 if (value_len == -1) {
561 len = (int)STRLEN(value)strlen((char *)(value)); // Append the entire string
562 } else {
563 len = value_len; // Append only "value_len" characters
564 }
565
566 ga_grow(&redir_ga, len);
567 memmove((char *)redir_ga.ga_data + redir_ga.ga_len, value, len);
568 redir_ga.ga_len += len;
569}
570
571/*
572 * Stop redirecting command output to a variable.
573 * Frees the allocated memory.
574 */
575void var_redir_stop(void)
576{
577 typval_T tv;
578
579 if (redir_lval != NULL((void*)0)) {
580 // If there was no error: assign the text to the variable.
581 if (redir_endp != NULL((void*)0)) {
582 ga_append(&redir_ga, NUL'\000'); // Append the trailing NUL.
583 tv.v_type = VAR_STRING;
584 tv.vval.v_string = redir_ga.ga_data;
585 // Call get_lval() again, if it's inside a Dict or List it may
586 // have changed.
587 redir_endp = (char_u *)get_lval(redir_varname, NULL((void*)0), redir_lval,
588 false0, false0, 0, FNE_CHECK_START2);
589 if (redir_endp != NULL((void*)0) && redir_lval->ll_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
590 set_var_lval(redir_lval, redir_endp, &tv, false0, false0, ".");
591 }
592 clear_lval(redir_lval);
593 }
594
595 // free the collected output
596 XFREE_CLEAR(redir_ga.ga_data)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(redir_ga.ga_data); xfree(*ptr_
); *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
597
598 XFREE_CLEAR(redir_lval)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(redir_lval); xfree(*ptr_); *
ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
599 }
600 XFREE_CLEAR(redir_varname)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(redir_varname); xfree(*ptr_
); *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
601}
602
603int eval_charconvert(const char *const enc_from, const char *const enc_to,
604 const char *const fname_from, const char *const fname_to)
605{
606 bool_Bool err = false0;
607
608 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_FROM, enc_from, -1);
609 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_TO, enc_to, -1);
610 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, fname_from, -1);
611 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, fname_to, -1);
612 if (eval_to_bool(p_ccv, &err, NULL((void*)0), false0)) {
613 err = true1;
614 }
615 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_FROM, NULL((void*)0), -1);
616 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_TO, NULL((void*)0), -1);
617 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
618 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, NULL((void*)0), -1);
619
620 if (err) {
621 return FAIL0;
622 }
623 return OK1;
624}
625
626int eval_printexpr(const char *const fname, const char *const args)
627{
628 bool_Bool err = false0;
629
630 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, fname, -1);
631 set_vim_var_string(VV_CMDARG, args, -1);
632 if (eval_to_bool(p_pexpr, &err, NULL((void*)0), false0)) {
633 err = true1;
634 }
635 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
636 set_vim_var_string(VV_CMDARG, NULL((void*)0), -1);
637
638 if (err) {
639 os_remove(fname);
640 return FAIL0;
641 }
642 return OK1;
643}
644
645void eval_diff(const char *const origfile, const char *const newfile,
646 const char *const outfile)
647{
648 bool_Bool err = false0;
649
650 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, origfile, -1);
651 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_NEW, newfile, -1);
652 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, outfile, -1);
653 (void)eval_to_bool(p_dex, &err, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
654 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
655 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_NEW, NULL((void*)0), -1);
656 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, NULL((void*)0), -1);
657}
658
659void eval_patch(const char *const origfile, const char *const difffile,
660 const char *const outfile)
661{
662 bool_Bool err = false0;
663
664 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, origfile, -1);
665 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_DIFF, difffile, -1);
666 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, outfile, -1);
667 (void)eval_to_bool(p_pex, &err, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
668 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
669 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_DIFF, NULL((void*)0), -1);
670 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, NULL((void*)0), -1);
671}
672
673/*
674 * Top level evaluation function, returning a boolean.
675 * Sets "error" to TRUE if there was an error.
676 * Return TRUE or FALSE.
677 */
678int
679eval_to_bool(
680 char_u *arg,
681 bool_Bool *error,
682 char_u **nextcmd,
683 int skip // only parse, don't execute
684)
685{
686 typval_T tv;
687 bool_Bool retval = false0;
688
689 if (skip) {
690 emsg_skip++;
691 }
692 if (eval0(arg, &tv, nextcmd, !skip) == FAIL0) {
693 *error = true1;
694 } else {
695 *error = false0;
696 if (!skip) {
697 retval = (tv_get_number_chk(&tv, error) != 0);
698 tv_clear(&tv);
699 }
700 }
701 if (skip) {
702 emsg_skip--;
703 }
704
705 return retval;
706}
707
708// Call eval1() and give an error message if not done at a lower level.
709static int eval1_emsg(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, bool_Bool evaluate)
710 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1, 2)
711{
712 const char_u *const start = *arg;
713 const int did_emsg_before = did_emsg;
714 const int called_emsg_before = called_emsg;
715
716 const int ret = eval1(arg, rettv, evaluate);
717 if (ret == FAIL0) {
718 // Report the invalid expression unless the expression evaluation has
719 // been cancelled due to an aborting error, an interrupt, or an
720 // exception, or we already gave a more specific error.
721 // Also check called_emsg for when using assert_fails().
722 if (!aborting()
723 && did_emsg == did_emsg_before
724 && called_emsg == called_emsg_before) {
725 emsgf(_(e_invexpr2)gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2)), start);
726 }
727 }
728 return ret;
729}
730
731int eval_expr_typval(const typval_T *expr, typval_T *argv,
732 int argc, typval_T *rettv)
733 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1, 2, 4)
734{
735 int dummy;
736
737 if (expr->v_type == VAR_FUNC) {
738 const char_u *const s = expr->vval.v_string;
739 if (s == NULL((void*)0) || *s == NUL'\000') {
740 return FAIL0;
741 }
742 if (call_func(s, -1, rettv, argc, argv, NULL((void*)0),
743 0L, 0L, &dummy, true1, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0)) == FAIL0) {
744 return FAIL0;
745 }
746 } else if (expr->v_type == VAR_PARTIAL) {
747 partial_T *const partial = expr->vval.v_partial;
748 const char_u *const s = partial_name(partial);
749 if (s == NULL((void*)0) || *s == NUL'\000') {
750 return FAIL0;
751 }
752 if (call_func(s, -1, rettv, argc, argv, NULL((void*)0),
753 0L, 0L, &dummy, true1, partial, NULL((void*)0)) == FAIL0) {
754 return FAIL0;
755 }
756 } else {
757 char buf[NUMBUFLEN];
758 char_u *s = (char_u *)tv_get_string_buf_chk(expr, buf);
759 if (s == NULL((void*)0)) {
760 return FAIL0;
761 }
762 s = skipwhite(s);
763 if (eval1_emsg(&s, rettv, true1) == FAIL0) {
764 return FAIL0;
765 }
766 if (*skipwhite(s) != NUL'\000') { // check for trailing chars after expr
767 tv_clear(rettv);
768 emsgf(_(e_invexpr2)gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2)), s);
769 return FAIL0;
770 }
771 }
772 return OK1;
773}
774
775/// Like eval_to_bool() but using a typval_T instead of a string.
776/// Works for string, funcref and partial.
777bool_Bool eval_expr_to_bool(const typval_T *expr, bool_Bool *error)
778 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1, 2)
779{
780 typval_T argv, rettv;
781
782 if (eval_expr_typval(expr, &argv, 0, &rettv) == FAIL0) {
783 *error = true1;
784 return false0;
785 }
786 const bool_Bool res = (tv_get_number_chk(&rettv, error) != 0);
787 tv_clear(&rettv);
788 return res;
789}
790
791/// Top level evaluation function, returning a string
792///
793/// @param[in] arg String to evaluate.
794/// @param nextcmd Pointer to the start of the next Ex command.
795/// @param[in] skip If true, only do parsing to nextcmd without reporting
796/// errors or actually evaluating anything.
797///
798/// @return [allocated] string result of evaluation or NULL in case of error or
799/// when skipping.
800char *eval_to_string_skip(const char *arg, const char **nextcmd,
801 const bool_Bool skip)
802 FUNC_ATTR_MALLOC FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1) FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
803{
804 typval_T tv;
805 char *retval;
806
807 if (skip) {
808 emsg_skip++;
809 }
810 if (eval0((char_u *)arg, &tv, (char_u **)nextcmd, !skip) == FAIL0 || skip) {
811 retval = NULL((void*)0);
812 } else {
813 retval = xstrdup(tv_get_string(&tv));
814 tv_clear(&tv);
815 }
816 if (skip) {
817 emsg_skip--;
818 }
819
820 return retval;
821}
822
823/*
824 * Skip over an expression at "*pp".
825 * Return FAIL for an error, OK otherwise.
826 */
827int skip_expr(char_u **pp)
828{
829 typval_T rettv;
830
831 *pp = skipwhite(*pp);
832 return eval1(pp, &rettv, FALSE0);
833}
834
835/*
836 * Top level evaluation function, returning a string.
837 * When "convert" is TRUE convert a List into a sequence of lines and convert
838 * a Float to a String.
839 * Return pointer to allocated memory, or NULL for failure.
840 */
841char_u *eval_to_string(char_u *arg, char_u **nextcmd, int convert)
842{
843 typval_T tv;
844 char *retval;
845 garray_T ga;
846
847 if (eval0(arg, &tv, nextcmd, true1) == FAIL0) {
848 retval = NULL((void*)0);
849 } else {
850 if (convert && tv.v_type == VAR_LIST) {
851 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char), 80);
852 if (tv.vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
853 tv_list_join(&ga, tv.vval.v_list, "\n");
854 if (tv_list_len(tv.vval.v_list) > 0) {
855 ga_append(&ga, NL'\012');
856 }
857 }
858 ga_append(&ga, NUL'\000');
859 retval = (char *)ga.ga_data;
860 } else if (convert && tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
861 char numbuf[NUMBUFLEN];
862 vim_snprintf(numbuf, NUMBUFLEN, "%g", tv.vval.v_float);
863 retval = xstrdup(numbuf);
864 } else {
865 retval = xstrdup(tv_get_string(&tv));
866 }
867 tv_clear(&tv);
868 }
869
870 return (char_u *)retval;
871}
872
873/*
874 * Call eval_to_string() without using current local variables and using
875 * textlock. When "use_sandbox" is TRUE use the sandbox.
876 */
877char_u *eval_to_string_safe(char_u *arg, char_u **nextcmd, int use_sandbox)
878{
879 char_u *retval;
880 funccal_entry_T funccal_entry;
881
882 save_funccal(&funccal_entry);
883 if (use_sandbox) {
884 sandbox++;
885 }
886 textlock++;
887 retval = eval_to_string(arg, nextcmd, false0);
888 if (use_sandbox) {
889 sandbox--;
890 }
891 textlock--;
892 restore_funccal();
893 return retval;
894}
895
896/*
897 * Top level evaluation function, returning a number.
898 * Evaluates "expr" silently.
899 * Returns -1 for an error.
900 */
901varnumber_T eval_to_number(char_u *expr)
902{
903 typval_T rettv;
904 varnumber_T retval;
905 char_u *p = skipwhite(expr);
906
907 ++emsg_off;
908
909 if (eval1(&p, &rettv, true1) == FAIL0) {
910 retval = -1;
911 } else {
912 retval = tv_get_number_chk(&rettv, NULL((void*)0));
913 tv_clear(&rettv);
914 }
915 --emsg_off;
916
917 return retval;
918}
919
920// Top level evaluation function.
921// Returns an allocated typval_T with the result.
922// Returns NULL when there is an error.
923typval_T *eval_expr(char_u *arg)
924{
925 typval_T *tv = xmalloc(sizeof(*tv));
926 if (eval0(arg, tv, NULL((void*)0), true1) == FAIL0) {
927 XFREE_CLEAR(tv)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(tv); xfree(*ptr_); *ptr_ = (
(void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
928 }
929 return tv;
930}
931
932/*
933 * Prepare v: variable "idx" to be used.
934 * Save the current typeval in "save_tv".
935 * When not used yet add the variable to the v: hashtable.
936 */
937void prepare_vimvar(int idx, typval_T *save_tv)
938{
939 *save_tv = vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv;
940 if (vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN)
941 hash_add(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, vimvars[idx].vv_di.di_key);
942}
943
944/*
945 * Restore v: variable "idx" to typeval "save_tv".
946 * When no longer defined, remove the variable from the v: hashtable.
947 */
948void restore_vimvar(int idx, typval_T *save_tv)
949{
950 hashitem_T *hi;
951
952 vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv = *save_tv;
953 if (vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN) {
954 hi = hash_find(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, vimvars[idx].vv_di.di_key);
955 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) {
956 internal_error("restore_vimvar()");
957 } else {
958 hash_remove(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, hi);
959 }
960 }
961}
962
963/// If there is a window for "curbuf", make it the current window.
964void find_win_for_curbuf(void)
965{
966 for (wininfo_T *wip = curbuf->b_wininfo; wip != NULL((void*)0); wip = wip->wi_next) {
967 if (wip->wi_win != NULL((void*)0)) {
968 curwin = wip->wi_win;
969 break;
970 }
971 }
972}
973
974/*
975 * Evaluate an expression to a list with suggestions.
976 * For the "expr:" part of 'spellsuggest'.
977 * Returns NULL when there is an error.
978 */
979list_T *eval_spell_expr(char_u *badword, char_u *expr)
980{
981 typval_T save_val;
982 typval_T rettv;
983 list_T *list = NULL((void*)0);
984 char_u *p = skipwhite(expr);
985
986 // Set "v:val" to the bad word.
987 prepare_vimvar(VV_VAL, &save_val);
988 vimvars[VV_VAL].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING;
989 vimvars[VV_VAL].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = badword;
990 if (p_verbose == 0)
991 ++emsg_off;
992
993 if (eval1(&p, &rettv, true1) == OK1) {
994 if (rettv.v_type != VAR_LIST) {
995 tv_clear(&rettv);
996 } else {
997 list = rettv.vval.v_list;
998 }
999 }
1000
1001 if (p_verbose == 0)
1002 --emsg_off;
1003 restore_vimvar(VV_VAL, &save_val);
1004
1005 return list;
1006}
1007
1008/// Get spell word from an entry from spellsuggest=expr:
1009///
1010/// Entry in question is supposed to be a list (to be checked by the caller)
1011/// with two items: a word and a score represented as an unsigned number
1012/// (whether it actually is unsigned is not checked).
1013///
1014/// Used to get the good word and score from the eval_spell_expr() result.
1015///
1016/// @param[in] list List to get values from.
1017/// @param[out] ret_word Suggested word. Not initialized if return value is
1018/// -1.
1019///
1020/// @return -1 in case of error, score otherwise.
1021int get_spellword(list_T *const list, const char **ret_word)
1022{
1023 if (tv_list_len(list) != 2) {
1024 EMSG(_("E5700: Expression from 'spellsuggest' must yield lists with "emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E5700: Expression from 'spellsuggest' must yield lists with "
"exactly two values"))))
1025 "exactly two values"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E5700: Expression from 'spellsuggest' must yield lists with "
"exactly two values"))));
1026 return -1;
1027 }
1028 *ret_word = tv_list_find_str(list, 0);
1029 if (*ret_word == NULL((void*)0)) {
1030 return -1;
1031 }
1032 return tv_list_find_nr(list, -1, NULL((void*)0));
1033}
1034
1035
1036// Call some vim script function and return the result in "*rettv".
1037// Uses argv[0] to argv[argc-1] for the function arguments. argv[argc]
1038// should have type VAR_UNKNOWN.
1039//
1040// Return OK or FAIL.
1041int call_vim_function(
1042 const char_u *func,
1043 int argc,
1044 typval_T *argv,
1045 typval_T *rettv
1046)
1047 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
1048{
1049 int doesrange;
1050 int ret;
1051 int len = (int)STRLEN(func)strlen((char *)(func));
1052 partial_T *pt = NULL((void*)0);
1053
1054 if (len >= 6 && !memcmp(func, "v:lua.", 6)) {
1055 func += 6;
1056 len = check_luafunc_name((const char *)func, false0);
1057 if (len == 0) {
1058 ret = FAIL0;
1059 goto fail;
1060 }
1061 pt = vvlua_partial;
1062 }
1063
1064 rettv->v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN; // tv_clear() uses this.
1065 ret = call_func(func, len, rettv, argc, argv, NULL((void*)0),
1066 curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
1067 &doesrange, true1, pt, NULL((void*)0));
1068
1069fail:
1070 if (ret == FAIL0) {
1071 tv_clear(rettv);
1072 }
1073
1074 return ret;
1075}
1076/// Call Vim script function and return the result as a number
1077///
1078/// @param[in] func Function name.
1079/// @param[in] argc Number of arguments.
1080/// @param[in] argv Array with typval_T arguments.
1081///
1082/// @return -1 when calling function fails, result of function otherwise.
1083varnumber_T call_func_retnr(const char_u *func, int argc,
1084 typval_T *argv)
1085 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
1086{
1087 typval_T rettv;
1088 varnumber_T retval;
1089
1090 if (call_vim_function(func, argc, argv, &rettv) == FAIL0) {
1091 return -1;
1092 }
1093 retval = tv_get_number_chk(&rettv, NULL((void*)0));
1094 tv_clear(&rettv);
1095 return retval;
1096}
1097/// Call Vim script function and return the result as a string
1098///
1099/// @param[in] func Function name.
1100/// @param[in] argc Number of arguments.
1101/// @param[in] argv Array with typval_T arguments.
1102///
1103/// @return [allocated] NULL when calling function fails, allocated string
1104/// otherwise.
1105char *call_func_retstr(const char *const func, int argc,
1106 typval_T *argv)
1107 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_MALLOC
1108{
1109 typval_T rettv;
1110 // All arguments are passed as strings, no conversion to number.
1111 if (call_vim_function((const char_u *)func, argc, argv, &rettv)
1112 == FAIL0) {
1113 return NULL((void*)0);
1114 }
1115
1116 char *const retval = xstrdup(tv_get_string(&rettv));
1117 tv_clear(&rettv);
1118 return retval;
1119}
1120/// Call Vim script function and return the result as a List
1121///
1122/// @param[in] func Function name.
1123/// @param[in] argc Number of arguments.
1124/// @param[in] argv Array with typval_T arguments.
1125///
1126/// @return [allocated] NULL when calling function fails or return tv is not a
1127/// List, allocated List otherwise.
1128void *call_func_retlist(const char_u *func, int argc, typval_T *argv)
1129 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
1130{
1131 typval_T rettv;
1132
1133 // All arguments are passed as strings, no conversion to number.
1134 if (call_vim_function(func, argc, argv, &rettv) == FAIL0) {
1135 return NULL((void*)0);
1136 }
1137
1138 if (rettv.v_type != VAR_LIST) {
1139 tv_clear(&rettv);
1140 return NULL((void*)0);
1141 }
1142
1143 return rettv.vval.v_list;
1144}
1145
1146/*
1147 * Prepare profiling for entering a child or something else that is not
1148 * counted for the script/function itself.
1149 * Should always be called in pair with prof_child_exit().
1150 */
1151void prof_child_enter(
1152 proftime_T *tm // place to store waittime
1153)
1154{
1155 funccall_T *fc = get_current_funccal();
1156
1157 if (fc != NULL((void*)0) && fc->func->uf_profiling) {
1158 fc->prof_child = profile_start();
1159 }
1160
1161 script_prof_save(tm);
1162}
1163
1164/*
1165 * Take care of time spent in a child.
1166 * Should always be called after prof_child_enter().
1167 */
1168void prof_child_exit(
1169 proftime_T *tm // where waittime was stored
1170)
1171{
1172 funccall_T *fc = get_current_funccal();
1173
1174 if (fc != NULL((void*)0) && fc->func->uf_profiling) {
1175 fc->prof_child = profile_end(fc->prof_child);
1176 // don't count waiting time
1177 fc->prof_child = profile_sub_wait(*tm, fc->prof_child);
1178 fc->func->uf_tm_children =
1179 profile_add(fc->func->uf_tm_children, fc->prof_child);
1180 fc->func->uf_tml_children =
1181 profile_add(fc->func->uf_tml_children, fc->prof_child);
1182 }
1183 script_prof_restore(tm);
1184}
1185
1186
1187/*
1188 * Evaluate 'foldexpr'. Returns the foldlevel, and any character preceding
1189 * it in "*cp". Doesn't give error messages.
1190 */
1191int eval_foldexpr(char_u *arg, int *cp)
1192{
1193 typval_T tv;
1194 varnumber_T retval;
1195 int use_sandbox = was_set_insecurely(curwin, (char_u *)"foldexpr", OPT_LOCAL);
1196
1197 ++emsg_off;
1198 if (use_sandbox)
1199 ++sandbox;
1200 ++textlock;
1201 *cp = NUL'\000';
1202 if (eval0(arg, &tv, NULL((void*)0), true1) == FAIL0) {
1203 retval = 0;
1204 } else {
1205 // If the result is a number, just return the number.
1206 if (tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER) {
1207 retval = tv.vval.v_number;
1208 } else if (tv.v_type != VAR_STRING || tv.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0)) {
1209 retval = 0;
1210 } else {
1211 // If the result is a string, check if there is a non-digit before
1212 // the number.
1213 char_u *s = tv.vval.v_string;
1214 if (!ascii_isdigit(*s) && *s != '-') {
1215 *cp = *s++;
1216 }
1217 retval = atol((char *)s);
1218 }
1219 tv_clear(&tv);
1220 }
1221 --emsg_off;
1222 if (use_sandbox)
1223 --sandbox;
1224 --textlock;
1225
1226 return (int)retval;
1227}
1228
1229// ":cons[t] var = expr1" define constant
1230// ":cons[t] [name1, name2, ...] = expr1" define constants unpacking list
1231// ":cons[t] [name, ..., ; lastname] = expr" define constants unpacking list
1232void ex_const(exarg_T *eap)
1233{
1234 ex_let_const(eap, true1);
1235}
1236
1237// Get a list of lines from a HERE document. The here document is a list of
1238// lines surrounded by a marker.
1239// cmd << {marker}
1240// {line1}
1241// {line2}
1242// ....
1243// {marker}
1244//
1245// The {marker} is a string. If the optional 'trim' word is supplied before the
1246// marker, then the leading indentation before the lines (matching the
1247// indentation in the 'cmd' line) is stripped.
1248// Returns a List with {lines} or NULL.
1249static list_T *
1250heredoc_get(exarg_T *eap, char_u *cmd)
1251{
1252 char_u *marker;
1253 char_u *p;
1254 int marker_indent_len = 0;
1255 int text_indent_len = 0;
1256 char_u *text_indent = NULL((void*)0);
1257
1258 if (eap->getline == NULL((void*)0)) {
1259 EMSG(_("E991: cannot use =<< here"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E991: cannot use =<< here"
))));
1260 return NULL((void*)0);
1261 }
1262
1263 // Check for the optional 'trim' word before the marker
1264 cmd = skipwhite(cmd);
1265 if (STRNCMP(cmd, "trim", 4)strncmp((char *)(cmd), (char *)("trim"), (size_t)(4)) == 0
1266 && (cmd[4] == NUL'\000' || ascii_iswhite(cmd[4]))) {
1267 cmd = skipwhite(cmd + 4);
1268
1269 // Trim the indentation from all the lines in the here document.
1270 // The amount of indentation trimmed is the same as the indentation of
1271 // the first line after the :let command line. To find the end marker
1272 // the indent of the :let command line is trimmed.
1273 p = *eap->cmdlinep;
1274 while (ascii_iswhite(*p)) {
1275 p++;
1276 marker_indent_len++;
1277 }
1278 text_indent_len = -1;
1279 }
1280
1281 // The marker is the next word.
1282 if (*cmd != NUL'\000' && *cmd != '"') {
1283 marker = skipwhite(cmd);
1284 p = skiptowhite(marker);
1285 if (*skipwhite(p) != NUL'\000' && *skipwhite(p) != '"') {
1286 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
1287 return NULL((void*)0);
1288 }
1289 *p = NUL'\000';
1290 if (islower(*marker)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*marker))] & (unsigned short
int) _ISlower)) {
1291 EMSG(_("E221: Marker cannot start with lower case letter"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E221: Marker cannot start with lower case letter"
))));
1292 return NULL((void*)0);
1293 }
1294 } else {
1295 EMSG(_("E172: Missing marker"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E172: Missing marker"))));
1296 return NULL((void*)0);
1297 }
1298
1299 list_T *l = tv_list_alloc(0);
1300 for (;;) {
1301 int mi = 0;
1302 int ti = 0;
1303
1304 char_u *theline = eap->getline(NUL'\000', eap->cookie, 0, false0);
1305 if (theline == NULL((void*)0)) {
1306 EMSG2(_("E990: Missing end marker '%s'"), marker)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E990: Missing end marker '%s'"
))), (marker));
1307 break;
1308 }
1309
1310 // with "trim": skip the indent matching the :let line to find the
1311 // marker
1312 if (marker_indent_len > 0
1313 && STRNCMP(theline, *eap->cmdlinep, marker_indent_len)strncmp((char *)(theline), (char *)(*eap->cmdlinep), (size_t
)(marker_indent_len)) == 0) {
1314 mi = marker_indent_len;
1315 }
1316 if (STRCMP(marker, theline + mi)strcmp((char *)(marker), (char *)(theline + mi)) == 0) {
1317 xfree(theline);
1318 break;
1319 }
1320 if (text_indent_len == -1 && *theline != NUL'\000') {
1321 // set the text indent from the first line.
1322 p = theline;
1323 text_indent_len = 0;
1324 while (ascii_iswhite(*p)) {
1325 p++;
1326 text_indent_len++;
1327 }
1328 text_indent = vim_strnsave(theline, text_indent_len);
1329 }
1330 // with "trim": skip the indent matching the first line
1331 if (text_indent != NULL((void*)0)) {
1332 for (ti = 0; ti < text_indent_len; ti++) {
1333 if (theline[ti] != text_indent[ti]) {
1334 break;
1335 }
1336 }
1337 }
1338
1339 tv_list_append_string(l, (char *)(theline + ti), -1);
1340 xfree(theline);
1341 }
1342 xfree(text_indent);
1343
1344 return l;
1345}
1346
1347// ":let" list all variable values
1348// ":let var1 var2" list variable values
1349// ":let var = expr" assignment command.
1350// ":let var += expr" assignment command.
1351// ":let var -= expr" assignment command.
1352// ":let var *= expr" assignment command.
1353// ":let var /= expr" assignment command.
1354// ":let var %= expr" assignment command.
1355// ":let var .= expr" assignment command.
1356// ":let var ..= expr" assignment command.
1357// ":let [var1, var2] = expr" unpack list.
1358// ":let [name, ..., ; lastname] = expr" unpack list.
1359void ex_let(exarg_T *eap)
1360{
1361 ex_let_const(eap, false0);
1362}
1363
1364static void ex_let_const(exarg_T *eap, const bool_Bool is_const)
1365{
1366 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
1367 char_u *expr = NULL((void*)0);
1368 typval_T rettv;
1369 int i;
1370 int var_count = 0;
1371 int semicolon = 0;
1372 char_u op[2];
1373 char_u *argend;
1374 int first = TRUE1;
1375
1376 argend = (char_u *)skip_var_list(arg, &var_count, &semicolon);
1377 if (argend == NULL((void*)0)) {
1378 return;
1379 }
1380 if (argend > arg && argend[-1] == '.') { // For var.='str'.
1381 argend--;
1382 }
1383 expr = skipwhite(argend);
1384 if (*expr != '=' && !((vim_strchr((char_u *)"+-*/%.", *expr) != NULL((void*)0)
1385 && expr[1] == '=') || STRNCMP(expr, "..=", 3)strncmp((char *)(expr), (char *)("..="), (size_t)(3)) == 0)) {
1386 // ":let" without "=": list variables
1387 if (*arg == '[') {
1388 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
1389 } else if (!ends_excmd(*arg)) {
1390 // ":let var1 var2"
1391 arg = (char_u *)list_arg_vars(eap, (const char *)arg, &first);
1392 } else if (!eap->skip) {
1393 // ":let"
1394 list_glob_vars(&first);
1395 list_buf_vars(&first);
1396 list_win_vars(&first);
1397 list_tab_vars(&first);
1398 list_script_vars(&first);
1399 list_func_vars(&first);
1400 list_vim_vars(&first);
1401 }
1402 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
1403 } else if (expr[0] == '=' && expr[1] == '<' && expr[2] == '<') {
1404 // HERE document
1405 list_T *l = heredoc_get(eap, expr + 3);
1406 if (l != NULL((void*)0)) {
1407 tv_list_set_ret(&rettv, l);
1408 if (!eap->skip) {
1409 op[0] = '=';
1410 op[1] = NUL'\000';
1411 (void)ex_let_vars(eap->arg, &rettv, false0, semicolon, var_count,
1412 is_const, op);
1413 }
1414 tv_clear(&rettv);
1415 }
1416 } else {
1417 op[0] = '=';
1418 op[1] = NUL'\000';
1419 if (*expr != '=') {
1420 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"+-*/%.", *expr) != NULL((void*)0)) {
1421 op[0] = *expr; // +=, -=, *=, /=, %= or .=
1422 if (expr[0] == '.' && expr[1] == '.') { // ..=
1423 expr++;
1424 }
1425 }
1426 expr = skipwhite(expr + 2);
1427 } else {
1428 expr = skipwhite(expr + 1);
1429 }
1430
1431 if (eap->skip)
1432 ++emsg_skip;
1433 i = eval0(expr, &rettv, &eap->nextcmd, !eap->skip);
1434 if (eap->skip) {
1435 if (i != FAIL0) {
1436 tv_clear(&rettv);
1437 }
1438 emsg_skip--;
1439 } else if (i != FAIL0) {
1440 (void)ex_let_vars(eap->arg, &rettv, false0, semicolon, var_count,
1441 is_const, op);
1442 tv_clear(&rettv);
1443 }
1444 }
1445}
1446
1447/*
1448 * Assign the typevalue "tv" to the variable or variables at "arg_start".
1449 * Handles both "var" with any type and "[var, var; var]" with a list type.
1450 * When "nextchars" is not NULL it points to a string with characters that
1451 * must appear after the variable(s). Use "+", "-" or "." for add, subtract
1452 * or concatenate.
1453 * Returns OK or FAIL;
1454 */
1455static int
1456ex_let_vars(
1457 char_u *arg_start,
1458 typval_T *tv,
1459 int copy, // copy values from "tv", don't move
1460 int semicolon, // from skip_var_list()
1461 int var_count, // from skip_var_list()
1462 int is_const, // lock variables for :const
1463 char_u *nextchars
1464)
1465{
1466 char_u *arg = arg_start;
1467 typval_T ltv;
1468
1469 if (*arg != '[') {
1470 /*
1471 * ":let var = expr" or ":for var in list"
1472 */
1473 if (ex_let_one(arg, tv, copy, is_const, nextchars, nextchars) == NULL((void*)0)) {
1474 return FAIL0;
1475 }
1476 return OK1;
1477 }
1478
1479 // ":let [v1, v2] = list" or ":for [v1, v2] in listlist"
1480 if (tv->v_type != VAR_LIST) {
1481 EMSG(_(e_listreq))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listreq))));
1482 return FAIL0;
1483 }
1484 list_T *const l = tv->vval.v_list;
1485
1486 const int len = tv_list_len(l);
1487 if (semicolon == 0 && var_count < len) {
1488 EMSG(_("E687: Less targets than List items"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E687: Less targets than List items"
))));
1489 return FAIL0;
1490 }
1491 if (var_count - semicolon > len) {
1492 EMSG(_("E688: More targets than List items"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E688: More targets than List items"
))));
1493 return FAIL0;
1494 }
1495 // List l may actually be NULL, but it should fail with E688 or even earlier
1496 // if you try to do ":let [] = v:_null_list".
1497 assert(l != NULL)((void) sizeof ((l != ((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if
(l != ((void*)0)) ; else __assert_fail ("l != NULL", "../src/nvim/eval.c"
, 1497, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
1498
1499 listitem_T *item = tv_list_first(l);
1500 size_t rest_len = tv_list_len(l);
1501 while (*arg != ']') {
1502 arg = skipwhite(arg + 1);
1503 arg = ex_let_one(arg, TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(item)(&(item)->li_tv), true1, is_const,
1504 (const char_u *)",;]", nextchars);
1505 if (arg == NULL((void*)0)) {
1506 return FAIL0;
1507 }
1508 rest_len--;
1509
1510 item = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(l, item)((item)->li_next);
1511 arg = skipwhite(arg);
1512 if (*arg == ';') {
1513 /* Put the rest of the list (may be empty) in the var after ';'.
1514 * Create a new list for this. */
1515 list_T *const rest_list = tv_list_alloc(rest_len);
1516 while (item != NULL((void*)0)) {
1517 tv_list_append_tv(rest_list, TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(item)(&(item)->li_tv));
1518 item = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(l, item)((item)->li_next);
1519 }
1520
1521 ltv.v_type = VAR_LIST;
1522 ltv.v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED;
1523 ltv.vval.v_list = rest_list;
1524 tv_list_ref(rest_list);
1525
1526 arg = ex_let_one(skipwhite(arg + 1), &ltv, false0, is_const,
1527 (char_u *)"]", nextchars);
1528 tv_clear(&ltv);
1529 if (arg == NULL((void*)0)) {
1530 return FAIL0;
1531 }
1532 break;
1533 } else if (*arg != ',' && *arg != ']') {
1534 internal_error("ex_let_vars()");
1535 return FAIL0;
1536 }
1537 }
1538
1539 return OK1;
1540}
1541
1542/*
1543 * Skip over assignable variable "var" or list of variables "[var, var]".
1544 * Used for ":let varvar = expr" and ":for varvar in expr".
1545 * For "[var, var]" increment "*var_count" for each variable.
1546 * for "[var, var; var]" set "semicolon".
1547 * Return NULL for an error.
1548 */
1549static const char_u *skip_var_list(const char_u *arg, int *var_count,
1550 int *semicolon)
1551{
1552 const char_u *p;
1553 const char_u *s;
1554
1555 if (*arg == '[') {
1556 // "[var, var]": find the matching ']'.
1557 p = arg;
1558 for (;; ) {
1559 p = skipwhite(p + 1); // skip whites after '[', ';' or ','
1560 s = skip_var_one(p);
1561 if (s == p) {
1562 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), p)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (p));
1563 return NULL((void*)0);
1564 }
1565 ++*var_count;
1566
1567 p = skipwhite(s);
1568 if (*p == ']')
1569 break;
1570 else if (*p == ';') {
1571 if (*semicolon == 1) {
1572 EMSG(_("Double ; in list of variables"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("Double ; in list of variables"
))));
1573 return NULL((void*)0);
1574 }
1575 *semicolon = 1;
1576 } else if (*p != ',') {
1577 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), p)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (p));
1578 return NULL((void*)0);
1579 }
1580 }
1581 return p + 1;
1582 } else
1583 return skip_var_one(arg);
1584}
1585
1586/*
1587 * Skip one (assignable) variable name, including @r, $VAR, &option, d.key,
1588 * l[idx].
1589 */
1590static const char_u *skip_var_one(const char_u *arg)
1591{
1592 if (*arg == '@' && arg[1] != NUL'\000')
1593 return arg + 2;
1594 return find_name_end(*arg == '$' || *arg == '&' ? arg + 1 : arg,
1595 NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FNE_INCL_BR1 | FNE_CHECK_START2);
1596}
1597
1598/*
1599 * List variables for hashtab "ht" with prefix "prefix".
1600 * If "empty" is TRUE also list NULL strings as empty strings.
1601 */
1602void list_hashtable_vars(hashtab_T *ht, const char *prefix, int empty,
1603 int *first)
1604{
1605 hashitem_T *hi;
1606 dictitem_T *di;
1607 int todo;
1608
1609 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
1610 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
1611 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) {
1612 todo--;
1613 di = TV_DICT_HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
1614 char buf[IOSIZE(1024+1)];
1615
1616 // apply :filter /pat/ to variable name
1617 xstrlcpy(buf, prefix, IOSIZE(1024+1) - 1);
1618 xstrlcat(buf, (char *)di->di_key, IOSIZE(1024+1));
1619 if (message_filtered((char_u *)buf)) {
1620 continue;
1621 }
1622
1623 if (empty || di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_STRING
1624 || di->di_tv.vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)) {
1625 list_one_var(di, prefix, first);
1626 }
1627 }
1628 }
1629}
1630
1631/*
1632 * List global variables.
1633 */
1634static void list_glob_vars(int *first)
1635{
1636 list_hashtable_vars(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab, "", true1, first);
1637}
1638
1639/*
1640 * List buffer variables.
1641 */
1642static void list_buf_vars(int *first)
1643{
1644 list_hashtable_vars(&curbuf->b_vars->dv_hashtab, "b:", true1, first);
1645}
1646
1647/*
1648 * List window variables.
1649 */
1650static void list_win_vars(int *first)
1651{
1652 list_hashtable_vars(&curwin->w_vars->dv_hashtab, "w:", true1, first);
1653}
1654
1655/*
1656 * List tab page variables.
1657 */
1658static void list_tab_vars(int *first)
1659{
1660 list_hashtable_vars(&curtab->tp_vars->dv_hashtab, "t:", true1, first);
1661}
1662
1663/*
1664 * List Vim variables.
1665 */
1666static void list_vim_vars(int *first)
1667{
1668 list_hashtable_vars(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, "v:", false0, first);
1669}
1670
1671// List script-local variables, if there is a script.
1672static void list_script_vars(int *first)
1673{
1674 if (current_sctx.sc_sid > 0 && current_sctx.sc_sid <= ga_scripts.ga_len) {
1675 list_hashtable_vars(&SCRIPT_VARS(current_sctx.sc_sid)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(current_sctx.sc_sid) -
1])->sv_dict.dv_hashtab), "s:", false0, first);
1676 }
1677}
1678
1679/*
1680 * List variables in "arg".
1681 */
1682static const char *list_arg_vars(exarg_T *eap, const char *arg, int *first)
1683{
1684 int error = FALSE0;
1685 int len;
1686 const char *name;
1687 const char *name_start;
1688 typval_T tv;
1689
1690 while (!ends_excmd(*arg) && !got_int) {
1691 if (error || eap->skip) {
1692 arg = (const char *)find_name_end((char_u *)arg, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0),
1693 FNE_INCL_BR1 | FNE_CHECK_START2);
1694 if (!ascii_iswhite(*arg) && !ends_excmd(*arg)) {
1695 emsg_severe = true1;
1696 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
1697 break;
1698 }
1699 } else {
1700 // get_name_len() takes care of expanding curly braces
1701 name_start = name = arg;
1702 char *tofree;
1703 len = get_name_len(&arg, &tofree, true1, true1);
1704 if (len <= 0) {
1705 /* This is mainly to keep test 49 working: when expanding
1706 * curly braces fails overrule the exception error message. */
1707 if (len < 0 && !aborting()) {
1708 emsg_severe = true1;
1709 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), arg)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (arg));
1710 break;
1711 }
1712 error = TRUE1;
1713 } else {
1714 if (tofree != NULL((void*)0)) {
1715 name = tofree;
1716 }
1717 if (get_var_tv((const char *)name, len, &tv, NULL((void*)0), true1, false0)
1718 == FAIL0) {
1719 error = true1;
1720 } else {
1721 // handle d.key, l[idx], f(expr)
1722 const char *const arg_subsc = arg;
1723 if (handle_subscript(&arg, &tv, true1, true1) == FAIL0) {
1724 error = true1;
1725 } else {
1726 if (arg == arg_subsc && len == 2 && name[1] == ':') {
1727 switch (*name) {
1728 case 'g': list_glob_vars(first); break;
1729 case 'b': list_buf_vars(first); break;
1730 case 'w': list_win_vars(first); break;
1731 case 't': list_tab_vars(first); break;
1732 case 'v': list_vim_vars(first); break;
1733 case 's': list_script_vars(first); break;
1734 case 'l': list_func_vars(first); break;
1735 default:
1736 EMSG2(_("E738: Can't list variables for %s"), name)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E738: Can't list variables for %s"
))), (name));
1737 }
1738 } else {
1739 char *const s = encode_tv2echo(&tv, NULL((void*)0));
1740 const char *const used_name = (arg == arg_subsc
1741 ? name
1742 : name_start);
1743 const ptrdiff_t name_size = (used_name == tofree
1744 ? (ptrdiff_t)strlen(used_name)
1745 : (arg - used_name));
1746 list_one_var_a("", used_name, name_size,
1747 tv.v_type, s == NULL((void*)0) ? "" : s, first);
1748 xfree(s);
1749 }
1750 tv_clear(&tv);
1751 }
1752 }
1753 }
1754
1755 xfree(tofree);
1756 }
1757
1758 arg = (const char *)skipwhite((const char_u *)arg);
1759 }
1760
1761 return arg;
1762}
1763
1764// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/ex_cmds
1765
1766/// Set one item of `:let var = expr` or `:let [v1, v2] = list` to its value
1767///
1768/// @param[in] arg Start of the variable name.
1769/// @param[in] tv Value to assign to the variable.
1770/// @param[in] copy If true, copy value from `tv`.
1771/// @param[in] endchars Valid characters after variable name or NULL.
1772/// @param[in] op Operation performed: *op is `+`, `-`, `.` for `+=`, etc.
1773/// NULL for `=`.
1774///
1775/// @return a pointer to the char just after the var name or NULL in case of
1776/// error.
1777static char_u *ex_let_one(char_u *arg, typval_T *const tv,
1778 const bool_Bool copy, const bool_Bool is_const,
1779 const char_u *const endchars, const char_u *const op)
1780 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1, 2) FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
1781{
1782 char_u *arg_end = NULL((void*)0);
1783 int len;
1784 int opt_flags;
1785 char_u *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
1786
1787 /*
1788 * ":let $VAR = expr": Set environment variable.
1789 */
1790 if (*arg == '$') {
1791 if (is_const) {
1792 EMSG(_("E996: Cannot lock an environment variable"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E996: Cannot lock an environment variable"
))));
1793 return NULL((void*)0);
1794 }
1795 // Find the end of the name.
1796 arg++;
1797 char *name = (char *)arg;
1798 len = get_env_len((const char_u **)&arg);
1799 if (len == 0) {
1800 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), name - 1)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (name - 1
));
1801 } else {
1802 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && vim_strchr((char_u *)"+-*/%", *op) != NULL((void*)0)) {
1803 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (op));
1804 } else if (endchars != NULL((void*)0)
1805 && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite(arg)) == NULL((void*)0)) {
1806 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1807 } else if (!check_secure()) {
1808 const char c1 = name[len];
1809 name[len] = NUL'\000';
1810 const char *p = tv_get_string_chk(tv);
1811 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && op != NULL((void*)0) && *op == '.') {
1812 char *s = vim_getenv(name);
1813
1814 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
1815 tofree = concat_str((const char_u *)s, (const char_u *)p);
1816 p = (const char *)tofree;
1817 xfree(s);
1818 }
1819 }
1820 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
1821 os_setenv(name, p, 1);
1822 if (STRICMP(name, "HOME")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("HOME")) == 0) {
1823 init_homedir();
1824 } else if (didset_vim && STRICMP(name, "VIM")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("VIM")) == 0) {
1825 didset_vim = false0;
1826 } else if (didset_vimruntime
1827 && STRICMP(name, "VIMRUNTIME")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("VIMRUNTIME")) == 0) {
1828 didset_vimruntime = false0;
1829 }
1830 arg_end = arg;
1831 }
1832 name[len] = c1;
1833 xfree(tofree);
1834 }
1835 }
1836 // ":let &option = expr": Set option value.
1837 // ":let &l:option = expr": Set local option value.
1838 // ":let &g:option = expr": Set global option value.
1839 } else if (*arg == '&') {
1840 if (is_const) {
1841 EMSG(_("E996: Cannot lock an option"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E996: Cannot lock an option"
))));
1842 return NULL((void*)0);
1843 }
1844 // Find the end of the name.
1845 char *const p = (char *)find_option_end((const char **)&arg, &opt_flags);
1846 if (p == NULL((void*)0)
1847 || (endchars != NULL((void*)0)
1848 && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite((const char_u *)p)) == NULL((void*)0))) {
1849 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1850 } else {
1851 int opt_type;
1852 long numval;
1853 char *stringval = NULL((void*)0);
1854 const char *s = NULL((void*)0);
1855
1856 const char c1 = *p;
1857 *p = NUL'\000';
1858
1859 varnumber_T n = tv_get_number(tv);
1860 if (tv->v_type != VAR_BOOL && tv->v_type != VAR_SPECIAL) {
1861 s = tv_get_string_chk(tv); // != NULL if number or string.
1862 }
1863 if (s != NULL((void*)0) && op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
1864 opt_type = get_option_value((char *)arg, &numval, (char_u **)&stringval,
1865 opt_flags);
1866 if ((opt_type == 1 && *op == '.')
1867 || (opt_type == 0 && *op != '.')) {
1868 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (op));
1869 s = NULL((void*)0); // don't set the value
1870 } else {
1871 if (opt_type == 1) { // number
1872 switch (*op) {
1873 case '+': n = numval + n; break;
1874 case '-': n = numval - n; break;
1875 case '*': n = numval * n; break;
1876 case '/': n = num_divide(numval, n); break;
1877 case '%': n = num_modulus(numval, n); break;
1878 }
1879 } else if (opt_type == 0 && stringval != NULL((void*)0)) { // string
1880 char *const oldstringval = stringval;
1881 stringval = (char *)concat_str((const char_u *)stringval,
1882 (const char_u *)s);
1883 xfree(oldstringval);
1884 s = stringval;
1885 }
1886 }
1887 }
1888 if (s != NULL((void*)0) || tv->v_type == VAR_BOOL
1889 || tv->v_type == VAR_SPECIAL) {
1890 set_option_value((const char *)arg, n, s, opt_flags);
1891 arg_end = (char_u *)p;
1892 }
1893 *p = c1;
1894 xfree(stringval);
1895 }
1896 // ":let @r = expr": Set register contents.
1897 } else if (*arg == '@') {
1898 if (is_const) {
1899 EMSG(_("E996: Cannot lock a register"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E996: Cannot lock a register"
))));
1900 return NULL((void*)0);
1901 }
1902 arg++;
1903 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && vim_strchr((char_u *)"+-*/%", *op) != NULL((void*)0)) {
1904 emsgf(_(e_letwrong)gettext((char *)(e_letwrong)), op);
1905 } else if (endchars != NULL((void*)0)
1906 && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite(arg + 1)) == NULL((void*)0)) {
1907 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1908 } else {
1909 char_u *s;
1910
1911 char_u *ptofree = NULL((void*)0);
1912 const char *p = tv_get_string_chk(tv);
1913 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && op != NULL((void*)0) && *op == '.') {
1914 s = get_reg_contents(*arg == '@' ? '"' : *arg, kGRegExprSrc);
1915 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
1916 ptofree = concat_str(s, (const char_u *)p);
1917 p = (const char *)ptofree;
1918 xfree(s);
1919 }
1920 }
1921 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
1922 write_reg_contents(*arg == '@' ? '"' : *arg,
1923 (const char_u *)p, STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)), false0);
1924 arg_end = arg + 1;
1925 }
1926 xfree(ptofree);
1927 }
1928 }
1929 /*
1930 * ":let var = expr": Set internal variable.
1931 * ":let {expr} = expr": Idem, name made with curly braces
1932 */
1933 else if (eval_isnamec1(*arg) || *arg == '{') {
1934 lval_T lv;
1935
1936 char_u *const p = get_lval(arg, tv, &lv, false0, false0, 0, FNE_CHECK_START2);
1937 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && lv.ll_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
1938 if (endchars != NULL((void*)0) && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite(p)) == NULL((void*)0)) {
1939 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1940 } else {
1941 set_var_lval(&lv, p, tv, copy, is_const, (const char *)op);
1942 arg_end = p;
1943 }
1944 }
1945 clear_lval(&lv);
1946 } else
1947 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), arg)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (arg));
1948
1949 return arg_end;
1950}
1951
1952// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/executor
1953
1954/// Get an lvalue
1955///
1956/// Lvalue may be
1957/// - variable: "name", "na{me}"
1958/// - dictionary item: "dict.key", "dict['key']"
1959/// - list item: "list[expr]"
1960/// - list slice: "list[expr:expr]"
1961///
1962/// Indexing only works if trying to use it with an existing List or Dictionary.
1963///
1964/// @param[in] name Name to parse.
1965/// @param rettv Pointer to the value to be assigned or NULL.
1966/// @param[out] lp Lvalue definition. When evaluation errors occur `->ll_name`
1967/// is NULL.
1968/// @param[in] unlet True if using `:unlet`. This results in slightly
1969/// different behaviour when something is wrong; must end in
1970/// space or cmd separator.
1971/// @param[in] skip True when skipping.
1972/// @param[in] flags @see GetLvalFlags.
1973/// @param[in] fne_flags Flags for find_name_end().
1974///
1975/// @return A pointer to just after the name, including indexes. Returns NULL
1976/// for a parsing error, but it is still needed to free items in lp.
1977char_u *get_lval(char_u *const name, typval_T *const rettv,
1978 lval_T *const lp, const bool_Bool unlet, const bool_Bool skip,
1979 const int flags, const int fne_flags)
1980 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1, 3)
1981{
1982 dictitem_T *v;
1983 typval_T var1;
1984 typval_T var2;
1985 int empty1 = FALSE0;
1986 listitem_T *ni;
1987 hashtab_T *ht = NULL((void*)0);
1988 int quiet = flags & GLV_QUIET;
1989
1990 // Clear everything in "lp".
1991 memset(lp, 0, sizeof(lval_T));
1992
1993 if (skip) {
1994 // When skipping just find the end of the name.
1995 lp->ll_name = (const char *)name;
1996 return (char_u *)find_name_end((const char_u *)name, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0),
1997 FNE_INCL_BR1 | fne_flags);
1998 }
1999
2000 // Find the end of the name.
2001 char_u *expr_start;
2002 char_u *expr_end;
2003 char_u *p = (char_u *)find_name_end(name,
2004 (const char_u **)&expr_start,
2005 (const char_u **)&expr_end,
2006 fne_flags);
2007 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
2008 // Don't expand the name when we already know there is an error.
2009 if (unlet && !ascii_iswhite(*p) && !ends_excmd(*p)
2010 && *p != '[' && *p != '.') {
2011 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
2012 return NULL((void*)0);
2013 }
2014
2015 lp->ll_exp_name = (char *)make_expanded_name(name, expr_start, expr_end,
2016 (char_u *)p);
2017 lp->ll_name = lp->ll_exp_name;
2018 if (lp->ll_exp_name == NULL((void*)0)) {
2019 /* Report an invalid expression in braces, unless the
2020 * expression evaluation has been cancelled due to an
2021 * aborting error, an interrupt, or an exception. */
2022 if (!aborting() && !quiet) {
2023 emsg_severe = true1;
2024 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), name)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (name));
2025 return NULL((void*)0);
2026 }
2027 lp->ll_name_len = 0;
2028 } else {
2029 lp->ll_name_len = strlen(lp->ll_name);
2030 }
2031 } else {
2032 lp->ll_name = (const char *)name;
2033 lp->ll_name_len = (size_t)((const char *)p - lp->ll_name);
2034 }
2035
2036 // Without [idx] or .key we are done.
2037 if ((*p != '[' && *p != '.') || lp->ll_name == NULL((void*)0)) {
2038 return p;
2039 }
2040
2041 // Only pass &ht when we would write to the variable, it prevents autoload
2042 // as well.
2043 v = find_var(lp->ll_name, lp->ll_name_len,
2044 (flags & GLV_READ_ONLY) ? NULL((void*)0) : &ht,
2045 flags & GLV_NO_AUTOLOAD);
2046 if (v == NULL((void*)0) && !quiet) {
2047 emsgf(_("E121: Undefined variable: %.*s")gettext((char *)("E121: Undefined variable: %.*s")),
2048 (int)lp->ll_name_len, lp->ll_name);
2049 }
2050 if (v == NULL((void*)0)) {
2051 return NULL((void*)0);
2052 }
2053
2054 /*
2055 * Loop until no more [idx] or .key is following.
2056 */
2057 lp->ll_tv = &v->di_tv;
2058 var1.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
2059 var2.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
2060 while (*p == '[' || (*p == '.' && lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT)) {
2061 if (!(lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_LIST && lp->ll_tv->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0))
2062 && !(lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT
2063 && lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict != NULL((void*)0))) {
2064 if (!quiet)
2065 EMSG(_("E689: Can only index a List or Dictionary"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E689: Can only index a List or Dictionary"
))));
2066 return NULL((void*)0);
2067 }
2068 if (lp->ll_range) {
2069 if (!quiet)
2070 EMSG(_("E708: [:] must come last"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E708: [:] must come last"))
));
2071 return NULL((void*)0);
2072 }
2073
2074 int len = -1;
2075 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0);
2076 if (*p == '.') {
2077 key = p + 1;
2078 for (len = 0; ASCII_ISALNUM(key[len])((((unsigned)(key[len]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(key[len
]) <= 'Z') || ((unsigned)(key[len]) >= 'a' && (
unsigned)(key[len]) <= 'z')) || ascii_isdigit(key[len])) || key[len] == '_'; len++) {
2079 }
2080 if (len == 0) {
2081 if (!quiet) {
2082 EMSG(_("E713: Cannot use empty key after ."))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E713: Cannot use empty key after ."
))));
2083 }
2084 return NULL((void*)0);
2085 }
2086 p = key + len;
2087 } else {
2088 // Get the index [expr] or the first index [expr: ].
2089 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
2090 if (*p == ':') {
2091 empty1 = true1;
2092 } else {
2093 empty1 = false0;
2094 if (eval1(&p, &var1, true1) == FAIL0) { // Recursive!
2095 return NULL((void*)0);
2096 }
2097 if (!tv_check_str(&var1)) {
2098 // Not a number or string.
2099 tv_clear(&var1);
2100 return NULL((void*)0);
2101 }
2102 p = skipwhite(p);
2103 }
2104
2105 // Optionally get the second index [ :expr].
2106 if (*p == ':') {
2107 if (lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT) {
2108 if (!quiet) {
2109 EMSG(_(e_dictrange))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictrange))));
2110 }
2111 tv_clear(&var1);
2112 return NULL((void*)0);
2113 }
2114 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0) && (rettv->v_type != VAR_LIST
2115 || rettv->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0))) {
2116 if (!quiet) {
2117 EMSG(_("E709: [:] requires a List value"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E709: [:] requires a List value"
))));
2118 }
2119 tv_clear(&var1);
2120 return NULL((void*)0);
2121 }
2122 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
2123 if (*p == ']') {
2124 lp->ll_empty2 = true1;
2125 } else {
2126 lp->ll_empty2 = false0;
2127 if (eval1(&p, &var2, true1) == FAIL0) { // Recursive!
2128 tv_clear(&var1);
2129 return NULL((void*)0);
2130 }
2131 if (!tv_check_str(&var2)) {
2132 // Not a number or string.
2133 tv_clear(&var1);
2134 tv_clear(&var2);
2135 return NULL((void*)0);
2136 }
2137 }
2138 lp->ll_range = true1;
2139 } else {
2140 lp->ll_range = false0;
2141 }
2142
2143 if (*p != ']') {
2144 if (!quiet) {
2145 EMSG(_(e_missbrac))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_missbrac))));
2146 }
2147 tv_clear(&var1);
2148 tv_clear(&var2);
2149 return NULL((void*)0);
2150 }
2151
2152 // Skip to past ']'.
2153 p++;
2154 }
2155
2156 if (lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT) {
2157 if (len == -1) {
2158 // "[key]": get key from "var1"
2159 key = (char_u *)tv_get_string(&var1); // is number or string
2160 }
2161 lp->ll_list = NULL((void*)0);
2162 lp->ll_dict = lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict;
2163 lp->ll_di = tv_dict_find(lp->ll_dict, (const char *)key, len);
2164
2165 /* When assigning to a scope dictionary check that a function and
2166 * variable name is valid (only variable name unless it is l: or
2167 * g: dictionary). Disallow overwriting a builtin function. */
2168 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0) && lp->ll_dict->dv_scope != 0) {
2169 int prevval;
2170 int wrong;
2171
2172 if (len != -1) {
2173 prevval = key[len];
2174 key[len] = NUL'\000';
2175 } else {
2176 prevval = 0; // Avoid compiler warning.
2177 }
2178 wrong = ((lp->ll_dict->dv_scope == VAR_DEF_SCOPE
2179 && tv_is_func(*rettv)
2180 && !var_check_func_name((const char *)key, lp->ll_di == NULL((void*)0)))
2181 || !valid_varname((const char *)key));
2182 if (len != -1) {
2183 key[len] = prevval;
2184 }
2185 if (wrong) {
2186 return NULL((void*)0);
2187 }
2188 }
2189
2190 if (lp->ll_di != NULL((void*)0) && tv_is_luafunc(&lp->ll_di->di_tv)
2191 && len == -1 && rettv == NULL((void*)0)) {
2192 tv_clear(&var1);
2193 EMSG2(e_illvar, "v:['lua']")emsgf((const char *) (e_illvar), ("v:['lua']"));
2194 return NULL((void*)0);
2195 }
2196
2197 if (lp->ll_di == NULL((void*)0)) {
2198 // Can't add "v:" or "a:" variable.
2199 if (lp->ll_dict == &vimvardict
2200 || &lp->ll_dict->dv_hashtab == get_funccal_args_ht()) {
2201 EMSG2(_(e_illvar), name)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_illvar))), (name));
2202 tv_clear(&var1);
2203 return NULL((void*)0);
2204 }
2205
2206 // Key does not exist in dict: may need to add it.
2207 if (*p == '[' || *p == '.' || unlet) {
2208 if (!quiet) {
2209 emsgf(_(e_dictkey)gettext((char *)(e_dictkey)), key);
2210 }
2211 tv_clear(&var1);
2212 return NULL((void*)0);
2213 }
2214 if (len == -1) {
2215 lp->ll_newkey = vim_strsave(key);
2216 } else {
2217 lp->ll_newkey = vim_strnsave(key, len);
2218 }
2219 tv_clear(&var1);
2220 break;
2221 // existing variable, need to check if it can be changed
2222 } else if (!(flags & GLV_READ_ONLY) && var_check_ro(lp->ll_di->di_flags,
2223 (const char *)name,
2224 (size_t)(p - name))) {
2225 tv_clear(&var1);
2226 return NULL((void*)0);
2227 }
2228
2229 tv_clear(&var1);
2230 lp->ll_tv = &lp->ll_di->di_tv;
2231 } else {
2232 // Get the number and item for the only or first index of the List.
2233 if (empty1) {
2234 lp->ll_n1 = 0;
2235 } else {
2236 // Is number or string.
2237 lp->ll_n1 = (long)tv_get_number(&var1);
2238 }
2239 tv_clear(&var1);
2240
2241 lp->ll_dict = NULL((void*)0);
2242 lp->ll_list = lp->ll_tv->vval.v_list;
2243 lp->ll_li = tv_list_find(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_n1);
2244 if (lp->ll_li == NULL((void*)0)) {
2245 if (lp->ll_n1 < 0) {
2246 lp->ll_n1 = 0;
2247 lp->ll_li = tv_list_find(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_n1);
2248 }
2249 }
2250 if (lp->ll_li == NULL((void*)0)) {
2251 tv_clear(&var2);
2252 if (!quiet) {
2253 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), lp->ll_n1)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t
)(lp->ll_n1));
2254 }
2255 return NULL((void*)0);
2256 }
2257
2258 // May need to find the item or absolute index for the second
2259 // index of a range.
2260 // When no index given: "lp->ll_empty2" is true.
2261 // Otherwise "lp->ll_n2" is set to the second index.
2262 if (lp->ll_range && !lp->ll_empty2) {
2263 lp->ll_n2 = (long)tv_get_number(&var2); // Is number or string.
2264 tv_clear(&var2);
2265 if (lp->ll_n2 < 0) {
2266 ni = tv_list_find(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_n2);
2267 if (ni == NULL((void*)0)) {
2268 if (!quiet)
2269 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), lp->ll_n2)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t
)(lp->ll_n2));
2270 return NULL((void*)0);
2271 }
2272 lp->ll_n2 = tv_list_idx_of_item(lp->ll_list, ni);
2273 }
2274
2275 // Check that lp->ll_n2 isn't before lp->ll_n1.
2276 if (lp->ll_n1 < 0) {
2277 lp->ll_n1 = tv_list_idx_of_item(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li);
2278 }
2279 if (lp->ll_n2 < lp->ll_n1) {
2280 if (!quiet) {
2281 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), lp->ll_n2)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t
)(lp->ll_n2));
2282 }
2283 return NULL((void*)0);
2284 }
2285 }
2286
2287 lp->ll_tv = TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(lp->ll_li)(&(lp->ll_li)->li_tv);
2288 }
2289 }
2290
2291 tv_clear(&var1);
2292 return p;
2293}
2294
2295// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/executor
2296
2297/*
2298 * Clear lval "lp" that was filled by get_lval().
2299 */
2300void clear_lval(lval_T *lp)
2301{
2302 xfree(lp->ll_exp_name);
2303 xfree(lp->ll_newkey);
2304}
2305
2306// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/executor
2307
2308/*
2309 * Set a variable that was parsed by get_lval() to "rettv".
2310 * "endp" points to just after the parsed name.
2311 * "op" is NULL, "+" for "+=", "-" for "-=", "*" for "*=", "/" for "/=",
2312 * "%" for "%=", "." for ".=" or "=" for "=".
2313 */
2314static void set_var_lval(lval_T *lp, char_u *endp, typval_T *rettv,
2315 int copy, const bool_Bool is_const, const char *op)
2316{
2317 int cc;
2318 listitem_T *ri;
2319 dictitem_T *di;
2320
2321 if (lp->ll_tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
2322 cc = *endp;
2323 *endp = NUL'\000';
2324 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
2325 typval_T tv;
2326
2327 if (is_const) {
2328 EMSG(_(e_cannot_mod))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_cannot_mod))));
2329 *endp = cc;
2330 return;
2331 }
2332
2333 // handle +=, -=, *=, /=, %= and .=
2334 di = NULL((void*)0);
2335 if (get_var_tv((const char *)lp->ll_name, (int)STRLEN(lp->ll_name)strlen((char *)(lp->ll_name)),
2336 &tv, &di, true1, false0) == OK1) {
2337 if ((di == NULL((void*)0)
2338 || (!var_check_ro(di->di_flags, (const char *)lp->ll_name,
2339 TV_CSTRING((18446744073709551615UL) - 1))
2340 && !tv_check_lock(di->di_tv.v_lock, (const char *)lp->ll_name,
2341 TV_CSTRING((18446744073709551615UL) - 1))))
2342 && eexe_mod_op(&tv, rettv, op) == OK1) {
2343 set_var(lp->ll_name, lp->ll_name_len, &tv, false0);
2344 }
2345 tv_clear(&tv);
2346 }
2347 } else {
2348 set_var_const(lp->ll_name, lp->ll_name_len, rettv, copy, is_const);
2349 }
2350 *endp = cc;
2351 } else if (tv_check_lock(lp->ll_newkey == NULL((void*)0)
2352 ? lp->ll_tv->v_lock
2353 : lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict->dv_lock,
2354 (const char *)lp->ll_name, TV_CSTRING((18446744073709551615UL) - 1))) {
2355 } else if (lp->ll_range) {
2356 listitem_T *ll_li = lp->ll_li;
2357 int ll_n1 = lp->ll_n1;
2358
2359 if (is_const) {
2360 EMSG(_("E996: Cannot lock a range"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E996: Cannot lock a range")
)));
2361 return;
2362 }
2363
2364 // Check whether any of the list items is locked
2365 for (ri = tv_list_first(rettv->vval.v_list);
2366 ri != NULL((void*)0) && ll_li != NULL((void*)0); ) {
2367 if (tv_check_lock(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(ll_li)(&(ll_li)->li_tv)->v_lock,
2368 (const char *)lp->ll_name,
2369 TV_CSTRING((18446744073709551615UL) - 1))) {
2370 return;
2371 }
2372 ri = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(rettv->vval.v_list, ri)((ri)->li_next);
2373 if (ri == NULL((void*)0) || (!lp->ll_empty2 && lp->ll_n2 == ll_n1)) {
2374 break;
2375 }
2376 ll_li = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(lp->ll_list, ll_li)((ll_li)->li_next);
2377 ll_n1++;
2378 }
2379
2380 /*
2381 * Assign the List values to the list items.
2382 */
2383 for (ri = tv_list_first(rettv->vval.v_list); ri != NULL((void*)0); ) {
2384 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
2385 eexe_mod_op(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(lp->ll_li)(&(lp->ll_li)->li_tv), TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(ri)(&(ri)->li_tv), op);
2386 } else {
2387 tv_clear(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(lp->ll_li)(&(lp->ll_li)->li_tv));
2388 tv_copy(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(ri)(&(ri)->li_tv), TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(lp->ll_li)(&(lp->ll_li)->li_tv));
2389 }
2390 ri = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(rettv->vval.v_list, ri)((ri)->li_next);
2391 if (ri == NULL((void*)0) || (!lp->ll_empty2 && lp->ll_n2 == lp->ll_n1)) {
2392 break;
2393 }
2394 assert(lp->ll_li != NULL)((void) sizeof ((lp->ll_li != ((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (lp->ll_li != ((void*)0)) ; else __assert_fail ("lp->ll_li != NULL"
, "../src/nvim/eval.c", 2394, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
); }));
2395 if (TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li)((lp->ll_li)->li_next) == NULL((void*)0)) {
2396 // Need to add an empty item.
2397 tv_list_append_number(lp->ll_list, 0);
2398 // ll_li may have become invalid after append, don’t use it.
2399 lp->ll_li = tv_list_last(lp->ll_list); // Valid again.
2400 } else {
2401 lp->ll_li = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li)((lp->ll_li)->li_next);
2402 }
2403 lp->ll_n1++;
2404 }
2405 if (ri != NULL((void*)0)) {
2406 EMSG(_("E710: List value has more items than target"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E710: List value has more items than target"
))));
2407 } else if (lp->ll_empty2
2408 ? (lp->ll_li != NULL((void*)0)
2409 && TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li)((lp->ll_li)->li_next) != NULL((void*)0))
2410 : lp->ll_n1 != lp->ll_n2) {
2411 EMSG(_("E711: List value has not enough items"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E711: List value has not enough items"
))));
2412 }
2413 } else {
2414 typval_T oldtv = TV_INITIAL_VALUE((typval_T) { .v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN, .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED, }
);
2415 dict_T *dict = lp->ll_dict;
2416 bool_Bool watched = tv_dict_is_watched(dict);
2417
2418 if (is_const) {
2419 EMSG(_("E996: Cannot lock a list or dict"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E996: Cannot lock a list or dict"
))));
2420 return;
2421 }
2422
2423 // Assign to a List or Dictionary item.
2424 if (lp->ll_newkey != NULL((void*)0)) {
2425 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
2426 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (op));
2427 return;
2428 }
2429
2430 // Need to add an item to the Dictionary.
2431 di = tv_dict_item_alloc((const char *)lp->ll_newkey);
2432 if (tv_dict_add(lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict, di) == FAIL0) {
2433 xfree(di);
2434 return;
2435 }
2436 lp->ll_tv = &di->di_tv;
2437 } else {
2438 if (watched) {
2439 tv_copy(lp->ll_tv, &oldtv);
2440 }
2441
2442 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
2443 eexe_mod_op(lp->ll_tv, rettv, op);
2444 goto notify;
2445 } else {
2446 tv_clear(lp->ll_tv);
2447 }
2448 }
2449
2450 // Assign the value to the variable or list item.
2451 if (copy) {
2452 tv_copy(rettv, lp->ll_tv);
2453 } else {
2454 *lp->ll_tv = *rettv;
2455 lp->ll_tv->v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED;
2456 tv_init(rettv);
2457 }
2458
2459notify:
2460 if (watched) {
2461 if (oldtv.v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN) {
2462 assert(lp->ll_newkey != NULL)((void) sizeof ((lp->ll_newkey != ((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (lp->ll_newkey != ((void*)0)) ; else __assert_fail (
"lp->ll_newkey != NULL", "../src/nvim/eval.c", 2462, __extension__
__PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
2463 tv_dict_watcher_notify(dict, (char *)lp->ll_newkey, lp->ll_tv, NULL((void*)0));
2464 } else {
2465 dictitem_T *di_ = lp->ll_di;
2466 assert(di_->di_key != NULL)((void) sizeof ((di_->di_key != ((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (di_->di_key != ((void*)0)) ; else __assert_fail ("di_->di_key != NULL"
, "../src/nvim/eval.c", 2466, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
); }));
2467 tv_dict_watcher_notify(dict, (char *)di_->di_key, lp->ll_tv, &oldtv);
2468 tv_clear(&oldtv);
2469 }
2470 }
2471 }
2472}
2473
2474// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/ex_cmds
2475
2476/*
2477 * Evaluate the expression used in a ":for var in expr" command.
2478 * "arg" points to "var".
2479 * Set "*errp" to TRUE for an error, FALSE otherwise;
2480 * Return a pointer that holds the info. Null when there is an error.
2481 */
2482void *eval_for_line(const char_u *arg, bool_Bool *errp, char_u **nextcmdp, int skip)
2483{
2484 forinfo_T *fi = xcalloc(1, sizeof(forinfo_T));
2485 const char_u *expr;
2486 typval_T tv;
2487 list_T *l;
2488
2489 *errp = true1; // Default: there is an error.
2490
2491 expr = skip_var_list(arg, &fi->fi_varcount, &fi->fi_semicolon);
2492 if (expr == NULL((void*)0))
2493 return fi;
2494
2495 expr = skipwhite(expr);
2496 if (expr[0] != 'i' || expr[1] != 'n' || !ascii_iswhite(expr[2])) {
2497 EMSG(_("E690: Missing \"in\" after :for"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E690: Missing \"in\" after :for"
))));
2498 return fi;
2499 }
2500
2501 if (skip)
2502 ++emsg_skip;
2503 if (eval0(skipwhite(expr + 2), &tv, nextcmdp, !skip) == OK1) {
2504 *errp = false0;
2505 if (!skip) {
2506 l = tv.vval.v_list;
2507 if (tv.v_type != VAR_LIST) {
2508 EMSG(_(e_listreq))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listreq))));
2509 tv_clear(&tv);
