2510 } else if (l == NULL((void*)0)) {
2511 // a null list is like an empty list: do nothing
2512 tv_clear(&tv);
2513 } else {
2514 /* No need to increment the refcount, it's already set for the
2515 * list being used in "tv". */
2516 fi->fi_list = l;
2517 tv_list_watch_add(l, &fi->fi_lw);
2518 fi->fi_lw.lw_item = tv_list_first(l);
2519 }
2520 }
2521 }
2522 if (skip)
2523 --emsg_skip;
2524
2525 return fi;
2526}
2527
2528// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/ex_cmds
2529
2530/*
2531 * Use the first item in a ":for" list. Advance to the next.
2532 * Assign the values to the variable (list). "arg" points to the first one.
2533 * Return TRUE when a valid item was found, FALSE when at end of list or
2534 * something wrong.
2535 */
2536bool_Bool next_for_item(void *fi_void, char_u *arg)
2537{
2538 forinfo_T *fi = (forinfo_T *)fi_void;
2539
2540 listitem_T *item = fi->fi_lw.lw_item;
2541 if (item == NULL((void*)0)) {
2542 return false0;
2543 } else {
2544 fi->fi_lw.lw_item = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(fi->fi_list, item)((item)->li_next);
2545 return (ex_let_vars(arg, TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(item)(&(item)->li_tv), true1,
2546 fi->fi_semicolon, fi->fi_varcount, false0, NULL((void*)0)) == OK1);
2547 }
2548}
2549
2550// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/ex_cmds
2551
2552/*
2553 * Free the structure used to store info used by ":for".
2554 */
2555void free_for_info(void *fi_void)
2556{
2557 forinfo_T *fi = (forinfo_T *)fi_void;
2558
2559 if (fi != NULL((void*)0) && fi->fi_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
2560 tv_list_watch_remove(fi->fi_list, &fi->fi_lw);
2561 tv_list_unref(fi->fi_list);
2562 }
2563 xfree(fi);
2564}
2565
2566
2567void set_context_for_expression(expand_T *xp, char_u *arg, cmdidx_T cmdidx)
2568 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
2569{
2570 int got_eq = FALSE0;
2571 int c;
2572 char_u *p;
2573
2574 if (cmdidx == CMD_let || cmdidx == CMD_const) {
2575 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_USER_VARS;
2576 if (vim_strpbrk(arg, (char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#")(char_u *)strpbrk((char *)(arg), (char *)((char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#"
)) == NULL((void*)0)) {
2577 // ":let var1 var2 ...": find last space.
2578 for (p = arg + STRLEN(arg)strlen((char *)(arg)); p >= arg; ) {
2579 xp->xp_pattern = p;
2580 MB_PTR_BACK(arg, p)(p -= utf_head_off((char_u *)arg, (char_u *)p - 1) + 1);
2581 if (ascii_iswhite(*p)) {
2582 break;
2583 }
2584 }
2585 return;
2586 }
2587 } else
2588 xp->xp_context = cmdidx == CMD_call ? EXPAND_FUNCTIONS
2589 : EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2590 while ((xp->xp_pattern = vim_strpbrk(arg,(char_u *)strpbrk((char *)(arg), (char *)((char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#"
))
2591 (char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#")(char_u *)strpbrk((char *)(arg), (char *)((char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#"
))) != NULL((void*)0)) {
2592 c = *xp->xp_pattern;
2593 if (c == '&') {
2594 c = xp->xp_pattern[1];
2595 if (c == '&') {
2596 ++xp->xp_pattern;
2597 xp->xp_context = cmdidx != CMD_let || got_eq
2598 ? EXPAND_EXPRESSION : EXPAND_NOTHING;
2599 } else if (c != ' ') {
2600 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_SETTINGS;
2601 if ((c == 'l' || c == 'g') && xp->xp_pattern[2] == ':')
2602 xp->xp_pattern += 2;
2603
2604 }
2605 } else if (c == '$') {
2606 // environment variable
2607 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_ENV_VARS;
2608 } else if (c == '=') {
2609 got_eq = TRUE1;
2610 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2611 } else if (c == '#'
2612 && xp->xp_context == EXPAND_EXPRESSION) {
2613 // Autoload function/variable contains '#'
2614 break;
2615 } else if ((c == '<' || c == '#')
2616 && xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FUNCTIONS
2617 && vim_strchr(xp->xp_pattern, '(') == NULL((void*)0)) {
2618 // Function name can start with "<SNR>" and contain '#'.
2619 break;
2620 } else if (cmdidx != CMD_let || got_eq) {
2621 if (c == '"') { // string
2622 while ((c = *++xp->xp_pattern) != NUL'\000' && c != '"') {
2623 if (c == '\\' && xp->xp_pattern[1] != NUL'\000') {
2624 xp->xp_pattern++;
2625 }
2626 }
2627 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
2628 } else if (c == '\'') { // literal string
2629 // Trick: '' is like stopping and starting a literal string.
2630 while ((c = *++xp->xp_pattern) != NUL'\000' && c != '\'') {
2631 }
2632 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
2633 } else if (c == '|') {
2634 if (xp->xp_pattern[1] == '|') {
2635 ++xp->xp_pattern;
2636 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2637 } else
2638 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_COMMANDS;
2639 } else
2640 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2641 } else
2642 /* Doesn't look like something valid, expand as an expression
2643 * anyway. */
2644 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2645 arg = xp->xp_pattern;
2646 if (*arg != NUL'\000') {
2647 while ((c = *++arg) != NUL'\000' && (c == ' ' || c == '\t')) {
2648 }
2649 }
2650 }
2651
2652 // ":exe one two" completes "two"
2653 if ((cmdidx == CMD_execute
2654 || cmdidx == CMD_echo
2655 || cmdidx == CMD_echon
2656 || cmdidx == CMD_echomsg)
2657 && xp->xp_context == EXPAND_EXPRESSION) {
2658 for (;;) {
2659 char_u *const n = skiptowhite(arg);
2660
2661 if (n == arg || ascii_iswhite_or_nul(*skipwhite(n))) {
2662 break;
2663 }
2664 arg = skipwhite(n);
2665 }
2666 }
2667
2668 xp->xp_pattern = arg;
2669}
2670
2671/// ":unlet[!] var1 ... " command.
2672void ex_unlet(exarg_T *eap)
2673{
2674 ex_unletlock(eap, eap->arg, 0, do_unlet_var);
2675}
2676
2677// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/ex_cmds
2678
2679/// ":lockvar" and ":unlockvar" commands
2680void ex_lockvar(exarg_T *eap)
2681{
2682 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
2683 int deep = 2;
2684
2685 if (eap->forceit) {
2686 deep = -1;
2687 } else if (ascii_isdigit(*arg)) {
2688 deep = getdigits_int(&arg, false0, -1);
2689 arg = skipwhite(arg);
2690 }
2691
2692 ex_unletlock(eap, arg, deep, do_lock_var);
2693}
2694
2695// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/ex_cmds
2696
2697/// Common parsing logic for :unlet, :lockvar and :unlockvar.
2698///
2699/// Invokes `callback` afterwards if successful and `eap->skip == false`.
2700///
2701/// @param[in] eap Ex command arguments for the command.
2702/// @param[in] argstart Start of the string argument for the command.
2703/// @param[in] deep Levels to (un)lock for :(un)lockvar, -1 to (un)lock
2704/// everything.
2705/// @param[in] callback Appropriate handler for the command.
2706static void ex_unletlock(exarg_T *eap, char_u *argstart, int deep,
2707 ex_unletlock_callback callback)
2708 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
2709{
2710 char_u *arg = argstart;
2711 char_u *name_end;
2712 bool_Bool error = false0;
2713 lval_T lv;
2714
2715 do {
2716 if (*arg == '$') {
2717 lv.ll_name = (const char *)arg;
2718 lv.ll_tv = NULL((void*)0);
2719 arg++;
2720 if (get_env_len((const char_u **)&arg) == 0) {
2721 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), arg - 1)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (arg - 1
));
2722 return;
2723 }
2724 if (!error && !eap->skip && callback(&lv, arg, eap, deep) == FAIL0) {
2725 error = true1;
2726 }
2727 name_end = arg;
2728 } else {
2729 // Parse the name and find the end.
2730 name_end = get_lval(arg, NULL((void*)0), &lv, true1, eap->skip || error,
2731 0, FNE_CHECK_START2);
2732 if (lv.ll_name == NULL((void*)0)) {
2733 error = true1; // error, but continue parsing.
2734 }
2735 if (name_end == NULL((void*)0)
2736 || (!ascii_iswhite(*name_end) && !ends_excmd(*name_end))) {
2737 if (name_end != NULL((void*)0)) {
2738 emsg_severe = true1;
2739 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
2740 }
2741 if (!(eap->skip || error)) {
2742 clear_lval(&lv);
2743 }
2744 break;
2745 }
2746
2747 if (!error && !eap->skip && callback(&lv, name_end, eap, deep) == FAIL0) {
2748 error = true1;
2749 }
2750
2751 if (!eap->skip) {
2752 clear_lval(&lv);
2753 }
2754 }
2755 arg = skipwhite(name_end);
2756 } while (!ends_excmd(*arg));
2757
2758 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
2759}
2760
2761// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/ex_cmds
2762
2763/// Unlet a variable indicated by `lp`.
2764///
2765/// @param[in] lp The lvalue.
2766/// @param[in] name_end End of the string argument for the command.
2767/// @param[in] eap Ex command arguments for :unlet.
2768/// @param[in] deep Unused.
2769///
2770/// @return OK on success, or FAIL on failure.
2771static int do_unlet_var(lval_T *lp, char_u *name_end, exarg_T *eap,
2772 int deep FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED)
2773 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
2774{
2775 int forceit = eap->forceit;
2776 int ret = OK1;
2777 int cc;
2778
2779 if (lp->ll_tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
2780 cc = *name_end;
2781 *name_end = NUL'\000';
2782
2783 // Environment variable, normal name or expanded name.
2784 if (*lp->ll_name == '$') {
2785 os_unsetenv(lp->ll_name + 1);
2786 } else if (do_unlet(lp->ll_name, lp->ll_name_len, forceit) == FAIL0) {
2787 ret = FAIL0;
2788 }
2789 *name_end = cc;
2790 } else if ((lp->ll_list != NULL((void*)0)
2791 // ll_list is not NULL when lvalue is not in a list, NULL lists
2792 // yield E689.
2793 && tv_check_lock(tv_list_locked(lp->ll_list),
2794 (const char *)lp->ll_name,
2795 lp->ll_name_len))
2796 || (lp->ll_dict != NULL((void*)0)
2797 && tv_check_lock(lp->ll_dict->dv_lock,
2798 (const char *)lp->ll_name,
2799 lp->ll_name_len))) {
2800 return FAIL0;
2801 } else if (lp->ll_range) {
2802 assert(lp->ll_list != NULL)((void) sizeof ((lp->ll_list != ((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (lp->ll_list != ((void*)0)) ; else __assert_fail ("lp->ll_list != NULL"
, "../src/nvim/eval.c", 2802, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
); }));
2803 // Delete a range of List items.
2804 listitem_T *const first_li = lp->ll_li;
2805 listitem_T *last_li = first_li;
2806 for (;;) {
2807 listitem_T *const li = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li)((lp->ll_li)->li_next);
2808 if (tv_check_lock(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(lp->ll_li)(&(lp->ll_li)->li_tv)->v_lock,
2809 (const char *)lp->ll_name,
2810 lp->ll_name_len)) {
2811 return false0;
2812 }
2813 lp->ll_li = li;
2814 lp->ll_n1++;
2815 if (lp->ll_li == NULL((void*)0) || (!lp->ll_empty2 && lp->ll_n2 < lp->ll_n1)) {
2816 break;
2817 } else {
2818 last_li = lp->ll_li;
2819 }
2820 }
2821 tv_list_remove_items(lp->ll_list, first_li, last_li);
2822 } else {
2823 if (lp->ll_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
2824 // unlet a List item.
2825 tv_list_item_remove(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li);
2826 } else {
2827 // unlet a Dictionary item.
2828 dict_T *d = lp->ll_dict;
2829 assert(d != NULL)((void) sizeof ((d != ((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ ({ if
(d != ((void*)0)) ; else __assert_fail ("d != NULL", "../src/nvim/eval.c"
, 2829, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
2830 dictitem_T *di = lp->ll_di;
2831 bool_Bool watched = tv_dict_is_watched(d);
2832 char *key = NULL((void*)0);
2833 typval_T oldtv;
2834
2835 if (watched) {
2836 tv_copy(&di->di_tv, &oldtv);
2837 // need to save key because dictitem_remove will free it
2838 key = xstrdup((char *)di->di_key);
2839 }
2840
2841 tv_dict_item_remove(d, di);
2842
2843 if (watched) {
2844 tv_dict_watcher_notify(d, key, NULL((void*)0), &oldtv);
2845 tv_clear(&oldtv);
2846 xfree(key);
2847 }
2848 }
2849 }
2850
2851 return ret;
2852}
2853
2854// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/ex_cmds
2855
2856/// unlet a variable
2857///
2858/// @param[in] name Variable name to unlet.
2859/// @param[in] name_len Variable name length.
2860/// @param[in] forceit If true, do not complain if variable doesn’t exist.
2861///
2862/// @return OK if it existed, FAIL otherwise.
2863int do_unlet(const char *const name, const size_t name_len, const bool_Bool forceit)
2864 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
2865{
2866 const char *varname;
2867 dict_T *dict;
2868 hashtab_T *ht = find_var_ht_dict(name, name_len, &varname, &dict);
2869
2870 if (ht != NULL((void*)0) && *varname != NUL'\000') {
2871 dict_T *d = get_current_funccal_dict(ht);
2872 if (d == NULL((void*)0)) {
2873 if (ht == &globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab) {
2874 d = &globvardict;
2875 } else if (ht == &compat_hashtab) {
2876 d = &vimvardict;
2877 } else {
2878 dictitem_T *const di = find_var_in_ht(ht, *name, "", 0, false0);
2879 d = di->di_tv.vval.v_dict;
2880 }
2881 if (d == NULL((void*)0)) {
2882 internal_error("do_unlet()");
2883 return FAIL0;
2884 }
2885 }
2886
2887 hashitem_T *hi = hash_find(ht, (const char_u *)varname);
2888 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) {
2889 hi = find_hi_in_scoped_ht((const char *)name, &ht);
2890 }
2891 if (hi != NULL((void*)0) && !HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) {
2892 dictitem_T *const di = TV_DICT_HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
2893 if (var_check_fixed(di->di_flags, (const char *)name, TV_CSTRING((18446744073709551615UL) - 1))
2894 || var_check_ro(di->di_flags, (const char *)name, TV_CSTRING((18446744073709551615UL) - 1))
2895 || tv_check_lock(d->dv_lock, (const char *)name, TV_CSTRING((18446744073709551615UL) - 1))) {
2896 return FAIL0;
2897 }
2898
2899 if (tv_check_lock(d->dv_lock, (const char *)name, TV_CSTRING((18446744073709551615UL) - 1))) {
2900 return FAIL0;
2901 }
2902
2903 typval_T oldtv;
2904 bool_Bool watched = tv_dict_is_watched(dict);
2905
2906 if (watched) {
2907 tv_copy(&di->di_tv, &oldtv);
2908 }
2909
2910 delete_var(ht, hi);
2911
2912 if (watched) {
2913 tv_dict_watcher_notify(dict, varname, NULL((void*)0), &oldtv);
2914 tv_clear(&oldtv);
2915 }
2916 return OK1;
2917 }
2918 }
2919 if (forceit)
2920 return OK1;
2921 EMSG2(_("E108: No such variable: \"%s\""), name)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E108: No such variable: \"%s\""
))), (name));
2922 return FAIL0;
2923}
2924
2925// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/ex_cmds
2926
2927/// Lock or unlock variable indicated by `lp`.
2928///
2929/// Locks if `eap->cmdidx == CMD_lockvar`, unlocks otherwise.
2930///
2931/// @param[in] lp The lvalue.
2932/// @param[in] name_end Unused.
2933/// @param[in] eap Ex command arguments for :(un)lockvar.
2934/// @param[in] deep Levels to (un)lock, -1 to (un)lock everything.
2935///
2936/// @return OK on success, or FAIL on failure.
2937static int do_lock_var(lval_T *lp, char_u *name_end FUNC_ATTR_UNUSED,
2938 exarg_T *eap, int deep)
2939 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1, 3)
2940{
2941 bool_Bool lock = eap->cmdidx == CMD_lockvar;
2942 int ret = OK1;
2943
2944 if (deep == 0) { // Nothing to do.
2945 return OK1;
2946 }
2947
2948 if (lp->ll_tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
2949 if (*lp->ll_name == '$') {
2950 EMSG2(_(e_lock_unlock), lp->ll_name)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_lock_unlock))), (lp->
ll_name));
2951 ret = FAIL0;
2952 } else {
2953 // Normal name or expanded name.
2954 dictitem_T *const di = find_var(
2955 (const char *)lp->ll_name, lp->ll_name_len, NULL((void*)0),
2956 true1);
2957 if (di == NULL((void*)0)) {
2958 ret = FAIL0;
2959 } else if ((di->di_flags & DI_FLAGS_FIX)
2960 && di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_DICT
2961 && di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_LIST) {
2962 // For historical reasons this error is not given for Lists and
2963 // Dictionaries. E.g. b: dictionary may be locked/unlocked.
2964 EMSG2(_(e_lock_unlock), lp->ll_name)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_lock_unlock))), (lp->
ll_name));
2965 ret = FAIL0;
2966 } else {
2967 if (lock) {
2968 di->di_flags |= DI_FLAGS_LOCK;
2969 } else {
2970 di->di_flags &= ~DI_FLAGS_LOCK;
2971 }
2972 tv_item_lock(&di->di_tv, deep, lock);
2973 }
2974 }
2975 } else if (lp->ll_range) {
2976 listitem_T *li = lp->ll_li;
2977
2978 // (un)lock a range of List items.
2979 while (li != NULL((void*)0) && (lp->ll_empty2 || lp->ll_n2 >= lp->ll_n1)) {
2980 tv_item_lock(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)(&(li)->li_tv), deep, lock);
2981 li = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(lp->ll_list, li)((li)->li_next);
2982 lp->ll_n1++;
2983 }
2984 } else if (lp->ll_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
2985 // (un)lock a List item.
2986 tv_item_lock(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(lp->ll_li)(&(lp->ll_li)->li_tv), deep, lock);
2987 } else {
2988 // (un)lock a Dictionary item.
2989 tv_item_lock(&lp->ll_di->di_tv, deep, lock);
2990 }
2991
2992 return ret;
2993}
2994
2995/*
2996 * Delete all "menutrans_" variables.
2997 */
2998void del_menutrans_vars(void)
2999{
3000 hash_lock(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab);
3001 HASHTAB_ITER(&globvarht, hi, {do { hashtab_T *const hiht_ = (&globvardict.dv_hashtab); size_t
hitodo_ = hiht_->ht_used; for (hashitem_T *hi = hiht_->
ht_array; hitodo_; hi++) { if (!((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0
) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *)&hash_removed)) { hitodo_
--; { { if (strncmp((char *)(hi->hi_key), (char *)("menutrans_"
), (size_t)(10)) == 0) { delete_var(&globvardict.dv_hashtab
, hi); } } } } } } while (0)
3002 if (STRNCMP(hi->hi_key, "menutrans_", 10) == 0) {do { hashtab_T *const hiht_ = (&globvardict.dv_hashtab); size_t
hitodo_ = hiht_->ht_used; for (hashitem_T *hi = hiht_->
ht_array; hitodo_; hi++) { if (!((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0
) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *)&hash_removed)) { hitodo_
--; { { if (strncmp((char *)(hi->hi_key), (char *)("menutrans_"
), (size_t)(10)) == 0) { delete_var(&globvardict.dv_hashtab
, hi); } } } } } } while (0)
3003 delete_var(&globvarht, hi);do { hashtab_T *const hiht_ = (&globvardict.dv_hashtab); size_t
hitodo_ = hiht_->ht_used; for (hashitem_T *hi = hiht_->
ht_array; hitodo_; hi++) { if (!((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0
) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *)&hash_removed)) { hitodo_
--; { { if (strncmp((char *)(hi->hi_key), (char *)("menutrans_"
), (size_t)(10)) == 0) { delete_var(&globvardict.dv_hashtab
, hi); } } } } } } while (0)
3004 }do { hashtab_T *const hiht_ = (&globvardict.dv_hashtab); size_t
hitodo_ = hiht_->ht_used; for (hashitem_T *hi = hiht_->
ht_array; hitodo_; hi++) { if (!((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0
) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *)&hash_removed)) { hitodo_
--; { { if (strncmp((char *)(hi->hi_key), (char *)("menutrans_"
), (size_t)(10)) == 0) { delete_var(&globvardict.dv_hashtab
, hi); } } } } } } while (0)
3005 })do { hashtab_T *const hiht_ = (&globvardict.dv_hashtab); size_t
hitodo_ = hiht_->ht_used; for (hashitem_T *hi = hiht_->
ht_array; hitodo_; hi++) { if (!((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0
) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *)&hash_removed)) { hitodo_
--; { { if (strncmp((char *)(hi->hi_key), (char *)("menutrans_"
), (size_t)(10)) == 0) { delete_var(&globvardict.dv_hashtab
, hi); } } } } } } while (0);
3006 hash_unlock(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab);
3007}
3008
3009/*
3010 * Local string buffer for the next two functions to store a variable name
3011 * with its prefix. Allocated in cat_prefix_varname(), freed later in
3012 * get_user_var_name().
3013 */
3014
3015
3016static char_u *varnamebuf = NULL((void*)0);
3017static size_t varnamebuflen = 0;
3018
3019/*
3020 * Function to concatenate a prefix and a variable name.
3021 */
3022char_u *cat_prefix_varname(int prefix, const char_u *name)
3023 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
3024{
3025 size_t len = STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)) + 3;
3026
3027 if (len > varnamebuflen) {
3028 xfree(varnamebuf);
3029 len += 10; // some additional space
3030 varnamebuf = xmalloc(len);
3031 varnamebuflen = len;
3032 }
3033 *varnamebuf = prefix;
3034 varnamebuf[1] = ':';
3035 STRCPY(varnamebuf + 2, name)strcpy((char *)(varnamebuf + 2), (char *)(name));
3036 return varnamebuf;
3037}
3038
3039/*
3040 * Function given to ExpandGeneric() to obtain the list of user defined
3041 * (global/buffer/window/built-in) variable names.
3042 */
3043char_u *get_user_var_name(expand_T *xp, int idx)
3044{
3045 static size_t gdone;
3046 static size_t bdone;
3047 static size_t wdone;
3048 static size_t tdone;
3049 static size_t vidx;
3050 static hashitem_T *hi;
3051
3052 if (idx == 0) {
3053 gdone = bdone = wdone = vidx = 0;
3054 tdone = 0;
3055 }
3056
3057 // Global variables
3058 if (gdone < globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_used) {
3059 if (gdone++ == 0)
3060 hi = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array;
3061 else
3062 ++hi;
3063 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed))
3064 ++hi;
3065 if (STRNCMP("g:", xp->xp_pattern, 2)strncmp((char *)("g:"), (char *)(xp->xp_pattern), (size_t)
(2)) == 0)
3066 return cat_prefix_varname('g', hi->hi_key);
3067 return hi->hi_key;
3068 }
3069
3070 // b: variables
3071 // In cmdwin, the alternative buffer should be used.
3072 hashtab_T *ht = (cmdwin_type != 0 && get_cmdline_type() == NUL'\000')
3073 ? &prevwin->w_buffer->b_vars->dv_hashtab
3074 : &curbuf->b_vars->dv_hashtab;
3075 if (bdone < ht->ht_used) {
3076 if (bdone++ == 0)
3077 hi = ht->ht_array;
3078 else
3079 ++hi;
3080 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed))
3081 ++hi;
3082 return cat_prefix_varname('b', hi->hi_key);
3083 }
3084
3085 // w: variables
3086 // In cmdwin, the alternative window should be used.
3087 ht = (cmdwin_type != 0 && get_cmdline_type() == NUL'\000')
3088 ? &prevwin->w_vars->dv_hashtab
3089 : &curwin->w_vars->dv_hashtab;
3090 if (wdone < ht->ht_used) {
3091 if (wdone++ == 0)
3092 hi = ht->ht_array;
3093 else
3094 ++hi;
3095 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed))
3096 ++hi;
3097 return cat_prefix_varname('w', hi->hi_key);
3098 }
3099
3100 // t: variables
3101 ht = &curtab->tp_vars->dv_hashtab;
3102 if (tdone < ht->ht_used) {
3103 if (tdone++ == 0)
3104 hi = ht->ht_array;
3105 else
3106 ++hi;
3107 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed))
3108 ++hi;
3109 return cat_prefix_varname('t', hi->hi_key);
3110 }
3111
3112 // v: variables
3113 if (vidx < ARRAY_SIZE(vimvars)((sizeof(vimvars)/sizeof((vimvars)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(
vimvars) % sizeof((vimvars)[0])))))) {
3114 return cat_prefix_varname('v', (char_u *)vimvars[vidx++].vv_name);
3115 }
3116
3117 XFREE_CLEAR(varnamebuf)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(varnamebuf); xfree(*ptr_); *
ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
3118 varnamebuflen = 0;
3119 return NULL((void*)0);
3120}
3121
3122// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
3123
3124/// Return TRUE if "pat" matches "text".
3125/// Does not use 'cpo' and always uses 'magic'.
3126static int pattern_match(char_u *pat, char_u *text, bool_Bool ic)
3127{
3128 int matches = 0;
3129 regmatch_T regmatch;
3130
3131 // avoid 'l' flag in 'cpoptions'
3132 char_u *save_cpo = p_cpo;
3133 p_cpo = (char_u *)"";
3134 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(pat, RE_MAGIC1 + RE_STRING2);
3135 if (regmatch.regprog != NULL((void*)0)) {
3136 regmatch.rm_ic = ic;
3137 matches = vim_regexec_nl(&regmatch, text, (colnr_T)0);
3138 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
3139 }
3140 p_cpo = save_cpo;
3141 return matches;
3142}
3143
3144// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
3145
3146/*
3147 * The "evaluate" argument: When FALSE, the argument is only parsed but not
3148 * executed. The function may return OK, but the rettv will be of type
3149 * VAR_UNKNOWN. The function still returns FAIL for a syntax error.
3150 */
3151
3152/*
3153 * Handle zero level expression.
3154 * This calls eval1() and handles error message and nextcmd.
3155 * Put the result in "rettv" when returning OK and "evaluate" is TRUE.
3156 * Note: "rettv.v_lock" is not set.
3157 * Return OK or FAIL.
3158 */
3159int eval0(char_u *arg, typval_T *rettv, char_u **nextcmd, int evaluate)
3160{
3161 int ret;
3162 char_u *p;
3163
3164 p = skipwhite(arg);
3165 ret = eval1(&p, rettv, evaluate);
3166 if (ret == FAIL0 || !ends_excmd(*p)) {
3167 if (ret != FAIL0) {
3168 tv_clear(rettv);
3169 }
3170 // Report the invalid expression unless the expression evaluation has
3171 // been cancelled due to an aborting error, an interrupt, or an
3172 // exception.
3173 if (!aborting()) {
3174 emsgf(_(e_invexpr2)gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2)), arg);
3175 }
3176 ret = FAIL0;
3177 }
3178 if (nextcmd != NULL((void*)0))
3179 *nextcmd = check_nextcmd(p);
3180
3181 return ret;
3182}
3183
3184// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
3185
3186/*
3187 * Handle top level expression:
3188 * expr2 ? expr1 : expr1
3189 *
3190 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3191 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3192 *
3193 * Note: "rettv.v_lock" is not set.
3194 *
3195 * Return OK or FAIL.
3196 */
3197int eval1(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3198{
3199 int result;
3200 typval_T var2;
3201
3202 /*
3203 * Get the first variable.
3204 */
3205 if (eval2(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3206 return FAIL0;
3207
3208 if ((*arg)[0] == '?') {
3209 result = FALSE0;
3210 if (evaluate) {
3211 bool_Bool error = false0;
3212
3213 if (tv_get_number_chk(rettv, &error) != 0) {
3214 result = true1;
3215 }
3216 tv_clear(rettv);
3217 if (error) {
3218 return FAIL0;
3219 }
3220 }
3221
3222 /*
3223 * Get the second variable.
3224 */
3225 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3226 if (eval1(arg, rettv, evaluate && result) == FAIL0) { // recursive!
3227 return FAIL0;
3228 }
3229
3230 /*
3231 * Check for the ":".
3232 */
3233 if ((*arg)[0] != ':') {
3234 EMSG(_("E109: Missing ':' after '?'"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E109: Missing ':' after '?'"
))));
3235 if (evaluate && result) {
3236 tv_clear(rettv);
3237 }
3238 return FAIL0;
3239 }
3240
3241 /*
3242 * Get the third variable.
3243 */
3244 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3245 if (eval1(arg, &var2, evaluate && !result) == FAIL0) { // Recursive!
3246 if (evaluate && result) {
3247 tv_clear(rettv);
3248 }
3249 return FAIL0;
3250 }
3251 if (evaluate && !result)
3252 *rettv = var2;
3253 }
3254
3255 return OK1;
3256}
3257
3258// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
3259
3260/*
3261 * Handle first level expression:
3262 * expr2 || expr2 || expr2 logical OR
3263 *
3264 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3265 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3266 *
3267 * Return OK or FAIL.
3268 */
3269static int eval2(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3270{
3271 typval_T var2;
3272 long result;
3273 int first;
3274 bool_Bool error = false0;
3275
3276 /*
3277 * Get the first variable.
3278 */
3279 if (eval3(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3280 return FAIL0;
3281
3282 /*
3283 * Repeat until there is no following "||".
3284 */
3285 first = TRUE1;
3286 result = FALSE0;
3287 while ((*arg)[0] == '|' && (*arg)[1] == '|') {
3288 if (evaluate && first) {
3289 if (tv_get_number_chk(rettv, &error) != 0) {
3290 result = true1;
3291 }
3292 tv_clear(rettv);
3293 if (error) {
3294 return FAIL0;
3295 }
3296 first = false0;
3297 }
3298
3299 /*
3300 * Get the second variable.
3301 */
3302 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 2);
3303 if (eval3(arg, &var2, evaluate && !result) == FAIL0)
3304 return FAIL0;
3305
3306 /*
3307 * Compute the result.
3308 */
3309 if (evaluate && !result) {
3310 if (tv_get_number_chk(&var2, &error) != 0) {
3311 result = true1;
3312 }
3313 tv_clear(&var2);
3314 if (error) {
3315 return FAIL0;
3316 }
3317 }
3318 if (evaluate) {
3319 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
3320 rettv->vval.v_number = result;
3321 }
3322 }
3323
3324 return OK1;
3325}
3326
3327// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
3328
3329/*
3330 * Handle second level expression:
3331 * expr3 && expr3 && expr3 logical AND
3332 *
3333 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3334 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3335 *
3336 * Return OK or FAIL.
3337 */
3338static int eval3(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3339{
3340 typval_T var2;
3341 long result;
3342 int first;
3343 bool_Bool error = false0;
3344
3345 /*
3346 * Get the first variable.
3347 */
3348 if (eval4(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3349 return FAIL0;
3350
3351 /*
3352 * Repeat until there is no following "&&".
3353 */
3354 first = TRUE1;
3355 result = TRUE1;
3356 while ((*arg)[0] == '&' && (*arg)[1] == '&') {
3357 if (evaluate && first) {
3358 if (tv_get_number_chk(rettv, &error) == 0) {
3359 result = false0;
3360 }
3361 tv_clear(rettv);
3362 if (error) {
3363 return FAIL0;
3364 }
3365 first = false0;
3366 }
3367
3368 /*
3369 * Get the second variable.
3370 */
3371 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 2);
3372 if (eval4(arg, &var2, evaluate && result) == FAIL0)
3373 return FAIL0;
3374
3375 /*
3376 * Compute the result.
3377 */
3378 if (evaluate && result) {
3379 if (tv_get_number_chk(&var2, &error) == 0) {
3380 result = false0;
3381 }
3382 tv_clear(&var2);
3383 if (error) {
3384 return FAIL0;
3385 }
3386 }
3387 if (evaluate) {
3388 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
3389 rettv->vval.v_number = result;
3390 }
3391 }
3392
3393 return OK1;
3394}
3395
3396// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
3397
3398/*
3399 * Handle third level expression:
3400 * var1 == var2
3401 * var1 =~ var2
3402 * var1 != var2
3403 * var1 !~ var2
3404 * var1 > var2
3405 * var1 >= var2
3406 * var1 < var2
3407 * var1 <= var2
3408 * var1 is var2
3409 * var1 isnot var2
3410 *
3411 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3412 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3413 *
3414 * Return OK or FAIL.
3415 */
3416static int eval4(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3417{
3418 typval_T var2;
3419 char_u *p;
3420 exprtype_T type = EXPR_UNKNOWN;
3421 int len = 2;
3422 bool_Bool ic;
3423
3424 /*
3425 * Get the first variable.
3426 */
3427 if (eval5(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3428 return FAIL0;
3429
3430 p = *arg;
3431 switch (p[0]) {
3432 case '=':
3433 if (p[1] == '=') {
3434 type = EXPR_EQUAL;
3435 } else if (p[1] == '~') {
3436 type = EXPR_MATCH;
3437 }
3438 break;
3439 case '!':
3440 if (p[1] == '=') {
3441 type = EXPR_NEQUAL;
3442 } else if (p[1] == '~') {
3443 type = EXPR_NOMATCH;
3444 }
3445 break;
3446 case '>':
3447 if (p[1] != '=') {
3448 type = EXPR_GREATER;
3449 len = 1;
3450 } else {
3451 type = EXPR_GEQUAL;
3452 }
3453 break;
3454 case '<':
3455 if (p[1] != '=') {
3456 type = EXPR_SMALLER;
3457 len = 1;
3458 } else {
3459 type = EXPR_SEQUAL;
3460 }
3461 break;
3462 case 'i': if (p[1] == 's') {
3463 if (p[2] == 'n' && p[3] == 'o' && p[4] == 't') {
3464 len = 5;
3465 }
3466 if (!isalnum(p[len])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((p[len]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISalnum) && p[len] != '_') {
3467 type = len == 2 ? EXPR_IS : EXPR_ISNOT;
3468 }
3469 }
3470 break;
3471 }
3472
3473 /*
3474 * If there is a comparative operator, use it.
3475 */
3476 if (type != EXPR_UNKNOWN) {
3477 // extra question mark appended: ignore case
3478 if (p[len] == '?') {
3479 ic = true1;
3480 len++;
3481 } else if (p[len] == '#') { // extra '#' appended: match case
3482 ic = false0;
3483 len++;
3484 } else { // nothing appended: use 'ignorecase'
3485 ic = p_ic;
3486 }
3487
3488 // Get the second variable.
3489 *arg = skipwhite(p + len);
3490 if (eval5(arg, &var2, evaluate) == FAIL0) {
3491 tv_clear(rettv);
3492 return FAIL0;
3493 }
3494 if (evaluate) {
3495 const int ret = typval_compare(rettv, &var2, type, ic);
3496
3497 tv_clear(&var2);
3498 return ret;
3499 }
3500 }
3501
3502 return OK1;
3503}
3504
3505// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
3506
3507/*
3508 * Handle fourth level expression:
3509 * + number addition
3510 * - number subtraction
3511 * . string concatenation
3512 * .. string concatenation
3513 *
3514 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3515 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3516 *
3517 * Return OK or FAIL.
3518 */
3519static int eval5(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3520{
3521 typval_T var2;
3522 typval_T var3;
3523 int op;
3524 varnumber_T n1, n2;
3525 float_T f1 = 0, f2 = 0;
3526 char_u *p;
3527
3528 /*
3529 * Get the first variable.
3530 */
3531 if (eval6(arg, rettv, evaluate, FALSE0) == FAIL0)
3532 return FAIL0;
3533
3534 /*
3535 * Repeat computing, until no '+', '-' or '.' is following.
3536 */
3537 for (;; ) {
3538 op = **arg;
3539 if (op != '+' && op != '-' && op != '.')
3540 break;
3541
3542 if ((op != '+' || rettv->v_type != VAR_LIST)
3543 && (op == '.' || rettv->v_type != VAR_FLOAT)) {
3544 // For "list + ...", an illegal use of the first operand as
3545 // a number cannot be determined before evaluating the 2nd
3546 // operand: if this is also a list, all is ok.
3547 // For "something . ...", "something - ..." or "non-list + ...",
3548 // we know that the first operand needs to be a string or number
3549 // without evaluating the 2nd operand. So check before to avoid
3550 // side effects after an error.
3551 if (evaluate && !tv_check_str(rettv)) {
3552 tv_clear(rettv);
3553 return FAIL0;
3554 }
3555 }
3556
3557 /*
3558 * Get the second variable.
3559 */
3560 if (op == '.' && *(*arg + 1) == '.') { // ..string concatenation
3561 (*arg)++;
3562 }
3563 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3564 if (eval6(arg, &var2, evaluate, op == '.') == FAIL0) {
3565 tv_clear(rettv);
3566 return FAIL0;
3567 }
3568
3569 if (evaluate) {
3570 /*
3571 * Compute the result.
3572 */
3573 if (op == '.') {
3574 char buf1[NUMBUFLEN];
3575 char buf2[NUMBUFLEN];
3576 // s1 already checked
3577 const char *const s1 = tv_get_string_buf(rettv, buf1);
3578 const char *const s2 = tv_get_string_buf_chk(&var2, buf2);
3579 if (s2 == NULL((void*)0)) { // Type error?
3580 tv_clear(rettv);
3581 tv_clear(&var2);
3582 return FAIL0;
3583 }
3584 p = concat_str((const char_u *)s1, (const char_u *)s2);
3585 tv_clear(rettv);
3586 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
3587 rettv->vval.v_string = p;
3588 } else if (op == '+' && rettv->v_type == VAR_LIST
3589 && var2.v_type == VAR_LIST) {
3590 // Concatenate Lists.
3591 if (tv_list_concat(rettv->vval.v_list, var2.vval.v_list, &var3)
3592 == FAIL0) {
3593 tv_clear(rettv);
3594 tv_clear(&var2);
3595 return FAIL0;
3596 }
3597 tv_clear(rettv);
3598 *rettv = var3;
3599 } else {
3600 bool_Bool error = false0;
3601
3602 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
3603 f1 = rettv->vval.v_float;
3604 n1 = 0;
3605 } else {
3606 n1 = tv_get_number_chk(rettv, &error);
3607 if (error) {
3608 /* This can only happen for "list + non-list". For
3609 * "non-list + ..." or "something - ...", we returned
3610 * before evaluating the 2nd operand. */
3611 tv_clear(rettv);
3612 return FAIL0;
3613 }
3614 if (var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT)
3615 f1 = n1;
3616 }
3617 if (var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
3618 f2 = var2.vval.v_float;
3619 n2 = 0;
3620 } else {
3621 n2 = tv_get_number_chk(&var2, &error);
3622 if (error) {
3623 tv_clear(rettv);
3624 tv_clear(&var2);
3625 return FAIL0;
3626 }
3627 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT)
3628 f2 = n2;
3629 }
3630 tv_clear(rettv);
3631
3632 // If there is a float on either side the result is a float.
3633 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT || var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
3634 if (op == '+')
3635 f1 = f1 + f2;
3636 else
3637 f1 = f1 - f2;
3638 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT;
3639 rettv->vval.v_float = f1;
3640 } else {
3641 if (op == '+')
3642 n1 = n1 + n2;
3643 else
3644 n1 = n1 - n2;
3645 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
3646 rettv->vval.v_number = n1;
3647 }
3648 }
3649 tv_clear(&var2);
3650 }
3651 }
3652 return OK1;
3653}
3654
3655// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
3656
3657/// Handle fifth level expression:
3658/// - * number multiplication
3659/// - / number division
3660/// - % number modulo
3661///
3662/// @param[in,out] arg Points to the first non-whitespace character of the
3663/// expression. Is advanced to the next non-whitespace
3664/// character after the recognized expression.
3665/// @param[out] rettv Location where result is saved.
3666/// @param[in] evaluate If not true, rettv is not populated.
3667/// @param[in] want_string True if "." is string_concatenation, otherwise
3668/// float
3669/// @return OK or FAIL.
3670static int eval6(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate, int want_string)
3671 FUNC_ATTR_NO_SANITIZE_UNDEFINED
3672{
3673 typval_T var2;
3674 int op;
3675 varnumber_T n1, n2;
3676 bool_Bool use_float = false0;
3677 float_T f1 = 0, f2 = 0;
3678 bool_Bool error = false0;
3679
3680 /*
3681 * Get the first variable.
3682 */
3683 if (eval7(arg, rettv, evaluate, want_string) == FAIL0)
3684 return FAIL0;
3685
3686 /*
3687 * Repeat computing, until no '*', '/' or '%' is following.
3688 */
3689 for (;; ) {
3690 op = **arg;
3691 if (op != '*' && op != '/' && op != '%') {
3692 break;
3693 }
3694
3695 if (evaluate) {
3696 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
3697 f1 = rettv->vval.v_float;
3698 use_float = true1;
3699 n1 = 0;
3700 } else {
3701 n1 = tv_get_number_chk(rettv, &error);
3702 }
3703 tv_clear(rettv);
3704 if (error) {
3705 return FAIL0;
3706 }
3707 } else {
3708 n1 = 0;
3709 }
3710
3711 /*
3712 * Get the second variable.
3713 */
3714 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3715 if (eval7(arg, &var2, evaluate, FALSE0) == FAIL0)
3716 return FAIL0;
3717
3718 if (evaluate) {
3719 if (var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
3720 if (!use_float) {
3721 f1 = n1;
3722 use_float = true1;
3723 }
3724 f2 = var2.vval.v_float;
3725 n2 = 0;
3726 } else {
3727 n2 = tv_get_number_chk(&var2, &error);
3728 tv_clear(&var2);
3729 if (error) {
3730 return FAIL0;
3731 }
3732 if (use_float) {
3733 f2 = n2;
3734 }
3735 }
3736
3737 /*
3738 * Compute the result.
3739 * When either side is a float the result is a float.
3740 */
3741 if (use_float) {
3742 if (op == '*') {
3743 f1 = f1 * f2;
3744 } else if (op == '/') {
3745 // Division by zero triggers error from AddressSanitizer
3746 f1 = (f2 == 0
3747 ? (
3748#ifdef NAN(__builtin_nanf (""))
3749 f1 == 0
3750 ? NAN(__builtin_nanf (""))
3751 :
3752#endif
3753 (f1 > 0
3754 ? INFINITY(__builtin_inff ())
3755 : -INFINITY(__builtin_inff ()))
3756 )
3757 : f1 / f2);
3758 } else {
3759 EMSG(_("E804: Cannot use '%' with Float"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E804: Cannot use '%' with Float"
))));
3760 return FAIL0;
3761 }
3762 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT;
3763 rettv->vval.v_float = f1;
3764 } else {
3765 if (op == '*') {
3766 n1 = n1 * n2;
3767 } else if (op == '/') {
3768 n1 = num_divide(n1, n2);
3769 } else {
3770 n1 = num_modulus(n1, n2);
3771 }
3772 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
3773 rettv->vval.v_number = n1;
3774 }
3775 }
3776 }
3777
3778 return OK1;
3779}
3780
3781// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
3782
3783// Handle sixth level expression:
3784// number number constant
3785// "string" string constant
3786// 'string' literal string constant
3787// &option-name option value
3788// @r register contents
3789// identifier variable value
3790// function() function call
3791// $VAR environment variable
3792// (expression) nested expression
3793// [expr, expr] List
3794// {key: val, key: val} Dictionary
3795// #{key: val, key: val} Dictionary with literal keys
3796//
3797// Also handle:
3798// ! in front logical NOT
3799// - in front unary minus
3800// + in front unary plus (ignored)
3801// trailing [] subscript in String or List
3802// trailing .name entry in Dictionary
3803//
3804// "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3805// "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3806//
3807// Return OK or FAIL.
3808static int eval7(
3809 char_u **arg,
3810 typval_T *rettv,
3811 int evaluate,
3812 int want_string // after "." operator
3813)
3814{
3815 varnumber_T n;
3816 int len;
3817 char_u *s;
3818 char_u *start_leader, *end_leader;
3819 int ret = OK1;
3820 char_u *alias;
3821
3822 // Initialise variable so that tv_clear() can't mistake this for a
3823 // string and free a string that isn't there.
3824 rettv->v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
3825
3826 // Skip '!', '-' and '+' characters. They are handled later.
3827 start_leader = *arg;
3828 while (**arg == '!' || **arg == '-' || **arg == '+') {
3829 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3830 }
3831 end_leader = *arg;
3832
3833 switch (**arg) {
3834 // Number constant.
3835 case '0':
3836 case '1':
3837 case '2':
3838 case '3':
3839 case '4':
3840 case '5':
3841 case '6':
3842 case '7':
3843 case '8':
3844 case '9':
3845 {
3846 char_u *p = skipdigits(*arg + 1);
3847 int get_float = false0;
3848
3849 // We accept a float when the format matches
3850 // "[0-9]\+\.[0-9]\+\([eE][+-]\?[0-9]\+\)\?". This is very
3851 // strict to avoid backwards compatibility problems.
3852 // Don't look for a float after the "." operator, so that
3853 // ":let vers = 1.2.3" doesn't fail.
3854 if (!want_string && p[0] == '.' && ascii_isdigit(p[1])) {
3855 get_float = true1;
3856 p = skipdigits(p + 2);
3857 if (*p == 'e' || *p == 'E') {
3858 ++p;
3859 if (*p == '-' || *p == '+') {
3860 ++p;
3861 }
3862 if (!ascii_isdigit(*p)) {
3863 get_float = false0;
3864 } else {
3865 p = skipdigits(p + 1);
3866 }
3867 }
3868 if (ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z')) || *p == '.') {
3869 get_float = false0;
3870 }
3871 }
3872 if (get_float) {
3873 float_T f;
3874
3875 *arg += string2float((char *) *arg, &f);
3876 if (evaluate) {
3877 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT;
3878 rettv->vval.v_float = f;
3879 }
3880 } else {
3881 vim_str2nr(*arg, NULL((void*)0), &len, STR2NR_ALL, &n, NULL((void*)0), 0);
3882 *arg += len;
3883 if (evaluate) {
3884 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
3885 rettv->vval.v_number = n;
3886 }
3887 }
3888 break;
3889 }
3890
3891 // String constant: "string".
3892 case '"': ret = get_string_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
3893 break;
3894
3895 // Literal string constant: 'str''ing'.
3896 case '\'': ret = get_lit_string_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
3897 break;
3898
3899 // List: [expr, expr]
3900 case '[': ret = get_list_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
3901 break;
3902
3903 // Dictionary: #{key: val, key: val}
3904 case '#':
3905 if ((*arg)[1] == '{') {
3906 (*arg)++;
3907 ret = dict_get_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate, true1);
3908 } else {
3909 ret = NOTDONE2;
3910 }
3911 break;
3912
3913 // Lambda: {arg, arg -> expr}
3914 // Dictionary: {'key': val, 'key': val}
3915 case '{': ret = get_lambda_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
3916 if (ret == NOTDONE2) {
3917 ret = dict_get_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate, false0);
3918 }
3919 break;
3920
3921 // Option value: &name
3922 case '&': {
3923 ret = get_option_tv((const char **)arg, rettv, evaluate);
3924 break;
3925 }
3926 // Environment variable: $VAR.
3927 case '$': ret = get_env_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
3928 break;
3929
3930 // Register contents: @r.
3931 case '@': ++*arg;
3932 if (evaluate) {
3933 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
3934 rettv->vval.v_string = get_reg_contents(**arg, kGRegExprSrc);
3935 }
3936 if (**arg != NUL'\000') {
3937 ++*arg;
3938 }
3939 break;
3940
3941 // nested expression: (expression).
3942 case '(': *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3943 ret = eval1(arg, rettv, evaluate); // recursive!
3944 if (**arg == ')') {
3945 ++*arg;
3946 } else if (ret == OK1) {
3947 EMSG(_("E110: Missing ')'"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E110: Missing ')'"))));
3948 tv_clear(rettv);
3949 ret = FAIL0;
3950 }
3951 break;
3952
3953 default: ret = NOTDONE2;
3954 break;
3955 }
3956
3957 if (ret == NOTDONE2) {
3958 // Must be a variable or function name.
3959 // Can also be a curly-braces kind of name: {expr}.
3960 s = *arg;
3961 len = get_name_len((const char **)arg, (char **)&alias, evaluate, true1);
3962 if (alias != NULL((void*)0)) {
3963 s = alias;
3964 }
3965
3966 if (len <= 0) {
3967 ret = FAIL0;
3968 } else {
3969 if (**arg == '(') { // recursive!
3970 partial_T *partial;
3971
3972 if (!evaluate) {
3973 check_vars((const char *)s, len);
3974 }
3975
3976 // If "s" is the name of a variable of type VAR_FUNC
3977 // use its contents.
3978 s = deref_func_name((const char *)s, &len, &partial, !evaluate);
3979
3980 // Need to make a copy, in case evaluating the arguments makes
3981 // the name invalid.
3982 s = xmemdupz(s, len);
3983
3984 // Invoke the function.
3985 ret = get_func_tv(s, len, rettv, arg,
3986 curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
3987 &len, evaluate, partial, NULL((void*)0));
3988
3989 xfree(s);
3990
3991 // If evaluate is false rettv->v_type was not set in
3992 // get_func_tv, but it's needed in handle_subscript() to parse
3993 // what follows. So set it here.
3994 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN && !evaluate && **arg == '(') {
3995 rettv->vval.v_string = (char_u *)tv_empty_string;
3996 rettv->v_type = VAR_FUNC;
3997 }
3998
3999 // Stop the expression evaluation when immediately
4000 // aborting on error, or when an interrupt occurred or
4001 // an exception was thrown but not caught.
4002 if (evaluate && aborting()) {
4003 if (ret == OK1) {
4004 tv_clear(rettv);
4005 }
4006 ret = FAIL0;
4007 }
4008 } else if (evaluate) {
4009 ret = get_var_tv((const char *)s, len, rettv, NULL((void*)0), true1, false0);
4010 } else {
4011 check_vars((const char *)s, len);
4012 ret = OK1;
4013 }
4014 }
4015 xfree(alias);
4016 }
4017
4018 *arg = skipwhite(*arg);
4019
4020 // Handle following '[', '(' and '.' for expr[expr], expr.name,
4021 // expr(expr).
4022 if (ret == OK1) {
4023 ret = handle_subscript((const char **)arg, rettv, evaluate, true1);
4024 }
4025
4026 // Apply logical NOT and unary '-', from right to left, ignore '+'.
4027 if (ret == OK1 && evaluate && end_leader > start_leader) {
4028 bool_Bool error = false0;
4029 varnumber_T val = 0;
4030 float_T f = 0.0;
4031
4032 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
4033 f = rettv->vval.v_float;
4034 } else {
4035 val = tv_get_number_chk(rettv, &error);
4036 }
4037 if (error) {
4038 tv_clear(rettv);
4039 ret = FAIL0;
4040 } else {
4041 while (end_leader > start_leader) {
4042 --end_leader;
4043 if (*end_leader == '!') {
4044 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
4045 f = !f;
4046 } else {
4047 val = !val;
4048 }
4049 } else if (*end_leader == '-') {
4050 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
4051 f = -f;
4052 } else {
4053 val = -val;
4054 }
4055 }
4056 }
4057 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
4058 tv_clear(rettv);
4059 rettv->vval.v_float = f;
4060 } else {
4061 tv_clear(rettv);
4062 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
4063 rettv->vval.v_number = val;
4064 }
4065 }
4066 }
4067
4068 return ret;
4069}
4070
4071// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
4072
4073/*
4074 * Evaluate an "[expr]" or "[expr:expr]" index. Also "dict.key".
4075 * "*arg" points to the '[' or '.'.
4076 * Returns FAIL or OK. "*arg" is advanced to after the ']'.
4077 */
4078static int
4079eval_index(
4080 char_u **arg,
4081 typval_T *rettv,
4082 int evaluate,
4083 int verbose // give error messages
4084)
4085{
4086 bool_Bool empty1 = false0;
4087 bool_Bool empty2 = false0;
4088 long n1, n2 = 0;
4089 ptrdiff_t len = -1;
4090 int range = false0;
4091 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0);
4092
4093 switch (rettv->v_type) {
4094 case VAR_FUNC:
4095 case VAR_PARTIAL: {
4096 if (verbose) {
4097 EMSG(_("E695: Cannot index a Funcref"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E695: Cannot index a Funcref"
))));
4098 }
4099 return FAIL0;
4100 }
4101 case VAR_FLOAT: {
4102 if (verbose) {
4103 EMSG(_(e_float_as_string))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_float_as_string))));
4104 }
4105 return FAIL0;
4106 }
4107 case VAR_BOOL:
4108 case VAR_SPECIAL: {
4109 if (verbose) {
4110 EMSG(_("E909: Cannot index a special variable"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E909: Cannot index a special variable"
))));
4111 }
4112 return FAIL0;
4113 }
4114 case VAR_UNKNOWN: {
4115 if (evaluate) {
4116 return FAIL0;
4117 }
4118 FALLTHROUGH__attribute__((fallthrough));
4119 }
4120 case VAR_STRING:
4121 case VAR_NUMBER:
4122 case VAR_LIST:
4123 case VAR_DICT: {
4124 break;
4125 }
4126 }
4127
4128 typval_T var1 = TV_INITIAL_VALUE((typval_T) { .v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN, .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED, }
);
4129 typval_T var2 = TV_INITIAL_VALUE((typval_T) { .v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN, .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED, }
);
4130 if (**arg == '.') {
4131 /*
4132 * dict.name
4133 */
4134 key = *arg + 1;
4135 for (len = 0; ASCII_ISALNUM(key[len])((((unsigned)(key[len]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(key[len
]) <= 'Z') || ((unsigned)(key[len]) >= 'a' && (
unsigned)(key[len]) <= 'z')) || ascii_isdigit(key[len])) || key[len] == '_'; ++len)
4136 ;
4137 if (len == 0)
4138 return FAIL0;
4139 *arg = skipwhite(key + len);
4140 } else {
4141 /*
4142 * something[idx]
4143 *
4144 * Get the (first) variable from inside the [].
4145 */
4146 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4147 if (**arg == ':') {
4148 empty1 = true1;
4149 } else if (eval1(arg, &var1, evaluate) == FAIL0) { // Recursive!
4150 return FAIL0;
4151 } else if (evaluate && !tv_check_str(&var1)) {
4152 // Not a number or string.
4153 tv_clear(&var1);
4154 return FAIL0;
4155 }
4156
4157 /*
4158 * Get the second variable from inside the [:].
4159 */
4160 if (**arg == ':') {
4161 range = TRUE1;
4162 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4163 if (**arg == ']') {
4164 empty2 = true1;
4165 } else if (eval1(arg, &var2, evaluate) == FAIL0) { // Recursive!
4166 if (!empty1) {
4167 tv_clear(&var1);
4168 }
4169 return FAIL0;
4170 } else if (evaluate && !tv_check_str(&var2)) {
4171 // Not a number or string.
4172 if (!empty1) {
4173 tv_clear(&var1);
4174 }
4175 tv_clear(&var2);
4176 return FAIL0;
4177 }
4178 }
4179
4180 // Check for the ']'.
4181 if (**arg != ']') {
4182 if (verbose) {
4183 EMSG(_(e_missbrac))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_missbrac))));
4184 }
4185 tv_clear(&var1);
4186 if (range) {
4187 tv_clear(&var2);
4188 }
4189 return FAIL0;
4190 }
4191 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1); // skip the ']'
4192 }
4193
4194 if (evaluate) {
4195 n1 = 0;
4196 if (!empty1 && rettv->v_type != VAR_DICT && !tv_is_luafunc(rettv)) {
4197 n1 = tv_get_number(&var1);
4198 tv_clear(&var1);
4199 }
4200 if (range) {
4201 if (empty2) {
4202 n2 = -1;
4203 } else {
4204 n2 = tv_get_number(&var2);
4205 tv_clear(&var2);
4206 }
4207 }
4208
4209 switch (rettv->v_type) {
4210 case VAR_NUMBER:
4211 case VAR_STRING: {
4212 const char *const s = tv_get_string(rettv);
4213 char *v;
4214 len = (ptrdiff_t)strlen(s);
4215 if (range) {
4216 // The resulting variable is a substring. If the indexes
4217 // are out of range the result is empty.
4218 if (n1 < 0) {
4219 n1 = len + n1;
4220 if (n1 < 0) {
4221 n1 = 0;
4222 }
4223 }
4224 if (n2 < 0) {
4225 n2 = len + n2;
4226 } else if (n2 >= len) {
4227 n2 = len;
4228 }
4229 if (n1 >= len || n2 < 0 || n1 > n2) {
4230 v = NULL((void*)0);
4231 } else {
4232 v = xmemdupz(s + n1, (size_t)(n2 - n1 + 1));
4233 }
4234 } else {
4235 // The resulting variable is a string of a single
4236 // character. If the index is too big or negative the
4237 // result is empty.
4238 if (n1 >= len || n1 < 0) {
4239 v = NULL((void*)0);
4240 } else {
4241 v = xmemdupz(s + n1, 1);
4242 }
4243 }
4244 tv_clear(rettv);
4245 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
4246 rettv->vval.v_string = (char_u *)v;
4247 break;
4248 }
4249 case VAR_LIST: {
4250 len = tv_list_len(rettv->vval.v_list);
4251 if (n1 < 0) {
4252 n1 = len + n1;
4253 }
4254 if (!empty1 && (n1 < 0 || n1 >= len)) {
4255 // For a range we allow invalid values and return an empty
4256 // list. A list index out of range is an error.
4257 if (!range) {
4258 if (verbose) {
4259 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), n1)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t
)(n1));
4260 }
4261 return FAIL0;
4262 }
4263 n1 = len;
4264 }
4265 if (range) {
4266 list_T *l;
4267 listitem_T *item;
4268
4269 if (n2 < 0) {
4270 n2 = len + n2;
4271 } else if (n2 >= len) {
4272 n2 = len - 1;
4273 }
4274 if (!empty2 && (n2 < 0 || n2 + 1 < n1)) {
4275 n2 = -1;
4276 }
4277 l = tv_list_alloc(n2 - n1 + 1);
4278 item = tv_list_find(rettv->vval.v_list, n1);
4279 while (n1++ <= n2) {
4280 tv_list_append_tv(l, TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(item)(&(item)->li_tv));
4281 item = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(rettv->vval.v_list, item)((item)->li_next);
4282 }
4283 tv_clear(rettv);
4284 tv_list_set_ret(rettv, l);
4285 } else {
4286 tv_copy(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(tv_list_find(rettv->vval.v_list, n1))(&(tv_list_find(rettv->vval.v_list, n1))->li_tv), &var1);
4287 tv_clear(rettv);
4288 *rettv = var1;
4289 }
4290 break;
4291 }
4292 case VAR_DICT: {
4293 if (range) {
4294 if (verbose) {
4295 EMSG(_(e_dictrange))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictrange))));
4296 }
4297 if (len == -1) {
4298 tv_clear(&var1);
4299 }
4300 return FAIL0;
4301 }
4302
4303 if (len == -1) {
4304 key = (char_u *)tv_get_string_chk(&var1);
4305 if (key == NULL((void*)0)) {
4306 tv_clear(&var1);
4307 return FAIL0;
4308 }
4309 }
4310
4311 dictitem_T *const item = tv_dict_find(rettv->vval.v_dict,
4312 (const char *)key, len);
4313
4314 if (item == NULL((void*)0) && verbose) {
4315 emsgf(_(e_dictkey)gettext((char *)(e_dictkey)), key);
4316 }
4317 if (len == -1) {
4318 tv_clear(&var1);
4319 }
4320 if (item == NULL((void*)0) || tv_is_luafunc(&item->di_tv)) {
4321 return FAIL0;
4322 }
4323
4324 tv_copy(&item->di_tv, &var1);
4325 tv_clear(rettv);
4326 *rettv = var1;
4327 break;
4328 }
4329 case VAR_BOOL:
4330 case VAR_SPECIAL:
4331 case VAR_FUNC:
4332 case VAR_FLOAT:
4333 case VAR_PARTIAL:
4334 case VAR_UNKNOWN: {
4335 break; // Not evaluating, skipping over subscript
4336 }
4337 }
4338 }
4339
4340 return OK1;
4341}
4342
4343// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/executor
4344
4345/// Get an option value
4346///
4347/// @param[in,out] arg Points to the '&' or '+' before the option name. Is
4348/// advanced to the character after the option name.
4349/// @param[out] rettv Location where result is saved.
4350/// @param[in] evaluate If not true, rettv is not populated.
4351///
4352/// @return OK or FAIL.
4353int get_option_tv(const char **const arg, typval_T *const rettv,
4354 const bool_Bool evaluate)
4355 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1)
4356{
4357 long numval;
4358 char_u *stringval;
4359 int opt_type;
4360 int c;
4361 bool_Bool working = (**arg == '+'); // has("+option")
4362 int ret = OK1;
4363 int opt_flags;
4364
4365 // Isolate the option name and find its value.
4366 char *option_end = (char *)find_option_end(arg, &opt_flags);
4367 if (option_end == NULL((void*)0)) {
4368 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0)) {
4369 EMSG2(_("E112: Option name missing: %s"), *arg)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E112: Option name missing: %s"
))), (*arg));
4370 }
4371 return FAIL0;
4372 }
4373
4374 if (!evaluate) {
4375 *arg = option_end;
4376 return OK1;
4377 }
4378
4379 c = *option_end;
4380 *option_end = NUL'\000';
4381 opt_type = get_option_value(*arg, &numval,
4382 rettv == NULL((void*)0) ? NULL((void*)0) : &stringval, opt_flags);
4383
4384 if (opt_type == -3) { // invalid name
4385 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0)) {
4386 EMSG2(_("E113: Unknown option: %s"), *arg)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E113: Unknown option: %s"
))), (*arg));
4387 }
4388 ret = FAIL0;
4389 } else if (rettv != NULL((void*)0)) {
4390 if (opt_type == -2) { // hidden string option
4391 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
4392 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
4393 } else if (opt_type == -1) { // hidden number option
4394 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
4395 rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
4396 } else if (opt_type == 1) { // number option
4397 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
4398 rettv->vval.v_number = numval;
4399 } else { // string option
4400 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
4401 rettv->vval.v_string = stringval;
4402 }
4403 } else if (working && (opt_type == -2 || opt_type == -1))
4404 ret = FAIL0;
4405
4406 *option_end = c; // put back for error messages
4407 *arg = option_end;
4408
4409 return ret;
4410}
4411
4412/*
4413 * Allocate a variable for a string constant.
4414 * Return OK or FAIL.
4415 */
4416static int get_string_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
4417{
4418 char_u *p;
4419 unsigned int extra = 0;
4420
4421 /*
4422 * Find the end of the string, skipping backslashed characters.
4423 */
4424 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '"'; MB_PTR_ADV(p)(p += utfc_ptr2len((char_u *)p))) {
4425 if (*p == '\\' && p[1] != NUL'\000') {
4426 p++;
4427 // A "\<x>" form occupies at least 4 characters, and produces up
4428 // to 21 characters (3 * 6 for the char and 3 for a modifier):
4429 // reserve space for 18 extra.
4430 // Each byte in the char could be encoded as K_SPECIAL K_EXTRA x.
4431 if (*p == '<') {
4432 extra += 18;
4433 }
4434 }
4435 }
4436
4437 if (*p != '"') {
4438 EMSG2(_("E114: Missing quote: %s"), *arg)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E114: Missing quote: %s"
))), (*arg));
4439 return FAIL0;
4440 }
4441
4442 // If only parsing, set *arg and return here
4443 if (!evaluate) {
4444 *arg = p + 1;
4445 return OK1;
4446 }
4447
4448 /*
4449 * Copy the string into allocated memory, handling backslashed
4450 * characters.
4451 */
4452 const int len = (int)(p - *arg + extra);
4453 char_u *name = xmalloc(len);
4454 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
4455 rettv->vval.v_string = name;
4456
4457 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '"'; ) {
4458 if (*p == '\\') {
4459 switch (*++p) {
4460 case 'b': *name++ = BS'\010'; ++p; break;
4461 case 'e': *name++ = ESC'\033'; ++p; break;
4462 case 'f': *name++ = FF'\014'; ++p; break;
4463 case 'n': *name++ = NL'\012'; ++p; break;
4464 case 'r': *name++ = CAR'\015'; ++p; break;
4465 case 't': *name++ = TAB'\011'; ++p; break;
4466
4467 case 'X': // hex: "\x1", "\x12"
4468 case 'x':
4469 case 'u': // Unicode: "\u0023"
4470 case 'U':
4471 if (ascii_isxdigit(p[1])) {
4472 int n, nr;
4473 int c = toupper(*p);
4474
4475 if (c == 'X') {
4476 n = 2;
4477 } else if (*p == 'u') {
4478 n = 4;
4479 } else {
4480 n = 8;
4481 }
4482 nr = 0;
4483 while (--n >= 0 && ascii_isxdigit(p[1])) {
4484 ++p;
4485 nr = (nr << 4) + hex2nr(*p);
4486 }
4487 ++p;
4488 /* For "\u" store the number according to
4489 * 'encoding'. */
4490 if (c != 'X') {
4491 name += utf_char2bytes(nr, name);
4492 } else {
4493 *name++ = nr;
4494 }
4495 }
4496 break;
4497
4498 // octal: "\1", "\12", "\123"
4499 case '0':
4500 case '1':
4501 case '2':
4502 case '3':
4503 case '4':
4504 case '5':
4505 case '6':
4506 case '7': *name = *p++ - '0';
4507 if (*p >= '0' && *p <= '7') {
4508 *name = (*name << 3) + *p++ - '0';
4509 if (*p >= '0' && *p <= '7')
4510 *name = (*name << 3) + *p++ - '0';
4511 }
4512 ++name;
4513 break;
4514
4515 // Special key, e.g.: "\<C-W>"
4516 case '<':
4517 extra = trans_special((const char_u **)&p, STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p)), name, true1, true1);
4518 if (extra != 0) {
4519 name += extra;
4520 if (name >= rettv->vval.v_string + len) {
4521 iemsg("get_string_tv() used more space than allocated");
4522 }
4523 break;
4524 }
4525 FALLTHROUGH__attribute__((fallthrough));
4526
4527 default: MB_COPY_CHAR(p, name)mb_copy_char((const char_u **)(&p), &name);;
4528 break;
4529 }
4530 } else
4531 MB_COPY_CHAR(p, name)mb_copy_char((const char_u **)(&p), &name);;
4532
4533 }
4534 *name = NUL'\000';
4535 if (*p != NUL'\000') { // just in case
4536 p++;
4537 }
4538 *arg = p;
4539
4540 return OK1;
4541}
4542
4543/*
4544 * Allocate a variable for a 'str''ing' constant.
4545 * Return OK or FAIL.
4546 */
4547static int get_lit_string_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
4548{
4549 char_u *p;
4550 char_u *str;
4551 int reduce = 0;
4552
4553 /*
4554 * Find the end of the string, skipping ''.
4555 */
4556 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000'; MB_PTR_ADV(p)(p += utfc_ptr2len((char_u *)p))) {
4557 if (*p == '\'') {
4558 if (p[1] != '\'')
4559 break;
4560 ++reduce;
4561 ++p;
4562 }
4563 }
4564
4565 if (*p != '\'') {
4566 EMSG2(_("E115: Missing quote: %s"), *arg)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E115: Missing quote: %s"
))), (*arg));
4567 return FAIL0;
4568 }
4569
4570 // If only parsing return after setting "*arg"
4571 if (!evaluate) {
4572 *arg = p + 1;
4573 return OK1;
4574 }
4575
4576 /*
4577 * Copy the string into allocated memory, handling '' to ' reduction.
4578 */
4579 str = xmalloc((p - *arg) - reduce);
4580 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
4581 rettv->vval.v_string = str;
4582
4583 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
4584 if (*p == '\'') {
4585 if (p[1] != '\'')
4586 break;
4587 ++p;
4588 }
4589 MB_COPY_CHAR(p, str)mb_copy_char((const char_u **)(&p), &str);;
4590 }
4591 *str = NUL'\000';
4592 *arg = p + 1;
4593
4594 return OK1;
4595}
4596
4597/// @return the function name of the partial.
4598char_u *partial_name(partial_T *pt)
4599{
4600 if (pt->pt_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
4601 return pt->pt_name;
4602 }
4603 return pt->pt_func->uf_name;
4604}
4605
4606// TODO(ZyX-I): Move to eval/typval.h
4607
4608static void partial_free(partial_T *pt)
4609{
4610 for (int i = 0; i < pt->pt_argc; i++) {
4611 tv_clear(&pt->pt_argv[i]);
4612 }
4613 xfree(pt->pt_argv);
4614 tv_dict_unref(pt->pt_dict);
4615 if (pt->pt_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
4616 func_unref(pt->pt_name);
4617 xfree(pt->pt_name);
4618 } else {
4619 func_ptr_unref(pt->pt_func);
4620 }
4621 xfree(pt);
4622}
4623
4624// TODO(ZyX-I): Move to eval/typval.h
4625
4626/// Unreference a closure: decrement the reference count and free it when it
4627/// becomes zero.
4628void partial_unref(partial_T *pt)
4629{
4630 if (pt != NULL((void*)0) && --pt->pt_refcount <= 0) {
4631 partial_free(pt);
4632 }
4633}
4634
4635/// Allocate a variable for a List and fill it from "*arg".
4636/// Return OK or FAIL.
4637static int get_list_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
4638{
4639 list_T *l = NULL((void*)0);
4640
4641 if (evaluate) {
4642 l = tv_list_alloc(kListLenShouldKnow);
4643 }
4644
4645 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4646 while (**arg != ']' && **arg != NUL'\000') {
4647 typval_T tv;
4648 if (eval1(arg, &tv, evaluate) == FAIL0) { // Recursive!
4649 goto failret;
4650 }
4651 if (evaluate) {
4652 tv.v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED;
4653 tv_list_append_owned_tv(l, tv);
4654 }
4655
4656 if (**arg == ']') {
4657 break;
4658 }
4659 if (**arg != ',') {
4660 emsgf(_("E696: Missing comma in List: %s")gettext((char *)("E696: Missing comma in List: %s")), *arg);
4661 goto failret;
4662 }
4663 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4664 }
4665
4666 if (**arg != ']') {
4667 emsgf(_("E697: Missing end of List ']': %s")gettext((char *)("E697: Missing end of List ']': %s")), *arg);
4668failret:
4669 if (evaluate) {
4670 tv_list_free(l);
4671 }
4672 return FAIL0;
4673 }
4674
4675 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4676 if (evaluate) {
4677 tv_list_set_ret(rettv, l);
4678 }
4679
4680 return OK1;
4681}
4682
4683bool_Bool func_equal(
4684 typval_T *tv1,
4685 typval_T *tv2,
4686 bool_Bool ic // ignore case
4687) {
4688 char_u *s1, *s2;
4689 dict_T *d1, *d2;
4690 int a1, a2;
4691
4692 // empty and NULL function name considered the same
4693 s1 = tv1->v_type == VAR_FUNC ? tv1->vval.v_string
4694 : partial_name(tv1->vval.v_partial);
4695 if (s1 != NULL((void*)0) && *s1 == NUL'\000') {
4696 s1 = NULL((void*)0);
4697 }
4698 s2 = tv2->v_type == VAR_FUNC ? tv2->vval.v_string
4699 : partial_name(tv2->vval.v_partial);
4700 if (s2 != NULL((void*)0) && *s2 == NUL'\000') {
4701 s2 = NULL((void*)0);
4702 }
4703 if (s1 == NULL((void*)0) || s2 == NULL((void*)0)) {
4704 if (s1 != s2) {
4705 return false0;
4706 }
4707 } else if (STRCMP(s1, s2)strcmp((char *)(s1), (char *)(s2)) != 0) {
4708 return false0;
4709 }
4710
4711 // empty dict and NULL dict is different
4712 d1 = tv1->v_type == VAR_FUNC ? NULL((void*)0) : tv1->vval.v_partial->pt_dict;
4713 d2 = tv2->v_type == VAR_FUNC ? NULL((void*)0) : tv2->vval.v_partial->pt_dict;
4714 if (d1 == NULL((void*)0) || d2 == NULL((void*)0)) {
4715 if (d1 != d2) {
4716 return false0;
4717 }
4718 } else if (!tv_dict_equal(d1, d2, ic, true1)) {
4719 return false0;
4720 }
4721
4722 // empty list and no list considered the same
4723 a1 = tv1->v_type == VAR_FUNC ? 0 : tv1->vval.v_partial->pt_argc;
4724 a2 = tv2->v_type == VAR_FUNC ? 0 : tv2->vval.v_partial->pt_argc;
4725 if (a1 != a2) {
4726 return false0;
4727 }
4728 for (int i = 0; i < a1; i++) {
4729 if (!tv_equal(tv1->vval.v_partial->pt_argv + i,
4730 tv2->vval.v_partial->pt_argv + i, ic, true1)) {
4731 return false0;
4732 }
4733 }
4734 return true1;
4735}
4736
4737/// Get next (unique) copy ID
4738///
4739/// Used for traversing nested structures e.g. when serializing them or garbage
4740/// collecting.
4741int get_copyID(void)
4742 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
4743{
4744 // CopyID for recursively traversing lists and dicts
4745 //
4746 // This value is needed to avoid endless recursiveness. Last bit is used for
4747 // previous_funccal and normally ignored when comparing.
4748 static int current_copyID = 0;
4749 current_copyID += COPYID_INC2;
4750 return current_copyID;
4751}
4752
4753/*
4754 * Garbage collection for lists and dictionaries.
4755 *
4756 * We use reference counts to be able to free most items right away when they
4757 * are no longer used. But for composite items it's possible that it becomes
4758 * unused while the reference count is > 0: When there is a recursive
4759 * reference. Example:
4760 * :let l = [1, 2, 3]
4761 * :let d = {9: l}
4762 * :let l[1] = d
4763 *
4764 * Since this is quite unusual we handle this with garbage collection: every
4765 * once in a while find out which lists and dicts are not referenced from any
4766 * variable.
4767 *
4768 * Here is a good reference text about garbage collection (refers to Python
4769 * but it applies to all reference-counting mechanisms):
4770 * http://python.ca/nas/python/gc/
4771 */
4772
4773/// Do garbage collection for lists and dicts.
4774///
4775/// @param testing true if called from test_garbagecollect_now().
4776/// @returns true if some memory was freed.
4777bool_Bool garbage_collect(bool_Bool testing)
4778{
4779 bool_Bool abort = false0;
4780#define ABORTING(func) abort = abort || func
4781
4782 if (!testing) {
4783 // Only do this once.
4784 want_garbage_collect = false0;
4785 may_garbage_collect = false0;
4786 garbage_collect_at_exit = false0;
4787 }
4788
4789 // We advance by two (COPYID_INC) because we add one for items referenced
4790 // through previous_funccal.
4791 const int copyID = get_copyID();
4792
4793 // 1. Go through all accessible variables and mark all lists and dicts
4794 // with copyID.
4795
4796 // Don't free variables in the previous_funccal list unless they are only
4797 // referenced through previous_funccal. This must be first, because if
4798 // the item is referenced elsewhere the funccal must not be freed.
4799 ABORTING(set_ref_in_previous_funccal)(copyID);
4800
4801 // script-local variables
4802 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i) {
4803 ABORTING(set_ref_in_ht)(&SCRIPT_VARS(i)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1])->sv_dict.
dv_hashtab), copyID, NULL((void*)0));
4804 }
4805
4806 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
4807 // buffer-local variables
4808 ABORTING(set_ref_in_item)(&buf->b_bufvar.di_tv, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
4809 // buffer marks (ShaDa additional data)
4810 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(buf->b_last_cursor, copyID);
4811 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(buf->b_last_insert, copyID);
4812 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(buf->b_last_change, copyID);
4813 for (size_t i = 0; i < NMARKS('z' - 'a' + 1); i++) {
4814 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(buf->b_namedm[i], copyID);
4815 }
4816 // buffer change list (ShaDa additional data)
4817 for (int i = 0; i < buf->b_changelistlen; i++) {
4818 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(buf->b_changelist[i], copyID);
4819 }
4820 // buffer ShaDa additional data
4821 ABORTING(set_ref_dict)(buf->additional_data, copyID);
4822
4823 // buffer callback functions
4824 set_ref_in_callback(&buf->b_prompt_callback, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
4825 set_ref_in_callback(&buf->b_prompt_interrupt, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
4826 }
4827
4828 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (
tp)->tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
4829 // window-local variables
4830 ABORTING(set_ref_in_item)(&wp->w_winvar.di_tv, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
4831 // window jump list (ShaDa additional data)
4832 for (int i = 0; i < wp->w_jumplistlen; i++) {
4833 ABORTING(set_ref_in_fmark)(wp->w_jumplist[i].fmark, copyID);
4834 }
4835 }
4836 if (aucmd_win != NULL((void*)0)) {
4837 ABORTING(set_ref_in_item)(&aucmd_win->w_winvar.di_tv, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
4838 }
4839
4840 // registers (ShaDa additional data)
4841 {
4842 const void *reg_iter = NULL((void*)0);
4843 do {
4844 yankreg_T reg;
4845 char name = NUL'\000';
4846 bool_Bool is_unnamed = false0;
4847 reg_iter = op_global_reg_iter(reg_iter, &name, &reg, &is_unnamed);
4848 if (name != NUL'\000') {
4849 ABORTING(set_ref_dict)(reg.additional_data, copyID);
4850 }
4851 } while (reg_iter != NULL((void*)0));
4852 }
4853
4854 // global marks (ShaDa additional data)
4855 {
4856 const void *mark_iter = NULL((void*)0);
4857 do {
4858 xfmark_T fm;
4859 char name = NUL'\000';
4860 mark_iter = mark_global_iter(mark_iter, &name, &fm);
4861 if (name != NUL'\000') {
4862 ABORTING(set_ref_dict)(fm.fmark.additional_data, copyID);
4863 }
4864 } while (mark_iter != NULL((void*)0));
4865 }
4866
4867 // tabpage-local variables
4868 FOR_ALL_TABS(tp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) {
4869 ABORTING(set_ref_in_item)(&tp->tp_winvar.di_tv, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
4870 }
4871
4872 // global variables
4873 ABORTING(set_ref_in_ht)(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab, copyID, NULL((void*)0));
4874
4875 // function-local variables
4876 ABORTING(set_ref_in_call_stack)(copyID);
4877
4878 // named functions (matters for closures)
4879 ABORTING(set_ref_in_functions)(copyID);
4880
4881 // Channels
4882 {
4883 Channel *data;
4884 map_foreach_value(channels, data, {{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((channels->
table)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((channels->table)
->flags[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1)
)&3))) continue; (data) = ((channels->table)->vals[
__i]); { set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data->on_data, copyID
, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data
->on_stderr, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); set_ref_in_callback
(&data->on_exit, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); }; }
}
4885 set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data->on_data, copyID, NULL, NULL);{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((channels->
table)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((channels->table)
->flags[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1)
)&3))) continue; (data) = ((channels->table)->vals[
__i]); { set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data->on_data, copyID
, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data
->on_stderr, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); set_ref_in_callback
(&data->on_exit, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); }; }
}
4886 set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data->on_stderr, copyID, NULL, NULL);{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((channels->
table)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((channels->table)
->flags[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1)
)&3))) continue; (data) = ((channels->table)->vals[
__i]); { set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data->on_data, copyID
, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data
->on_stderr, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); set_ref_in_callback
(&data->on_exit, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); }; }
}
4887 set_ref_in_callback(&data->on_exit, copyID, NULL, NULL);{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((channels->
table)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((channels->table)
->flags[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1)
)&3))) continue; (data) = ((channels->table)->vals[
__i]); { set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data->on_data, copyID
, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data
->on_stderr, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); set_ref_in_callback
(&data->on_exit, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); }; }
}
4888 }){ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((channels->
table)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((channels->table)
->flags[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1)
)&3))) continue; (data) = ((channels->table)->vals[
__i]); { set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data->on_data, copyID
, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); set_ref_in_callback_reader(&data
->on_stderr, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); set_ref_in_callback
(&data->on_exit, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); }; }
}
4889 }
4890
4891 // Timers
4892 {
4893 timer_T *timer;
4894 map_foreach_value(timers, timer, {{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((timers->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((timers->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (timer) = ((timers->table)->vals[__i]); { set_ref_in_callback
(&timer->callback, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); };
} }
4895 set_ref_in_callback(&timer->callback, copyID, NULL, NULL);{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((timers->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((timers->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (timer) = ((timers->table)->vals[__i]); { set_ref_in_callback
(&timer->callback, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); };
} }
4896 }){ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((timers->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((timers->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (timer) = ((timers->table)->vals[__i]); { set_ref_in_callback
(&timer->callback, copyID, ((void*)0), ((void*)0)); };
} }
4897 }
4898
4899 // function call arguments, if v:testing is set.
4900 ABORTING(set_ref_in_func_args)(copyID);
4901
4902 // v: vars
4903 ABORTING(set_ref_in_ht)(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, copyID, NULL((void*)0));
4904
4905 // history items (ShaDa additional elements)
4906 if (p_hi) {
4907 for (uint8_t i = 0; i < HIST_COUNT(HIST_DEBUG + 1); i++) {
4908 const void *iter = NULL((void*)0);
4909 do {
4910 histentry_T hist;
4911 iter = hist_iter(iter, i, false0, &hist);
4912 if (hist.hisstr != NULL((void*)0)) {
4913 ABORTING(set_ref_list)(hist.additional_elements, copyID);
4914 }
4915 } while (iter != NULL((void*)0));
4916 }
4917 }
4918
4919 // previously used search/substitute patterns (ShaDa additional data)
4920 {
4921 SearchPattern pat;
4922 get_search_pattern(&pat);
4923 ABORTING(set_ref_dict)(pat.additional_data, copyID);
4924 get_substitute_pattern(&pat);
4925 ABORTING(set_ref_dict)(pat.additional_data, copyID);
4926 }
4927
4928 // previously used replacement string
4929 {
4930 SubReplacementString sub;
4931 sub_get_replacement(&sub);
4932 ABORTING(set_ref_list)(sub.additional_elements, copyID);
4933 }
4934
4935 ABORTING(set_ref_in_quickfix)(copyID);
4936
4937 bool_Bool did_free = false0;
4938 if (!abort) {
4939 // 2. Free lists and dictionaries that are not referenced.
4940 did_free = free_unref_items(copyID);
4941
4942 // 3. Check if any funccal can be freed now.
4943 // This may call us back recursively.
4944 did_free = free_unref_funccal(copyID, testing) || did_free;
4945 } else if (p_verbose > 0) {
4946 verb_msg(_(gettext((char *)("Not enough memory to set references, garbage collection aborted!"
))
4947 "Not enough memory to set references, garbage collection aborted!")gettext((char *)("Not enough memory to set references, garbage collection aborted!"
)));
4948 }
4949#undef ABORTING
4950 return did_free;
4951}
4952
4953/// Free lists and dictionaries that are no longer referenced.
4954///
4955/// @note This function may only be called from garbage_collect().
4956///
4957/// @param copyID Free lists/dictionaries that don't have this ID.
4958/// @return true, if something was freed.
4959static int free_unref_items(int copyID)
4960{
4961 bool_Bool did_free = false0;
4962
4963 // Let all "free" functions know that we are here. This means no
4964 // dictionaries, lists, or jobs are to be freed, because we will
4965 // do that here.
4966 tv_in_free_unref_items = true1;
4967
4968 // PASS 1: free the contents of the items. We don't free the items
4969 // themselves yet, so that it is possible to decrement refcount counters.
4970
4971 // Go through the list of dicts and free items without the copyID.
4972 // Don't free dicts that are referenced internally.
4973 for (dict_T *dd = gc_first_dict; dd != NULL((void*)0); dd = dd->dv_used_next) {
4974 if ((dd->dv_copyID & COPYID_MASK(~0x1)) != (copyID & COPYID_MASK(~0x1))) {
4975 // Free the Dictionary and ordinary items it contains, but don't
4976 // recurse into Lists and Dictionaries, they will be in the list
4977 // of dicts or list of lists.
4978 tv_dict_free_contents(dd);
4979 did_free = true1;
4980 }
4981 }
4982
4983 // Go through the list of lists and free items without the copyID.
4984 // But don't free a list that has a watcher (used in a for loop), these
4985 // are not referenced anywhere.
4986 for (list_T *ll = gc_first_list; ll != NULL((void*)0); ll = ll->lv_used_next) {
4987 if ((tv_list_copyid(ll) & COPYID_MASK(~0x1)) != (copyID & COPYID_MASK(~0x1))
4988 && !tv_list_has_watchers(ll)) {
4989 // Free the List and ordinary items it contains, but don't recurse
4990 // into Lists and Dictionaries, they will be in the list of dicts
4991 // or list of lists.
4992 tv_list_free_contents(ll);
4993 did_free = true1;
4994 }
4995 }
4996
4997 // PASS 2: free the items themselves.
4998 dict_T *dd_next;
4999 for (dict_T *dd = gc_first_dict; dd != NULL((void*)0); dd = dd_next) {
5000 dd_next = dd->dv_used_next;
5001 if ((dd->dv_copyID & COPYID_MASK(~0x1)) != (copyID & COPYID_MASK(~0x1))) {
5002 tv_dict_free_dict(dd);
5003 }
5004 }
5005
5006 list_T *ll_next;
5007 for (list_T *ll = gc_first_list; ll != NULL((void*)0); ll = ll_next) {
5008 ll_next = ll->lv_used_next;
5009 if ((ll->lv_copyID & COPYID_MASK(~0x1)) != (copyID & COPYID_MASK(~0x1))
5010 && !tv_list_has_watchers(ll)) {
5011 // Free the List and ordinary items it contains, but don't recurse
5012 // into Lists and Dictionaries, they will be in the list of dicts
5013 // or list of lists.
5014 tv_list_free_list(ll);
5015 }
5016 }
5017 tv_in_free_unref_items = false0;
5018 return did_free;
5019}
5020
5021/// Mark all lists and dicts referenced through hashtab "ht" with "copyID".
5022///
5023/// @param ht Hashtab content will be marked.
5024/// @param copyID New mark for lists and dicts.
5025/// @param list_stack Used to add lists to be marked. Can be NULL.
5026///
5027/// @returns true if setting references failed somehow.
5028bool_Bool set_ref_in_ht(hashtab_T *ht, int copyID, list_stack_T **list_stack)
5029 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
5030{
5031 bool_Bool abort = false0;
5032 ht_stack_T *ht_stack = NULL((void*)0);
5033
5034 hashtab_T *cur_ht = ht;
5035 for (;;) {
5036 if (!abort) {
5037 // Mark each item in the hashtab. If the item contains a hashtab
5038 // it is added to ht_stack, if it contains a list it is added to
5039 // list_stack.
5040 HASHTAB_ITER(cur_ht, hi, {do { hashtab_T *const hiht_ = (cur_ht); size_t hitodo_ = hiht_
->ht_used; for (hashitem_T *hi = hiht_->ht_array; hitodo_
; hi++) { if (!((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key
== (char_u *)&hash_removed)) { hitodo_--; { { abort = abort
|| set_ref_in_item( &((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key)))->di_tv, copyID, &ht_stack, list_stack
); } } } } } while (0)
5041 abort = abort || set_ref_in_item(do { hashtab_T *const hiht_ = (cur_ht); size_t hitodo_ = hiht_
->ht_used; for (hashitem_T *hi = hiht_->ht_array; hitodo_
; hi++) { if (!((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key
== (char_u *)&hash_removed)) { hitodo_--; { { abort = abort
|| set_ref_in_item( &((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key)))->di_tv, copyID, &ht_stack, list_stack
); } } } } } while (0)
5042 &TV_DICT_HI2DI(hi)->di_tv, copyID, &ht_stack, list_stack);do { hashtab_T *const hiht_ = (cur_ht); size_t hitodo_ = hiht_
->ht_used; for (hashitem_T *hi = hiht_->ht_array; hitodo_
; hi++) { if (!((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key
== (char_u *)&hash_removed)) { hitodo_--; { { abort = abort
|| set_ref_in_item( &((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key)))->di_tv, copyID, &ht_stack, list_stack
); } } } } } while (0)
5043 })do { hashtab_T *const hiht_ = (cur_ht); size_t hitodo_ = hiht_
->ht_used; for (hashitem_T *hi = hiht_->ht_array; hitodo_
; hi++) { if (!((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key
== (char_u *)&hash_removed)) { hitodo_--; { { abort = abort
|| set_ref_in_item( &((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key)))->di_tv, copyID, &ht_stack, list_stack
); } } } } } while (0);
5044 }
5045
5046 if (ht_stack == NULL((void*)0)) {
5047 break;
5048 }
5049
5050 // take an item from the stack
5051 cur_ht = ht_stack->ht;
5052 ht_stack_T *tempitem = ht_stack;
5053 ht_stack = ht_stack->prev;
5054 xfree(tempitem);
5055 }
5056
5057 return abort;
5058}
5059
5060/// Mark all lists and dicts referenced through list "l" with "copyID".
5061///
5062/// @param l List content will be marked.
5063/// @param copyID New mark for lists and dicts.
5064/// @param ht_stack Used to add hashtabs to be marked. Can be NULL.
5065///
5066/// @returns true if setting references failed somehow.
5067bool_Bool set_ref_in_list(list_T *l, int copyID, ht_stack_T **ht_stack)
5068 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
5069{
5070 bool_Bool abort = false0;
5071 list_stack_T *list_stack = NULL((void*)0);
5072
5073 list_T *cur_l = l;
5074 for (;;) {
5075 // Mark each item in the list. If the item contains a hashtab
