5076 // it is added to ht_stack, if it contains a list it is added to
5077 // list_stack.
5078 TV_LIST_ITER(cur_l, li, {do { list_T *const l_ = (cur_l); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0)) { for
( listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*)0); li = li
->li_next) { { if (abort) { break; } abort = set_ref_in_item
((&(li)->li_tv), copyID, ht_stack, &list_stack); }
} } } while (0)
5079 if (abort) {do { list_T *const l_ = (cur_l); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0)) { for
( listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*)0); li = li
->li_next) { { if (abort) { break; } abort = set_ref_in_item
((&(li)->li_tv), copyID, ht_stack, &list_stack); }
} } } while (0)
5080 break;do { list_T *const l_ = (cur_l); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0)) { for
( listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*)0); li = li
->li_next) { { if (abort) { break; } abort = set_ref_in_item
((&(li)->li_tv), copyID, ht_stack, &list_stack); }
} } } while (0)
5081 }do { list_T *const l_ = (cur_l); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0)) { for
( listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*)0); li = li
->li_next) { { if (abort) { break; } abort = set_ref_in_item
((&(li)->li_tv), copyID, ht_stack, &list_stack); }
} } } while (0)
5082 abort = set_ref_in_item(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li), copyID, ht_stack,do { list_T *const l_ = (cur_l); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0)) { for
( listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*)0); li = li
->li_next) { { if (abort) { break; } abort = set_ref_in_item
((&(li)->li_tv), copyID, ht_stack, &list_stack); }
} } } while (0)
5083 &list_stack);do { list_T *const l_ = (cur_l); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0)) { for
( listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*)0); li = li
->li_next) { { if (abort) { break; } abort = set_ref_in_item
((&(li)->li_tv), copyID, ht_stack, &list_stack); }
} } } while (0)
5084 })do { list_T *const l_ = (cur_l); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0)) { for
( listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*)0); li = li
->li_next) { { if (abort) { break; } abort = set_ref_in_item
((&(li)->li_tv), copyID, ht_stack, &list_stack); }
} } } while (0);
5085
5086 if (list_stack == NULL((void*)0)) {
5087 break;
5088 }
5089
5090 // take an item from the stack
5091 cur_l = list_stack->list;
5092 list_stack_T *tempitem = list_stack;
5093 list_stack = list_stack->prev;
5094 xfree(tempitem);
5095 }
5096
5097 return abort;
5098}
5099
5100/// Mark all lists and dicts referenced through typval "tv" with "copyID".
5101///
5102/// @param tv Typval content will be marked.
5103/// @param copyID New mark for lists and dicts.
5104/// @param ht_stack Used to add hashtabs to be marked. Can be NULL.
5105/// @param list_stack Used to add lists to be marked. Can be NULL.
5106///
5107/// @returns true if setting references failed somehow.
5108bool_Bool set_ref_in_item(typval_T *tv, int copyID, ht_stack_T **ht_stack,
5109 list_stack_T **list_stack)
5110 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
5111{
5112 bool_Bool abort = false0;
5113
5114 switch (tv->v_type) {
5115 case VAR_DICT: {
5116 dict_T *dd = tv->vval.v_dict;
5117 if (dd != NULL((void*)0) && dd->dv_copyID != copyID) {
5118 // Didn't see this dict yet.
5119 dd->dv_copyID = copyID;
5120 if (ht_stack == NULL((void*)0)) {
5121 abort = set_ref_in_ht(&dd->dv_hashtab, copyID, list_stack);
5122 } else {
5123 ht_stack_T *const newitem = xmalloc(sizeof(ht_stack_T));
5124 newitem->ht = &dd->dv_hashtab;
5125 newitem->prev = *ht_stack;
5126 *ht_stack = newitem;
5127 }
5128
5129 QUEUE *w = NULL((void*)0);
5130 DictWatcher *watcher = NULL((void*)0);
5131 QUEUE_FOREACH(w, &dd->watchers, {(w) = (&dd->watchers)->next; while((w) != (&dd->
watchers)) { QUEUE *next = w->next; { watcher = tv_dict_watcher_node_data
(w); set_ref_in_callback(&watcher->callback, copyID, ht_stack
, list_stack); } (w) = next; }
5132 watcher = tv_dict_watcher_node_data(w);(w) = (&dd->watchers)->next; while((w) != (&dd->
watchers)) { QUEUE *next = w->next; { watcher = tv_dict_watcher_node_data
(w); set_ref_in_callback(&watcher->callback, copyID, ht_stack
, list_stack); } (w) = next; }
5133 set_ref_in_callback(&watcher->callback, copyID, ht_stack, list_stack);(w) = (&dd->watchers)->next; while((w) != (&dd->
watchers)) { QUEUE *next = w->next; { watcher = tv_dict_watcher_node_data
(w); set_ref_in_callback(&watcher->callback, copyID, ht_stack
, list_stack); } (w) = next; }
5134 })(w) = (&dd->watchers)->next; while((w) != (&dd->
watchers)) { QUEUE *next = w->next; { watcher = tv_dict_watcher_node_data
(w); set_ref_in_callback(&watcher->callback, copyID, ht_stack
, list_stack); } (w) = next; }
5135 }
5136 break;
5137 }
5138
5139 case VAR_LIST: {
5140 list_T *ll = tv->vval.v_list;
5141 if (ll != NULL((void*)0) && ll->lv_copyID != copyID) {
5142 // Didn't see this list yet.
5143 ll->lv_copyID = copyID;
5144 if (list_stack == NULL((void*)0)) {
5145 abort = set_ref_in_list(ll, copyID, ht_stack);
5146 } else {
5147 list_stack_T *const newitem = xmalloc(sizeof(list_stack_T));
5148 newitem->list = ll;
5149 newitem->prev = *list_stack;
5150 *list_stack = newitem;
5151 }
5152 }
5153 break;
5154 }
5155
5156 case VAR_PARTIAL: {
5157 partial_T *pt = tv->vval.v_partial;
5158
5159 // A partial does not have a copyID, because it cannot contain itself.
5160 if (pt != NULL((void*)0)) {
5161 abort = set_ref_in_func(pt->pt_name, pt->pt_func, copyID);
5162 if (pt->pt_dict != NULL((void*)0)) {
5163 typval_T dtv;
5164
5165 dtv.v_type = VAR_DICT;
5166 dtv.vval.v_dict = pt->pt_dict;
5167 abort = abort || set_ref_in_item(&dtv, copyID, ht_stack, list_stack);
5168 }
5169
5170 for (int i = 0; i < pt->pt_argc; i++) {
5171 abort = abort || set_ref_in_item(&pt->pt_argv[i], copyID,
5172 ht_stack, list_stack);
5173 }
5174 }
5175 break;
5176 }
5177 case VAR_FUNC:
5178 abort = set_ref_in_func(tv->vval.v_string, NULL((void*)0), copyID);
5179 break;
5180 case VAR_UNKNOWN:
5181 case VAR_BOOL:
5182 case VAR_SPECIAL:
5183 case VAR_FLOAT:
5184 case VAR_NUMBER:
5185 case VAR_STRING: {
5186 break;
5187 }
5188 }
5189 return abort;
5190}
5191
5192
5193
5194/// Mark all lists and dicts referenced in given mark
5195///
5196/// @returns true if setting references failed somehow.
5197static inline bool_Bool set_ref_in_fmark(fmark_T fm, int copyID)
5198 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
5199{
5200 if (fm.additional_data != NULL((void*)0)
5201 && fm.additional_data->dv_copyID != copyID) {
5202 fm.additional_data->dv_copyID = copyID;
5203 return set_ref_in_ht(&fm.additional_data->dv_hashtab, copyID, NULL((void*)0));
5204 }
5205 return false0;
5206}
5207
5208/// Mark all lists and dicts referenced in given list and the list itself
5209///
5210/// @returns true if setting references failed somehow.
5211static inline bool_Bool set_ref_list(list_T *list, int copyID)
5212 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
5213{
5214 if (list != NULL((void*)0)) {
5215 typval_T tv = (typval_T) {
5216 .v_type = VAR_LIST,
5217 .vval = { .v_list = list }
5218 };
5219 return set_ref_in_item(&tv, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
5220 }
5221 return false0;
5222}
5223
5224/// Mark all lists and dicts referenced in given dict and the dict itself
5225///
5226/// @returns true if setting references failed somehow.
5227static inline bool_Bool set_ref_dict(dict_T *dict, int copyID)
5228 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
5229{
5230 if (dict != NULL((void*)0)) {
5231 typval_T tv = (typval_T) {
5232 .v_type = VAR_DICT,
5233 .vval = { .v_dict = dict }
5234 };
5235 return set_ref_in_item(&tv, copyID, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
5236 }
5237 return false0;
5238}
5239
5240
5241// Get the key for *{key: val} into "tv" and advance "arg".
5242// Return FAIL when there is no valid key.
5243static int get_literal_key(char_u **arg, typval_T *tv)
5244 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5245{
5246 char_u *p;
5247
5248 if (!ASCII_ISALNUM(**arg)((((unsigned)(**arg) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(**arg) <=
'Z') || ((unsigned)(**arg) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*
*arg) <= 'z')) || ascii_isdigit(**arg)) && **arg != '_' && **arg != '-') {
5249 return FAIL0;
5250 }
5251 for (p = *arg; ASCII_ISALNUM(*p)((((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z')) || ascii_isdigit(*p)) || *p == '_' || *p == '-'; p++) {
5252 }
5253 tv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
5254 tv->vval.v_string = vim_strnsave(*arg, p - *arg);
5255
5256 *arg = skipwhite(p);
5257 return OK1;
5258}
5259
5260// Allocate a variable for a Dictionary and fill it from "*arg".
5261// "literal" is true for *{key: val}
5262// Return OK or FAIL. Returns NOTDONE for {expr}.
5263static int dict_get_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate,
5264 bool_Bool literal)
5265{
5266 dict_T *d = NULL((void*)0);
5267 typval_T tvkey;
5268 typval_T tv;
5269 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0);
5270 dictitem_T *item;
5271 char_u *start = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
5272 char buf[NUMBUFLEN];
5273
5274 /*
5275 * First check if it's not a curly-braces thing: {expr}.
5276 * Must do this without evaluating, otherwise a function may be called
5277 * twice. Unfortunately this means we need to call eval1() twice for the
5278 * first item.
5279 * But {} is an empty Dictionary.
5280 */
5281 if (*start != '}') {
5282 if (eval1(&start, &tv, false0) == FAIL0) { // recursive!
5283 return FAIL0;
5284 }
5285 if (*skipwhite(start) == '}') {
5286 return NOTDONE2;
5287 }
5288 }
5289
5290 if (evaluate) {
5291 d = tv_dict_alloc();
5292 }
5293 tvkey.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
5294 tv.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
5295
5296 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
5297 while (**arg != '}' && **arg != NUL'\000') {
5298 if ((literal
5299 ? get_literal_key(arg, &tvkey)
5300 : eval1(arg, &tvkey, evaluate)) == FAIL0) { // recursive!
5301 goto failret;
5302 }
5303 if (**arg != ':') {
5304 EMSG2(_("E720: Missing colon in Dictionary: %s"), *arg)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E720: Missing colon in Dictionary: %s"
))), (*arg));
5305 tv_clear(&tvkey);
5306 goto failret;
5307 }
5308 if (evaluate) {
5309 key = (char_u *)tv_get_string_buf_chk(&tvkey, buf);
5310 if (key == NULL((void*)0)) {
5311 // "key" is NULL when tv_get_string_buf_chk() gave an errmsg
5312 tv_clear(&tvkey);
5313 goto failret;
5314 }
5315 }
5316
5317 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
5318 if (eval1(arg, &tv, evaluate) == FAIL0) { // Recursive!
5319 if (evaluate) {
5320 tv_clear(&tvkey);
5321 }
5322 goto failret;
5323 }
5324 if (evaluate) {
5325 item = tv_dict_find(d, (const char *)key, -1);
5326 if (item != NULL((void*)0)) {
5327 EMSG2(_("E721: Duplicate key in Dictionary: \"%s\""), key)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E721: Duplicate key in Dictionary: \"%s\""
))), (key));
5328 tv_clear(&tvkey);
5329 tv_clear(&tv);
5330 goto failret;
5331 }
5332 item = tv_dict_item_alloc((const char *)key);
5333 item->di_tv = tv;
5334 item->di_tv.v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED;
5335 if (tv_dict_add(d, item) == FAIL0) {
5336 tv_dict_item_free(item);
5337 }
5338 }
5339 tv_clear(&tvkey);
5340
5341 if (**arg == '}')
5342 break;
5343 if (**arg != ',') {
5344 EMSG2(_("E722: Missing comma in Dictionary: %s"), *arg)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E722: Missing comma in Dictionary: %s"
))), (*arg));
5345 goto failret;
5346 }
5347 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
5348 }
5349
5350 if (**arg != '}') {
5351 EMSG2(_("E723: Missing end of Dictionary '}': %s"), *arg)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E723: Missing end of Dictionary '}': %s"
))), (*arg));
5352failret:
5353 if (d != NULL((void*)0)) {
5354 tv_dict_free(d);
5355 }
5356 return FAIL0;
5357 }
5358
5359 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
5360 if (evaluate) {
5361 tv_dict_set_ret(rettv, d);
5362 }
5363
5364 return OK1;
5365}
5366
5367/// Convert the string to a floating point number
5368///
5369/// This uses strtod(). setlocale(LC_NUMERIC, "C") has been used earlier to
5370/// make sure this always uses a decimal point.
5371///
5372/// @param[in] text String to convert.
5373/// @param[out] ret_value Location where conversion result is saved.
5374///
5375/// @return Length of the text that was consumed.
5376size_t string2float(const char *const text, float_T *const ret_value)
5377 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5378{
5379 char *s = NULL((void*)0);
5380
5381 // MS-Windows does not deal with "inf" and "nan" properly
5382 if (STRNICMP(text, "inf", 3)strncasecmp((char *)(text), (char *)("inf"), (size_t)(3)) == 0) {
5383 *ret_value = INFINITY(__builtin_inff ());
5384 return 3;
5385 }
5386 if (STRNICMP(text, "-inf", 3)strncasecmp((char *)(text), (char *)("-inf"), (size_t)(3)) == 0) {
5387 *ret_value = -INFINITY(__builtin_inff ());
5388 return 4;
5389 }
5390 if (STRNICMP(text, "nan", 3)strncasecmp((char *)(text), (char *)("nan"), (size_t)(3)) == 0) {
5391 *ret_value = NAN(__builtin_nanf (""));
5392 return 3;
5393 }
5394 *ret_value = strtod(text, &s);
5395 return (size_t) (s - text);
5396}
5397
5398/// Get the value of an environment variable.
5399///
5400/// If the environment variable was not set, silently assume it is empty.
5401///
5402/// @param arg Points to the '$'. It is advanced to after the name.
5403/// @return FAIL if the name is invalid.
5404///
5405static int get_env_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
5406{
5407 char_u *name;
5408 char_u *string = NULL((void*)0);
5409 int len;
5410 int cc;
5411
5412 ++*arg;
5413 name = *arg;
5414 len = get_env_len((const char_u **)arg);
5415
5416 if (evaluate) {
5417 if (len == 0) {
5418 return FAIL0; // Invalid empty name.
5419 }
5420 cc = name[len];
5421 name[len] = NUL'\000';
5422 // First try vim_getenv(), fast for normal environment vars.
5423 string = (char_u *)vim_getenv((char *)name);
5424 if (string == NULL((void*)0) || *string == NUL'\000') {
5425 xfree(string);
5426
5427 // Next try expanding things like $VIM and ${HOME}.
5428 string = expand_env_save(name - 1);
5429 if (string != NULL((void*)0) && *string == '$') {
5430 XFREE_CLEAR(string)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(string); xfree(*ptr_); *ptr_
= ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
5431 }
5432 }
5433 name[len] = cc;
5434 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
5435 rettv->vval.v_string = string;
5436 }
5437
5438 return OK1;
5439}
5440
5441/// Get the argument list for a given window
5442void get_arglist_as_rettv(aentry_T *arglist, int argcount,
5443 typval_T *rettv)
5444{
5445 tv_list_alloc_ret(rettv, argcount);
5446 if (arglist != NULL((void*)0)) {
5447 for (int idx = 0; idx < argcount; idx++) {
5448 tv_list_append_string(rettv->vval.v_list,
5449 (const char *)alist_name(&arglist[idx]), -1);
5450 }
5451 }
5452}
5453
5454// Prepare "gap" for an assert error and add the sourcing position.
5455void prepare_assert_error(garray_T *gap)
5456{
5457 char buf[NUMBUFLEN];
5458
5459 ga_init(gap, 1, 100);
5460 if (sourcing_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
5461 ga_concat(gap, sourcing_name);
5462 if (sourcing_lnum > 0) {
5463 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)" ");
5464 }
5465 }
5466 if (sourcing_lnum > 0) {
5467 vim_snprintf(buf, ARRAY_SIZE(buf)((sizeof(buf)/sizeof((buf)[0])) / ((size_t)(!(sizeof(buf) % sizeof
((buf)[0]))))), "line %" PRId64"l" "d", (int64_t)sourcing_lnum);
5468 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)buf);
5469 }
5470 if (sourcing_name != NULL((void*)0) || sourcing_lnum > 0) {
5471 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)": ");
5472 }
5473}
5474
5475// Append "p[clen]" to "gap", escaping unprintable characters.
5476// Changes NL to \n, CR to \r, etc.
5477static void ga_concat_esc(garray_T *gap, const char_u *p, int clen)
5478 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5479{
5480 char_u buf[NUMBUFLEN];
5481
5482 if (clen > 1) {
5483 memmove(buf, p, clen);
5484 buf[clen] = NUL'\000';
5485 ga_concat(gap, buf);
5486 } else {
5487 switch (*p) {
5488 case BS'\010': ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"\\b"); break;
5489 case ESC'\033': ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"\\e"); break;
5490 case FF'\014': ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"\\f"); break;
5491 case NL'\012': ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"\\n"); break;
5492 case TAB'\011': ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"\\t"); break;
5493 case CAR'\015': ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"\\r"); break;
5494 case '\\': ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"\\\\"); break;
5495 default:
5496 if (*p < ' ') {
5497 vim_snprintf((char *)buf, NUMBUFLEN, "\\x%02x", *p);
5498 ga_concat(gap, buf);
5499 } else {
5500 ga_append(gap, *p);
5501 }
5502 break;
5503 }
5504 }
5505}
5506
5507// Append "str" to "gap", escaping unprintable characters.
5508// Changes NL to \n, CR to \r, etc.
5509static void ga_concat_shorten_esc(garray_T *gap, const char_u *str)
5510 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1)
5511{
5512 char_u buf[NUMBUFLEN];
5513
5514 if (str == NULL((void*)0)) {
5515 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"NULL");
5516 return;
5517 }
5518
5519 for (const char_u *p = str; *p != NUL'\000'; p++) {
5520 int same_len = 1;
5521 const char_u *s = p;
5522 const int c = mb_ptr2char_adv(&s);
5523 const int clen = s - p;
5524 while (*s != NUL'\000' && c == utf_ptr2char(s)) {
5525 same_len++;
5526 s += clen;
5527 }
5528 if (same_len > 20) {
5529 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"\\[");
5530 ga_concat_esc(gap, p, clen);
5531 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)" occurs ");
5532 vim_snprintf((char *)buf, NUMBUFLEN, "%d", same_len);
5533 ga_concat(gap, buf);
5534 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)" times]");
5535 p = s - 1;
5536 } else {
5537 ga_concat_esc(gap, p, clen);
5538 }
5539 }
5540}
5541
5542// Fill "gap" with information about an assert error.
5543void fill_assert_error(garray_T *gap, typval_T *opt_msg_tv,
5544 char_u *exp_str, typval_T *exp_tv,
5545 typval_T *got_tv, assert_type_T atype)
5546{
5547 char_u *tofree;
5548
5549 if (opt_msg_tv->v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
5550 tofree = (char_u *)encode_tv2echo(opt_msg_tv, NULL((void*)0));
5551 ga_concat(gap, tofree);
5552 xfree(tofree);
5553 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)": ");
5554 }
5555
5556 if (atype == ASSERT_MATCH || atype == ASSERT_NOTMATCH) {
5557 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"Pattern ");
5558 } else if (atype == ASSERT_NOTEQUAL) {
5559 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"Expected not equal to ");
5560 } else {
5561 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)"Expected ");
5562 }
5563
5564 if (exp_str == NULL((void*)0)) {
5565 tofree = (char_u *)encode_tv2string(exp_tv, NULL((void*)0));
5566 ga_concat_shorten_esc(gap, tofree);
5567 xfree(tofree);
5568 } else {
5569 ga_concat_shorten_esc(gap, exp_str);
5570 }
5571
5572 if (atype != ASSERT_NOTEQUAL) {
5573 if (atype == ASSERT_MATCH) {
5574 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)" does not match ");
5575 } else if (atype == ASSERT_NOTMATCH) {
5576 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)" does match ");
5577 } else {
5578 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)" but got ");
5579 }
5580 tofree = (char_u *)encode_tv2string(got_tv, NULL((void*)0));
5581 ga_concat_shorten_esc(gap, tofree);
5582 xfree(tofree);
5583 }
5584}
5585
5586// Add an assert error to v:errors.
5587void assert_error(garray_T *gap)
5588{
5589 struct vimvar *vp = &vimvars[VV_ERRORS];
5590
5591 if (vp->vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type != VAR_LIST || vimvars[VV_ERRORS].vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0)) {
5592 // Make sure v:errors is a list.
5593 set_vim_var_list(VV_ERRORS, tv_list_alloc(1));
5594 }
5595 tv_list_append_string(vimvars[VV_ERRORS].vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list,
5596 (const char *)gap->ga_data, (ptrdiff_t)gap->ga_len);
5597}
5598
5599int assert_equal_common(typval_T *argvars, assert_type_T atype)
5600 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5601{
5602 garray_T ga;
5603
5604 if (tv_equal(&argvars[0], &argvars[1], false0, false0)
5605 != (atype == ASSERT_EQUAL)) {
5606 prepare_assert_error(&ga);
5607 fill_assert_error(&ga, &argvars[2], NULL((void*)0),
5608 &argvars[0], &argvars[1], atype);
5609 assert_error(&ga);
5610 ga_clear(&ga);
5611 return 1;
5612 }
5613 return 0;
5614}
5615
5616int assert_equalfile(typval_T *argvars)
5617 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5618{
5619 char buf1[NUMBUFLEN];
5620 char buf2[NUMBUFLEN];
5621 const char *const fname1 = tv_get_string_buf_chk(&argvars[0], buf1);
5622 const char *const fname2 = tv_get_string_buf_chk(&argvars[1], buf2);
5623 garray_T ga;
5624
5625 if (fname1 == NULL((void*)0) || fname2 == NULL((void*)0)) {
5626 return 0;
5627 }
5628
5629 IObuff[0] = NUL'\000';
5630 FILE *const fd1 = os_fopen(fname1, READBIN"rb");
5631 char line1[200];
5632 char line2[200];
5633 ptrdiff_t lineidx = 0;
5634 if (fd1 == NULL((void*)0)) {
5635 snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), (char *)e_notread, fname1);
5636 } else {
5637 FILE *const fd2 = os_fopen(fname2, READBIN"rb");
5638 if (fd2 == NULL((void*)0)) {
5639 fclose(fd1);
5640 snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1), (char *)e_notread, fname2);
5641 } else {
5642 int64_t linecount = 1;
5643 for (int64_t count = 0; ; count++) {
5644 const int c1 = fgetc(fd1);
5645 const int c2 = fgetc(fd2);
5646 if (c1 == EOF(-1)) {
5647 if (c2 != EOF(-1)) {
5648 STRCPY(IObuff, "first file is shorter")strcpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("first file is shorter"));
5649 }
5650 break;
5651 } else if (c2 == EOF(-1)) {
5652 STRCPY(IObuff, "second file is shorter")strcpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("second file is shorter"));
5653 break;
5654 } else {
5655 line1[lineidx] = c1;
5656 line2[lineidx] = c2;
5657 lineidx++;
5658 if (c1 != c2) {
5659 snprintf((char *)IObuff, IOSIZE(1024+1),
5660 "difference at byte %" PRId64"l" "d" ", line %" PRId64"l" "d",
5661 count, linecount);
5662 break;
5663 }
5664 }
5665 if (c1 == NL'\012') {
5666 linecount++;
5667 lineidx = 0;
5668 } else if (lineidx + 2 == (ptrdiff_t)sizeof(line1)) {
5669 memmove(line1, line1 + 100, lineidx - 100);
5670 memmove(line2, line2 + 100, lineidx - 100);
5671 lineidx -= 100;
5672 }
5673 }
5674 fclose(fd1);
5675 fclose(fd2);
5676 }
5677 }
5678 if (IObuff[0] != NUL'\000') {
5679 prepare_assert_error(&ga);
5680 if (argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
5681 char *const tofree = encode_tv2echo(&argvars[2], NULL((void*)0));
5682 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)tofree);
5683 xfree(tofree);
5684 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)": ");
5685 }
5686 ga_concat(&ga, IObuff);
5687 if (lineidx > 0) {
5688 line1[lineidx] = NUL'\000';
5689 line2[lineidx] = NUL'\000';
5690 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)" after \"");
5691 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)line1);
5692 if (STRCMP(line1, line2)strcmp((char *)(line1), (char *)(line2)) != 0) {
5693 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)"\" vs \"");
5694 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)line2);
5695 }
5696 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)"\"");
5697 }
5698 assert_error(&ga);
5699 ga_clear(&ga);
5700 return 1;
5701 }
5702 return 0;
5703}
5704
5705int assert_inrange(typval_T *argvars)
5706 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5707{
5708 bool_Bool error = false0;
5709
5710 if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_FLOAT
5711 || argvars[1].v_type == VAR_FLOAT
5712 || argvars[2].v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
5713 const float_T flower = tv_get_float(&argvars[0]);
5714 const float_T fupper = tv_get_float(&argvars[1]);
5715 const float_T factual = tv_get_float(&argvars[2]);
5716
5717 if (factual < flower || factual > fupper) {
5718 garray_T ga;
5719 prepare_assert_error(&ga);
5720 if (argvars[3].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
5721 char_u *const tofree = (char_u *)encode_tv2string(&argvars[3], NULL((void*)0));
5722 ga_concat(&ga, tofree);
5723 xfree(tofree);
5724 } else {
5725 char msg[80];
5726 vim_snprintf(msg, sizeof(msg), "Expected range %g - %g, but got %g",
5727 flower, fupper, factual);
5728 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)msg);
5729 }
5730 assert_error(&ga);
5731 ga_clear(&ga);
5732 return 1;
5733 }
5734 } else {
5735 const varnumber_T lower = tv_get_number_chk(&argvars[0], &error);
5736 const varnumber_T upper = tv_get_number_chk(&argvars[1], &error);
5737 const varnumber_T actual = tv_get_number_chk(&argvars[2], &error);
5738
5739 if (error) {
5740 return 0;
5741 }
5742 if (actual < lower || actual > upper) {
5743 garray_T ga;
5744 prepare_assert_error(&ga);
5745
5746 char msg[55];
5747 vim_snprintf(msg, sizeof(msg),
5748 "range %" PRIdVARNUMBER"l" "d" " - %" PRIdVARNUMBER"l" "d" ",",
5749 lower, upper);
5750 fill_assert_error(&ga, &argvars[3], (char_u *)msg, NULL((void*)0), &argvars[2],
5751 ASSERT_INRANGE);
5752 assert_error(&ga);
5753 ga_clear(&ga);
5754 return 1;
5755 }
5756 }
5757 return 0;
5758}
5759
5760// Common for assert_true() and assert_false().
5761int assert_bool(typval_T *argvars, bool_Bool is_true)
5762 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5763{
5764 bool_Bool error = false0;
5765 garray_T ga;
5766
5767 if ((argvars[0].v_type != VAR_NUMBER
5768 || (tv_get_number_chk(&argvars[0], &error) == 0) == is_true
5769 || error)
5770 && (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_BOOL
5771 || (argvars[0].vval.v_bool
5772 != (BoolVarValue)(is_true
5773 ? kBoolVarTrue
5774 : kBoolVarFalse)))) {
5775 prepare_assert_error(&ga);
5776 fill_assert_error(&ga, &argvars[1],
5777 (char_u *)(is_true ? "True" : "False"),
5778 NULL((void*)0), &argvars[0], ASSERT_OTHER);
5779 assert_error(&ga);
5780 ga_clear(&ga);
5781 return 1;
5782 }
5783 return 0;
5784}
5785
5786int assert_exception(typval_T *argvars)
5787 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5788{
5789 garray_T ga;
5790
5791 const char *const error = tv_get_string_chk(&argvars[0]);
5792 if (vimvars[VV_EXCEPTION].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0)) {
5793 prepare_assert_error(&ga);
5794 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)"v:exception is not set");
5795 assert_error(&ga);
5796 ga_clear(&ga);
5797 return 1;
5798 } else if (error != NULL((void*)0)
5799 && strstr((char *)vimvars[VV_EXCEPTION].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string, error) == NULL((void*)0)) {
5800 prepare_assert_error(&ga);
5801 fill_assert_error(&ga, &argvars[1], NULL((void*)0), &argvars[0],
5802 &vimvars[VV_EXCEPTION].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv, ASSERT_OTHER);
5803 assert_error(&ga);
5804 ga_clear(&ga);
5805 return 1;
5806 }
5807 return 0;
5808}
5809
5810static void assert_append_cmd_or_arg(garray_T *gap, typval_T *argvars,
5811 const char *cmd)
5812 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5813{
5814 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN && argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
5815 char *const tofree = encode_tv2echo(&argvars[2], NULL((void*)0));
5816 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)tofree);
5817 xfree(tofree);
5818 } else {
5819 ga_concat(gap, (char_u *)cmd);
5820 }
5821}
5822
5823int assert_beeps(typval_T *argvars, bool_Bool no_beep)
5824 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5825{
5826 const char *const cmd = tv_get_string_chk(&argvars[0]);
5827 int ret = 0;
5828
5829 called_vim_beep = false0;
5830 suppress_errthrow = true1;
5831 emsg_silent = false0;
5832 do_cmdline_cmd(cmd);
5833 if (no_beep ? called_vim_beep : !called_vim_beep) {
5834 garray_T ga;
5835 prepare_assert_error(&ga);
5836 if (no_beep) {
5837 ga_concat(&ga, (const char_u *)"command did beep: ");
5838 } else {
5839 ga_concat(&ga, (const char_u *)"command did not beep: ");
5840 }
5841 ga_concat(&ga, (const char_u *)cmd);
5842 assert_error(&ga);
5843 ga_clear(&ga);
5844 ret = 1;
5845 }
5846
5847 suppress_errthrow = false0;
5848 emsg_on_display = false0;
5849 return ret;
5850}
5851
5852int assert_fails(typval_T *argvars)
5853 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5854{
5855 const char *const cmd = tv_get_string_chk(&argvars[0]);
5856 garray_T ga;
5857 int ret = 0;
5858 int save_trylevel = trylevel;
5859
5860 // trylevel must be zero for a ":throw" command to be considered failed
5861 trylevel = 0;
5862 called_emsg = false0;
5863 suppress_errthrow = true1;
5864 emsg_silent = true1;
5865
5866 do_cmdline_cmd(cmd);
5867 if (!called_emsg) {
5868 prepare_assert_error(&ga);
5869 ga_concat(&ga, (const char_u *)"command did not fail: ");
5870 assert_append_cmd_or_arg(&ga, argvars, cmd);
5871 assert_error(&ga);
5872 ga_clear(&ga);
5873 ret = 1;
5874 } else if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
5875 char buf[NUMBUFLEN];
5876 const char *const error = tv_get_string_buf_chk(&argvars[1], buf);
5877
5878 if (error == NULL((void*)0)
5879 || strstr((char *)vimvars[VV_ERRMSG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string, error) == NULL((void*)0)) {
5880 prepare_assert_error(&ga);
5881 fill_assert_error(&ga, &argvars[2], NULL((void*)0), &argvars[1],
5882 &vimvars[VV_ERRMSG].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv, ASSERT_OTHER);
5883 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)": ");
5884 assert_append_cmd_or_arg(&ga, argvars, cmd);
5885 assert_error(&ga);
5886 ga_clear(&ga);
5887 ret = 1;
5888 }
5889 }
5890
5891 trylevel = save_trylevel;
5892 called_emsg = false0;
5893 suppress_errthrow = false0;
5894 emsg_silent = false0;
5895 emsg_on_display = false0;
5896 set_vim_var_string(VV_ERRMSG, NULL((void*)0), 0);
5897 return ret;
5898}
5899
5900int assert_match_common(typval_T *argvars, assert_type_T atype)
5901 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
5902{
5903 char buf1[NUMBUFLEN];
5904 char buf2[NUMBUFLEN];
5905 const char *const pat = tv_get_string_buf_chk(&argvars[0], buf1);
5906 const char *const text = tv_get_string_buf_chk(&argvars[1], buf2);
5907
5908 if (pat == NULL((void*)0) || text == NULL((void*)0)) {
5909 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
5910 } else if (pattern_match((char_u *)pat, (char_u *)text, false0)
5911 != (atype == ASSERT_MATCH)) {
5912 garray_T ga;
5913 prepare_assert_error(&ga);
5914 fill_assert_error(&ga, &argvars[2], NULL((void*)0), &argvars[0], &argvars[1], atype);
5915 assert_error(&ga);
5916 ga_clear(&ga);
5917 return 1;
5918 }
5919 return 0;
5920}
5921
5922/// Find a window: When using a Window ID in any tab page, when using a number
5923/// in the current tab page.
5924win_T * find_win_by_nr_or_id(typval_T *vp)
5925{
5926 int nr = (int)tv_get_number_chk(vp, NULL((void*)0));
5927
5928 if (nr >= LOWEST_WIN_ID1000) {
5929 return win_id2wp(vp);
5930 }
5931
5932 return find_win_by_nr(vp, NULL((void*)0));
5933}
5934
5935/*
5936 * Implementation of map() and filter().
5937 */
5938void filter_map(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv, int map)
5939{
5940 typval_T *expr;
5941 list_T *l = NULL((void*)0);
5942 dictitem_T *di;
5943 hashtab_T *ht;
5944 hashitem_T *hi;
5945 dict_T *d = NULL((void*)0);
5946 typval_T save_val;
5947 typval_T save_key;
5948 int rem = false0;
5949 int todo;
5950 char_u *ermsg = (char_u *)(map ? "map()" : "filter()");
5951 const char *const arg_errmsg = (map
5952 ? N_("map() argument")"map() argument"
5953 : N_("filter() argument")"filter() argument");
5954 int save_did_emsg;
5955 int idx = 0;
5956
5957 if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_LIST) {
5958 tv_copy(&argvars[0], rettv);
5959 if ((l = argvars[0].vval.v_list) == NULL((void*)0)
5960 || (!map && tv_check_lock(tv_list_locked(l), arg_errmsg,
5961 TV_TRANSLATE((18446744073709551615UL))))) {
5962 return;
5963 }
5964 } else if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_DICT) {
5965 tv_copy(&argvars[0], rettv);
5966 if ((d = argvars[0].vval.v_dict) == NULL((void*)0)
5967 || (!map && tv_check_lock(d->dv_lock, arg_errmsg, TV_TRANSLATE((18446744073709551615UL))))) {
5968 return;
5969 }
5970 } else {
5971 EMSG2(_(e_listdictarg), ermsg)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_listdictarg))), (ermsg
));
5972 return;
5973 }
5974
5975 expr = &argvars[1];
5976 // On type errors, the preceding call has already displayed an error
5977 // message. Avoid a misleading error message for an empty string that
5978 // was not passed as argument.
5979 if (expr->v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
5980 prepare_vimvar(VV_VAL, &save_val);
5981
5982 // We reset "did_emsg" to be able to detect whether an error
5983 // occurred during evaluation of the expression.
5984 save_did_emsg = did_emsg;
5985 did_emsg = FALSE0;
5986
5987 prepare_vimvar(VV_KEY, &save_key);
5988 if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_DICT) {
5989 vimvars[VV_KEY].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING;
5990
5991 ht = &d->dv_hashtab;
5992 hash_lock(ht);
5993 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
5994 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
5995 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) {
5996 --todo;
5997
5998 di = TV_DICT_HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
5999 if (map
6000 && (tv_check_lock(di->di_tv.v_lock, arg_errmsg, TV_TRANSLATE((18446744073709551615UL)))
6001 || var_check_ro(di->di_flags, arg_errmsg, TV_TRANSLATE((18446744073709551615UL))))) {
6002 break;
6003 }
6004
6005 vimvars[VV_KEY].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = vim_strsave(di->di_key);
6006 int r = filter_map_one(&di->di_tv, expr, map, &rem);
6007 tv_clear(&vimvars[VV_KEY].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv);
6008 if (r == FAIL0 || did_emsg) {
6009 break;
6010 }
6011 if (!map && rem) {
6012 if (var_check_fixed(di->di_flags, arg_errmsg, TV_TRANSLATE((18446744073709551615UL)))
6013 || var_check_ro(di->di_flags, arg_errmsg, TV_TRANSLATE((18446744073709551615UL)))) {
6014 break;
6015 }
6016 tv_dict_item_remove(d, di);
6017 }
6018 }
6019 }
6020 hash_unlock(ht);
6021 } else {
6022 assert(argvars[0].v_type == VAR_LIST)((void) sizeof ((argvars[0].v_type == VAR_LIST) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_LIST) ; else __assert_fail (
"argvars[0].v_type == VAR_LIST", "../src/nvim/eval.c", 6022, __extension__
__PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
6023 vimvars[VV_KEY].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
6024
6025 for (listitem_T *li = tv_list_first(l); li != NULL((void*)0);) {
6026 if (map
6027 && tv_check_lock(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)(&(li)->li_tv)->v_lock, arg_errmsg,
6028 TV_TRANSLATE((18446744073709551615UL)))) {
6029 break;
6030 }
6031 vimvars[VV_KEY].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = idx;
6032 if (filter_map_one(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)(&(li)->li_tv), expr, map, &rem) == FAIL0
6033 || did_emsg) {
6034 break;
6035 }
6036 if (!map && rem) {
6037 li = tv_list_item_remove(l, li);
6038 } else {
6039 li = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(l, li)((li)->li_next);
6040 }
6041 idx++;
6042 }
6043 }
6044
6045 restore_vimvar(VV_KEY, &save_key);
6046 restore_vimvar(VV_VAL, &save_val);
6047
6048 did_emsg |= save_did_emsg;
6049 }
6050}
6051
6052static int filter_map_one(typval_T *tv, typval_T *expr, int map, int *remp)
6053 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1, 2)
6054{
6055 typval_T rettv;
6056 typval_T argv[3];
6057 int retval = FAIL0;
6058
6059 tv_copy(tv, &vimvars[VV_VAL].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv);
6060 argv[0] = vimvars[VV_KEY].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv;
6061 argv[1] = vimvars[VV_VAL].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv;
6062 if (eval_expr_typval(expr, argv, 2, &rettv) == FAIL0) {
6063 goto theend;
6064 }
6065 if (map) {
6066 // map(): replace the list item value.
6067 tv_clear(tv);
6068 rettv.v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED;
6069 *tv = rettv;
6070 } else {
6071 bool_Bool error = false0;
6072
6073 // filter(): when expr is zero remove the item
6074 *remp = (tv_get_number_chk(&rettv, &error) == 0);
6075 tv_clear(&rettv);
6076 // On type error, nothing has been removed; return FAIL to stop the
6077 // loop. The error message was given by tv_get_number_chk().
6078 if (error) {
6079 goto theend;
6080 }
6081 }
6082 retval = OK1;
6083theend:
6084 tv_clear(&vimvars[VV_VAL].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv);
6085 return retval;
6086}
6087
6088void common_function(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv,
6089 bool_Bool is_funcref, FunPtr fptr)
6090{
6091 char_u *s;
6092 char_u *name;
6093 bool_Bool use_string = false0;
6094 partial_T *arg_pt = NULL((void*)0);
6095 char_u *trans_name = NULL((void*)0);
6096
6097 if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_FUNC) {
6098 // function(MyFunc, [arg], dict)
6099 s = argvars[0].vval.v_string;
6100 } else if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_PARTIAL
6101 && argvars[0].vval.v_partial != NULL((void*)0)) {
6102 // function(dict.MyFunc, [arg])
6103 arg_pt = argvars[0].vval.v_partial;
6104 s = partial_name(arg_pt);
6105 // TODO(bfredl): do the entire nlua_is_table_from_lua dance
6106 } else {
6107 // function('MyFunc', [arg], dict)
6108 s = (char_u *)tv_get_string(&argvars[0]);
6109 use_string = true1;
6110 }
6111
6112 if ((use_string && vim_strchr(s, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') == NULL((void*)0)) || is_funcref) {
6113 name = s;
6114 trans_name = trans_function_name(&name, false0,
6115 TFN_INT | TFN_QUIET | TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD
6116 | TFN_NO_DEREF, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0));
6117 if (*name != NUL'\000') {
6118 s = NULL((void*)0);
6119 }
6120 }
6121 if (s == NULL((void*)0) || *s == NUL'\000' || (use_string && ascii_isdigit(*s))
6122 || (is_funcref && trans_name == NULL((void*)0))) {
6123 emsgf(_(e_invarg2)gettext((char *)(e_invarg2)), (use_string
6124 ? tv_get_string(&argvars[0])
6125 : (const char *)s));
6126 // Don't check an autoload name for existence here.
6127 } else if (trans_name != NULL((void*)0)
6128 && (is_funcref ? find_func(trans_name) == NULL((void*)0)
6129 : !translated_function_exists((const char *)trans_name))) {
6130 emsgf(_("E700: Unknown function: %s")gettext((char *)("E700: Unknown function: %s")), s);
6131 } else {
6132 int dict_idx = 0;
6133 int arg_idx = 0;
6134 list_T *list = NULL((void*)0);
6135 if (STRNCMP(s, "s:", 2)strncmp((char *)(s), (char *)("s:"), (size_t)(2)) == 0 || STRNCMP(s, "<SID>", 5)strncmp((char *)(s), (char *)("<SID>"), (size_t)(5)) == 0) {
6136 char sid_buf[25];
6137 int off = *s == 's' ? 2 : 5;
6138
6139 // Expand s: and <SID> into <SNR>nr_, so that the function can
6140 // also be called from another script. Using trans_function_name()
6141 // would also work, but some plugins depend on the name being
6142 // printable text.
6143 snprintf(sid_buf, sizeof(sid_buf), "<SNR>%" PRId64"l" "d" "_",
6144 (int64_t)current_sctx.sc_sid);
6145 name = xmalloc(STRLEN(sid_buf)strlen((char *)(sid_buf)) + STRLEN(s + off)strlen((char *)(s + off)) + 1);
6146 STRCPY(name, sid_buf)strcpy((char *)(name), (char *)(sid_buf));
6147 STRCAT(name, s + off)strcat((char *)(name), (char *)(s + off));
6148 } else {
6149 name = vim_strsave(s);
6150 }
6151
6152 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
6153 if (argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
6154 // function(name, [args], dict)
6155 arg_idx = 1;
6156 dict_idx = 2;
6157 } else if (argvars[1].v_type == VAR_DICT) {
6158 // function(name, dict)
6159 dict_idx = 1;
6160 } else {
6161 // function(name, [args])
6162 arg_idx = 1;
6163 }
6164 if (dict_idx > 0) {
6165 if (argvars[dict_idx].v_type != VAR_DICT) {
6166 EMSG(_("E922: expected a dict"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E922: expected a dict"))));
6167 xfree(name);
6168 goto theend;
6169 }
6170 if (argvars[dict_idx].vval.v_dict == NULL((void*)0)) {
6171 dict_idx = 0;
6172 }
6173 }
6174 if (arg_idx > 0) {
6175 if (argvars[arg_idx].v_type != VAR_LIST) {
6176 EMSG(_("E923: Second argument of function() must be "emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E923: Second argument of function() must be "
"a list or a dict"))))
6177 "a list or a dict"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E923: Second argument of function() must be "
"a list or a dict"))));
6178 xfree(name);
6179 goto theend;
6180 }
6181 list = argvars[arg_idx].vval.v_list;
6182 if (tv_list_len(list) == 0) {
6183 arg_idx = 0;
6184 } else if (tv_list_len(list) > MAX_FUNC_ARGS20) {
6185 emsg_funcname((char *)e_toomanyarg, s);
6186 xfree(name);
6187 goto theend;
6188 }
6189 }
6190 }
6191 if (dict_idx > 0 || arg_idx > 0 || arg_pt != NULL((void*)0) || is_funcref) {
6192 partial_T *const pt = xcalloc(1, sizeof(*pt));
6193
6194 // result is a VAR_PARTIAL
6195 if (arg_idx > 0 || (arg_pt != NULL((void*)0) && arg_pt->pt_argc > 0)) {
6196 const int arg_len = (arg_pt == NULL((void*)0) ? 0 : arg_pt->pt_argc);
6197 const int lv_len = tv_list_len(list);
6198
6199 pt->pt_argc = arg_len + lv_len;
6200 pt->pt_argv = xmalloc(sizeof(pt->pt_argv[0]) * pt->pt_argc);
6201 int i = 0;
6202 for (; i < arg_len; i++) {
6203 tv_copy(&arg_pt->pt_argv[i], &pt->pt_argv[i]);
6204 }
6205 if (lv_len > 0) {
6206 TV_LIST_ITER(list, li, {do { list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0)) { for
( listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*)0); li = li
->li_next) { { tv_copy((&(li)->li_tv), &pt->
pt_argv[i++]); } } } } while (0)
6207 tv_copy(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li), &pt->pt_argv[i++]);do { list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0)) { for
( listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*)0); li = li
->li_next) { { tv_copy((&(li)->li_tv), &pt->
pt_argv[i++]); } } } } while (0)
6208 })do { list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0)) { for
( listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*)0); li = li
->li_next) { { tv_copy((&(li)->li_tv), &pt->
pt_argv[i++]); } } } } while (0);
6209 }
6210 }
6211
6212 // For "function(dict.func, [], dict)" and "func" is a partial
6213 // use "dict". That is backwards compatible.
6214 if (dict_idx > 0) {
6215 // The dict is bound explicitly, pt_auto is false
6216 pt->pt_dict = argvars[dict_idx].vval.v_dict;
6217 (pt->pt_dict->dv_refcount)++;
6218 } else if (arg_pt != NULL((void*)0)) {
6219 // If the dict was bound automatically the result is also
6220 // bound automatically.
6221 pt->pt_dict = arg_pt->pt_dict;
6222 pt->pt_auto = arg_pt->pt_auto;
6223 if (pt->pt_dict != NULL((void*)0)) {
6224 (pt->pt_dict->dv_refcount)++;
6225 }
6226 }
6227
6228 pt->pt_refcount = 1;
6229 if (arg_pt != NULL((void*)0) && arg_pt->pt_func != NULL((void*)0)) {
6230 pt->pt_func = arg_pt->pt_func;
6231 func_ptr_ref(pt->pt_func);
6232 xfree(name);
6233 } else if (is_funcref) {
6234 pt->pt_func = find_func(trans_name);
6235 func_ptr_ref(pt->pt_func);
6236 xfree(name);
6237 } else {
6238 pt->pt_name = name;
6239 func_ref(name);
6240 }
6241
6242 rettv->v_type = VAR_PARTIAL;
6243 rettv->vval.v_partial = pt;
6244 } else {
6245 // result is a VAR_FUNC
6246 rettv->v_type = VAR_FUNC;
6247 rettv->vval.v_string = name;
6248 func_ref(name);
6249 }
6250 }
6251theend:
6252 xfree(trans_name);
6253}
6254
6255/// Returns buffer options, variables and other attributes in a dictionary.
6256dict_T *get_buffer_info(buf_T *buf)
6257{
6258 dict_T *const dict = tv_dict_alloc();
6259
6260 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("bufnr")("bufnr"), (sizeof("bufnr") - 1), buf->b_fnumhandle);
6261 tv_dict_add_str(dict, S_LEN("name")("name"), (sizeof("name") - 1),
6262 buf->b_ffname != NULL((void*)0) ? (const char *)buf->b_ffname : "");
6263 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("lnum")("lnum"), (sizeof("lnum") - 1),
6264 buf == curbuf ? curwin->w_cursor.lnum : buflist_findlnum(buf));
6265 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("linecount")("linecount"), (sizeof("linecount") - 1), buf->b_ml.ml_line_count);
6266 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("loaded")("loaded"), (sizeof("loaded") - 1), buf->b_ml.ml_mfp != NULL((void*)0));
6267 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("listed")("listed"), (sizeof("listed") - 1), buf->b_p_bl);
6268 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("changed")("changed"), (sizeof("changed") - 1), bufIsChanged(buf));
6269 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("changedtick")("changedtick"), (sizeof("changedtick") - 1), buf_get_changedtick(buf));
6270 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("hidden")("hidden"), (sizeof("hidden") - 1),
6271 buf->b_ml.ml_mfp != NULL((void*)0) && buf->b_nwindows == 0);
6272
6273 // Get a reference to buffer variables
6274 tv_dict_add_dict(dict, S_LEN("variables")("variables"), (sizeof("variables") - 1), buf->b_vars);
6275
6276 // List of windows displaying this buffer
6277 list_T *const windows = tv_list_alloc(kListLenMayKnow);
6278 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (
tp)->tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
6279 if (wp->w_buffer == buf) {
6280 tv_list_append_number(windows, (varnumber_T)wp->handle);
6281 }
6282 }
6283 tv_dict_add_list(dict, S_LEN("windows")("windows"), (sizeof("windows") - 1), windows);
6284
6285 if (buf->b_signlist != NULL((void*)0)) {
6286 // List of signs placed in this buffer
6287 tv_dict_add_list(dict, S_LEN("signs")("signs"), (sizeof("signs") - 1), get_buffer_signs(buf));
6288 }
6289
6290 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("lastused")("lastused"), (sizeof("lastused") - 1), buf->b_last_used);
6291
6292 return dict;
6293}
6294
6295/// Get the line number from VimL object
6296///
6297/// @note Unlike tv_get_lnum(), this one supports only "$" special string.
6298///
6299/// @param[in] tv Object to get value from. Is expected to be a number or
6300/// a special string "$".
6301/// @param[in] buf Buffer to take last line number from in case tv is "$". May
6302/// be NULL, in this case "$" results in zero return.
6303///
6304/// @return Line number or 0 in case of error.
6305linenr_T tv_get_lnum_buf(const typval_T *const tv,
6306 const buf_T *const buf)
6307 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1) FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
6308{
6309 if (tv->v_type == VAR_STRING
6310 && tv->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)
6311 && tv->vval.v_string[0] == '$'
6312 && buf != NULL((void*)0)) {
6313 return buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
6314 }
6315 return tv_get_number_chk(tv, NULL((void*)0));
6316}
6317
6318void get_qf_loc_list(int is_qf, win_T *wp, typval_T *what_arg,
6319 typval_T *rettv)
6320{
6321 if (what_arg->v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN) {
6322 tv_list_alloc_ret(rettv, kListLenMayKnow);
6323 if (is_qf || wp != NULL((void*)0)) {
6324 (void)get_errorlist(NULL((void*)0), wp, -1, rettv->vval.v_list);
6325 }
6326 } else {
6327 tv_dict_alloc_ret(rettv);
6328 if (is_qf || wp != NULL((void*)0)) {
6329 if (what_arg->v_type == VAR_DICT) {
6330 dict_T *d = what_arg->vval.v_dict;
6331
6332 if (d != NULL((void*)0)) {
6333 qf_get_properties(wp, d, rettv->vval.v_dict);
6334 }
6335 } else {
6336 EMSG(_(e_dictreq))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictreq))));
6337 }
6338 }
6339 }
6340}
6341
6342/// Returns information (variables, options, etc.) about a tab page
6343/// as a dictionary.
6344dict_T *get_tabpage_info(tabpage_T *tp, int tp_idx)
6345{
6346 dict_T *const dict = tv_dict_alloc();
6347
6348 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("tabnr")("tabnr"), (sizeof("tabnr") - 1), tp_idx);
6349
6350 list_T *const l = tv_list_alloc(kListLenMayKnow);
6351 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS_IN_TAB(wp, tp)for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (tp)->tp_firstwin
; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
6352 tv_list_append_number(l, (varnumber_T)wp->handle);
6353 }
6354 tv_dict_add_list(dict, S_LEN("windows")("windows"), (sizeof("windows") - 1), l);
6355
6356 // Make a reference to tabpage variables
6357 tv_dict_add_dict(dict, S_LEN("variables")("variables"), (sizeof("variables") - 1), tp->tp_vars);
6358
6359 return dict;
6360}
6361
6362/// Returns information about a window as a dictionary.
6363dict_T *get_win_info(win_T *wp, int16_t tpnr, int16_t winnr)
6364{
6365 dict_T *const dict = tv_dict_alloc();
6366
6367 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("tabnr")("tabnr"), (sizeof("tabnr") - 1), tpnr);
6368 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("winnr")("winnr"), (sizeof("winnr") - 1), winnr);
6369 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("winid")("winid"), (sizeof("winid") - 1), wp->handle);
6370 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("height")("height"), (sizeof("height") - 1), wp->w_height);
6371 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("winrow")("winrow"), (sizeof("winrow") - 1), wp->w_winrow + 1);
6372 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("topline")("topline"), (sizeof("topline") - 1), wp->w_topline);
6373 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("botline")("botline"), (sizeof("botline") - 1), wp->w_botline - 1);
6374 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("winbar")("winbar"), (sizeof("winbar") - 1), 0);
6375 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("width")("width"), (sizeof("width") - 1), wp->w_width);
6376 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("bufnr")("bufnr"), (sizeof("bufnr") - 1), wp->w_buffer->b_fnumhandle);
6377 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("wincol")("wincol"), (sizeof("wincol") - 1), wp->w_wincol + 1);
6378
6379 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("terminal")("terminal"), (sizeof("terminal") - 1), bt_terminal(wp->w_buffer));
6380 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("quickfix")("quickfix"), (sizeof("quickfix") - 1), bt_quickfix(wp->w_buffer));
6381 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("loclist")("loclist"), (sizeof("loclist") - 1),
6382 (bt_quickfix(wp->w_buffer) && wp->w_llist_ref != NULL((void*)0)));
6383
6384 // Add a reference to window variables
6385 tv_dict_add_dict(dict, S_LEN("variables")("variables"), (sizeof("variables") - 1), wp->w_vars);
6386
6387 return dict;
6388}
6389
6390// Find window specified by "vp" in tabpage "tp".
6391win_T *
6392find_win_by_nr(
6393 typval_T *vp,
6394 tabpage_T *tp // NULL for current tab page
6395)
6396{
6397 int nr = (int)tv_get_number_chk(vp, NULL((void*)0));
6398
6399 if (nr < 0) {
6400 return NULL((void*)0);
6401 }
6402
6403 if (nr == 0) {
6404 return curwin;
6405 }
6406
6407 // This method accepts NULL as an alias for curtab.
6408 if (tp == NULL((void*)0)) {
6409 tp = curtab;
6410 }
6411
6412 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS_IN_TAB(wp, tp)for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (tp)->tp_firstwin
; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
6413 if (nr >= LOWEST_WIN_ID1000) {
6414 if (wp->handle == nr) {
6415 return wp;
6416 }
6417 } else if (--nr <= 0) {
6418 return wp;
6419 }
6420 }
6421 return NULL((void*)0);
6422}
6423
6424/// Find window specified by "wvp" in tabpage "tvp".
6425win_T *find_tabwin(typval_T *wvp, typval_T *tvp)
6426{
6427 win_T *wp = NULL((void*)0);
6428 tabpage_T *tp = NULL((void*)0);
6429
6430 if (wvp->v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
6431 if (tvp->v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
6432 long n = tv_get_number(tvp);
6433 if (n >= 0) {
6434 tp = find_tabpage(n);
6435 }
6436 } else {
6437 tp = curtab;
6438 }
6439
6440 if (tp != NULL((void*)0)) {
6441 wp = find_win_by_nr(wvp, tp);
6442 }
6443 } else {
6444 wp = curwin;
6445 }
6446
6447 return wp;
6448}
6449
6450/*
6451 * getwinvar() and gettabwinvar()
6452 */
6453void
6454getwinvar(
6455 typval_T *argvars,
6456 typval_T *rettv,
6457 int off // 1 for gettabwinvar()
6458)
6459{
6460 win_T *win, *oldcurwin;
6461 dictitem_T *v;
6462 tabpage_T *tp = NULL((void*)0);
6463 tabpage_T *oldtabpage = NULL((void*)0);
6464 bool_Bool done = false0;
6465
6466 if (off == 1) {
6467 tp = find_tabpage((int)tv_get_number_chk(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0)));
6468 } else {
6469 tp = curtab;
6470 }
6471 win = find_win_by_nr(&argvars[off], tp);
6472 const char *varname = tv_get_string_chk(&argvars[off + 1]);
6473
6474 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
6475 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
6476
6477 emsg_off++;
6478 if (win != NULL((void*)0) && varname != NULL((void*)0)) {
6479 // Set curwin to be our win, temporarily. Also set the tabpage,
6480 // otherwise the window is not valid. Only do this when needed,
6481 // autocommands get blocked.
6482 bool_Bool need_switch_win = tp != curtab || win != curwin;
6483 if (!need_switch_win
6484 || switch_win(&oldcurwin, &oldtabpage, win, tp, true1) == OK1) {
6485 if (*varname == '&') {
6486 if (varname[1] == NUL'\000') {
6487 // get all window-local options in a dict
6488 dict_T *opts = get_winbuf_options(false0);
6489
6490 if (opts != NULL((void*)0)) {
6491 tv_dict_set_ret(rettv, opts);
6492 done = true1;
6493 }
6494 } else if (get_option_tv(&varname, rettv, 1) == OK1) {
6495 // window-local-option
6496 done = true1;
6497 }
6498 } else {
6499 // Look up the variable.
6500 // Let getwinvar({nr}, "") return the "w:" dictionary.
6501 v = find_var_in_ht(&win->w_vars->dv_hashtab, 'w', varname,
6502 strlen(varname), false0);
6503 if (v != NULL((void*)0)) {
6504 tv_copy(&v->di_tv, rettv);
6505 done = true1;
6506 }
6507 }
6508 }
6509
6510 if (need_switch_win) {
6511 // restore previous notion of curwin
6512 restore_win(oldcurwin, oldtabpage, true1);
6513 }
6514 }
6515 emsg_off--;
6516
6517 if (!done && argvars[off + 2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
6518 // use the default return value
6519 tv_copy(&argvars[off + 2], rettv);
6520 }
6521}
6522
6523/*
6524 * This function is used by f_input() and f_inputdialog() functions. The third
6525 * argument to f_input() specifies the type of completion to use at the
6526 * prompt. The third argument to f_inputdialog() specifies the value to return
6527 * when the user cancels the prompt.
6528 */
6529void get_user_input(const typval_T *const argvars,
6530 typval_T *const rettv,
6531 const bool_Bool inputdialog,
6532 const bool_Bool secret)
6533 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
6534{
6535 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
6536 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
6537
6538 const char *prompt = "";
6539 const char *defstr = "";
6540 const char *cancelreturn = NULL((void*)0);
6541 const char *xp_name = NULL((void*)0);
6542 Callback input_callback = { .type = kCallbackNone };
6543 char prompt_buf[NUMBUFLEN];
6544 char defstr_buf[NUMBUFLEN];
6545 char cancelreturn_buf[NUMBUFLEN];
6546 char xp_name_buf[NUMBUFLEN];
6547 char def[1] = { 0 };
6548 if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_DICT) {
6549 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
6550 EMSG(_("E5050: {opts} must be the only argument"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E5050: {opts} must be the only argument"
))));
6551 return;
6552 }
6553 dict_T *const dict = argvars[0].vval.v_dict;
6554 prompt = tv_dict_get_string_buf_chk(dict, S_LEN("prompt")("prompt"), (sizeof("prompt") - 1), prompt_buf, "");
6555 if (prompt == NULL((void*)0)) {
6556 return;
6557 }
6558 defstr = tv_dict_get_string_buf_chk(dict, S_LEN("default")("default"), (sizeof("default") - 1), defstr_buf, "");
6559 if (defstr == NULL((void*)0)) {
6560 return;
6561 }
6562 cancelreturn = tv_dict_get_string_buf_chk(dict, S_LEN("cancelreturn")("cancelreturn"), (sizeof("cancelreturn") - 1),
6563 cancelreturn_buf, def);
6564 if (cancelreturn == NULL((void*)0)) { // error
6565 return;
6566 }
6567 if (*cancelreturn == NUL'\000') {
6568 cancelreturn = NULL((void*)0);
6569 }
6570 xp_name = tv_dict_get_string_buf_chk(dict, S_LEN("completion")("completion"), (sizeof("completion") - 1),
6571 xp_name_buf, def);
6572 if (xp_name == NULL((void*)0)) { // error
6573 return;
6574 }
6575 if (xp_name == def) { // default to NULL
6576 xp_name = NULL((void*)0);
6577 }
6578 if (!tv_dict_get_callback(dict, S_LEN("highlight")("highlight"), (sizeof("highlight") - 1), &input_callback)) {
6579 return;
6580 }
6581 } else {
6582 prompt = tv_get_string_buf_chk(&argvars[0], prompt_buf);
6583 if (prompt == NULL((void*)0)) {
6584 return;
6585 }
6586 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
6587 defstr = tv_get_string_buf_chk(&argvars[1], defstr_buf);
6588 if (defstr == NULL((void*)0)) {
6589 return;
6590 }
6591 if (argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
6592 const char *const arg2 = tv_get_string_buf_chk(&argvars[2],
6593 cancelreturn_buf);
6594 if (arg2 == NULL((void*)0)) {
6595 return;
6596 }
6597 if (inputdialog) {
6598 cancelreturn = arg2;
6599 } else {
6600 xp_name = arg2;
6601 }
6602 }
6603 }
6604 }
6605
6606 int xp_type = EXPAND_NOTHING;
6607 char *xp_arg = NULL((void*)0);
6608 if (xp_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
6609 // input() with a third argument: completion
6610 const int xp_namelen = (int)strlen(xp_name);
6611
6612 uint32_t argt;
6613 if (parse_compl_arg((char_u *)xp_name, xp_namelen, &xp_type,
6614 &argt, (char_u **)&xp_arg) == FAIL0) {
6615 return;
6616 }
6617 }
6618
6619 const bool_Bool cmd_silent_save = cmd_silent;
6620
6621 cmd_silent = false0; // Want to see the prompt.
6622 // Only the part of the message after the last NL is considered as
6623 // prompt for the command line, unlsess cmdline is externalized
6624 const char *p = prompt;
6625 if (!ui_has(kUICmdline)) {
6626 const char *lastnl = strrchr(prompt, '\n');
6627 if (lastnl != NULL((void*)0)) {
6628 p = lastnl+1;
6629 msg_start();
6630 msg_clr_eos();
6631 msg_puts_attr_len(prompt, p - prompt, echo_attr);
6632 msg_didout = false0;
6633 msg_starthere();
6634 }
6635 }
6636 cmdline_row = msg_row;
6637
6638 stuffReadbuffSpec(defstr);
6639
6640 const int save_ex_normal_busy = ex_normal_busy;
6641 ex_normal_busy = 0;
6642 rettv->vval.v_string =
6643 (char_u *)getcmdline_prompt(secret ? NUL'\000' : '@', p, echo_attr,
6644 xp_type, xp_arg, input_callback);
6645 ex_normal_busy = save_ex_normal_busy;
6646 callback_free(&input_callback);
6647
6648 if (rettv->vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0) && cancelreturn != NULL((void*)0)) {
6649 rettv->vval.v_string = (char_u *)xstrdup(cancelreturn);
6650 }
6651
6652 xfree(xp_arg);
6653
6654 // Since the user typed this, no need to wait for return.
6655 need_wait_return = false0;
6656 msg_didout = false0;
6657 cmd_silent = cmd_silent_save;
6658}
6659
6660/// Turn a dictionary into a list
6661///
6662/// @param[in] tv Dictionary to convert. Is checked for actually being
6663/// a dictionary, will give an error if not.
6664/// @param[out] rettv Location where result will be saved.
6665/// @param[in] what What to save in rettv.
6666void dict_list(typval_T *const tv, typval_T *const rettv,
6667 const DictListType what)
6668{
6669 if (tv->v_type != VAR_DICT) {
6670 EMSG(_(e_dictreq))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictreq))));
6671 return;
6672 }
6673 if (tv->vval.v_dict == NULL((void*)0)) {
6674 return;
6675 }
6676
6677 tv_list_alloc_ret(rettv, tv_dict_len(tv->vval.v_dict));
6678
6679 TV_DICT_ITER(tv->vval.v_dict, di, {do { hashtab_T *const dihi_ht_ = (&(tv->vval.v_dict)->
dv_hashtab); size_t dihi_todo_ = dihi_ht_->ht_used; for (hashitem_T
*dihi_ = dihi_ht_->ht_array; dihi_todo_; dihi_++) { if (!
((dihi_)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (dihi_)->hi_key == (char_u
*)&hash_removed)) { dihi_todo_--; { { { dictitem_T *const
di = ((dictitem_T *)((dihi_)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key))); { { typval_T tv_item = { .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED
}; switch (what) { case kDictListKeys: { tv_item.v_type = VAR_STRING
; tv_item.vval.v_string = vim_strsave(di->di_key); break; }
case kDictListValues: { tv_copy(&di->di_tv, &tv_item
); break; } case kDictListItems: { list_T *const sub_l = tv_list_alloc
(2); tv_item.v_type = VAR_LIST; tv_item.vval.v_list = sub_l; tv_list_ref
(sub_l); tv_list_append_owned_tv(sub_l, (typval_T) { .v_type =
VAR_STRING, .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED, .vval.v_string = (char_u
*)xstrdup((const char *)di->di_key), }); tv_list_append_tv
(sub_l, &di->di_tv); break; } } tv_list_append_owned_tv

((dihi_)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (dihi_)->hi_key == (char_u
*)&hash_removed)) { dihi_todo_--; { { { dictitem_T *const
di = ((dictitem_T *)((dihi_)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key))); { { typval_T tv_item = { .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED
}; switch (what) { case kDictListKeys: { tv_item.v_type = VAR_STRING
; tv_item.vval.v_string = vim_strsave(di->di_key); break; }
case kDictListValues: { tv_copy(&di->di_tv, &tv_item
); break; } case kDictListItems: { list_T *const sub_l = tv_list_alloc
(2); tv_item.v_type = VAR_LIST; tv_item.vval.v_list = sub_l; tv_list_ref
(sub_l); tv_list_append_owned_tv(sub_l, (typval_T) { .v_type =
VAR_STRING, .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED, .vval.v_string = (char_u
*)xstrdup((const char *)di->di_key), }); tv_list_append_tv
(sub_l, &di->di_tv); break; } } tv_list_append_owned_tv
(rettv->vval.v_list, tv_item); } } } } } } } } while (0)
6698

dv_hashtab); size_t dihi_todo_ = dihi_ht_->ht_used; for (hashitem_T

(sub_l, &di->di_tv); break; } } tv_list_append_owned_tv
(rettv->vval.v_list, tv_item); } } } } } } } } while (0)

(rettv->vval.v_list, tv_item); } } } } } } } } while (0)

6710

); break; } case kDictListItems: { list_T *const sub_l = tv_list_alloc
