6713}
6714
6715/// Builds a process argument vector from a VimL object (typval_T).
6716///
6717/// @param[in] cmd_tv VimL object
6718/// @param[out] cmd Returns the command or executable name.
6719/// @param[out] executable Returns `false` if argv[0] is not executable.
6720///
6721/// @returns Result of `shell_build_argv()` if `cmd_tv` is a String.
6722/// Else, string values of `cmd_tv` copied to a (char **) list with
6723/// argv[0] resolved to full path ($PATHEXT-resolved on Windows).
6724char **tv_to_argv(typval_T *cmd_tv, const char **cmd, bool_Bool *executable)
6725{
6726 if (cmd_tv->v_type == VAR_STRING) { // String => "shell semantics".
6727 const char *cmd_str = tv_get_string(cmd_tv);
6728 if (cmd) {
6729 *cmd = cmd_str;
6730 }
6731 return shell_build_argv(cmd_str, NULL((void*)0));
6732 }
6733
6734 if (cmd_tv->v_type != VAR_LIST) {
6735 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), "expected String or List")emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), ("expected String or List"
));
6736 return NULL((void*)0);
6737 }
6738
6739 list_T *argl = cmd_tv->vval.v_list;
6740 int argc = tv_list_len(argl);
6741 if (!argc) {
6742 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg)))); // List must have at least one item.
6743 return NULL((void*)0);
6744 }
6745
6746 const char *arg0 = tv_get_string_chk(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(tv_list_first(argl))(&(tv_list_first(argl))->li_tv));
6747 char *exe_resolved = NULL((void*)0);
6748 if (!arg0 || !os_can_exe(arg0, &exe_resolved, true1)) {
6749 if (arg0 && executable) {
6750 char buf[IOSIZE(1024+1)];
6751 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "'%s' is not executable", arg0);
6752 EMSG3(_(e_invargNval), "cmd", buf)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_invargNval))), ("cmd"
), (buf));
6753 *executable = false0;
6754 }
6755 return NULL((void*)0);
6756 }
6757
6758 if (cmd) {
6759 *cmd = exe_resolved;
6760 }
6761
6762 // Build the argument vector
6763 int i = 0;
6764 char **argv = xcalloc(argc + 1, sizeof(char *));
6765 TV_LIST_ITER_CONST(argl, arg, {do { const list_T *const l_ = (argl); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *arg = l_->lv_first; arg != ((void
*)0); arg = arg->li_next) { { const char *a = tv_get_string_chk
((&(arg)->li_tv)); if (!a) { shell_free_argv(argv); xfree
(exe_resolved); return ((void*)0); } argv[i++] = xstrdup(a); }
} } } while (0)
6766 const char *a = tv_get_string_chk(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(arg));do { const list_T *const l_ = (argl); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *arg = l_->lv_first; arg != ((void
*)0); arg = arg->li_next) { { const char *a = tv_get_string_chk
((&(arg)->li_tv)); if (!a) { shell_free_argv(argv); xfree
(exe_resolved); return ((void*)0); } argv[i++] = xstrdup(a); }
} } } while (0)
6767 if (!a) {do { const list_T *const l_ = (argl); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *arg = l_->lv_first; arg != ((void
*)0); arg = arg->li_next) { { const char *a = tv_get_string_chk
((&(arg)->li_tv)); if (!a) { shell_free_argv(argv); xfree
(exe_resolved); return ((void*)0); } argv[i++] = xstrdup(a); }
} } } while (0)
6768 // Did emsg in tv_get_string_chk; just deallocate argv.do { const list_T *const l_ = (argl); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *arg = l_->lv_first; arg != ((void
*)0); arg = arg->li_next) { { const char *a = tv_get_string_chk
((&(arg)->li_tv)); if (!a) { shell_free_argv(argv); xfree
(exe_resolved); return ((void*)0); } argv[i++] = xstrdup(a); }
} } } while (0)
6769 shell_free_argv(argv);do { const list_T *const l_ = (argl); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *arg = l_->lv_first; arg != ((void
*)0); arg = arg->li_next) { { const char *a = tv_get_string_chk
((&(arg)->li_tv)); if (!a) { shell_free_argv(argv); xfree
(exe_resolved); return ((void*)0); } argv[i++] = xstrdup(a); }
} } } while (0)
6770 xfree(exe_resolved);do { const list_T *const l_ = (argl); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *arg = l_->lv_first; arg != ((void
*)0); arg = arg->li_next) { { const char *a = tv_get_string_chk
((&(arg)->li_tv)); if (!a) { shell_free_argv(argv); xfree
(exe_resolved); return ((void*)0); } argv[i++] = xstrdup(a); }
} } } while (0)
6771 return NULL;do { const list_T *const l_ = (argl); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *arg = l_->lv_first; arg != ((void
*)0); arg = arg->li_next) { { const char *a = tv_get_string_chk
((&(arg)->li_tv)); if (!a) { shell_free_argv(argv); xfree
(exe_resolved); return ((void*)0); } argv[i++] = xstrdup(a); }
} } } while (0)
6772 }do { const list_T *const l_ = (argl); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *arg = l_->lv_first; arg != ((void
*)0); arg = arg->li_next) { { const char *a = tv_get_string_chk
((&(arg)->li_tv)); if (!a) { shell_free_argv(argv); xfree
(exe_resolved); return ((void*)0); } argv[i++] = xstrdup(a); }
} } } while (0)
6773 argv[i++] = xstrdup(a);do { const list_T *const l_ = (argl); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *arg = l_->lv_first; arg != ((void
*)0); arg = arg->li_next) { { const char *a = tv_get_string_chk
((&(arg)->li_tv)); if (!a) { shell_free_argv(argv); xfree
(exe_resolved); return ((void*)0); } argv[i++] = xstrdup(a); }
} } } while (0)
6774 })do { const list_T *const l_ = (argl); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *arg = l_->lv_first; arg != ((void
*)0); arg = arg->li_next) { { const char *a = tv_get_string_chk
((&(arg)->li_tv)); if (!a) { shell_free_argv(argv); xfree
(exe_resolved); return ((void*)0); } argv[i++] = xstrdup(a); }
} } } while (0);
6775 // Replace argv[0] with absolute path. The only reason for this is to make
6776 // $PATHEXT work on Windows with jobstart([…]). #9569
6777 xfree(argv[0]);
6778 argv[0] = exe_resolved;
6779
6780 return argv;
6781}
6782
6783/// Fill a dictionary with all applicable maparg() like dictionaries
6784///
6785/// @param dict The dictionary to be filled
6786/// @param mp The maphash that contains the mapping information
6787/// @param buffer_value The "buffer" value
6788/// @param compatible True for compatible with old maparg() dict
6789void mapblock_fill_dict(dict_T *const dict,
6790 const mapblock_T *const mp,
6791 long buffer_value,
6792 bool_Bool compatible)
6793 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
6794{
6795 char *const lhs = str2special_save((const char *)mp->m_keys,
6796 compatible, !compatible);
6797 char *const mapmode = map_mode_to_chars(mp->m_mode);
6798 varnumber_T noremap_value;
6799
6800 if (compatible) {
6801 // Keep old compatible behavior
6802 // This is unable to determine whether a mapping is a <script> mapping
6803 noremap_value = !!mp->m_noremap;
6804 } else {
6805 // Distinguish between <script> mapping
6806 // If it's not a <script> mapping, check if it's a noremap
6807 noremap_value = mp->m_noremap == REMAP_SCRIPT ? 2 : !!mp->m_noremap;
6808 }
6809
6810 if (compatible) {
6811 tv_dict_add_str(dict, S_LEN("rhs")("rhs"), (sizeof("rhs") - 1), (const char *)mp->m_orig_str);
6812 } else {
6813 tv_dict_add_allocated_str(dict, S_LEN("rhs")("rhs"), (sizeof("rhs") - 1),
6814 str2special_save((const char *)mp->m_str, false0,
6815 true1));
6816 }
6817 tv_dict_add_allocated_str(dict, S_LEN("lhs")("lhs"), (sizeof("lhs") - 1), lhs);
6818 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("noremap")("noremap"), (sizeof("noremap") - 1), noremap_value);
6819 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("script")("script"), (sizeof("script") - 1), mp->m_noremap == REMAP_SCRIPT ? 1 : 0);
6820 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("expr")("expr"), (sizeof("expr") - 1), mp->m_expr ? 1 : 0);
6821 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("silent")("silent"), (sizeof("silent") - 1), mp->m_silent ? 1 : 0);
6822 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("sid")("sid"), (sizeof("sid") - 1), (varnumber_T)mp->m_script_ctx.sc_sid);
6823 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("lnum")("lnum"), (sizeof("lnum") - 1), (varnumber_T)mp->m_script_ctx.sc_lnum);
6824 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("buffer")("buffer"), (sizeof("buffer") - 1), (varnumber_T)buffer_value);
6825 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("nowait")("nowait"), (sizeof("nowait") - 1), mp->m_nowait ? 1 : 0);
6826 tv_dict_add_allocated_str(dict, S_LEN("mode")("mode"), (sizeof("mode") - 1), mapmode);
6827}
6828
6829int matchadd_dict_arg(typval_T *tv, const char **conceal_char,
6830 win_T **win)
6831{
6832 dictitem_T *di;
6833
6834 if (tv->v_type != VAR_DICT) {
6835 EMSG(_(e_dictreq))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictreq))));
6836 return FAIL0;
6837 }
6838
6839 if ((di = tv_dict_find(tv->vval.v_dict, S_LEN("conceal")("conceal"), (sizeof("conceal") - 1))) != NULL((void*)0)) {
6840 *conceal_char = tv_get_string(&di->di_tv);
6841 }
6842
6843 if ((di = tv_dict_find(tv->vval.v_dict, S_LEN("window")("window"), (sizeof("window") - 1))) != NULL((void*)0)) {
6844 *win = find_win_by_nr_or_id(&di->di_tv);
6845 if (*win == NULL((void*)0)) {
6846 EMSG(_(e_invalwindow))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invalwindow))));
6847 return FAIL0;
6848 }
6849 }
6850
6851 return OK1;
6852}
6853
6854void return_register(int regname, typval_T *rettv)
6855{
6856 char_u buf[2] = { regname, 0 };
6857
6858 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
6859 rettv->vval.v_string = vim_strsave(buf);
6860}
6861
6862void screenchar_adjust_grid(ScreenGrid **grid, int *row, int *col)
6863{
6864 // TODO(bfredl): this is a hack for legacy tests which use screenchar()
6865 // to check printed messages on the screen (but not floats etc
6866 // as these are not legacy features). If the compositor is refactored to
6867 // have its own buffer, this should just read from it instead.
6868 msg_scroll_flush();
6869 if (msg_grid.chars && msg_grid.comp_index > 0 && *row >= msg_grid.comp_row
6870 && *row < (msg_grid.Rows + msg_grid.comp_row)
6871 && *col < msg_grid.Columns) {
6872 *grid = &msg_grid;
6873 *row -= msg_grid.comp_row;
6874 }
6875}
6876
6877/// Set line or list of lines in buffer "buf".
6878void set_buffer_lines(buf_T *buf, linenr_T lnum_arg, bool_Bool append,
6879 const typval_T *lines, typval_T *rettv)
6880 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(4, 5)
6881{
6882 linenr_T lnum = lnum_arg + (append ? 1 : 0);
6883 const char *line = NULL((void*)0);
6884 list_T *l = NULL((void*)0);
6885 listitem_T *li = NULL((void*)0);
6886 long added = 0;
6887 linenr_T append_lnum;
6888 buf_T *curbuf_save = NULL((void*)0);
6889 win_T *curwin_save = NULL((void*)0);
6890 const bool_Bool is_curbuf = buf == curbuf;
6891
6892 // When using the current buffer ml_mfp will be set if needed. Useful when
6893 // setline() is used on startup. For other buffers the buffer must be
6894 // loaded.
6895 if (buf == NULL((void*)0) || (!is_curbuf && buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL((void*)0)) || lnum < 1) {
6896 rettv->vval.v_number = 1; // FAIL
6897 return;
6898 }
6899
6900 if (!is_curbuf) {
6901 curbuf_save = curbuf;
6902 curwin_save = curwin;
6903 curbuf = buf;
6904 find_win_for_curbuf();
6905 }
6906
6907 if (append) {
6908 // appendbufline() uses the line number below which we insert
6909 append_lnum = lnum - 1;
6910 } else {
6911 // setbufline() uses the line number above which we insert, we only
6912 // append if it's below the last line
6913 append_lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
6914 }
6915
6916 if (lines->v_type == VAR_LIST) {
6917 l = lines->vval.v_list;
6918 li = tv_list_first(l);
6919 } else {
6920 line = tv_get_string_chk(lines);
6921 }
6922
6923 // Default result is zero == OK.
6924 for (;; ) {
6925 if (lines->v_type == VAR_LIST) {
6926 // List argument, get next string.
6927 if (li == NULL((void*)0)) {
6928 break;
6929 }
6930 line = tv_get_string_chk(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)(&(li)->li_tv));
6931 li = TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(l, li)((li)->li_next);
6932 }
6933
6934 rettv->vval.v_number = 1; // FAIL
6935 if (line == NULL((void*)0) || lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count + 1) {
6936 break;
6937 }
6938
6939 // When coming here from Insert mode, sync undo, so that this can be
6940 // undone separately from what was previously inserted.
6941 if (u_sync_once == 2) {
6942 u_sync_once = 1; // notify that u_sync() was called
6943 u_sync(true1);
6944 }
6945
6946 if (!append && lnum <= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
6947 // Existing line, replace it.
6948 int old_len = (int)STRLEN(ml_get(lnum))strlen((char *)(ml_get(lnum)));
6949 if (u_savesub(lnum) == OK1
6950 && ml_replace(lnum, (char_u *)line, true1) == OK1) {
6951 inserted_bytes(lnum, 0, old_len, STRLEN(line)strlen((char *)(line)));
6952 if (is_curbuf && lnum == curwin->w_cursor.lnum) {
6953 check_cursor_col();
6954 }
6955 rettv->vval.v_number = 0; // OK
6956 }
6957 } else if (added > 0 || u_save(lnum - 1, lnum) == OK1) {
6958 // append the line.
6959 added++;
6960 if (ml_append(lnum - 1, (char_u *)line, 0, false0) == OK1) {
6961 rettv->vval.v_number = 0; // OK
6962 }
6963 }
6964
6965 if (l == NULL((void*)0)) { // only one string argument
6966 break;
6967 }
6968 lnum++;
6969 }
6970
6971 if (added > 0) {
6972 appended_lines_mark(append_lnum, added);
6973
6974 // Only adjust the cursor for buffers other than the current, unless it
6975 // is the current window. For curbuf and other windows it has been done
6976 // in mark_adjust_internal().
6977 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for (tabpage_T *tp = first_tabpage; tp != ((void*)0); tp = tp
->tp_next) for (win_T *wp = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (
tp)->tp_firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next) {
6978 if (wp->w_buffer == buf
6979 && (wp->w_buffer != curbuf || wp == curwin)
6980 && wp->w_cursor.lnum > append_lnum) {
6981 wp->w_cursor.lnum += added;
6982 }
6983 }
6984 check_cursor_col();
6985 update_topline(curwin);
6986 }
6987
6988 if (!is_curbuf) {
6989 curbuf = curbuf_save;
6990 curwin = curwin_save;
6991 }
6992}
6993
6994/*
6995 * "setwinvar()" and "settabwinvar()" functions
6996 */
6997
6998void setwinvar(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv, int off)
6999{
7000 if (check_secure()) {
7001 return;
7002 }
7003
7004 tabpage_T *tp = NULL((void*)0);
7005 if (off == 1) {
7006 tp = find_tabpage((int)tv_get_number_chk(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0)));
7007 } else {
7008 tp = curtab;
7009 }
7010 win_T *const win = find_win_by_nr(&argvars[off], tp);
7011 const char *varname = tv_get_string_chk(&argvars[off + 1]);
7012 typval_T *varp = &argvars[off + 2];
7013
7014 if (win != NULL((void*)0) && varname != NULL((void*)0) && varp != NULL((void*)0)) {
7015 win_T *save_curwin;
7016 tabpage_T *save_curtab;
7017 bool_Bool need_switch_win = tp != curtab || win != curwin;
7018 if (!need_switch_win
7019 || switch_win(&save_curwin, &save_curtab, win, tp, true1) == OK1) {
7020 if (*varname == '&') {
7021 long numval;
7022 bool_Bool error = false0;
7023
7024 varname++;
7025 numval = tv_get_number_chk(varp, &error);
7026 char nbuf[NUMBUFLEN];
7027 const char *const strval = tv_get_string_buf_chk(varp, nbuf);
7028 if (!error && strval != NULL((void*)0)) {
7029 set_option_value(varname, numval, strval, OPT_LOCAL);
7030 }
7031 } else {
7032 const size_t varname_len = strlen(varname);
7033 char *const winvarname = xmalloc(varname_len + 3);
7034 memcpy(winvarname, "w:", 2);
7035 memcpy(winvarname + 2, varname, varname_len + 1);
7036 set_var(winvarname, varname_len + 2, varp, true1);
7037 xfree(winvarname);
7038 }
7039 }
7040 if (need_switch_win) {
7041 restore_win(save_curwin, save_curtab, true1);
7042 }
7043 }
7044}
7045
7046/// "stdpath()" helper for list results
7047void get_xdg_var_list(const XDGVarType xdg, typval_T *rettv)
7048 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
7049{
7050 const void *iter = NULL((void*)0);
7051 list_T *const list = tv_list_alloc(kListLenShouldKnow);
7052 rettv->v_type = VAR_LIST;
7053 rettv->vval.v_list = list;
7054 tv_list_ref(list);
7055 char *const dirs = stdpaths_get_xdg_var(xdg);
7056 if (dirs == NULL((void*)0)) {
7057 return;
7058 }
7059 do {
7060 size_t dir_len;
7061 const char *dir;
7062 iter = vim_env_iter(ENV_SEPCHAR':', dirs, iter, &dir, &dir_len);
7063 if (dir != NULL((void*)0) && dir_len > 0) {
7064 char *dir_with_nvim = xmemdupz(dir, dir_len);
7065 dir_with_nvim = concat_fnames_realloc(dir_with_nvim, "nvim", true1);
7066 tv_list_append_string(list, dir_with_nvim, strlen(dir_with_nvim));
7067 xfree(dir_with_nvim);
7068 }
7069 } while (iter != NULL((void*)0));
7070 xfree(dirs);
7071}
7072
7073static list_T *string_to_list(const char *str, size_t len, const bool_Bool keepempty)
7074{
7075 if (!keepempty && str[len - 1] == NL'\012') {
7076 len--;
7077 }
7078 list_T *const list = tv_list_alloc(kListLenMayKnow);
7079 encode_list_write(list, str, len);
7080 return list;
7081}
7082
7083// os_system wrapper. Handles 'verbose', :profile, and v:shell_error.
7084void get_system_output_as_rettv(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv,
7085 bool_Bool retlist)
7086{
7087 proftime_T wait_time;
7088 bool_Bool profiling = do_profiling == PROF_YES1;
7089
7090 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
7091 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
7092
7093 if (check_secure()) {
7094 return;
7095 }
7096
7097 // get input to the shell command (if any), and its length
7098 ptrdiff_t input_len;
7099 char *input = save_tv_as_string(&argvars[1], &input_len, false0);
7100 if (input_len < 0) {
7101 assert(input == NULL)((void) sizeof ((input == ((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (input == ((void*)0)) ; else __assert_fail ("input == NULL"
, "../src/nvim/eval.c", 7101, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
); }));
7102 return;
7103 }
7104
7105 // get shell command to execute
7106 bool_Bool executable = true1;
7107 char **argv = tv_to_argv(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0), &executable);
7108 if (!argv) {
7109 if (!executable) {
7110 set_vim_var_nr(VV_SHELL_ERROR, (long)-1);
7111 }
7112 xfree(input);
7113 return; // Already did emsg.
7114 }
7115
7116 if (p_verbose > 3) {
7117 char *cmdstr = shell_argv_to_str(argv);
7118 verbose_enter_scroll();
7119 smsg(_("Executing command: \"%s\"")gettext((char *)("Executing command: \"%s\"")), cmdstr);
7120 msg_puts("\n\n");
7121 verbose_leave_scroll();
7122 xfree(cmdstr);
7123 }
7124
7125 if (profiling) {
7126 prof_child_enter(&wait_time);
7127 }
7128
7129 // execute the command
7130 size_t nread = 0;
7131 char *res = NULL((void*)0);
7132 int status = os_system(argv, input, input_len, &res, &nread);
7133
7134 if (profiling) {
7135 prof_child_exit(&wait_time);
7136 }
7137
7138 xfree(input);
7139
7140 set_vim_var_nr(VV_SHELL_ERROR, (long) status);
7141
7142 if (res == NULL((void*)0)) {
7143 if (retlist) {
7144 // return an empty list when there's no output
7145 tv_list_alloc_ret(rettv, 0);
7146 } else {
7147 rettv->vval.v_string = (char_u *) xstrdup("");
7148 }
7149 return;
7150 }
7151
7152 if (retlist) {
7153 int keepempty = 0;
7154 if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN && argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN) {
7155 keepempty = tv_get_number(&argvars[2]);
7156 }
7157 rettv->vval.v_list = string_to_list(res, nread, (bool_Bool)keepempty);
7158 tv_list_ref(rettv->vval.v_list);
7159 rettv->v_type = VAR_LIST;
7160
7161 xfree(res);
7162 } else {
7163 // res may contain several NULs before the final terminating one.
7164 // Replace them with SOH (1) like in get_cmd_output() to avoid truncation.
7165 memchrsub(res, NUL'\000', 1, nread);
7166#ifdef USE_CRNL
7167 // translate <CR><NL> into <NL>
7168 char *d = res;
7169 for (char *s = res; *s; ++s) {
7170 if (s[0] == CAR'\015' && s[1] == NL'\012') {
7171 ++s;
7172 }
7173
7174 *d++ = *s;
7175 }
7176
7177 *d = NUL'\000';
7178#endif
7179 rettv->vval.v_string = (char_u *) res;
7180 }
7181}
7182
7183bool_Bool callback_from_typval(Callback *const callback, typval_T *const arg)
7184 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
7185{
7186 int r = OK1;
7187
7188 if (arg->v_type == VAR_PARTIAL && arg->vval.v_partial != NULL((void*)0)) {
1
Assuming field 'v_type' is not equal to VAR_PARTIAL
→
7189 callback->data.partial = arg->vval.v_partial;
7190 callback->data.partial->pt_refcount++;
7191 callback->type = kCallbackPartial;
7192 } else if (arg->v_type == VAR_STRING
2
←
Assuming field 'v_type' is equal to VAR_STRING
→
7193 && arg->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)
3
←
Assuming field 'v_string' is equal to NULL
→
7194 && ascii_isdigit(*arg->vval.v_string)) {
7195 r = FAIL0;
7196 } else if (arg->v_type
3.1
Field 'v_type' is not equal to VAR_FUNC
 == VAR_FUNC || arg->v_type
3.2
Field 'v_type' is equal to VAR_STRING
 == VAR_STRING) {
4
←
Taking true branch
→
7197 char_u *name = arg->vval.v_string;
5
←
'name' initialized to a null pointer value
→
7198 func_ref(name);
7199 callback->data.funcref = vim_strsave(name);
6
←
Null pointer passed to 1st parameter expecting 'nonnull'
7200 callback->type = kCallbackFuncref;
7201 } else if (nlua_is_table_from_lua(arg)) {
7202 char_u *name = nlua_register_table_as_callable(arg);
7203
7204 if (name != NULL((void*)0)) {
7205 callback->data.funcref = vim_strsave(name);
7206 callback->type = kCallbackFuncref;
7207 } else {
7208 r = FAIL0;
7209 }
7210 } else if (arg->v_type == VAR_NUMBER && arg->vval.v_number == 0) {
7211 callback->type = kCallbackNone;
7212 } else {
7213 r = FAIL0;
7214 }
7215
7216 if (r == FAIL0) {
7217 EMSG(_("E921: Invalid callback argument"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E921: Invalid callback argument"
))));
7218 return false0;
7219 }
7220 return true1;
7221}
7222
7223bool_Bool callback_call(Callback *const callback, const int argcount_in,
7224 typval_T *const argvars_in, typval_T *const rettv)
7225 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
7226{
7227 partial_T *partial;
7228 char_u *name;
7229 switch (callback->type) {
7230 case kCallbackFuncref:
7231 name = callback->data.funcref;
7232 partial = NULL((void*)0);
7233 break;
7234
7235 case kCallbackPartial:
7236 partial = callback->data.partial;
7237 name = partial_name(partial);
7238 break;
7239
7240 case kCallbackNone:
7241 return false0;
7242 break;
7243
7244 default:
7245 abort();
7246 }
7247
7248 int dummy;
7249 return call_func(name, -1, rettv, argcount_in, argvars_in,
7250 NULL((void*)0), curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.lnum, &dummy,
7251 true1, partial, NULL((void*)0));
7252}
7253
7254static bool_Bool set_ref_in_callback(Callback *callback, int copyID,
7255 ht_stack_T **ht_stack,
7256 list_stack_T **list_stack)
7257{
7258 typval_T tv;
7259 switch (callback->type) {
7260 case kCallbackFuncref:
7261 case kCallbackNone:
7262 break;
7263
7264 case kCallbackPartial:
7265 tv.v_type = VAR_PARTIAL;
7266 tv.vval.v_partial = callback->data.partial;
7267 return set_ref_in_item(&tv, copyID, ht_stack, list_stack);
7268 break;
7269
7270
7271 default:
7272 abort();
7273 }
7274 return false0;
7275}
7276
7277static bool_Bool set_ref_in_callback_reader(CallbackReader *reader, int copyID,
7278 ht_stack_T **ht_stack,
7279 list_stack_T **list_stack)
7280{
7281 if (set_ref_in_callback(&reader->cb, copyID, ht_stack, list_stack)) {
7282 return true1;
7283 }
7284
7285 if (reader->self) {
7286 typval_T tv;
7287 tv.v_type = VAR_DICT;
7288 tv.vval.v_dict = reader->self;
7289 return set_ref_in_item(&tv, copyID, ht_stack, list_stack);
7290 }
7291 return false0;
7292}
7293
7294timer_T *find_timer_by_nr(varnumber_T xx)
7295{
7296 return pmap_get(uint64_t)map_uint64_t_ptr_t_get(timers, xx);
7297}
7298
7299void add_timer_info(typval_T *rettv, timer_T *timer)
7300{
7301 list_T *list = rettv->vval.v_list;
7302 dict_T *dict = tv_dict_alloc();
7303
7304 tv_list_append_dict(list, dict);
7305 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("id")("id"), (sizeof("id") - 1), timer->timer_id);
7306 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("time")("time"), (sizeof("time") - 1), timer->timeout);
7307 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("paused")("paused"), (sizeof("paused") - 1), timer->paused);
7308
7309 tv_dict_add_nr(dict, S_LEN("repeat")("repeat"), (sizeof("repeat") - 1),
7310 (timer->repeat_count < 0 ? -1 : timer->repeat_count));
7311
7312 dictitem_T *di = tv_dict_item_alloc("callback");
7313 if (tv_dict_add(dict, di) == FAIL0) {
7314 xfree(di);
7315 return;
7316 }
7317
7318 if (timer->callback.type == kCallbackPartial) {
7319 di->di_tv.v_type = VAR_PARTIAL;
7320 di->di_tv.vval.v_partial = timer->callback.data.partial;
7321 timer->callback.data.partial->pt_refcount++;
7322 } else if (timer->callback.type == kCallbackFuncref) {
7323 di->di_tv.v_type = VAR_FUNC;
7324 di->di_tv.vval.v_string = vim_strsave(timer->callback.data.funcref);
7325 }
7326}
7327
7328void add_timer_info_all(typval_T *rettv)
7329{
7330 tv_list_alloc_ret(rettv, timers->table->n_occupied);
7331 timer_T *timer;
7332 map_foreach_value(timers, timer, {{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((timers->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((timers->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (timer) = ((timers->table)->vals[__i]); { if
(!timer->stopped) { add_timer_info(rettv, timer); } }; } }
7333 if (!timer->stopped) {{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((timers->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((timers->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (timer) = ((timers->table)->vals[__i]); { if
(!timer->stopped) { add_timer_info(rettv, timer); } }; } }
7334 add_timer_info(rettv, timer);{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((timers->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((timers->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (timer) = ((timers->table)->vals[__i]); { if
(!timer->stopped) { add_timer_info(rettv, timer); } }; } }
7335 }{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((timers->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((timers->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (timer) = ((timers->table)->vals[__i]); { if
(!timer->stopped) { add_timer_info(rettv, timer); } }; } }
7336 }){ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((timers->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((timers->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (timer) = ((timers->table)->vals[__i]); { if
(!timer->stopped) { add_timer_info(rettv, timer); } }; } }
7337}
7338
7339// invoked on the main loop
7340void timer_due_cb(TimeWatcher *tw, void *data)
7341{
7342 timer_T *timer = (timer_T *)data;
7343 int save_did_emsg = did_emsg;
7344 int save_called_emsg = called_emsg;
7345 const bool_Bool save_ex_pressedreturn = get_pressedreturn();
7346
7347 if (timer->stopped || timer->paused) {
7348 return;
7349 }
7350
7351 timer->refcount++;
7352 // if repeat was negative repeat forever
7353 if (timer->repeat_count >= 0 && --timer->repeat_count == 0) {
7354 timer_stop(timer);
7355 }
7356
7357 typval_T argv[2] = { TV_INITIAL_VALUE((typval_T) { .v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN, .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED, }
), TV_INITIAL_VALUE((typval_T) { .v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN, .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED, }
) };
7358 argv[0].v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
7359 argv[0].vval.v_number = timer->timer_id;
7360 typval_T rettv = TV_INITIAL_VALUE((typval_T) { .v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN, .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED, }
);
7361 called_emsg = false0;
7362
7363 callback_call(&timer->callback, 1, argv, &rettv);
7364
7365 // Handle error message
7366 if (called_emsg && did_emsg) {
7367 timer->emsg_count++;
7368 if (current_exception != NULL((void*)0)) {
7369 discard_current_exception();
7370 }
7371 }
7372 did_emsg = save_did_emsg;
7373 called_emsg = save_called_emsg;
7374 set_pressedreturn(save_ex_pressedreturn);
7375
7376 if (timer->emsg_count >= 3) {
7377 timer_stop(timer);
7378 }
7379
7380 tv_clear(&rettv);
7381
7382 if (!timer->stopped && timer->timeout == 0) {
7383 // special case: timeout=0 means the callback will be
7384 // invoked again on the next event loop tick.
7385 // we don't use uv_idle_t to not spin the event loop
7386 // when the main loop is blocked.
7387 time_watcher_start(&timer->tw, timer_due_cb, 0, 0);
7388 }
7389 timer_decref(timer);
7390}
7391
7392uint64_t timer_start(const long timeout,
7393 const int repeat_count,
7394 const Callback *const callback)
7395{
7396 timer_T *timer = xmalloc(sizeof *timer);
7397 timer->refcount = 1;
7398 timer->stopped = false0;
7399 timer->paused = false0;
7400 timer->emsg_count = 0;
7401 timer->repeat_count = repeat_count;
7402 timer->timeout = timeout;
7403 timer->timer_id = last_timer_id++;
7404 timer->callback = *callback;
7405
7406 time_watcher_init(&main_loop, &timer->tw, timer);
7407 timer->tw.events = multiqueue_new_child(main_loop.events);
7408 // if main loop is blocked, don't queue up multiple events
7409 timer->tw.blockable = true1;
7410 time_watcher_start(&timer->tw, timer_due_cb, timeout, timeout);
7411
7412 pmap_put(uint64_t)map_uint64_t_ptr_t_put(timers, timer->timer_id, timer);
7413 return timer->timer_id;
7414}
7415
7416void timer_stop(timer_T *timer)
7417{
7418 if (timer->stopped) {
7419 // avoid double free
7420 return;
7421 }
7422 timer->stopped = true1;
7423 time_watcher_stop(&timer->tw);
7424 time_watcher_close(&timer->tw, timer_close_cb);
7425}
7426
7427// This will be run on the main loop after the last timer_due_cb, so at this
7428// point it is safe to free the callback.
7429static void timer_close_cb(TimeWatcher *tw, void *data)
7430{
7431 timer_T *timer = (timer_T *)data;
7432 multiqueue_free(timer->tw.events);
7433 callback_free(&timer->callback);
7434 pmap_del(uint64_t)map_uint64_t_ptr_t_del(timers, timer->timer_id);
7435 timer_decref(timer);
7436}
7437
7438static void timer_decref(timer_T *timer)
7439{
7440 if (--timer->refcount == 0) {
7441 xfree(timer);
7442 }
7443}
7444
7445void timer_stop_all(void)
7446{
7447 timer_T *timer;
7448 map_foreach_value(timers, timer, {{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((timers->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((timers->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (timer) = ((timers->table)->vals[__i]); { timer_stop
(timer); }; } }
7449 timer_stop(timer);{ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((timers->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((timers->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (timer) = ((timers->table)->vals[__i]); { timer_stop
(timer); }; } }
7450 }){ khint_t __i; for (__i = (khint_t)(0); __i != ((timers->table
)->n_buckets); ++__i) { if (!(!(((timers->table)->flags
[(__i)>>4]>>(((__i)&0xfU)<<1))&3)))
continue; (timer) = ((timers->table)->vals[__i]); { timer_stop
(timer); }; } }
7451}
7452
7453void timer_teardown(void)
7454{
7455 timer_stop_all();
7456}
7457
7458/// Write "list" of strings to file "fd".
7459///
7460/// @param fp File to write to.
7461/// @param[in] list List to write.
7462/// @param[in] binary Whether to write in binary mode.
7463///
7464/// @return true in case of success, false otherwise.
7465bool_Bool write_list(FileDescriptor *const fp, const list_T *const list,
7466 const bool_Bool binary)
7467 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(1)
7468{
7469 int error = 0;
7470 TV_LIST_ITER_CONST(list, li, {do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { const char *const s = tv_get_string_chk
((&(li)->li_tv)); if (s == ((void*)0)) { return 0; } const
char *hunk_start = s; for (const char *p = hunk_start;; p++)
{ if (*p == '\000' || *p == '\012') { if (p != hunk_start) {
const ptrdiff_t written = file_write(fp, hunk_start, (size_t
)(p - hunk_start)); if (written < 0) { error = (int)written
; goto write_list_error; } } if (*p == '\000') { break; } else
{ hunk_start = p + 1; const ptrdiff_t written = file_write(fp
, (char[]){ '\000' }, 1); if (written < 0) { error = (int)
written; break; } } } } if (!binary || ((li)->li_next) != (
(void*)0)) { const ptrdiff_t written = file_write(fp, "\n", 1
); if (written < 0) { error = (int)written; goto write_list_error
; } } } } } } while (0)
7471 const char *const s = tv_get_string_chk(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li));do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { const char *const s = tv_get_string_chk
((&(li)->li_tv)); if (s == ((void*)0)) { return 0; } const
char *hunk_start = s; for (const char *p = hunk_start;; p++)
{ if (*p == '\000' || *p == '\012') { if (p != hunk_start) {
const ptrdiff_t written = file_write(fp, hunk_start, (size_t
)(p - hunk_start)); if (written < 0) { error = (int)written
; goto write_list_error; } } if (*p == '\000') { break; } else
{ hunk_start = p + 1; const ptrdiff_t written = file_write(fp
, (char[]){ '\000' }, 1); if (written < 0) { error = (int)
written; break; } } } } if (!binary || ((li)->li_next) != (
(void*)0)) { const ptrdiff_t written = file_write(fp, "\n", 1
); if (written < 0) { error = (int)written; goto write_list_error
; } } } } } } while (0)

written; break; } } } } if (!binary || ((li)->li_next) != (
(void*)0)) { const ptrdiff_t written = file_write(fp, "\n", 1

; } } } } } } while (0)

; goto write_list_error; } } if (*p == '\000') { break; } else

(void*)0)) { const ptrdiff_t written = file_write(fp, "\n", 1

((&(li)->li_tv)); if (s == ((void*)0)) { return 0; } const

; goto write_list_error; } } if (*p == '\000') { break; } else

written; break; } } } } if (!binary || ((li)->li_next) != (
(void*)0)) { const ptrdiff_t written = file_write(fp, "\n", 1
); if (written < 0) { error = (int)written; goto write_list_error
; } } } } } } while (0);
7506 if ((error = file_flush(fp)) != 0) {
7507 goto write_list_error;
7508 }
7509 return true1;
7510write_list_error:
7511 emsgf(_("E80: Error while writing: %s")gettext((char *)("E80: Error while writing: %s")), os_strerroruv_strerror(error));
7512 return false0;
7513}
7514
7515/// Saves a typval_T as a string.
7516///
7517/// For lists or buffers, replaces NLs with NUL and separates items with NLs.
7518///
7519/// @param[in] tv Value to store as a string.
7520/// @param[out] len Length of the resulting string or -1 on error.
7521/// @param[in] endnl If true, the output will end in a newline (if a list).
7522/// @returns an allocated string if `tv` represents a VimL string, list, or
7523/// number; NULL otherwise.
7524char *save_tv_as_string(typval_T *tv, ptrdiff_t *const len, bool_Bool endnl)
7525 FUNC_ATTR_MALLOC FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
7526{
7527 *len = 0;
7528 if (tv->v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN) {
7529 return NULL((void*)0);
7530 }
7531
7532 // For other types, let tv_get_string_buf_chk() get the value or
7533 // print an error.
7534 if (tv->v_type != VAR_LIST && tv->v_type != VAR_NUMBER) {
7535 const char *ret = tv_get_string_chk(tv);
7536 if (ret) {
7537 *len = strlen(ret);
7538 return xmemdupz(ret, (size_t)(*len));
7539 } else {
7540 *len = -1;
7541 return NULL((void*)0);
7542 }
7543 }
7544
7545 if (tv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER) { // Treat number as a buffer-id.
7546 buf_T *buf = buflist_findnr(tv->vval.v_number);
7547 if (buf) {
7548 for (linenr_T lnum = 1; lnum <= buf->b_ml.ml_line_count; lnum++) {
7549 for (char_u *p = ml_get_buf(buf, lnum, false0); *p != NUL'\000'; p++) {
7550 *len += 1;
7551 }
7552 *len += 1;
7553 }
7554 } else {
7555 EMSGN(_(e_nobufnr), tv->vval.v_number)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_nobufnr))), (int64_t
)(tv->vval.v_number));
7556 *len = -1;
7557 return NULL((void*)0);
7558 }
7559
7560 if (*len == 0) {
7561 return NULL((void*)0);
7562 }
7563
7564 char *ret = xmalloc(*len + 1);
7565 char *end = ret;
7566 for (linenr_T lnum = 1; lnum <= buf->b_ml.ml_line_count; lnum++) {
7567 for (char_u *p = ml_get_buf(buf, lnum, false0); *p != NUL'\000'; p++) {
7568 *end++ = (*p == '\n') ? NUL'\000' : *p;
7569 }
7570 *end++ = '\n';
7571 }
7572 *end = NUL'\000';
7573 *len = end - ret;
7574 return ret;
7575 }
7576
7577 assert(tv->v_type == VAR_LIST)((void) sizeof ((tv->v_type == VAR_LIST) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (tv->v_type == VAR_LIST) ; else __assert_fail ("tv->v_type == VAR_LIST"
, "../src/nvim/eval.c", 7577, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
); }));
7578 // Pre-calculate the resulting length.
7579 list_T *list = tv->vval.v_list;
7580 TV_LIST_ITER_CONST(list, li, {do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { *len += strlen(tv_get_string((&
(li)->li_tv))) + 1; } } } } while (0)
7581 *len += strlen(tv_get_string(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li))) + 1;do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { *len += strlen(tv_get_string((&
(li)->li_tv))) + 1; } } } } while (0)
7582 })do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { *len += strlen(tv_get_string((&
(li)->li_tv))) + 1; } } } } while (0);
7583
7584 if (*len == 0) {
7585 return NULL((void*)0);
7586 }
7587
7588 char *ret = xmalloc(*len + endnl);
7589 char *end = ret;
7590 TV_LIST_ITER_CONST(list, li, {do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { for (const char *s = tv_get_string
((&(li)->li_tv)); *s != '\000'; s++) { *end++ = (*s ==
'\n') ? '\000' : *s; } if (endnl || ((li)->li_next) != ((
void*)0)) { *end++ = '\n'; } } } } } while (0)
7591 for (const char *s = tv_get_string(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)); *s != NUL; s++) {do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { for (const char *s = tv_get_string
((&(li)->li_tv)); *s != '\000'; s++) { *end++ = (*s ==
'\n') ? '\000' : *s; } if (endnl || ((li)->li_next) != ((
void*)0)) { *end++ = '\n'; } } } } } while (0)
7592 *end++ = (*s == '\n') ? NUL : *s;do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { for (const char *s = tv_get_string
((&(li)->li_tv)); *s != '\000'; s++) { *end++ = (*s ==
'\n') ? '\000' : *s; } if (endnl || ((li)->li_next) != ((
void*)0)) { *end++ = '\n'; } } } } } while (0)
7593 }do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { for (const char *s = tv_get_string
((&(li)->li_tv)); *s != '\000'; s++) { *end++ = (*s ==
'\n') ? '\000' : *s; } if (endnl || ((li)->li_next) != ((
void*)0)) { *end++ = '\n'; } } } } } while (0)
7594 if (endnl || TV_LIST_ITEM_NEXT(list, li) != NULL) {do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { for (const char *s = tv_get_string
((&(li)->li_tv)); *s != '\000'; s++) { *end++ = (*s ==
'\n') ? '\000' : *s; } if (endnl || ((li)->li_next) != ((
void*)0)) { *end++ = '\n'; } } } } } while (0)
7595 *end++ = '\n';do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { for (const char *s = tv_get_string
((&(li)->li_tv)); *s != '\000'; s++) { *end++ = (*s ==
'\n') ? '\000' : *s; } if (endnl || ((li)->li_next) != ((
void*)0)) { *end++ = '\n'; } } } } } while (0)
7596 }do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { for (const char *s = tv_get_string
((&(li)->li_tv)); *s != '\000'; s++) { *end++ = (*s ==
'\n') ? '\000' : *s; } if (endnl || ((li)->li_next) != ((
void*)0)) { *end++ = '\n'; } } } } } while (0)
7597 })do { const list_T *const l_ = (list); ; if (l_ != ((void*)0))
{ for (const listitem_T *li = l_->lv_first; li != ((void*
)0); li = li->li_next) { { for (const char *s = tv_get_string
((&(li)->li_tv)); *s != '\000'; s++) { *end++ = (*s ==
'\n') ? '\000' : *s; } if (endnl || ((li)->li_next) != ((
void*)0)) { *end++ = '\n'; } } } } } while (0);
7598 *end = NUL'\000';
7599 *len = end - ret;
7600 return ret;
7601}
7602
7603/// Translate a VimL object into a position
7604///
7605/// Accepts VAR_LIST and VAR_STRING objects. Does not give an error for invalid
7606/// type.
7607///
7608/// @param[in] tv Object to translate.
7609/// @param[in] dollar_lnum True when "$" is last line.
7610/// @param[out] ret_fnum Set to fnum for marks.
7611///
7612/// @return Pointer to position or NULL in case of error (e.g. invalid type).
7613pos_T *var2fpos(const typval_T *const tv, const int dollar_lnum,
7614 int *const ret_fnum)
7615 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
7616{
7617 static pos_T pos;
7618 pos_T *pp;
7619
7620 // Argument can be [lnum, col, coladd].
7621 if (tv->v_type == VAR_LIST) {
7622 list_T *l;
7623 int len;
7624 bool_Bool error = false0;
7625 listitem_T *li;
7626
7627 l = tv->vval.v_list;
7628 if (l == NULL((void*)0)) {
7629 return NULL((void*)0);
7630 }
7631
7632 // Get the line number.
7633 pos.lnum = tv_list_find_nr(l, 0L, &error);
7634 if (error || pos.lnum <= 0 || pos.lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count) {
7635 // Invalid line number.
7636 return NULL((void*)0);
7637 }
7638
7639 // Get the column number.
7640 pos.col = tv_list_find_nr(l, 1L, &error);
7641 if (error) {
7642 return NULL((void*)0);
7643 }
7644 len = (long)STRLEN(ml_get(pos.lnum))strlen((char *)(ml_get(pos.lnum)));
7645
7646 // We accept "$" for the column number: last column.
7647 li = tv_list_find(l, 1L);
7648 if (li != NULL((void*)0) && TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)(&(li)->li_tv)->v_type == VAR_STRING
7649 && TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)(&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)
7650 && STRCMP(TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(li)->vval.v_string, "$")strcmp((char *)((&(li)->li_tv)->vval.v_string), (char
*)("$")) == 0) {
7651 pos.col = len + 1;
7652 }
7653
7654 // Accept a position up to the NUL after the line.
7655 if (pos.col == 0 || (int)pos.col > len + 1) {
7656 // Invalid column number.
7657 return NULL((void*)0);
7658 }
7659 pos.col--;
7660
7661 // Get the virtual offset. Defaults to zero.
7662 pos.coladd = tv_list_find_nr(l, 2L, &error);
7663 if (error) {
7664 pos.coladd = 0;
7665 }
7666
7667 return &pos;
7668 }
7669
7670 const char *const name = tv_get_string_chk(tv);
7671 if (name == NULL((void*)0)) {
7672 return NULL((void*)0);
7673 }
7674 if (name[0] == '.') { // Cursor.
7675 return &curwin->w_cursor;
7676 }
7677 if (name[0] == 'v' && name[1] == NUL'\000') { // Visual start.
7678 if (VIsual_active) {
7679 return &VIsual;
7680 }
7681 return &curwin->w_cursor;
7682 }
7683 if (name[0] == '\'') { // Mark.
7684 pp = getmark_buf_fnum(curbuf, (uint8_t)name[1], false0, ret_fnum);
7685 if (pp == NULL((void*)0) || pp == (pos_T *)-1 || pp->lnum <= 0) {
7686 return NULL((void*)0);
7687 }
7688 return pp;
7689 }
7690
7691 pos.coladd = 0;
7692
7693 if (name[0] == 'w' && dollar_lnum) {
7694 pos.col = 0;
7695 if (name[1] == '0') { // "w0": first visible line
7696 update_topline(curwin);
7697 // In silent Ex mode topline is zero, but that's not a valid line
7698 // number; use one instead.
7699 pos.lnum = curwin->w_topline > 0 ? curwin->w_topline : 1;
7700 return &pos;
7701 } else if (name[1] == '$') { // "w$": last visible line
7702 validate_botline(curwin);
7703 // In silent Ex mode botline is zero, return zero then.
7704 pos.lnum = curwin->w_botline > 0 ? curwin->w_botline - 1 : 0;
7705 return &pos;
7706 }
7707 } else if (name[0] == '$') { // last column or line
7708 if (dollar_lnum) {
7709 pos.lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
7710 pos.col = 0;
7711 } else {
7712 pos.lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
7713 pos.col = (colnr_T)STRLEN(get_cursor_line_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_line_ptr()));
7714 }
7715 return &pos;
7716 }
7717 return NULL((void*)0);
7718}
7719
7720/*
7721 * Convert list in "arg" into a position and optional file number.
7722 * When "fnump" is NULL there is no file number, only 3 items.
7723 * Note that the column is passed on as-is, the caller may want to decrement
7724 * it to use 1 for the first column.
7725 * Return FAIL when conversion is not possible, doesn't check the position for
7726 * validity.
7727 */
7728int list2fpos(typval_T *arg, pos_T *posp, int *fnump, colnr_T *curswantp)
7729{
7730 list_T *l;
7731 long i = 0;
7732 long n;
7733
7734 // List must be: [fnum, lnum, col, coladd, curswant], where "fnum" is only
7735 // there when "fnump" isn't NULL; "coladd" and "curswant" are optional.
7736 if (arg->v_type != VAR_LIST
7737 || (l = arg->vval.v_list) == NULL((void*)0)
7738 || tv_list_len(l) < (fnump == NULL((void*)0) ? 2 : 3)
7739 || tv_list_len(l) > (fnump == NULL((void*)0) ? 4 : 5)) {
7740 return FAIL0;
7741 }
7742
7743 if (fnump != NULL((void*)0)) {
7744 n = tv_list_find_nr(l, i++, NULL((void*)0)); // fnum
7745 if (n < 0) {
7746 return FAIL0;
7747 }
7748 if (n == 0) {
7749 n = curbuf->b_fnumhandle; // Current buffer.
7750 }
7751 *fnump = n;
7752 }
7753
7754 n = tv_list_find_nr(l, i++, NULL((void*)0)); // lnum
7755 if (n < 0) {
7756 return FAIL0;
7757 }
7758 posp->lnum = n;
7759
7760 n = tv_list_find_nr(l, i++, NULL((void*)0)); // col
7761 if (n < 0) {
7762 return FAIL0;
7763 }
7764 posp->col = n;
7765
7766 n = tv_list_find_nr(l, i, NULL((void*)0)); // off
7767 if (n < 0) {
7768 posp->coladd = 0;
7769 } else {
7770 posp->coladd = n;
7771 }
7772
7773 if (curswantp != NULL((void*)0)) {
7774 *curswantp = tv_list_find_nr(l, i + 1, NULL((void*)0)); // curswant
7775 }
7776
7777 return OK1;
7778}
7779
7780/*
7781 * Get the length of an environment variable name.
7782 * Advance "arg" to the first character after the name.
7783 * Return 0 for error.
7784 */
7785static int get_env_len(const char_u **arg)
7786{
7787 int len;
7788
7789 const char_u *p;
7790 for (p = *arg; vim_isIDc(*p); p++) {
7791 }
7792 if (p == *arg) { // No name found.
7793 return 0;
7794 }
7795
7796 len = (int)(p - *arg);
7797 *arg = p;
7798 return len;
7799}
7800
7801// Get the length of the name of a function or internal variable.
7802// "arg" is advanced to the first non-white character after the name.
7803// Return 0 if something is wrong.
7804int get_id_len(const char **const arg)
7805{
7806 int len;
7807
7808 // Find the end of the name.
7809 const char *p;
7810 for (p = *arg; eval_isnamec(*p); p++) {
7811 if (*p == ':') {
7812 // "s:" is start of "s:var", but "n:" is not and can be used in
7813 // slice "[n:]". Also "xx:" is not a namespace.
7814 len = (int)(p - *arg);
7815 if (len > 1
7816 || (len == 1 && vim_strchr(namespace_char, **arg) == NULL((void*)0))) {
7817 break;
7818 }
7819 }
7820 }
7821 if (p == *arg) { // no name found
7822 return 0;
7823 }
7824
7825 len = (int)(p - *arg);
7826 *arg = (const char *)skipwhite((const char_u *)p);
7827
7828 return len;
7829}
7830
7831/*
7832 * Get the length of the name of a variable or function.
7833 * Only the name is recognized, does not handle ".key" or "[idx]".
7834 * "arg" is advanced to the first non-white character after the name.
7835 * Return -1 if curly braces expansion failed.
7836 * Return 0 if something else is wrong.
7837 * If the name contains 'magic' {}'s, expand them and return the
7838 * expanded name in an allocated string via 'alias' - caller must free.
7839 */
7840int get_name_len(const char **const arg,
7841 char **alias,
7842 bool_Bool evaluate,
7843 bool_Bool verbose)
7844{
7845 int len;
7846
7847 *alias = NULL((void*)0); // default to no alias
7848
7849 if ((*arg)[0] == (char)K_SPECIAL(0x80) && (*arg)[1] == (char)KS_EXTRA253
7850 && (*arg)[2] == (char)KE_SNR) {
7851 // Hard coded <SNR>, already translated.
7852 *arg += 3;
7853 return get_id_len(arg) + 3;
7854 }
7855 len = eval_fname_script(*arg);
7856 if (len > 0) {
7857 // literal "<SID>", "s:" or "<SNR>"
7858 *arg += len;
7859 }
7860
7861 // Find the end of the name; check for {} construction.
7862 char_u *expr_start;
7863 char_u *expr_end;
7864 const char *p = (const char *)find_name_end((char_u *)(*arg),
7865 (const char_u **)&expr_start,
7866 (const char_u **)&expr_end,
7867 len > 0 ? 0 : FNE_CHECK_START2);
7868 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
7869 if (!evaluate) {
7870 len += (int)(p - *arg);
7871 *arg = (const char *)skipwhite((const char_u *)p);
7872 return len;
7873 }
7874
7875 /*
7876 * Include any <SID> etc in the expanded string:
7877 * Thus the -len here.
7878 */
7879 char_u *temp_string = make_expanded_name((char_u *)(*arg) - len, expr_start,
7880 expr_end, (char_u *)p);
7881 if (temp_string == NULL((void*)0)) {
7882 return -1;
7883 }
7884 *alias = (char *)temp_string;
7885 *arg = (const char *)skipwhite((const char_u *)p);
7886 return (int)STRLEN(temp_string)strlen((char *)(temp_string));
7887 }
7888
7889 len += get_id_len(arg);
7890 // Only give an error when there is something, otherwise it will be
7891 // reported at a higher level.
7892 if (len == 0 && verbose && **arg != NUL'\000') {
7893 EMSG2(_(e_invexpr2), *arg)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2))), (*arg));
7894 }
7895
7896 return len;
7897}
7898
7899// Find the end of a variable or function name, taking care of magic braces.
7900// If "expr_start" is not NULL then "expr_start" and "expr_end" are set to the
7901// start and end of the first magic braces item.
7902// "flags" can have FNE_INCL_BR and FNE_CHECK_START.
7903// Return a pointer to just after the name. Equal to "arg" if there is no
7904// valid name.
7905const char_u *find_name_end(const char_u *arg, const char_u **expr_start,
7906 const char_u **expr_end, int flags)
7907{
7908 int mb_nest = 0;
7909 int br_nest = 0;
7910 int len;
7911
7912 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
7913 *expr_start = NULL((void*)0);
7914 *expr_end = NULL((void*)0);
7915 }
7916
7917 // Quick check for valid starting character.
7918 if ((flags & FNE_CHECK_START2) && !eval_isnamec1(*arg) && *arg != '{') {
7919 return arg;
7920 }
7921
7922 const char_u *p;
7923 for (p = arg; *p != NUL'\000'
7924 && (eval_isnamec(*p)
7925 || *p == '{'
7926 || ((flags & FNE_INCL_BR1) && (*p == '[' || *p == '.'))
7927 || mb_nest != 0
7928 || br_nest != 0); MB_PTR_ADV(p)(p += utfc_ptr2len((char_u *)p))) {
7929 if (*p == '\'') {
7930 // skip over 'string' to avoid counting [ and ] inside it.
7931 for (p = p + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '\''; MB_PTR_ADV(p)(p += utfc_ptr2len((char_u *)p))) {
7932 }
7933 if (*p == NUL'\000') {
7934 break;
7935 }
7936 } else if (*p == '"') {
7937 // skip over "str\"ing" to avoid counting [ and ] inside it.
7938 for (p = p + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '"'; MB_PTR_ADV(p)(p += utfc_ptr2len((char_u *)p))) {
7939 if (*p == '\\' && p[1] != NUL'\000') {
7940 ++p;
7941 }
7942 }
7943 if (*p == NUL'\000') {
7944 break;
7945 }
7946 } else if (br_nest == 0 && mb_nest == 0 && *p == ':') {
7947 // "s:" is start of "s:var", but "n:" is not and can be used in
7948 // slice "[n:]". Also "xx:" is not a namespace. But {ns}: is. */
7949 len = (int)(p - arg);
7950 if ((len > 1 && p[-1] != '}')
7951 || (len == 1 && vim_strchr(namespace_char, *arg) == NULL((void*)0))) {
7952 break;
7953 }
7954 }
7955
7956 if (mb_nest == 0) {
7957 if (*p == '[') {
7958 ++br_nest;
7959 } else if (*p == ']') {
7960 --br_nest;
7961 }
7962 }
7963
7964 if (br_nest == 0) {
7965 if (*p == '{') {
7966 mb_nest++;
7967 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0) && *expr_start == NULL((void*)0)) {
7968 *expr_start = p;
7969 }
7970 } else if (*p == '}') {
7971 mb_nest--;
7972 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0) && mb_nest == 0 && *expr_end == NULL((void*)0)) {
7973 *expr_end = p;
7974 }
7975 }
7976 }
7977 }
7978
7979 return p;
7980}
7981
7982/*
7983 * Expands out the 'magic' {}'s in a variable/function name.
7984 * Note that this can call itself recursively, to deal with
7985 * constructs like foo{bar}{baz}{bam}
7986 * The four pointer arguments point to "foo{expre}ss{ion}bar"
7987 * "in_start" ^
7988 * "expr_start" ^
7989 * "expr_end" ^
7990 * "in_end" ^
7991 *
7992 * Returns a new allocated string, which the caller must free.
7993 * Returns NULL for failure.
7994 */
7995static char_u *make_expanded_name(const char_u *in_start, char_u *expr_start,
7996 char_u *expr_end, char_u *in_end)
7997{
7998 char_u c1;
7999 char_u *retval = NULL((void*)0);
8000 char_u *temp_result;
8001 char_u *nextcmd = NULL((void*)0);
8002
8003 if (expr_end == NULL((void*)0) || in_end == NULL((void*)0))
8004 return NULL((void*)0);
8005 *expr_start = NUL'\000';
8006 *expr_end = NUL'\000';
8007 c1 = *in_end;
8008 *in_end = NUL'\000';
8009
8010 temp_result = eval_to_string(expr_start + 1, &nextcmd, FALSE0);
8011 if (temp_result != NULL((void*)0) && nextcmd == NULL((void*)0)) {
8012 retval = xmalloc(STRLEN(temp_result)strlen((char *)(temp_result)) + (expr_start - in_start)
8013 + (in_end - expr_end) + 1);
8014 STRCPY(retval, in_start)strcpy((char *)(retval), (char *)(in_start));
8015 STRCAT(retval, temp_result)strcat((char *)(retval), (char *)(temp_result));
8016 STRCAT(retval, expr_end + 1)strcat((char *)(retval), (char *)(expr_end + 1));
8017 }
8018 xfree(temp_result);
8019
8020 *in_end = c1; // put char back for error messages
8021 *expr_start = '{';
8022 *expr_end = '}';
8023
8024 if (retval != NULL((void*)0)) {
8025 temp_result = (char_u *)find_name_end(retval,
8026 (const char_u **)&expr_start,
8027 (const char_u **)&expr_end, 0);
8028 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
8029 // Further expansion!
8030 temp_result = make_expanded_name(retval, expr_start,
8031 expr_end, temp_result);
8032 xfree(retval);
8033 retval = temp_result;
8034 }
8035 }
8036
8037 return retval;
8038}
8039
8040/*
8041 * Return TRUE if character "c" can be used in a variable or function name.
8042 * Does not include '{' or '}' for magic braces.
8043 */
8044int eval_isnamec(int c)
8045{
8046 return ASCII_ISALNUM(c)((((unsigned)(c) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(c) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(c) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(c) <= 'z'
)) || ascii_isdigit(c)) || c == '_' || c == ':' || c == AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#';
8047}
8048
8049/*
8050 * Return TRUE if character "c" can be used as the first character in a
8051 * variable or function name (excluding '{' and '}').
8052 */
8053int eval_isnamec1(int c)
8054{
8055 return ASCII_ISALPHA(c)(((unsigned)(c) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(c) <= 'Z')
|| ((unsigned)(c) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(c) <= 'z'
)) || c == '_';
8056}
8057
8058/*
8059 * Get number v: variable value.
8060 */
8061varnumber_T get_vim_var_nr(int idx) FUNC_ATTR_PURE
8062{
8063 return vimvars[idx].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number;
8064}
8065
8066// Get string v: variable value. Uses a static buffer, can only be used once.
8067// If the String variable has never been set, return an empty string.
8068// Never returns NULL;
8069char_u *get_vim_var_str(int idx) FUNC_ATTR_PURE FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
8070{
8071 return (char_u *)tv_get_string(&vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv);
8072}
8073
8074/*
8075 * Get List v: variable value. Caller must take care of reference count when
8076 * needed.
8077 */
8078list_T *get_vim_var_list(int idx) FUNC_ATTR_PURE
8079{
8080 return vimvars[idx].vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list;
8081}
8082
8083/// Get Dictionary v: variable value. Caller must take care of reference count
8084/// when needed.
8085dict_T *get_vim_var_dict(int idx) FUNC_ATTR_PURE
8086{
8087 return vimvars[idx].vv_dictvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_dict;
8088}
8089
8090/*
8091 * Set v:char to character "c".
8092 */
8093void set_vim_var_char(int c)
8094{
8095 char buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
8096
8097 buf[utf_char2bytes(c, (char_u *)buf)] = NUL'\000';
8098 set_vim_var_string(VV_CHAR, buf, -1);
8099}
8100
8101/*
8102 * Set v:count to "count" and v:count1 to "count1".
8103 * When "set_prevcount" is TRUE first set v:prevcount from v:count.
8104 */
8105void set_vcount(long count, long count1, int set_prevcount)
8106{
8107 if (set_prevcount)
8108 vimvars[VV_PREVCOUNT].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = vimvars[VV_COUNT].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number;
8109 vimvars[VV_COUNT].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = count;
8110 vimvars[VV_COUNT1].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = count1;
8111}
8112
8113/// Set number v: variable to the given value
8114///
8115/// @param[in] idx Index of variable to set.
8116/// @param[in] val Value to set to.
8117void set_vim_var_nr(const VimVarIndex idx, const varnumber_T val)
8118{
8119 tv_clear(&vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv);
8120 vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
8121 vimvars[idx].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = val;
8122}
8123
8124/// Set boolean v: {true, false} to the given value
8125///
8126/// @param[in] idx Index of variable to set.
8127/// @param[in] val Value to set to.
8128void set_vim_var_bool(const VimVarIndex idx, const BoolVarValue val)
8129{
8130 tv_clear(&vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv);
8131 vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_BOOL;
8132 vimvars[idx].vv_boolvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_bool = val;
8133}
8134
8135/// Set special v: variable to the given value
8136///
8137/// @param[in] idx Index of variable to set.
8138/// @param[in] val Value to set to.
8139void set_vim_var_special(const VimVarIndex idx, const SpecialVarValue val)
8140{
8141 tv_clear(&vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv);
8142 vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_SPECIAL;
8143 vimvars[idx].vv_specialvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_special = val;
8144}
8145
8146/// Set string v: variable to the given string
8147///
8148/// @param[in] idx Index of variable to set.
8149/// @param[in] val Value to set to. Will be copied.
8150/// @param[in] len Legth of that value or -1 in which case strlen() will be
8151/// used.
8152void set_vim_var_string(const VimVarIndex idx, const char *const val,
8153 const ptrdiff_t len)
8154{
8155 tv_clear(&vimvars[idx].vv_di.di_tv);
8156 vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING;
8157 if (val == NULL((void*)0)) {
8158 vimvars[idx].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
8159 } else if (len == -1) {
8160 vimvars[idx].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = (char_u *) xstrdup(val);
8161 } else {
8162 vimvars[idx].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = (char_u *) xstrndup(val, (size_t) len);
8163 }
8164}
8165
8166/// Set list v: variable to the given list
8167///
8168/// @param[in] idx Index of variable to set.
8169/// @param[in,out] val Value to set to. Reference count will be incremented.
8170void set_vim_var_list(const VimVarIndex idx, list_T *const val)
8171{
8172 tv_clear(&vimvars[idx].vv_di.di_tv);
8173 vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_LIST;
8174 vimvars[idx].vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list = val;
8175 if (val != NULL((void*)0)) {
8176 tv_list_ref(val);
8177 }
8178}
8179
8180/// Set Dictionary v: variable to the given dictionary
8181///
8182/// @param[in] idx Index of variable to set.
8183/// @param[in,out] val Value to set to. Reference count will be incremented.
8184/// Also keys of the dictionary will be made read-only.
8185void set_vim_var_dict(const VimVarIndex idx, dict_T *const val)
8186{
8187 tv_clear(&vimvars[idx].vv_di.di_tv);
8188 vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_DICT;
8189 vimvars[idx].vv_dictvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_dict = val;
8190
8191 if (val != NULL((void*)0)) {
8192 val->dv_refcount++;
8193 // Set readonly
8194 tv_dict_set_keys_readonly(val);
8195 }
8196}
8197
8198/// Set the v:argv list.
8199void set_argv_var(char **argv, int argc)
8200{
8201 list_T *l = tv_list_alloc(argc);
8202 int i;
8203
8204 tv_list_set_lock(l, VAR_FIXED);
8205 for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
8206 tv_list_append_string(l, (const char *const)argv[i], -1);
8207 TV_LIST_ITEM_TV(tv_list_last(l))(&(tv_list_last(l))->li_tv)->v_lock = VAR_FIXED;
8208 }
8209 set_vim_var_list(VV_ARGV, l);
8210}
8211
8212/*
8213 * Set v:register if needed.
8214 */
8215void set_reg_var(int c)
8216{
8217 char regname;
8218
8219 if (c == 0 || c == ' ') {
8220 regname = '"';
8221 } else {
8222 regname = c;
8223 }
8224 // Avoid free/alloc when the value is already right.
8225 if (vimvars[VV_REG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0) || vimvars[VV_REG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string[0] != c) {
8226 set_vim_var_string(VV_REG, &regname, 1);
8227 }
8228}
8229
8230/*
8231 * Get or set v:exception. If "oldval" == NULL, return the current value.
8232 * Otherwise, restore the value to "oldval" and return NULL.
8233 * Must always be called in pairs to save and restore v:exception! Does not
8234 * take care of memory allocations.
8235 */
8236char_u *v_exception(char_u *oldval)
8237{
8238 if (oldval == NULL((void*)0))
8239 return vimvars[VV_EXCEPTION].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string;
8240
8241 vimvars[VV_EXCEPTION].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = oldval;
8242 return NULL((void*)0);
8243}
8244
8245/*
8246 * Get or set v:throwpoint. If "oldval" == NULL, return the current value.
8247 * Otherwise, restore the value to "oldval" and return NULL.
8248 * Must always be called in pairs to save and restore v:throwpoint! Does not
8249 * take care of memory allocations.
8250 */
8251char_u *v_throwpoint(char_u *oldval)
8252{
8253 if (oldval == NULL((void*)0))
8254 return vimvars[VV_THROWPOINT].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string;
8255
8256 vimvars[VV_THROWPOINT].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = oldval;
8257 return NULL((void*)0);
8258}
8259
8260/*
8261 * Set v:cmdarg.
8262 * If "eap" != NULL, use "eap" to generate the value and return the old value.
8263 * If "oldarg" != NULL, restore the value to "oldarg" and return NULL.
8264 * Must always be called in pairs!
8265 */
8266char_u *set_cmdarg(exarg_T *eap, char_u *oldarg)
8267{
8268 char_u *oldval = vimvars[VV_CMDARG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string;
8269 if (eap == NULL((void*)0)) {
8270 xfree(oldval);
8271 vimvars[VV_CMDARG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = oldarg;
8272 return NULL((void*)0);
8273 }
8274
8275 size_t len = 0;
8276 if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_BIN1)
8277 len = 6;
8278 else if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_NOBIN2)
8279 len = 8;
8280
8281 if (eap->read_edit)
8282 len += 7;
8283
8284 if (eap->force_ff != 0) {
8285 len += 10; // " ++ff=unix"
8286 }
8287 if (eap->force_enc != 0) {
8288 len += STRLEN(eap->cmd + eap->force_enc)strlen((char *)(eap->cmd + eap->force_enc)) + 7;
8289 }
8290 if (eap->bad_char != 0) {
8291 len += 7 + 4; // " ++bad=" + "keep" or "drop"
8292 }
8293
8294 const size_t newval_len = len + 1;
8295 char_u *newval = xmalloc(newval_len);
8296
8297 if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_BIN1)
8298 sprintf((char *)newval, " ++bin");
8299 else if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_NOBIN2)
8300 sprintf((char *)newval, " ++nobin");
8301 else
8302 *newval = NUL'\000';
8303
8304 if (eap->read_edit)
8305 STRCAT(newval, " ++edit")strcat((char *)(newval), (char *)(" ++edit"));
8306
8307 if (eap->force_ff != 0) {
8308 snprintf((char *)newval + STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval)), newval_len, " ++ff=%s",
8309 eap->force_ff == 'u' ? "unix" :
8310 eap->force_ff == 'd' ? "dos" : "mac");
8311 }
8312 if (eap->force_enc != 0) {
8313 snprintf((char *)newval + STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval)), newval_len, " ++enc=%s",
8314 eap->cmd + eap->force_enc);
8315 }
8316 if (eap->bad_char == BAD_KEEP-1) {
8317 STRCPY(newval + STRLEN(newval), " ++bad=keep")strcpy((char *)(newval + strlen((char *)(newval))), (char *)(
" ++bad=keep"));
8318 } else if (eap->bad_char == BAD_DROP-2) {
8319 STRCPY(newval + STRLEN(newval), " ++bad=drop")strcpy((char *)(newval + strlen((char *)(newval))), (char *)(
" ++bad=drop"));
8320 } else if (eap->bad_char != 0) {
8321 snprintf((char *)newval + STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval)), newval_len, " ++bad=%c",
8322 eap->bad_char);
8323 }
8324 vimvars[VV_CMDARG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = newval;
8325 return oldval;
8326}
8327
8328// Get the value of internal variable "name".
8329// Return OK or FAIL. If OK is returned "rettv" must be cleared.
8330int get_var_tv(
8331 const char *name,
8332 int len, // length of "name"
8333 typval_T *rettv, // NULL when only checking existence
8334 dictitem_T **dip, // non-NULL when typval's dict item is needed
8335 int verbose, // may give error message
8336 int no_autoload // do not use script autoloading
8337)
8338{
8339 int ret = OK1;
8340 typval_T *tv = NULL((void*)0);
8341 dictitem_T *v;
8342
8343 v = find_var(name, (size_t)len, NULL((void*)0), no_autoload);
8344 if (v != NULL((void*)0)) {
8345 tv = &v->di_tv;
8346 if (dip != NULL((void*)0)) {
8347 *dip = v;
8348 }
8349 }
8350
8351 if (tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
8352 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0) && verbose) {
8353 emsgf(_("E121: Undefined variable: %.*s")gettext((char *)("E121: Undefined variable: %.*s")), len, name);
8354 }
8355 ret = FAIL0;
8356 } else if (rettv != NULL((void*)0)) {
8357 tv_copy(tv, rettv);
8358 }
8359
8360 return ret;
8361}
8362
8363/// Check if variable "name[len]" is a local variable or an argument.
8364/// If so, "*eval_lavars_used" is set to true.
8365static void check_vars(const char *name, size_t len)
8366{
8367 if (eval_lavars_used == NULL((void*)0)) {
8368 return;
8369 }
8370
8371 const char *varname;
8372 hashtab_T *ht = find_var_ht(name, len, &varname);
8373
8374 if (ht == get_funccal_local_ht() || ht == get_funccal_args_ht()) {
8375 if (find_var(name, len, NULL((void*)0), true1) != NULL((void*)0)) {
8376 *eval_lavars_used = true1;
8377 }
8378 }
8379}
8380
8381/// check if special v:lua value for calling lua functions
8382bool_Bool is_luafunc(partial_T *partial)
8383{
8384 return partial == vvlua_partial;
8385}
8386
8387/// check if special v:lua value for calling lua functions
8388static bool_Bool tv_is_luafunc(typval_T *tv)
8389{
8390 return tv->v_type == VAR_PARTIAL && is_luafunc(tv->vval.v_partial);
8391}
8392
8393/// check the function name after "v:lua."
8394int check_luafunc_name(const char *str, bool_Bool paren)
8395{
8396 const char *p = str;
8397 while (ASCII_ISALNUM(*p)((((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z')) || ascii_isdigit(*p)) || *p == '_' || *p == '.' || *p == '\'') {
8398 p++;
8399 }
8400 if (*p != (paren ? '(' : NUL'\000')) {
8401 return 0;
8402 } else {
8403 return (int)(p-str);
8404 }
8405}
8406
8407/// Handle expr[expr], expr[expr:expr] subscript and .name lookup.
8408/// Also handle function call with Funcref variable: func(expr)
8409/// Can all be combined: dict.func(expr)[idx]['func'](expr)
8410int
8411handle_subscript(
8412 const char **const arg,
8413 typval_T *rettv,
8414 int evaluate, // do more than finding the end
8415 int verbose // give error messages
8416)
8417{
8418 int ret = OK1;
8419 dict_T *selfdict = NULL((void*)0);
8420 const char_u *s;
8421 int len;
8422 typval_T functv;
8423 int slen = 0;
8424 bool_Bool lua = false0;
8425
8426 if (tv_is_luafunc(rettv)) {
8427 if (**arg != '.') {
8428 tv_clear(rettv);
8429 ret = FAIL0;
8430 } else {
8431 (*arg)++;
8432
8433 lua = true1;
8434 s = (char_u *)(*arg);
8435 slen = check_luafunc_name(*arg, true1);
8436 if (slen == 0) {
8437 tv_clear(rettv);
8438 ret = FAIL0;
8439 }
8440 (*arg) += slen;
8441 }
8442 }
8443
8444
8445 while (ret == OK1
8446 && (**arg == '['
8447 || (**arg == '.' && rettv->v_type == VAR_DICT)
8448 || (**arg == '(' && (!evaluate || tv_is_func(*rettv))))
8449 && !ascii_iswhite(*(*arg - 1))) {
8450 if (**arg == '(') {
8451 partial_T *pt = NULL((void*)0);
8452 // need to copy the funcref so that we can clear rettv
8453 if (evaluate) {
8454 functv = *rettv;
8455 rettv->v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
8456
8457 // Invoke the function. Recursive!
8458 if (functv.v_type == VAR_PARTIAL) {
8459 pt = functv.vval.v_partial;
8460 if (!lua) {
8461 s = partial_name(pt);
8462 }
8463 } else {
8464 s = functv.vval.v_string;
8465 }
8466 } else {
8467 s = (char_u *)"";
8468 }
8469 ret = get_func_tv(s, lua ? slen : -1, rettv, (char_u **)arg,
8470 curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
8471 &len, evaluate, pt, selfdict);
8472
8473 // Clear the funcref afterwards, so that deleting it while
8474 // evaluating the arguments is possible (see test55).
8475 if (evaluate) {
8476 tv_clear(&functv);
8477 }
8478
8479 /* Stop the expression evaluation when immediately aborting on
8480 * error, or when an interrupt occurred or an exception was thrown
8481 * but not caught. */
8482 if (aborting()) {
8483 if (ret == OK1) {
8484 tv_clear(rettv);
8485 }
8486 ret = FAIL0;
8487 }
8488 tv_dict_unref(selfdict);
8489 selfdict = NULL((void*)0);
8490 } else { // **arg == '[' || **arg == '.'
8491 tv_dict_unref(selfdict);
8492 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_DICT) {
8493 selfdict = rettv->vval.v_dict;
8494 if (selfdict != NULL((void*)0))
8495 ++selfdict->dv_refcount;
8496 } else
8497 selfdict = NULL((void*)0);
8498 if (eval_index((char_u **)arg, rettv, evaluate, verbose) == FAIL0) {
8499 tv_clear(rettv);
8500 ret = FAIL0;
8501 }
8502 }
8503 }
8504
8505 // Turn "dict.Func" into a partial for "Func" bound to "dict".
8506 if (selfdict != NULL((void*)0) && tv_is_func(*rettv)) {
8507 set_selfdict(rettv, selfdict);
8508 }
8509
8510 tv_dict_unref(selfdict);
8511 return ret;
8512}
8513
8514void set_selfdict(typval_T *const rettv, dict_T *const selfdict)
8515{
8516 // Don't do this when "dict.Func" is already a partial that was bound
8517 // explicitly (pt_auto is false).
8518 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_PARTIAL && !rettv->vval.v_partial->pt_auto
8519 && rettv->vval.v_partial->pt_dict != NULL((void*)0)) {
8520 return;
8521 }
8522 make_partial(selfdict, rettv);
8523}
8524
8525// Find variable "name" in the list of variables.
8526// Return a pointer to it if found, NULL if not found.
8527// Careful: "a:0" variables don't have a name.
8528// When "htp" is not NULL we are writing to the variable, set "htp" to the
8529// hashtab_T used.
8530dictitem_T *find_var(const char *const name, const size_t name_len,
8531 hashtab_T **htp, int no_autoload)
8532{
8533 const char *varname;
8534 hashtab_T *const ht = find_var_ht(name, name_len, &varname);
8535 if (htp != NULL((void*)0)) {
8536 *htp = ht;
8537 }
8538 if (ht == NULL((void*)0)) {
8539 return NULL((void*)0);
8540 }
8541 dictitem_T *const ret = find_var_in_ht(ht, *name,
8542 varname,
8543 name_len - (size_t)(varname - name),
8544 no_autoload || htp != NULL((void*)0));
8545 if (ret != NULL((void*)0)) {
8546 return ret;
8547 }
8548
8549 // Search in parent scope for lambda
8550 return find_var_in_scoped_ht(name, name_len, no_autoload || htp != NULL((void*)0));
8551}
8552
8553/// Find variable in hashtab.
8554/// When "varname" is empty returns curwin/curtab/etc vars dictionary.
8555///
8556/// @param[in] ht Hashtab to find variable in.
8557/// @param[in] htname Hashtab name (first character).
8558/// @param[in] varname Variable name.
8559/// @param[in] varname_len Variable name length.
8560/// @param[in] no_autoload If true then autoload scripts will not be sourced
8561/// if autoload variable was not found.
8562///
8563/// @return pointer to the dictionary item with the found variable or NULL if it
8564/// was not found.
8565dictitem_T *find_var_in_ht(hashtab_T *const ht,
8566 int htname,
8567 const char *const varname,
8568 const size_t varname_len,
8569 int no_autoload)
8570 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
8571{
8572 hashitem_T *hi;
8573
8574 if (varname_len == 0) {
8575 // Must be something like "s:", otherwise "ht" would be NULL.
8576 switch (htname) {
8577 case 's': return (dictitem_T *)&SCRIPT_SV(current_sctx.sc_sid)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(current_sctx.sc_sid) -
1])->sv_var;
8578 case 'g': return (dictitem_T *)&globvars_var;
8579 case 'v': return (dictitem_T *)&vimvars_var;
8580 case 'b': return (dictitem_T *)&curbuf->b_bufvar;
8581 case 'w': return (dictitem_T *)&curwin->w_winvar;
8582 case 't': return (dictitem_T *)&curtab->tp_winvar;
8583 case 'l': return get_funccal_local_var();
8584 case 'a': return get_funccal_args_var();
8585 }
8586 return NULL((void*)0);
8587 }
8588
8589 hi = hash_find_len(ht, varname, varname_len);
8590 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) {
8591 // For global variables we may try auto-loading the script. If it
8592 // worked find the variable again. Don't auto-load a script if it was
8593 // loaded already, otherwise it would be loaded every time when
8594 // checking if a function name is a Funcref variable.
8595 if (ht == &globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab && !no_autoload) {
8596 // Note: script_autoload() may make "hi" invalid. It must either
8597 // be obtained again or not used.
8598 if (!script_autoload(varname, varname_len, false0) || aborting()) {
8599 return NULL((void*)0);
8600 }
8601 hi = hash_find_len(ht, varname, varname_len);
8602 }
8603 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) {
8604 return NULL((void*)0);
8605 }
8606 }
8607 return TV_DICT_HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
8608}
8609
8610/// Finds the dict (g:, l:, s:, …) and hashtable used for a variable.
8611///
8612/// @param[in] name Variable name, possibly with scope prefix.
8613/// @param[in] name_len Variable name length.
8614/// @param[out] varname Will be set to the start of the name without scope
8615/// prefix.
8616/// @param[out] d Scope dictionary.
8617///
8618/// @return Scope hashtab, NULL if name is not valid.
8619static hashtab_T *find_var_ht_dict(const char *name, const size_t name_len,
8620 const char **varname, dict_T **d)
8621{
8622 hashitem_T *hi;
8623 funccall_T *funccal = get_funccal();
8624 *d = NULL((void*)0);
8625
8626 if (name_len == 0) {
8627 return NULL((void*)0);
8628 }
8629 if (name_len == 1 || name[1] != ':') {
8630 // name has implicit scope
8631 if (name[0] == ':' || name[0] == AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') {
8632 // The name must not start with a colon or #.
8633 return NULL((void*)0);
8634 }
8635 *varname = name;
8636
8637 // "version" is "v:version" in all scopes
8638 hi = hash_find_len(&compat_hashtab, name, name_len);
8639 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) {
8640 return &compat_hashtab;
8641 }
8642
8643 if (funccal == NULL((void*)0)) { // global variable
8644 *d = &globvardict;
8645 } else { // l: variable
8646 *d = &funccal->l_vars;
8647 }
8648 goto end;
8649 }
8650
8651 *varname = name + 2;
8652 if (*name == 'g') { // global variable
8653 *d = &globvardict;
8654 } else if (name_len > 2
8655 && (memchr(name + 2, ':', name_len - 2) != NULL((void*)0)
8656 || memchr(name + 2, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#', name_len - 2) != NULL((void*)0))) {
8657 // There must be no ':' or '#' in the rest of the name if g: was not used
8658 return NULL((void*)0);
8659 }
8660
8661 if (*name == 'b') { // buffer variable
8662 *d = curbuf->b_vars;
8663 } else if (*name == 'w') { // window variable
8664 *d = curwin->w_vars;
8665 } else if (*name == 't') { // tab page variable
8666 *d = curtab->tp_vars;
8667 } else if (*name == 'v') { // v: variable
8668 *d = &vimvardict;
8669 } else if (*name == 'a' && funccal != NULL((void*)0)) { // function argument
8670 *d = &funccal->l_avars;
8671 } else if (*name == 'l' && funccal != NULL((void*)0)) { // local variable
8672 *d = &funccal->l_vars;
8673 } else if (*name == 's' // script variable
8674 && current_sctx.sc_sid > 0
8675 && current_sctx.sc_sid <= ga_scripts.ga_len) {
8676 *d = &SCRIPT_SV(current_sctx.sc_sid)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(current_sctx.sc_sid) -
1])->sv_dict;
8677 }
8678
8679end:
8680 return *d ? &(*d)->dv_hashtab : NULL((void*)0);
8681}
8682
8683/// Find the hashtable used for a variable
8684///
8685/// @param[in] name Variable name, possibly with scope prefix.
8686/// @param[in] name_len Variable name length.
8687/// @param[out] varname Will be set to the start of the name without scope
8688/// prefix.
8689///
8690/// @return Scope hashtab, NULL if name is not valid.
8691hashtab_T *find_var_ht(const char *name, const size_t name_len,
8692 const char **varname)
8693{
8694 dict_T *d;
8695 return find_var_ht_dict(name, name_len, varname, &d);
8696}
8697
8698/*
8699 * Get the string value of a (global/local) variable.
8700 * Note: see tv_get_string() for how long the pointer remains valid.
8701 * Returns NULL when it doesn't exist.
8702 */
8703char_u *get_var_value(const char *const name)
8704{
8705 dictitem_T *v;
8706
8707 v = find_var(name, strlen(name), NULL((void*)0), false0);
8708 if (v == NULL((void*)0)) {
8709 return NULL((void*)0);
8710 }
8711 return (char_u *)tv_get_string(&v->di_tv);
8712}
8713
8714/*
8715 * Allocate a new hashtab for a sourced script. It will be used while
8716 * sourcing this script and when executing functions defined in the script.
8717 */
8718void new_script_vars(scid_T id)
8719{
8720 hashtab_T *ht;
8721 scriptvar_T *sv;
8722
8723 ga_grow(&ga_scripts, (int)(id - ga_scripts.ga_len));
8724 {
8725 /* Re-allocating ga_data means that an ht_array pointing to
8726 * ht_smallarray becomes invalid. We can recognize this: ht_mask is
8727 * at its init value. Also reset "v_dict", it's always the same. */
8728 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i) {
8729 ht = &SCRIPT_VARS(i)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1])->sv_dict.
dv_hashtab);
8730 if (ht->ht_mask == HT_INIT_SIZE16 - 1)
8731 ht->ht_array = ht->ht_smallarray;
8732 sv = SCRIPT_SV(i)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1]);
8733 sv->sv_var.di_tv.vval.v_dict = &sv->sv_dict;
8734 }
8735
8736 while (ga_scripts.ga_len < id) {
8737 sv = SCRIPT_SV(ga_scripts.ga_len + 1)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(ga_scripts.ga_len + 1)
- 1]) = xcalloc(1, sizeof(scriptvar_T));
8738 init_var_dict(&sv->sv_dict, &sv->sv_var, VAR_SCOPE);
8739 ++ga_scripts.ga_len;
8740 }
8741 }
8742}
8743
8744/*
8745 * Initialize dictionary "dict" as a scope and set variable "dict_var" to
8746 * point to it.
8747 */
8748void init_var_dict(dict_T *dict, ScopeDictDictItem *dict_var, int scope)
8749{
8750 hash_init(&dict->dv_hashtab);
8751 dict->dv_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED;
8752 dict->dv_scope = scope;
8753 dict->dv_refcount = DO_NOT_FREE_CNT;
8754 dict->dv_copyID = 0;
8755 dict_var->di_tv.vval.v_dict = dict;
8756 dict_var->di_tv.v_type = VAR_DICT;
8757 dict_var->di_tv.v_lock = VAR_FIXED;
8758 dict_var->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO | DI_FLAGS_FIX;
8759 dict_var->di_key[0] = NUL'\000';
8760 QUEUE_INIT(&dict->watchers);
8761}
8762
8763/*
8764 * Unreference a dictionary initialized by init_var_dict().
8765 */
8766void unref_var_dict(dict_T *dict)
8767{
8768 /* Now the dict needs to be freed if no one else is using it, go back to
8769 * normal reference counting. */
8770 dict->dv_refcount -= DO_NOT_FREE_CNT - 1;
8771 tv_dict_unref(dict);
8772}
8773
8774/*
8775 * Clean up a list of internal variables.
8776 * Frees all allocated variables and the value they contain.
8777 * Clears hashtab "ht", does not free it.
8778 */
8779void vars_clear(hashtab_T *ht)
8780{
8781 vars_clear_ext(ht, TRUE1);
8782}
8783
8784/*
8785 * Like vars_clear(), but only free the value if "free_val" is TRUE.
8786 */
8787void vars_clear_ext(hashtab_T *ht, int free_val)
8788{
8789 int todo;
8790 hashitem_T *hi;
8791 dictitem_T *v;
8792
8793 hash_lock(ht);
8794 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
8795 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
8796 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) {
8797 --todo;
8798
8799 // Free the variable. Don't remove it from the hashtab,
8800 // ht_array might change then. hash_clear() takes care of it
8801 // later.
8802 v = TV_DICT_HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
8803 if (free_val) {
8804 tv_clear(&v->di_tv);
8805 }
8806 if (v->di_flags & DI_FLAGS_ALLOC) {
8807 xfree(v);
8808 }
8809 }
8810 }
8811 hash_clear(ht);
8812 ht->ht_used = 0;
8813}
8814
8815/*
8816 * Delete a variable from hashtab "ht" at item "hi".
8817 * Clear the variable value and free the dictitem.
8818 */
8819static void delete_var(hashtab_T *ht, hashitem_T *hi)
8820{
8821 dictitem_T *di = TV_DICT_HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)));
8822
8823 hash_remove(ht, hi);
8824 tv_clear(&di->di_tv);
8825 xfree(di);
8826}
8827
8828/*
8829 * List the value of one internal variable.
8830 */
8831static void list_one_var(dictitem_T *v, const char *prefix, int *first)
8832{
8833 char *const s = encode_tv2echo(&v->di_tv, NULL((void*)0));
8834 list_one_var_a(prefix, (const char *)v->di_key, STRLEN(v->di_key)strlen((char *)(v->di_key)),
8835 v->di_tv.v_type, (s == NULL((void*)0) ? "" : s), first);
8836 xfree(s);
8837}
8838
8839/// @param[in] name_len Length of the name. May be -1, in this case strlen()
8840/// will be used.
8841/// @param[in,out] first When true clear rest of screen and set to false.
8842static void list_one_var_a(const char *prefix, const char *name,
8843 const ptrdiff_t name_len, const int type,
8844 const char *string, int *first)
8845{
8846 // don't use msg() or msg_attr() to avoid overwriting "v:statusmsg"
8847 msg_start();
8848 msg_puts(prefix);
8849 if (name != NULL((void*)0)) { // "a:" vars don't have a name stored
8850 msg_puts_attr_len(name, name_len, 0);
8851 }
8852 msg_putchar(' ');
8853 msg_advance(22);
8854 if (type == VAR_NUMBER) {
8855 msg_putchar('#');
8856 } else if (type == VAR_FUNC || type == VAR_PARTIAL) {
8857 msg_putchar('*');
8858 } else if (type == VAR_LIST) {
8859 msg_putchar('[');
8860 if (*string == '[')
