8861 ++string;
8862 } else if (type == VAR_DICT) {
8863 msg_putchar('{');
8864 if (*string == '{')
8865 ++string;
8866 } else
8867 msg_putchar(' ');
8868
8869 msg_outtrans((char_u *)string);
8870
8871 if (type == VAR_FUNC || type == VAR_PARTIAL) {
8872 msg_puts("()");
8873 }
8874 if (*first) {
8875 msg_clr_eos();
8876 *first = FALSE0;
8877 }
8878}
8879
8880/// Set variable to the given value
8881///
8882/// If the variable already exists, the value is updated. Otherwise the variable
8883/// is created.
8884///
8885/// @param[in] name Variable name to set.
8886/// @param[in] name_len Length of the variable name.
8887/// @param tv Variable value.
8888/// @param[in] copy True if value in tv is to be copied.
8889void set_var(const char *name, const size_t name_len, typval_T *const tv,
8890 const bool_Bool copy)
8891 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
8892{
8893 set_var_const(name, name_len, tv, copy, false0);
8894}
8895
8896/// Set variable to the given value
8897///
8898/// If the variable already exists, the value is updated. Otherwise the variable
8899/// is created.
8900///
8901/// @param[in] name Variable name to set.
8902/// @param[in] name_len Length of the variable name.
8903/// @param tv Variable value.
8904/// @param[in] copy True if value in tv is to be copied.
8905/// @param[in] is_const True if value in tv is to be locked.
8906static void set_var_const(const char *name, const size_t name_len,
8907 typval_T *const tv, const bool_Bool copy,
8908 const bool_Bool is_const)
8909 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
8910{
8911 dictitem_T *v;
8912 hashtab_T *ht;
8913 dict_T *dict;
8914
8915 const char *varname;
8916 ht = find_var_ht_dict(name, name_len, &varname, &dict);
8917 const bool_Bool watched = tv_dict_is_watched(dict);
8918
8919 if (ht == NULL((void*)0) || *varname == NUL'\000') {
8920 EMSG2(_(e_illvar), name)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_illvar))), (name));
8921 return;
8922 }
8923 v = find_var_in_ht(ht, 0, varname, name_len - (size_t)(varname - name), true1);
8924
8925 // Search in parent scope which is possible to reference from lambda
8926 if (v == NULL((void*)0)) {
8927 v = find_var_in_scoped_ht((const char *)name, name_len, true1);
8928 }
8929
8930 if (tv_is_func(*tv) && !var_check_func_name(name, v == NULL((void*)0))) {
8931 return;
8932 }
8933
8934 typval_T oldtv = TV_INITIAL_VALUE((typval_T) { .v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN, .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED, }
);
8935 if (v != NULL((void*)0)) {
8936 if (is_const) {
8937 EMSG(_(e_cannot_mod))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_cannot_mod))));
8938 return;
8939 }
8940
8941 // existing variable, need to clear the value
8942 if (var_check_ro(v->di_flags, name, name_len)
8943 || tv_check_lock(v->di_tv.v_lock, name, name_len)) {
8944 return;
8945 }
8946
8947 // Handle setting internal v: variables separately where needed to
8948 // prevent changing the type.
8949 if (ht == &vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab) {
8950 if (v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING) {
8951 XFREE_CLEAR(v->di_tv.vval.v_string)do { void **ptr_ = (void **)&(v->di_tv.vval.v_string);
xfree(*ptr_); *ptr_ = ((void*)0); (void)(*ptr_); } while (0);
8952 if (copy || tv->v_type != VAR_STRING) {
8953 const char *const val = tv_get_string(tv);
8954
8955 // Careful: when assigning to v:errmsg and tv_get_string()
8956 // causes an error message the variable will alrady be set.
8957 if (v->di_tv.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0)) {
8958 v->di_tv.vval.v_string = (char_u *)xstrdup(val);
8959 }
8960 } else {
8961 // Take over the string to avoid an extra alloc/free.
8962 v->di_tv.vval.v_string = tv->vval.v_string;
8963 tv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
8964 }
8965 return;
8966 } else if (v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER) {
8967 v->di_tv.vval.v_number = tv_get_number(tv);
8968 if (strcmp(varname, "searchforward") == 0) {
8969 set_search_direction(v->di_tv.vval.v_number ? '/' : '?');
8970 } else if (strcmp(varname, "hlsearch") == 0) {
8971 no_hlsearch = !v->di_tv.vval.v_number;
8972 redraw_all_later(SOME_VALID35);
8973 }
8974 return;
8975 } else if (v->di_tv.v_type != tv->v_type) {
8976 EMSG2(_("E963: setting %s to value with wrong type"), name)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E963: setting %s to value with wrong type"
))), (name));
8977 return;
8978 }
8979 }
8980
8981 if (watched) {
8982 tv_copy(&v->di_tv, &oldtv);
8983 }
8984 tv_clear(&v->di_tv);
8985 } else { // Add a new variable.
8986 // Can't add "v:" or "a:" variable.
8987 if (ht == &vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab || ht == get_funccal_args_ht()) {
8988 emsgf(_(e_illvar)gettext((char *)(e_illvar)), name);
8989 return;
8990 }
8991
8992 // Make sure the variable name is valid.
8993 if (!valid_varname(varname)) {
8994 return;
8995 }
8996
8997 // Make sure dict is valid
8998 assert(dict != NULL)((void) sizeof ((dict != ((void*)0)) ? 1 : 0), __extension__ (
{ if (dict != ((void*)0)) ; else __assert_fail ("dict != NULL"
, "../src/nvim/eval.c", 8998, __extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
); }));
8999
9000 v = xmalloc(sizeof(dictitem_T) + strlen(varname));
9001 STRCPY(v->di_key, varname)strcpy((char *)(v->di_key), (char *)(varname));
9002 if (tv_dict_add(dict, v) == FAIL0) {
9003 xfree(v);
9004 return;
9005 }
9006 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_ALLOC;
9007 if (is_const) {
9008 v->di_flags |= DI_FLAGS_LOCK;
9009 }
9010 }
9011
9012 if (copy || tv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER || tv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT) {
9013 tv_copy(tv, &v->di_tv);
9014 } else {
9015 v->di_tv = *tv;
9016 v->di_tv.v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED;
9017 tv_init(tv);
9018 }
9019
9020 if (watched) {
9021 if (oldtv.v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN) {
9022 tv_dict_watcher_notify(dict, (char *)v->di_key, &v->di_tv, NULL((void*)0));
9023 } else {
9024 tv_dict_watcher_notify(dict, (char *)v->di_key, &v->di_tv, &oldtv);
9025 tv_clear(&oldtv);
9026 }
9027 }
9028
9029 if (is_const) {
9030 tv_item_lock(&v->di_tv, 1, true1);
9031 }
9032}
9033
9034/// Check whether variable is read-only (DI_FLAGS_RO, DI_FLAGS_RO_SBX)
9035///
9036/// Also gives an error message.
9037///
9038/// @param[in] flags di_flags attribute value.
9039/// @param[in] name Variable name, for use in error message.
9040/// @param[in] name_len Variable name length. Use #TV_TRANSLATE to translate
9041/// variable name and compute the length. Use #TV_CSTRING
9042/// to compute the length with strlen() without
9043/// translating.
9044///
9045/// Both #TV_… values are used for optimization purposes:
9046/// variable name with its length is needed only in case
9047/// of error, when no error occurs computing them is
9048/// a waste of CPU resources. This especially applies to
9049/// gettext.
9050///
9051/// @return True if variable is read-only: either always or in sandbox when
9052/// sandbox is enabled, false otherwise.
9053bool_Bool var_check_ro(const int flags, const char *name,
9054 size_t name_len)
9055 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
9056{
9057 const char *error_message = NULL((void*)0);
9058 if (flags & DI_FLAGS_RO) {
9059 error_message = _(e_readonlyvar)gettext((char *)(e_readonlyvar));
9060 } else if ((flags & DI_FLAGS_RO_SBX) && sandbox) {
9061 error_message = N_("E794: Cannot set variable in the sandbox: \"%.*s\"")"E794: Cannot set variable in the sandbox: \"%.*s\"";
9062 }
9063
9064 if (error_message == NULL((void*)0)) {
9065 return false0;
9066 }
9067 if (name_len == TV_TRANSLATE((18446744073709551615UL))) {
9068 name = _(name)gettext((char *)(name));
9069 name_len = strlen(name);
9070 } else if (name_len == TV_CSTRING((18446744073709551615UL) - 1)) {
9071 name_len = strlen(name);
9072 }
9073
9074 emsgf(_(error_message)gettext((char *)(error_message)), (int)name_len, name);
9075
9076 return true1;
9077}
9078
9079/// Check whether variable is fixed (DI_FLAGS_FIX)
9080///
9081/// Also gives an error message.
9082///
9083/// @param[in] flags di_flags attribute value.
9084/// @param[in] name Variable name, for use in error message.
9085/// @param[in] name_len Variable name length. Use #TV_TRANSLATE to translate
9086/// variable name and compute the length. Use #TV_CSTRING
9087/// to compute the length with strlen() without
9088/// translating.
9089///
9090/// Both #TV_… values are used for optimization purposes:
9091/// variable name with its length is needed only in case
9092/// of error, when no error occurs computing them is
9093/// a waste of CPU resources. This especially applies to
9094/// gettext.
9095///
9096/// @return True if variable is fixed, false otherwise.
9097bool_Bool var_check_fixed(const int flags, const char *name,
9098 size_t name_len)
9099 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
9100{
9101 if (flags & DI_FLAGS_FIX) {
9102 if (name_len == TV_TRANSLATE((18446744073709551615UL))) {
9103 name = _(name)gettext((char *)(name));
9104 name_len = strlen(name);
9105 } else if (name_len == TV_CSTRING((18446744073709551615UL) - 1)) {
9106 name_len = strlen(name);
9107 }
9108 EMSG3(_("E795: Cannot delete variable %.*s"), (int)name_len, name)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E795: Cannot delete variable %.*s"
))), ((int)name_len), (name));
9109 return true1;
9110 }
9111 return false0;
9112}
9113
9114// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
9115
9116/// Check if name is a valid name to assign funcref to
9117///
9118/// @param[in] name Possible function/funcref name.
9119/// @param[in] new_var True if it is a name for a variable.
9120///
9121/// @return false in case of error, true in case of success. Also gives an
9122/// error message if appropriate.
9123bool_Bool var_check_func_name(const char *const name, const bool_Bool new_var)
9124 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
9125{
9126 // Allow for w: b: s: and t:.
9127 if (!(vim_strchr((char_u *)"wbst", name[0]) != NULL((void*)0) && name[1] == ':')
9128 && !ASCII_ISUPPER((name[0] != NUL && name[1] == ':') ? name[2]((unsigned)((name[0] != '\000' && name[1] == ':') ? name
[2] : name[0]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)((name[0] != '\000'
&& name[1] == ':') ? name[2] : name[0]) <= 'Z')
9129 : name[0])((unsigned)((name[0] != '\000' && name[1] == ':') ? name
[2] : name[0]) >= 'A' && (unsigned)((name[0] != '\000'
&& name[1] == ':') ? name[2] : name[0]) <= 'Z')) {
9130 EMSG2(_("E704: Funcref variable name must start with a capital: %s"), name)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E704: Funcref variable name must start with a capital: %s"
))), (name));
9131 return false0;
9132 }
9133 // Don't allow hiding a function. When "v" is not NULL we might be
9134 // assigning another function to the same var, the type is checked
9135 // below.
9136 if (new_var && function_exists((const char *)name, false0)) {
9137 EMSG2(_("E705: Variable name conflicts with existing function: %s"),emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E705: Variable name conflicts with existing function: %s"
))), (name))
9138 name)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E705: Variable name conflicts with existing function: %s"
))), (name));
9139 return false0;
9140 }
9141 return true1;
9142}
9143
9144// TODO(ZyX-I): move to eval/expressions
9145
9146/// Check if a variable name is valid
9147///
9148/// @param[in] varname Variable name to check.
9149///
9150/// @return false when variable name is not valid, true when it is. Also gives
9151/// an error message if appropriate.
9152bool_Bool valid_varname(const char *varname)
9153 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
9154{
9155 for (const char *p = varname; *p != NUL'\000'; p++) {
9156 if (!eval_isnamec1((int)(uint8_t)(*p))
9157 && (p == varname || !ascii_isdigit(*p))
9158 && *p != AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') {
9159 emsgf(_(e_illvar)gettext((char *)(e_illvar)), varname);
9160 return false0;
9161 }
9162 }
9163 return true1;
9164}
9165
9166/// Make a copy of an item
9167///
9168/// Lists and Dictionaries are also copied.
9169///
9170/// @param[in] conv If not NULL, convert all copied strings.
9171/// @param[in] from Value to copy.
9172/// @param[out] to Location where to copy to.
9173/// @param[in] deep If true, use copy the container and all of the contained
9174/// containers (nested).
9175/// @param[in] copyID If non-zero then when container is referenced more then
9176/// once then copy of it that was already done is used. E.g.
9177/// when copying list `list = [list2, list2]` (`list[0] is
9178/// list[1]`) var_item_copy with zero copyID will emit
9179/// a copy with (`copy[0] isnot copy[1]`), with non-zero it
9180/// will emit a copy with (`copy[0] is copy[1]`) like in the
9181/// original list. Not used when deep is false.
9182int var_item_copy(const vimconv_T *const conv,
9183 typval_T *const from,
9184 typval_T *const to,
9185 const bool_Bool deep,
9186 const int copyID)
9187 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(2, 3)
9188{
9189 static int recurse = 0;
9190 int ret = OK1;
9191
9192 if (recurse >= DICT_MAXNEST100) {
9193 EMSG(_("E698: variable nested too deep for making a copy"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E698: variable nested too deep for making a copy"
))));
9194 return FAIL0;
9195 }
9196 ++recurse;
9197
9198 switch (from->v_type) {
9199 case VAR_NUMBER:
9200 case VAR_FLOAT:
9201 case VAR_FUNC:
9202 case VAR_PARTIAL:
9203 case VAR_BOOL:
9204 case VAR_SPECIAL:
9205 tv_copy(from, to);
9206 break;
9207 case VAR_STRING:
9208 if (conv == NULL((void*)0) || conv->vc_type == CONV_NONE
9209 || from->vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0)) {
9210 tv_copy(from, to);
9211 } else {
9212 to->v_type = VAR_STRING;
9213 to->v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED;
9214 if ((to->vval.v_string = string_convert((vimconv_T *)conv,
9215 from->vval.v_string,
9216 NULL((void*)0)))
9217 == NULL((void*)0)) {
9218 to->vval.v_string = (char_u *) xstrdup((char *) from->vval.v_string);
9219 }
9220 }
9221 break;
9222 case VAR_LIST:
9223 to->v_type = VAR_LIST;
9224 to->v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED;
9225 if (from->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0)) {
9226 to->vval.v_list = NULL((void*)0);
9227 } else if (copyID != 0 && tv_list_copyid(from->vval.v_list) == copyID) {
9228 // Use the copy made earlier.
9229 to->vval.v_list = tv_list_latest_copy(from->vval.v_list);
9230 tv_list_ref(to->vval.v_list);
9231 } else {
9232 to->vval.v_list = tv_list_copy(conv, from->vval.v_list, deep, copyID);
9233 }
9234 if (to->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0) && from->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
9235 ret = FAIL0;
9236 }
9237 break;
9238 case VAR_DICT:
9239 to->v_type = VAR_DICT;
9240 to->v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED;
9241 if (from->vval.v_dict == NULL((void*)0)) {
9242 to->vval.v_dict = NULL((void*)0);
9243 } else if (copyID != 0 && from->vval.v_dict->dv_copyID == copyID) {
9244 // use the copy made earlier
9245 to->vval.v_dict = from->vval.v_dict->dv_copydict;
9246 ++to->vval.v_dict->dv_refcount;
9247 } else {
9248 to->vval.v_dict = tv_dict_copy(conv, from->vval.v_dict, deep, copyID);
9249 }
9250 if (to->vval.v_dict == NULL((void*)0) && from->vval.v_dict != NULL((void*)0)) {
9251 ret = FAIL0;
9252 }
9253 break;
9254 case VAR_UNKNOWN:
9255 internal_error("var_item_copy(UNKNOWN)");
9256 ret = FAIL0;
9257 }
9258 --recurse;
9259 return ret;
9260}
9261
9262/*
9263 * ":echo expr1 ..." print each argument separated with a space, add a
9264 * newline at the end.
9265 * ":echon expr1 ..." print each argument plain.
9266 */
9267void ex_echo(exarg_T *eap)
9268{
9269 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
9270 typval_T rettv;
9271 bool_Bool atstart = true1;
9272 bool_Bool need_clear = true1;
9273 const int did_emsg_before = did_emsg;
9274
9275 if (eap->skip)
9276 ++emsg_skip;
9277 while (*arg != NUL'\000' && *arg != '|' && *arg != '\n' && !got_int) {
9278 // If eval1() causes an error message the text from the command may
9279 // still need to be cleared. E.g., "echo 22,44".
9280 need_clr_eos = true1;
9281
9282 {
9283 char_u *p = arg;
9284 if (eval1(&arg, &rettv, !eap->skip) == FAIL0) {
9285 // Report the invalid expression unless the expression evaluation
9286 // has been cancelled due to an aborting error, an interrupt, or an
9287 // exception.
9288 if (!aborting() && did_emsg == did_emsg_before) {
9289 EMSG2(_(e_invexpr2), p)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2))), (p));
9290 }
9291 need_clr_eos = false0;
9292 break;
9293 }
9294 need_clr_eos = false0;
9295 }
9296
9297 if (!eap->skip) {
9298 if (atstart) {
9299 atstart = false0;
9300 /* Call msg_start() after eval1(), evaluating the expression
9301 * may cause a message to appear. */
9302 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echo) {
9303 /* Mark the saved text as finishing the line, so that what
9304 * follows is displayed on a new line when scrolling back
9305 * at the more prompt. */
9306 msg_sb_eol();
9307 msg_start();
9308 }
9309 } else if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echo) {
9310 msg_puts_attr(" ", echo_attr);
9311 }
9312 char *tofree = encode_tv2echo(&rettv, NULL((void*)0));
9313 if (*tofree != NUL'\000') {
9314 msg_ext_set_kind("echo");
9315 msg_multiline_attr(tofree, echo_attr, true1, &need_clear);
9316 }
9317 xfree(tofree);
9318 }
9319 tv_clear(&rettv);
9320 arg = skipwhite(arg);
9321 }
9322 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
9323
9324 if (eap->skip) {
9325 emsg_skip--;
9326 } else {
9327 // remove text that may still be there from the command
9328 if (need_clear) {
9329 msg_clr_eos();
9330 }
9331 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echo) {
9332 msg_end();
9333 }
9334 }
9335}
9336
9337/*
9338 * ":echohl {name}".
9339 */
9340void ex_echohl(exarg_T *eap)
9341{
9342 echo_attr = syn_name2attr(eap->arg);
9343}
9344
9345/*
9346 * ":execute expr1 ..." execute the result of an expression.
9347 * ":echomsg expr1 ..." Print a message
9348 * ":echoerr expr1 ..." Print an error
9349 * Each gets spaces around each argument and a newline at the end for
9350 * echo commands
9351 */
9352void ex_execute(exarg_T *eap)
9353{
9354 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
9355 typval_T rettv;
9356 int ret = OK1;
9357 garray_T ga;
9358 int save_did_emsg;
9359
9360 ga_init(&ga, 1, 80);
9361
9362 if (eap->skip)
9363 ++emsg_skip;
9364 while (*arg != NUL'\000' && *arg != '|' && *arg != '\n') {
9365 ret = eval1_emsg(&arg, &rettv, !eap->skip);
9366 if (ret == FAIL0) {
9367 break;
9368 }
9369
9370 if (!eap->skip) {
9371 const char *const argstr = eap->cmdidx == CMD_execute
9372 ? tv_get_string(&rettv)
9373 : rettv.v_type == VAR_STRING
9374 ? encode_tv2echo(&rettv, NULL((void*)0))
9375 : encode_tv2string(&rettv, NULL((void*)0));
9376 const size_t len = strlen(argstr);
9377 ga_grow(&ga, len + 2);
9378 if (!GA_EMPTY(&ga)((&ga)->ga_len <= 0)) {
9379 ((char_u *)(ga.ga_data))[ga.ga_len++] = ' ';
9380 }
9381 memcpy((char_u *)(ga.ga_data) + ga.ga_len, argstr, len + 1);
9382 if (eap->cmdidx != CMD_execute) {
9383 xfree((void *)argstr);
9384 }
9385 ga.ga_len += len;
9386 }
9387
9388 tv_clear(&rettv);
9389 arg = skipwhite(arg);
9390 }
9391
9392 if (ret != FAIL0 && ga.ga_data != NULL((void*)0)) {
9393 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echomsg || eap->cmdidx == CMD_echoerr) {
9394 // Mark the already saved text as finishing the line, so that what
9395 // follows is displayed on a new line when scrolling back at the
9396 // more prompt.
9397 msg_sb_eol();
9398 }
9399
9400 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echomsg) {
9401 msg_ext_set_kind("echomsg");
9402 MSG_ATTR(ga.ga_data, echo_attr)msg_attr((const char *)(ga.ga_data), (echo_attr));
9403 ui_flush();
9404 } else if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echoerr) {
9405 // We don't want to abort following commands, restore did_emsg.
9406 save_did_emsg = did_emsg;
9407 msg_ext_set_kind("echoerr");
9408 EMSG((char_u *)ga.ga_data)emsg((char_u *)((char_u *)ga.ga_data));
9409 if (!force_abort)
9410 did_emsg = save_did_emsg;
9411 } else if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_execute)
9412 do_cmdline((char_u *)ga.ga_data,
9413 eap->getline, eap->cookie, DOCMD_NOWAIT0x02|DOCMD_VERBOSE0x01);
9414 }
9415
9416 ga_clear(&ga);
9417
9418 if (eap->skip)
9419 --emsg_skip;
9420
9421 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
9422}
9423
9424/*
9425 * Skip over the name of an option: "&option", "&g:option" or "&l:option".
9426 * "arg" points to the "&" or '+' when called, to "option" when returning.
9427 * Returns NULL when no option name found. Otherwise pointer to the char
9428 * after the option name.
9429 */
9430static const char *find_option_end(const char **const arg, int *const opt_flags)
9431{
9432 const char *p = *arg;
9433
9434 ++p;
9435 if (*p == 'g' && p[1] == ':') {
9436 *opt_flags = OPT_GLOBAL;
9437 p += 2;
9438 } else if (*p == 'l' && p[1] == ':') {
9439 *opt_flags = OPT_LOCAL;
9440 p += 2;
9441 } else {
9442 *opt_flags = 0;
9443 }
9444
9445 if (!ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z'))) {
9446 return NULL((void*)0);
9447 }
9448 *arg = p;
9449
9450 if (p[0] == 't' && p[1] == '_' && p[2] != NUL'\000' && p[3] != NUL'\000') {
9451 p += 4; // t_xx/termcap option
9452 } else {
9453 while (ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
) || ((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <=
'z'))) {
9454 p++;
9455 }
9456 }
9457 return p;
9458}
9459
9460/// Start profiling function "fp".
9461void func_do_profile(ufunc_T *fp)
9462{
9463 int len = fp->uf_lines.ga_len;
9464
9465 if (!fp->uf_prof_initialized) {
9466 if (len == 0) {
9467 len = 1; // avoid getting error for allocating zero bytes
9468 }
9469 fp->uf_tm_count = 0;
9470 fp->uf_tm_self = profile_zero();
9471 fp->uf_tm_total = profile_zero();
9472
9473 if (fp->uf_tml_count == NULL((void*)0)) {
9474 fp->uf_tml_count = xcalloc(len, sizeof(int));
9475 }
9476
9477 if (fp->uf_tml_total == NULL((void*)0)) {
9478 fp->uf_tml_total = xcalloc(len, sizeof(proftime_T));
9479 }
9480
9481 if (fp->uf_tml_self == NULL((void*)0)) {
9482 fp->uf_tml_self = xcalloc(len, sizeof(proftime_T));
9483 }
9484
9485 fp->uf_tml_idx = -1;
9486 fp->uf_prof_initialized = true1;
9487 }
9488
9489 fp->uf_profiling = TRUE1;
9490}
9491
9492/*
9493 * Dump the profiling results for all functions in file "fd".
9494 */
9495void func_dump_profile(FILE *fd)
9496{
9497 hashitem_T *hi;
9498 int todo;
9499 ufunc_T *fp;
9500 ufunc_T **sorttab;
9501 int st_len = 0;
9502
9503 todo = (int)func_hashtab.ht_used;
9504 if (todo == 0) {
9505 return; // nothing to dump
9506 }
9507
9508 sorttab = xmalloc(sizeof(ufunc_T *) * todo);
9509
9510 for (hi = func_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
9511 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) {
9512 --todo;
9513 fp = HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(ufunc_T, uf_name
)));
9514 if (fp->uf_prof_initialized) {
9515 sorttab[st_len++] = fp;
9516
9517 if (fp->uf_name[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80)) {
9518 fprintf(fd, "FUNCTION <SNR>%s()\n", fp->uf_name + 3);
9519 } else {
9520 fprintf(fd, "FUNCTION %s()\n", fp->uf_name);
9521 }
9522 if (fp->uf_script_ctx.sc_sid != 0) {
9523 bool_Bool should_free;
9524 const LastSet last_set = (LastSet){
9525 .script_ctx = fp->uf_script_ctx,
9526 .channel_id = 0,
9527 };
9528 char_u *p = get_scriptname(last_set, &should_free);
9529 fprintf(fd, " Defined: %s:%" PRIdLINENR"ld" "\n",
9530 p, fp->uf_script_ctx.sc_lnum);
9531 if (should_free) {
9532 xfree(p);
9533 }
9534 }
9535 if (fp->uf_tm_count == 1) {
9536 fprintf(fd, "Called 1 time\n");
9537 } else {
9538 fprintf(fd, "Called %d times\n", fp->uf_tm_count);
9539 }
9540 fprintf(fd, "Total time: %s\n", profile_msg(fp->uf_tm_total));
9541 fprintf(fd, " Self time: %s\n", profile_msg(fp->uf_tm_self));
9542 fprintf(fd, "\n");
9543 fprintf(fd, "count total (s) self (s)\n");
9544
9545 for (int i = 0; i < fp->uf_lines.ga_len; ++i) {
9546 if (FUNCLINE(fp, i)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[i] == NULL((void*)0))
9547 continue;
9548 prof_func_line(fd, fp->uf_tml_count[i],
9549 &fp->uf_tml_total[i], &fp->uf_tml_self[i], TRUE1);
9550 fprintf(fd, "%s\n", FUNCLINE(fp, i)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[i]);
9551 }
9552 fprintf(fd, "\n");
9553 }
9554 }
9555 }
9556
9557 if (st_len > 0) {
9558 qsort((void *)sorttab, (size_t)st_len, sizeof(ufunc_T *),
9559 prof_total_cmp);
9560 prof_sort_list(fd, sorttab, st_len, "TOTAL", FALSE0);
9561 qsort((void *)sorttab, (size_t)st_len, sizeof(ufunc_T *),
9562 prof_self_cmp);
9563 prof_sort_list(fd, sorttab, st_len, "SELF", TRUE1);
9564 }
9565
9566 xfree(sorttab);
9567}
9568
9569static void
9570prof_sort_list(
9571 FILE *fd,
9572 ufunc_T **sorttab,
9573 int st_len,
9574 char *title,
9575 int prefer_self // when equal print only self time
9576)
9577{
9578 int i;
9579 ufunc_T *fp;
9580
9581 fprintf(fd, "FUNCTIONS SORTED ON %s TIME\n", title);
9582 fprintf(fd, "count total (s) self (s) function\n");
9583 for (i = 0; i < 20 && i < st_len; ++i) {
9584 fp = sorttab[i];
9585 prof_func_line(fd, fp->uf_tm_count, &fp->uf_tm_total, &fp->uf_tm_self,
9586 prefer_self);
9587 if (fp->uf_name[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80))
9588 fprintf(fd, " <SNR>%s()\n", fp->uf_name + 3);
9589 else
9590 fprintf(fd, " %s()\n", fp->uf_name);
9591 }
9592 fprintf(fd, "\n");
9593}
9594
9595/*
9596 * Print the count and times for one function or function line.
9597 */
9598static void prof_func_line(
9599 FILE *fd,
9600 int count,
9601 proftime_T *total,
9602 proftime_T *self,
9603 int prefer_self // when equal print only self time
9604)
9605{
9606 if (count > 0) {
9607 fprintf(fd, "%5d ", count);
9608 if (prefer_self && profile_equal(*total, *self))
9609 fprintf(fd, " ");
9610 else
9611 fprintf(fd, "%s ", profile_msg(*total));
9612 if (!prefer_self && profile_equal(*total, *self))
9613 fprintf(fd, " ");
9614 else
9615 fprintf(fd, "%s ", profile_msg(*self));
9616 } else
9617 fprintf(fd, " ");
9618}
9619
9620/*
9621 * Compare function for total time sorting.
9622 */
9623static int prof_total_cmp(const void *s1, const void *s2)
9624{
9625 ufunc_T *p1 = *(ufunc_T **)s1;
9626 ufunc_T *p2 = *(ufunc_T **)s2;
9627 return profile_cmp(p1->uf_tm_total, p2->uf_tm_total);
9628}
9629
9630/*
9631 * Compare function for self time sorting.
9632 */
9633static int prof_self_cmp(const void *s1, const void *s2)
9634{
9635 ufunc_T *p1 = *(ufunc_T **)s1;
9636 ufunc_T *p2 = *(ufunc_T **)s2;
9637 return profile_cmp(p1->uf_tm_self, p2->uf_tm_self);
9638}
9639
9640/// Return the autoload script name for a function or variable name
9641/// Caller must make sure that "name" contains AUTOLOAD_CHAR.
9642///
9643/// @param[in] name Variable/function name.
9644/// @param[in] name_len Name length.
9645///
9646/// @return [allocated] autoload script name.
9647char *autoload_name(const char *const name, const size_t name_len)
9648 FUNC_ATTR_MALLOC FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT
9649{
9650 // Get the script file name: replace '#' with '/', append ".vim".
9651 char *const scriptname = xmalloc(name_len + sizeof("autoload/.vim"));
9652 memcpy(scriptname, "autoload/", sizeof("autoload/") - 1);
9653 memcpy(scriptname + sizeof("autoload/") - 1, name, name_len);
9654 size_t auchar_idx = 0;
9655 for (size_t i = sizeof("autoload/") - 1;
9656 i - sizeof("autoload/") + 1 < name_len;
9657 i++) {
9658 if (scriptname[i] == AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') {
9659 scriptname[i] = '/';
9660 auchar_idx = i;
9661 }
9662 }
9663 memcpy(scriptname + auchar_idx, ".vim", sizeof(".vim"));
9664
9665 return scriptname;
9666}
9667
9668/// If name has a package name try autoloading the script for it
9669///
9670/// @param[in] name Variable/function name.
9671/// @param[in] name_len Name length.
9672/// @param[in] reload If true, load script again when already loaded.
9673///
9674/// @return true if a package was loaded.
9675bool_Bool script_autoload(const char *const name, const size_t name_len,
9676 const bool_Bool reload)
9677{
9678 // If there is no '#' after name[0] there is no package name.
9679 const char *p = memchr(name, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#', name_len);
9680 if (p == NULL((void*)0) || p == name) {
9681 return false0;
9682 }
9683
9684 bool_Bool ret = false0;
9685 char *tofree = autoload_name(name, name_len);
9686 char *scriptname = tofree;
9687
9688 // Find the name in the list of previously loaded package names. Skip
9689 // "autoload/", it's always the same.
9690 int i = 0;
9691 for (; i < ga_loaded.ga_len; i++) {
9692 if (STRCMP(((char **)ga_loaded.ga_data)[i] + 9, scriptname + 9)strcmp((char *)(((char **)ga_loaded.ga_data)[i] + 9), (char *
)(scriptname + 9)) == 0) {
9693 break;
9694 }
9695 }
9696 if (!reload && i < ga_loaded.ga_len) {
9697 ret = false0; // Was loaded already.
9698 } else {
9699 // Remember the name if it wasn't loaded already.
9700 if (i == ga_loaded.ga_len) {
9701 GA_APPEND(char *, &ga_loaded, scriptname)do { ga_grow(&ga_loaded, 1); ((char * *)(&ga_loaded)->
ga_data)[(&ga_loaded)->ga_len++] = (scriptname); } while
(0);
9702 tofree = NULL((void*)0);
9703 }
9704
9705 // Try loading the package from $VIMRUNTIME/autoload/<name>.vim
9706 if (source_runtime((char_u *)scriptname, 0) == OK1) {
9707 ret = true1;
9708 }
9709 }
9710
9711 xfree(tofree);
9712 return ret;
9713}
9714
9715/*
9716 * Called when starting to read a function line.
9717 * "sourcing_lnum" must be correct!
9718 * When skipping lines it may not actually be executed, but we won't find out
9719 * until later and we need to store the time now.
9720 */
9721void func_line_start(void *cookie)
9722{
9723 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
9724 ufunc_T *fp = fcp->func;
9725
9726 if (fp->uf_profiling && sourcing_lnum >= 1
9727 && sourcing_lnum <= fp->uf_lines.ga_len) {
9728 fp->uf_tml_idx = sourcing_lnum - 1;
9729 // Skip continuation lines.
9730 while (fp->uf_tml_idx > 0 && FUNCLINE(fp, fp->uf_tml_idx)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[fp->uf_tml_idx] == NULL((void*)0)) {
9731 fp->uf_tml_idx--;
9732 }
9733 fp->uf_tml_execed = false0;
9734 fp->uf_tml_start = profile_start();
9735 fp->uf_tml_children = profile_zero();
9736 fp->uf_tml_wait = profile_get_wait();
9737 }
9738}
9739
9740/*
9741 * Called when actually executing a function line.
9742 */
9743void func_line_exec(void *cookie)
9744{
9745 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
9746 ufunc_T *fp = fcp->func;
9747
9748 if (fp->uf_profiling && fp->uf_tml_idx >= 0)
9749 fp->uf_tml_execed = TRUE1;
9750}
9751
9752/*
9753 * Called when done with a function line.
9754 */
9755void func_line_end(void *cookie)
9756{
9757 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
9758 ufunc_T *fp = fcp->func;
9759
9760 if (fp->uf_profiling && fp->uf_tml_idx >= 0) {
9761 if (fp->uf_tml_execed) {
9762 ++fp->uf_tml_count[fp->uf_tml_idx];
9763 fp->uf_tml_start = profile_end(fp->uf_tml_start);
9764 fp->uf_tml_start = profile_sub_wait(fp->uf_tml_wait, fp->uf_tml_start);
9765 fp->uf_tml_total[fp->uf_tml_idx] =
9766 profile_add(fp->uf_tml_total[fp->uf_tml_idx], fp->uf_tml_start);
9767 fp->uf_tml_self[fp->uf_tml_idx] =
9768 profile_self(fp->uf_tml_self[fp->uf_tml_idx], fp->uf_tml_start,
9769 fp->uf_tml_children);
9770 }
9771 fp->uf_tml_idx = -1;
9772 }
9773}
9774
9775static var_flavour_T var_flavour(char_u *varname)
9776{
9777 char_u *p = varname;
9778
9779 if (ASCII_ISUPPER(*p)((unsigned)(*p) >= 'A' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'Z'
)) {
9780 while (*(++p))
9781 if (ASCII_ISLOWER(*p)((unsigned)(*p) >= 'a' && (unsigned)(*p) <= 'z'
)) {
9782 return VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION;
9783 }
9784 return VAR_FLAVOUR_SHADA;
9785 } else {
9786 return VAR_FLAVOUR_DEFAULT;
9787 }
9788}
9789
9790/// Iterate over global variables
9791///
9792/// @warning No modifications to global variable dictionary must be performed
9793/// while iteration is in progress.
9794///
9795/// @param[in] iter Iterator. Pass NULL to start iteration.
9796/// @param[out] name Variable name.
9797/// @param[out] rettv Variable value.
9798///
9799/// @return Pointer that needs to be passed to next `var_shada_iter` invocation
9800/// or NULL to indicate that iteration is over.
9801const void *var_shada_iter(const void *const iter, const char **const name,
9802 typval_T *rettv, var_flavour_T flavour)
9803 FUNC_ATTR_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG(2, 3)
9804{
9805 const hashitem_T *hi;
9806 const hashitem_T *hifirst = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array;
9807 const size_t hinum = (size_t) globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_mask + 1;
9808 *name = NULL((void*)0);
9809 if (iter == NULL((void*)0)) {
9810 hi = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array;
9811 while ((size_t) (hi - hifirst) < hinum
9812 && (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)
9813 || !(var_flavour(hi->hi_key) & flavour))) {
9814 hi++;
9815 }
9816 if ((size_t) (hi - hifirst) == hinum) {
9817 return NULL((void*)0);
9818 }
9819 } else {
9820 hi = (const hashitem_T *) iter;
9821 }
9822 *name = (char *)TV_DICT_HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)))->di_key;
9823 tv_copy(&TV_DICT_HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof(dictitem_T
, di_key)))->di_tv, rettv);
9824 while ((size_t)(++hi - hifirst) < hinum) {
9825 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed) && (var_flavour(hi->hi_key) & flavour)) {
9826 return hi;
9827 }
9828 }
9829 return NULL((void*)0);
9830}
9831
9832void var_set_global(const char *const name, typval_T vartv)
9833{
9834 funccal_entry_T funccall_entry;
9835
9836 save_funccal(&funccall_entry);
9837 set_var(name, strlen(name), &vartv, false0);
9838 restore_funccal();
9839}
9840

; if (f < 0) { f = -f; sign = '-'; } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f"
, this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) {
return 0; } } } } } } } } } } while (0)
9878 sign = '-';do { hashtab_T *const this_varhi_ht_ = (&(&globvardict
)->dv_hashtab); size_t this_varhi_todo_ = this_varhi_ht_->
ht_used; for (hashitem_T *this_varhi_ = this_varhi_ht_->ht_array
; this_varhi_todo_; this_varhi_++) { if (!((this_varhi_)->
hi_key == ((void*)0) || (this_varhi_)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) { this_varhi_todo_--; { { { dictitem_T *
const this_var = ((dictitem_T *)((this_varhi_)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key))); { { if ((this_var->di_tv.v_type ==
VAR_NUMBER || this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING) &&
var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) { char_u
*const p = vim_strsave_escaped( (const char_u *)tv_get_string
(&this_var->di_tv), (const char_u *)"\\\"\n\r"); for (
char_u *t = p; *t != '\000'; t++) { if (*t == '\n') { *t = 'n'
; } else if (*t == '\r') { *t = 'r'; } } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%s%c"
, this_var->di_key, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING
) ? '"' : ' '), p, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING)
? '"' : ' ')) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) { xfree(p); return
0; } xfree(p); } else if (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT
&& var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION
) { float_T f = this_var->di_tv.vval.v_float; int sign = ' '
; if (f < 0) { f = -f; sign = '-'; } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f"
, this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) {
return 0; } } } } } } } } } } while (0)
9879 }do { hashtab_T *const this_varhi_ht_ = (&(&globvardict
)->dv_hashtab); size_t this_varhi_todo_ = this_varhi_ht_->
ht_used; for (hashitem_T *this_varhi_ = this_varhi_ht_->ht_array
; this_varhi_todo_; this_varhi_++) { if (!((this_varhi_)->
hi_key == ((void*)0) || (this_varhi_)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) { this_varhi_todo_--; { { { dictitem_T *
const this_var = ((dictitem_T *)((this_varhi_)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key))); { { if ((this_var->di_tv.v_type ==
VAR_NUMBER || this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING) &&
var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) { char_u
*const p = vim_strsave_escaped( (const char_u *)tv_get_string
(&this_var->di_tv), (const char_u *)"\\\"\n\r"); for (
char_u *t = p; *t != '\000'; t++) { if (*t == '\n') { *t = 'n'
; } else if (*t == '\r') { *t = 'r'; } } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%s%c"
, this_var->di_key, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING
) ? '"' : ' '), p, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING)
? '"' : ' ')) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) { xfree(p); return
0; } xfree(p); } else if (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT
&& var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION
) { float_T f = this_var->di_tv.vval.v_float; int sign = ' '
; if (f < 0) { f = -f; sign = '-'; } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f"
, this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) {
return 0; } } } } } } } } } } while (0)
9880 if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f", this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0)do { hashtab_T *const this_varhi_ht_ = (&(&globvardict
)->dv_hashtab); size_t this_varhi_todo_ = this_varhi_ht_->
ht_used; for (hashitem_T *this_varhi_ = this_varhi_ht_->ht_array
; this_varhi_todo_; this_varhi_++) { if (!((this_varhi_)->
hi_key == ((void*)0) || (this_varhi_)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) { this_varhi_todo_--; { { { dictitem_T *
const this_var = ((dictitem_T *)((this_varhi_)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key))); { { if ((this_var->di_tv.v_type ==
VAR_NUMBER || this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING) &&
var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) { char_u
*const p = vim_strsave_escaped( (const char_u *)tv_get_string
(&this_var->di_tv), (const char_u *)"\\\"\n\r"); for (
char_u *t = p; *t != '\000'; t++) { if (*t == '\n') { *t = 'n'
; } else if (*t == '\r') { *t = 'r'; } } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%s%c"
, this_var->di_key, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING
) ? '"' : ' '), p, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING)
? '"' : ' ')) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) { xfree(p); return
0; } xfree(p); } else if (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT
&& var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION
) { float_T f = this_var->di_tv.vval.v_float; int sign = ' '
; if (f < 0) { f = -f; sign = '-'; } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f"
, this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) {
return 0; } } } } } } } } } } while (0)
9881 || put_eol(fd) == FAIL) {do { hashtab_T *const this_varhi_ht_ = (&(&globvardict
)->dv_hashtab); size_t this_varhi_todo_ = this_varhi_ht_->
ht_used; for (hashitem_T *this_varhi_ = this_varhi_ht_->ht_array
; this_varhi_todo_; this_varhi_++) { if (!((this_varhi_)->
hi_key == ((void*)0) || (this_varhi_)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) { this_varhi_todo_--; { { { dictitem_T *
const this_var = ((dictitem_T *)((this_varhi_)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key))); { { if ((this_var->di_tv.v_type ==
VAR_NUMBER || this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING) &&
var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) { char_u
*const p = vim_strsave_escaped( (const char_u *)tv_get_string
(&this_var->di_tv), (const char_u *)"\\\"\n\r"); for (
char_u *t = p; *t != '\000'; t++) { if (*t == '\n') { *t = 'n'
; } else if (*t == '\r') { *t = 'r'; } } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%s%c"
, this_var->di_key, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING
) ? '"' : ' '), p, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING)
? '"' : ' ')) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) { xfree(p); return
0; } xfree(p); } else if (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT
&& var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION
) { float_T f = this_var->di_tv.vval.v_float; int sign = ' '
; if (f < 0) { f = -f; sign = '-'; } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f"
, this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) {
return 0; } } } } } } } } } } while (0)
9882 return FAIL;do { hashtab_T *const this_varhi_ht_ = (&(&globvardict
)->dv_hashtab); size_t this_varhi_todo_ = this_varhi_ht_->
ht_used; for (hashitem_T *this_varhi_ = this_varhi_ht_->ht_array
; this_varhi_todo_; this_varhi_++) { if (!((this_varhi_)->
hi_key == ((void*)0) || (this_varhi_)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) { this_varhi_todo_--; { { { dictitem_T *
const this_var = ((dictitem_T *)((this_varhi_)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key))); { { if ((this_var->di_tv.v_type ==
VAR_NUMBER || this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING) &&
var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) { char_u
*const p = vim_strsave_escaped( (const char_u *)tv_get_string
(&this_var->di_tv), (const char_u *)"\\\"\n\r"); for (
char_u *t = p; *t != '\000'; t++) { if (*t == '\n') { *t = 'n'
; } else if (*t == '\r') { *t = 'r'; } } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%s%c"
, this_var->di_key, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING
) ? '"' : ' '), p, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING)
? '"' : ' ')) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) { xfree(p); return
0; } xfree(p); } else if (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT
&& var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION
) { float_T f = this_var->di_tv.vval.v_float; int sign = ' '
; if (f < 0) { f = -f; sign = '-'; } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f"
, this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) {
return 0; } } } } } } } } } } while (0)
9883 }do { hashtab_T *const this_varhi_ht_ = (&(&globvardict
)->dv_hashtab); size_t this_varhi_todo_ = this_varhi_ht_->
ht_used; for (hashitem_T *this_varhi_ = this_varhi_ht_->ht_array
; this_varhi_todo_; this_varhi_++) { if (!((this_varhi_)->
hi_key == ((void*)0) || (this_varhi_)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) { this_varhi_todo_--; { { { dictitem_T *
const this_var = ((dictitem_T *)((this_varhi_)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key))); { { if ((this_var->di_tv.v_type ==
VAR_NUMBER || this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING) &&
var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) { char_u
*const p = vim_strsave_escaped( (const char_u *)tv_get_string
(&this_var->di_tv), (const char_u *)"\\\"\n\r"); for (
char_u *t = p; *t != '\000'; t++) { if (*t == '\n') { *t = 'n'
; } else if (*t == '\r') { *t = 'r'; } } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%s%c"
, this_var->di_key, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING
) ? '"' : ' '), p, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING)
? '"' : ' ')) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) { xfree(p); return
0; } xfree(p); } else if (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT
&& var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION
) { float_T f = this_var->di_tv.vval.v_float; int sign = ' '
; if (f < 0) { f = -f; sign = '-'; } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f"
, this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) {
return 0; } } } } } } } } } } while (0)
9884 }do { hashtab_T *const this_varhi_ht_ = (&(&globvardict
)->dv_hashtab); size_t this_varhi_todo_ = this_varhi_ht_->
ht_used; for (hashitem_T *this_varhi_ = this_varhi_ht_->ht_array
; this_varhi_todo_; this_varhi_++) { if (!((this_varhi_)->
hi_key == ((void*)0) || (this_varhi_)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) { this_varhi_todo_--; { { { dictitem_T *
const this_var = ((dictitem_T *)((this_varhi_)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key))); { { if ((this_var->di_tv.v_type ==
VAR_NUMBER || this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING) &&
var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) { char_u
*const p = vim_strsave_escaped( (const char_u *)tv_get_string
(&this_var->di_tv), (const char_u *)"\\\"\n\r"); for (
char_u *t = p; *t != '\000'; t++) { if (*t == '\n') { *t = 'n'
; } else if (*t == '\r') { *t = 'r'; } } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%s%c"
, this_var->di_key, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING
) ? '"' : ' '), p, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING)
? '"' : ' ')) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) { xfree(p); return
0; } xfree(p); } else if (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT
&& var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION
) { float_T f = this_var->di_tv.vval.v_float; int sign = ' '
; if (f < 0) { f = -f; sign = '-'; } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f"
, this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) {
return 0; } } } } } } } } } } while (0)
9885 })do { hashtab_T *const this_varhi_ht_ = (&(&globvardict
)->dv_hashtab); size_t this_varhi_todo_ = this_varhi_ht_->
ht_used; for (hashitem_T *this_varhi_ = this_varhi_ht_->ht_array
; this_varhi_todo_; this_varhi_++) { if (!((this_varhi_)->
hi_key == ((void*)0) || (this_varhi_)->hi_key == (char_u *
)&hash_removed)) { this_varhi_todo_--; { { { dictitem_T *
const this_var = ((dictitem_T *)((this_varhi_)->hi_key - __builtin_offsetof
(dictitem_T, di_key))); { { if ((this_var->di_tv.v_type ==
VAR_NUMBER || this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING) &&
var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) { char_u
*const p = vim_strsave_escaped( (const char_u *)tv_get_string
(&this_var->di_tv), (const char_u *)"\\\"\n\r"); for (
char_u *t = p; *t != '\000'; t++) { if (*t == '\n') { *t = 'n'
; } else if (*t == '\r') { *t = 'r'; } } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%s%c"
, this_var->di_key, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING
) ? '"' : ' '), p, ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING)
? '"' : ' ')) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) { xfree(p); return
0; } xfree(p); } else if (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT
&& var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION
) { float_T f = this_var->di_tv.vval.v_float; int sign = ' '
; if (f < 0) { f = -f; sign = '-'; } if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f"
, this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0) || put_eol(fd) == 0) {
return 0; } } } } } } } } } } while (0);
9886 return OK1;
9887}
9888
9889/*
9890 * Display script name where an item was last set.
9891 * Should only be invoked when 'verbose' is non-zero.
9892 */
9893void last_set_msg(sctx_T script_ctx)
9894{
9895 const LastSet last_set = (LastSet){
9896 .script_ctx = script_ctx,
9897 .channel_id = 0,
9898 };
9899 option_last_set_msg(last_set);
9900}
9901
9902/// Displays where an option was last set.
9903///
9904/// Should only be invoked when 'verbose' is non-zero.
9905void option_last_set_msg(LastSet last_set)
9906{
9907 if (last_set.script_ctx.sc_sid != 0) {
9908 bool_Bool should_free;
9909 char_u *p = get_scriptname(last_set, &should_free);
9910 verbose_enter();
9911 MSG_PUTS(_("\n\tLast set from "))msg_puts((const char *)(gettext((char *)("\n\tLast set from "
))));
9912 MSG_PUTS(p)msg_puts((const char *)(p));
9913 if (last_set.script_ctx.sc_lnum > 0) {
9914 MSG_PUTS(_(line_msg))msg_puts((const char *)(gettext((char *)(line_msg))));
9915 msg_outnum((long)last_set.script_ctx.sc_lnum);
9916 }
9917 if (should_free) {
9918 xfree(p);
9919 }
9920 verbose_leave();
9921 }
9922}
9923
9924// reset v:option_new, v:option_old and v:option_type
9925void reset_v_option_vars(void)
9926{
9927 set_vim_var_string(VV_OPTION_NEW, NULL((void*)0), -1);
9928 set_vim_var_string(VV_OPTION_OLD, NULL((void*)0), -1);
9929 set_vim_var_string(VV_OPTION_TYPE, NULL((void*)0), -1);
9930}
9931
9932/*
9933 * Adjust a filename, according to a string of modifiers.
9934 * *fnamep must be NUL terminated when called. When returning, the length is
9935 * determined by *fnamelen.
9936 * Returns VALID_ flags or -1 for failure.
9937 * When there is an error, *fnamep is set to NULL.
9938 */
9939int
9940modify_fname(
9941 char_u *src, // string with modifiers
9942 bool_Bool tilde_file, // "~" is a file name, not $HOME
9943 size_t *usedlen, // characters after src that are used
9944 char_u **fnamep, // file name so far
9945 char_u **bufp, // buffer for allocated file name or NULL
9946 size_t *fnamelen // length of fnamep
9947)
9948{
9949 int valid = 0;
9950 char_u *tail;
9951 char_u *s, *p, *pbuf;
9952 char_u dirname[MAXPATHL4096];
9953 int c;
9954 int has_fullname = 0;
9955
9956repeat:
9957 // ":p" - full path/file_name
9958 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 'p') {
9959 has_fullname = 1;
9960
9961 valid |= VALID_PATH1;
9962 *usedlen += 2;
9963
9964 // Expand "~/path" for all systems and "~user/path" for Unix
9965 if ((*fnamep)[0] == '~'
9966#if !defined(UNIX)
9967 && ((*fnamep)[1] == '/'
9968# ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
9969 || (*fnamep)[1] == '\\'
9970# endif
9971 || (*fnamep)[1] == NUL'\000')
9972#endif
9973 && !(tilde_file && (*fnamep)[1] == NUL'\000')
9974 ) {
9975 *fnamep = expand_env_save(*fnamep);
9976 xfree(*bufp); // free any allocated file name
9977 *bufp = *fnamep;
9978 if (*fnamep == NULL((void*)0))
9979 return -1;
9980 }
9981
9982 // When "/." or "/.." is used: force expansion to get rid of it.
9983 for (p = *fnamep; *p != NUL'\000'; MB_PTR_ADV(p)(p += utfc_ptr2len((char_u *)p))) {
9984 if (vim_ispathsep(*p)
9985 && p[1] == '.'
9986 && (p[2] == NUL'\000'
9987 || vim_ispathsep(p[2])
9988 || (p[2] == '.'
9989 && (p[3] == NUL'\000' || vim_ispathsep(p[3]))))) {
9990 break;
9991 }
9992 }
9993
9994 // FullName_save() is slow, don't use it when not needed.
9995 if (*p != NUL'\000' || !vim_isAbsName(*fnamep)) {
9996 *fnamep = (char_u *)FullName_save((char *)(*fnamep), *p != NUL'\000');
9997 xfree(*bufp); // free any allocated file name
9998 *bufp = *fnamep;
9999 if (*fnamep == NULL((void*)0))
10000 return -1;
10001 }
10002
10003 // Append a path separator to a directory.
10004 if (os_isdir(*fnamep)) {
10005 // Make room for one or two extra characters.
10006 *fnamep = vim_strnsave(*fnamep, STRLEN(*fnamep)strlen((char *)(*fnamep)) + 2);
10007 xfree(*bufp); // free any allocated file name
10008 *bufp = *fnamep;
10009 if (*fnamep == NULL((void*)0))
10010 return -1;
10011 add_pathsep((char *)*fnamep);
10012 }
10013 }
10014
10015 // ":." - path relative to the current directory
10016 // ":~" - path relative to the home directory
10017 // ":8" - shortname path - postponed till after
10018 while (src[*usedlen] == ':'
10019 && ((c = src[*usedlen + 1]) == '.' || c == '~' || c == '8')) {
10020 *usedlen += 2;
10021 if (c == '8') {
10022 continue;
10023 }
10024 pbuf = NULL((void*)0);
10025 // Need full path first (use expand_env() to remove a "~/")
10026 if (!has_fullname) {
10027 if (c == '.' && **fnamep == '~')
10028 p = pbuf = expand_env_save(*fnamep);
10029 else
10030 p = pbuf = (char_u *)FullName_save((char *)*fnamep, FALSE0);
10031 } else
10032 p = *fnamep;
10033
10034 has_fullname = 0;
10035
10036 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
10037 if (c == '.') {
10038 os_dirname(dirname, MAXPATHL4096);
10039 s = path_shorten_fname(p, dirname);
10040 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
10041 *fnamep = s;
10042 if (pbuf != NULL((void*)0)) {
10043 xfree(*bufp); // free any allocated file name
10044 *bufp = pbuf;
10045 pbuf = NULL((void*)0);
10046 }
10047 }
10048 } else {
10049 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), p, dirname, MAXPATHL4096, true1);
10050 // Only replace it when it starts with '~'
10051 if (*dirname == '~') {
10052 s = vim_strsave(dirname);
10053 *fnamep = s;
10054 xfree(*bufp);
10055 *bufp = s;
10056 }
10057 }
10058 xfree(pbuf);
10059 }
10060 }
10061
10062 tail = path_tail(*fnamep);
10063 *fnamelen = STRLEN(*fnamep)strlen((char *)(*fnamep));
10064
10065 // ":h" - head, remove "/file_name", can be repeated
10066 // Don't remove the first "/" or "c:\"
10067 while (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 'h') {
10068 valid |= VALID_HEAD2;
10069 *usedlen += 2;
10070 s = get_past_head(*fnamep);
10071 while (tail > s && after_pathsep((char *)s, (char *)tail)) {
10072 MB_PTR_BACK(*fnamep, tail)(tail -= utf_head_off((char_u *)*fnamep, (char_u *)tail - 1) +
1);
10073 }
10074 *fnamelen = (size_t)(tail - *fnamep);
10075 if (*fnamelen == 0) {
10076 // Result is empty. Turn it into "." to make ":cd %:h" work.
10077 xfree(*bufp);
10078 *bufp = *fnamep = tail = vim_strsave((char_u *)".");
10079 *fnamelen = 1;
10080 } else {
10081 while (tail > s && !after_pathsep((char *)s, (char *)tail)) {
10082 MB_PTR_BACK(*fnamep, tail)(tail -= utf_head_off((char_u *)*fnamep, (char_u *)tail - 1) +
1);
10083 }
10084 }
10085 }
10086
10087 // ":8" - shortname
10088 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == '8') {
10089 *usedlen += 2;
10090 }
10091
10092
10093 // ":t" - tail, just the basename
10094 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 't') {
10095 *usedlen += 2;
10096 *fnamelen -= (size_t)(tail - *fnamep);
10097 *fnamep = tail;
10098 }
10099
10100 // ":e" - extension, can be repeated
10101 // ":r" - root, without extension, can be repeated
10102 while (src[*usedlen] == ':'
10103 && (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'e' || src[*usedlen + 1] == 'r')) {
10104 /* find a '.' in the tail:
10105 * - for second :e: before the current fname
10106 * - otherwise: The last '.'
10107 */
10108 const bool_Bool is_second_e = *fnamep > tail;
10109 if (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'e' && is_second_e) {
10110 s = *fnamep - 2;
10111 } else {
10112 s = *fnamep + *fnamelen - 1;
10113 }
10114
10115 for (; s > tail; s--) {
10116 if (s[0] == '.') {
10117 break;
10118 }
10119 }
10120 if (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'e') {
10121 if (s > tail || (0 && is_second_e && s == tail)) {
10122 // we stopped at a '.' (so anchor to &'.' + 1)
10123 char_u *newstart = s + 1;
10124 size_t distance_stepped_back = *fnamep - newstart;
10125 *fnamelen += distance_stepped_back;
10126 *fnamep = newstart;
10127 } else if (*fnamep <= tail) {
10128 *fnamelen = 0;
10129 }
10130 } else {
10131 // :r - Remove one extension
10132 //
10133 // Ensure that `s` doesn't go before `*fnamep`,
10134 // since then we're taking too many roots:
10135 //
10136 // "path/to/this.file.ext" :e:e:r:r
10137 // ^ ^-------- *fnamep
10138 // +------------- tail
10139 //
10140 // Also ensure `s` doesn't go before `tail`,
10141 // since then we're taking too many roots again:
10142 //
10143 // "path/to/this.file.ext" :r:r:r
10144 // ^ ^------------- tail
10145 // +--------------------- *fnamep
10146 if (s > MAX(tail, *fnamep)(((tail)>(*fnamep))?(tail):(*fnamep))) {
10147 *fnamelen = (size_t)(s - *fnamep);
10148 }
10149 }
10150 *usedlen += 2;
10151 }
10152
10153 // ":s?pat?foo?" - substitute
10154 // ":gs?pat?foo?" - global substitute
10155 if (src[*usedlen] == ':'
10156 && (src[*usedlen + 1] == 's'
10157 || (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'g' && src[*usedlen + 2] == 's'))) {
10158 int sep;
10159 char_u *flags;
10160 int didit = FALSE0;
10161
10162 flags = (char_u *)"";
10163 s = src + *usedlen + 2;
10164 if (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'g') {
10165 flags = (char_u *)"g";
10166 ++s;
10167 }
10168
10169 sep = *s++;
10170 if (sep) {
10171 // find end of pattern
10172 p = vim_strchr(s, sep);
10173 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
10174 char_u *const pat = vim_strnsave(s, p - s);
10175 s = p + 1;
10176 // find end of substitution
10177 p = vim_strchr(s, sep);
10178 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
10179 char_u *const sub = vim_strnsave(s, p - s);
10180 char_u *const str = vim_strnsave(*fnamep, *fnamelen);
10181 *usedlen = (size_t)(p + 1 - src);
10182 s = do_string_sub(str, pat, sub, NULL((void*)0), flags);
10183 *fnamep = s;
10184 *fnamelen = STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
10185 xfree(*bufp);
10186 *bufp = s;
10187 didit = TRUE1;
10188 xfree(sub);
10189 xfree(str);
10190 }
10191 xfree(pat);
10192 }
10193 // after using ":s", repeat all the modifiers
10194 if (didit) {
10195 goto repeat;
10196 }
10197 }
10198 }
10199
10200 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 'S') {
10201 // vim_strsave_shellescape() needs a NUL terminated string.
10202 c = (*fnamep)[*fnamelen];
10203 if (c != NUL'\000') {
10204 (*fnamep)[*fnamelen] = NUL'\000';
10205 }
10206 p = vim_strsave_shellescape(*fnamep, false0, false0);
10207 if (c != NUL'\000') {
10208 (*fnamep)[*fnamelen] = c;
10209 }
10210 xfree(*bufp);
10211 *bufp = *fnamep = p;
10212 *fnamelen = STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
10213 *usedlen += 2;
10214 }
10215
10216 return valid;
10217}
10218
10219/// Perform a substitution on "str" with pattern "pat" and substitute "sub".
10220/// When "sub" is NULL "expr" is used, must be a VAR_FUNC or VAR_PARTIAL.
10221/// "flags" can be "g" to do a global substitute.
10222/// Returns an allocated string, NULL for error.
10223char_u *do_string_sub(char_u *str, char_u *pat, char_u *sub,
10224 typval_T *expr, char_u *flags)
10225{
10226 int sublen;
10227 regmatch_T regmatch;
10228 int do_all;
10229 char_u *tail;
10230 char_u *end;
10231 garray_T ga;
10232 char_u *save_cpo;
10233 char_u *zero_width = NULL((void*)0);
10234
10235 // Make 'cpoptions' empty, so that the 'l' flag doesn't work here
10236 save_cpo = p_cpo;
10237 p_cpo = empty_option;
10238
10239 ga_init(&ga, 1, 200);
10240
10241 do_all = (flags[0] == 'g');
10242
10243 regmatch.rm_ic = p_ic;
10244 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(pat, RE_MAGIC1 + RE_STRING2);
10245 if (regmatch.regprog != NULL((void*)0)) {
10246 tail = str;
10247 end = str + STRLEN(str)strlen((char *)(str));
10248 while (vim_regexec_nl(&regmatch, str, (colnr_T)(tail - str))) {
10249 // Skip empty match except for first match.
10250 if (regmatch.startp[0] == regmatch.endp[0]) {
10251 if (zero_width == regmatch.startp[0]) {
10252 // avoid getting stuck on a match with an empty string
10253 int i = utfc_ptr2len(tail);
10254 memmove((char_u *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len, tail, (size_t)i);
10255 ga.ga_len += i;
10256 tail += i;
10257 continue;
10258 }
10259 zero_width = regmatch.startp[0];
10260 }
10261
10262 // Get some space for a temporary buffer to do the substitution
10263 // into. It will contain:
10264 // - The text up to where the match is.
10265 // - The substituted text.
10266 // - The text after the match.
10267 sublen = vim_regsub(&regmatch, sub, expr, tail, false0, true1, false0);
10268 ga_grow(&ga, (int)((end - tail) + sublen -
10269 (regmatch.endp[0] - regmatch.startp[0])));
10270
10271 // copy the text up to where the match is
10272 int i = (int)(regmatch.startp[0] - tail);
10273 memmove((char_u *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len, tail, (size_t)i);
10274 // add the substituted text
10275 (void)vim_regsub(&regmatch, sub, expr, (char_u *)ga.ga_data
10276 + ga.ga_len + i, true1, true1, false0);
10277 ga.ga_len += i + sublen - 1;
10278 tail = regmatch.endp[0];
10279 if (*tail == NUL'\000')
10280 break;
10281 if (!do_all)
10282 break;
10283 }
10284
10285 if (ga.ga_data != NULL((void*)0))
10286 STRCPY((char *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len, tail)strcpy((char *)((char *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len), (char *)(tail
));
10287
10288 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
10289 }
10290
10291 char_u *ret = vim_strsave(ga.ga_data == NULL((void*)0) ? str : (char_u *)ga.ga_data);
10292 ga_clear(&ga);
10293 if (p_cpo == empty_option) {
10294 p_cpo = save_cpo;
10295 } else {
10296 // Darn, evaluating {sub} expression or {expr} changed the value.
10297 free_string_option(save_cpo);
10298 }
10299
10300 return ret;
10301}
10302
10303/// common code for getting job callbacks for jobstart, termopen and rpcstart
10304///
10305/// @return true/false on success/failure.
10306bool_Bool common_job_callbacks(dict_T *vopts,
10307 CallbackReader *on_stdout,
10308 CallbackReader *on_stderr,
10309 Callback *on_exit)
10310{
10311 if (tv_dict_get_callback(vopts, S_LEN("on_stdout")("on_stdout"), (sizeof("on_stdout") - 1), &on_stdout->cb)
10312 &&tv_dict_get_callback(vopts, S_LEN("on_stderr")("on_stderr"), (sizeof("on_stderr") - 1), &on_stderr->cb)
10313 && tv_dict_get_callback(vopts, S_LEN("on_exit")("on_exit"), (sizeof("on_exit") - 1), on_exit)) {
10314 on_stdout->buffered = tv_dict_get_number(vopts, "stdout_buffered");
10315 on_stderr->buffered = tv_dict_get_number(vopts, "stderr_buffered");
10316 if (on_stdout->buffered && on_stdout->cb.type == kCallbackNone) {
10317 on_stdout->self = vopts;
10318 }
10319 if (on_stderr->buffered && on_stderr->cb.type == kCallbackNone) {
10320 on_stderr->self = vopts;
10321 }
10322 vopts->dv_refcount++;
10323 return true1;
10324 }
10325
10326 callback_reader_free(on_stdout);
10327 callback_reader_free(on_stderr);
10328 callback_free(on_exit);
10329 return false0;
10330}
10331
10332
10333Channel *find_job(uint64_t id, bool_Bool show_error)
10334{
10335 Channel *data = find_channel(id);
10336 if (!data || data->streamtype != kChannelStreamProc
10337 || process_is_stopped(&data->stream.proc)) {
10338 if (show_error) {
10339 if (data && data->streamtype != kChannelStreamProc) {
10340 EMSG(_(e_invchanjob))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invchanjob))));
10341 } else {
10342 EMSG(_(e_invchan))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invchan))));
10343 }
10344 }
10345 return NULL((void*)0);
10346 }
10347 return data;
10348}
10349
10350
10351void script_host_eval(char *name, typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
10352{
10353 if (check_secure()) {
10354 return;
10355 }
10356
10357 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_STRING) {
10358 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
10359 return;
10360 }
10361
10362 list_T *args = tv_list_alloc(1);
10363 tv_list_append_string(args, (const char *)argvars[0].vval.v_string, -1);
10364 *rettv = eval_call_provider(name, "eval", args, false0);
10365}
10366
10367/// @param discard Clears the value returned by the provider and returns
10368/// an empty typval_T.
10369typval_T eval_call_provider(char *provider, char *method, list_T *arguments,
10370 bool_Bool discard)
10371{
10372 if (!eval_has_provider(provider)) {
10373 emsgf("E319: No \"%s\" provider found. Run \":checkhealth provider\"",
10374 provider);
10375 return (typval_T){
10376 .v_type = VAR_NUMBER,
10377 .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED,
10378 .vval.v_number = (varnumber_T)0
10379 };
10380 }
10381
10382 char func[256];
10383 int name_len = snprintf(func, sizeof(func), "provider#%s#Call", provider);
10384
10385 // Save caller scope information
10386 struct caller_scope saved_provider_caller_scope = provider_caller_scope;
10387 provider_caller_scope = (struct caller_scope) {
10388 .script_ctx = current_sctx,
10389 .sourcing_name = sourcing_name,
10390 .sourcing_lnum = sourcing_lnum,
10391 .autocmd_fname = autocmd_fname,
10392 .autocmd_match = autocmd_match,
10393 .autocmd_bufnr = autocmd_bufnr,
10394 .funccalp = (void *)get_current_funccal()
10395 };
10396 funccal_entry_T funccal_entry;
10397 save_funccal(&funccal_entry);
10398 provider_call_nesting++;
10399
10400 typval_T argvars[3] = {
10401 { .v_type = VAR_STRING, .vval.v_string = (char_u *)method,
10402 .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED },
10403 { .v_type = VAR_LIST, .vval.v_list = arguments, .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED },
10404 { .v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN }
10405 };
10406 typval_T rettv = { .v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN, .v_lock = VAR_UNLOCKED };
10407 tv_list_ref(arguments);
10408
10409 int dummy;
10410 (void)call_func((const char_u *)func,
10411 name_len,
10412 &rettv,
10413 2,
10414 argvars,
10415 NULL((void*)0),
10416 curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
10417 curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
10418 &dummy,
10419 true1,
10420 NULL((void*)0),
10421 NULL((void*)0));
10422
10423 tv_list_unref(arguments);
10424 // Restore caller scope information
10425 restore_funccal();
10426 provider_caller_scope = saved_provider_caller_scope;
10427 provider_call_nesting--;
10428 assert(provider_call_nesting >= 0)((void) sizeof ((provider_call_nesting >= 0) ? 1 : 0), __extension__
({ if (provider_call_nesting >= 0) ; else __assert_fail (
"provider_call_nesting >= 0", "../src/nvim/eval.c", 10428,
__extension__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__); }));
10429
10430 if (discard) {
10431 tv_clear(&rettv);
10432 }
10433
10434 return rettv;
10435}
10436
10437/// Checks if provider for feature `feat` is enabled.
10438bool_Bool eval_has_provider(const char *feat)
10439{
10440 if (!strequal(feat, "clipboard")
10441 && !strequal(feat, "python")
10442 && !strequal(feat, "python3")
10443 && !strequal(feat, "python_compiled")
10444 && !strequal(feat, "python_dynamic")
10445 && !strequal(feat, "python3_compiled")
10446 && !strequal(feat, "python3_dynamic")
10447 && !strequal(feat, "perl")
10448 && !strequal(feat, "ruby")
10449 && !strequal(feat, "node")) {
10450 // Avoid autoload for non-provider has() features.
10451 return false0;
10452 }
10453
10454 char name[32]; // Normalized: "python_compiled" => "python".
10455 snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "%s", feat);
10456 strchrsub(name, '_', '\0'); // Chop any "_xx" suffix.
10457
10458 char buf[256];
10459 typval_T tv;
10460 // Get the g:loaded_xx_provider variable.
10461 int len = snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "g:loaded_%s_provider", name);
10462 if (get_var_tv(buf, len, &tv, NULL((void*)0), false0, true1) == FAIL0) {
10463 // Trigger autoload once.
10464 len = snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "provider#%s#bogus", name);
10465 script_autoload(buf, len, false0);
10466
10467 // Retry the (non-autoload-style) variable.
10468 len = snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "g:loaded_%s_provider", name);
10469 if (get_var_tv(buf, len, &tv, NULL((void*)0), false0, true1) == FAIL0) {
10470 // Show a hint if Call() is defined but g:loaded_xx_provider is missing.
10471 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "provider#%s#Call", name);
10472 if (!!find_func((char_u *)buf) && p_lpl) {
10473 emsgf("provider: %s: missing required variable g:loaded_%s_provider",
10474 name, name);
10475 }
10476 return false0;
10477 }
10478 }
10479
10480 bool_Bool ok = (tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER)
10481 ? 2 == tv.vval.v_number // Value of 2 means "loaded and working".
10482 : false0;
10483
10484 if (ok) {
10485 // Call() must be defined if provider claims to be working.
10486 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "provider#%s#Call", name);
10487 if (!find_func((char_u *)buf)) {
10488 emsgf("provider: %s: g:loaded_%s_provider=2 but %s is not defined",
10489 name, name, buf);
10490 ok = false0;
10491 }
10492 }
10493
10494 return ok;
10495}
10496
10497/// Writes "<sourcing_name>:<sourcing_lnum>" to `buf[bufsize]`.
10498void eval_fmt_source_name_line(char *buf, size_t bufsize)
10499{
10500 if (sourcing_name) {
10501 snprintf(buf, bufsize, "%s:%" PRIdLINENR"ld", sourcing_name, sourcing_lnum);
10502 } else {
10503 snprintf(buf, bufsize, "?");
10504 }
10505}
10506
10507/// ":checkhealth [plugins]"
10508void ex_checkhealth(exarg_T *eap)
10509{
10510 bool_Bool found = !!find_func((char_u *)"health#check");
10511 if (!found
10512 && script_autoload("health#check", sizeof("health#check") - 1, false0)) {
10513 found = !!find_func((char_u *)"health#check");
10514 }
10515 if (!found) {
10516 const char *vimruntime_env = os_getenv("VIMRUNTIME");
10517 if (vimruntime_env == NULL((void*)0)) {
10518 EMSG(_("E5009: $VIMRUNTIME is empty or unset"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E5009: $VIMRUNTIME is empty or unset"
))));
10519 } else {
10520 bool_Bool rtp_ok = NULL((void*)0) != strstr((char *)p_rtp, vimruntime_env);
10521 if (rtp_ok) {
10522 EMSG2(_("E5009: Invalid $VIMRUNTIME: %s"), vimruntime_env)emsgf((const char *) (gettext((char *)("E5009: Invalid $VIMRUNTIME: %s"
))), (vimruntime_env));
10523 } else {
10524 EMSG(_("E5009: Invalid 'runtimepath'"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E5009: Invalid 'runtimepath'"
))));
10525 }
10526 }
10527 return;
10528 }
10529
10530 size_t bufsize = STRLEN(eap->arg)strlen((char *)(eap->arg)) + sizeof("call health#check('')");
10531 char *buf = xmalloc(bufsize);
10532 snprintf(buf, bufsize, "call health#check('%s')", eap->arg);
10533
10534 do_cmdline_cmd(buf);
10535
10536 xfree(buf);
10537}
10538
10539void invoke_prompt_callback(void)
10540{
10541 typval_T rettv;
10542 typval_T argv[2];
10543 char_u *text;
10544 char_u *prompt;
10545 linenr_T lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
10546
10547 // Add a new line for the prompt before invoking the callback, so that
10548 // text can always be inserted above the last line.
10549 ml_append(lnum, (char_u *)"", 0, false0);
10550 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum + 1;
10551 curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
10552
10553 if (curbuf->b_prompt_callback.type == kCallbackNone) {
10554 return;
10555 }
10556 text = ml_get(lnum);
10557 prompt = prompt_text();
10558 if (STRLEN(text)strlen((char *)(text)) >= STRLEN(prompt)strlen((char *)(prompt))) {
10559 text += STRLEN(prompt)strlen((char *)(prompt));
10560 }
10561 argv[0].v_type = VAR_STRING;
10562 argv[0].vval.v_string = vim_strsave(text);
10563 argv[1].v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
10564
10565 callback_call(&curbuf->b_prompt_callback, 1, argv, &rettv);
10566 tv_clear(&argv[0]);
10567 tv_clear(&rettv);
10568}
10569
10570// Return true When the interrupt callback was invoked.
10571bool_Bool invoke_prompt_interrupt(void)
10572{
10573 typval_T rettv;
10574 typval_T argv[1];
10575
10576 if (curbuf->b_prompt_interrupt.type == kCallbackNone) {
10577 return false0;
10578 }
10579 argv[0].v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
10580
10581 got_int = false0; // don't skip executing commands
10582 callback_call(&curbuf->b_prompt_interrupt, 0, argv, &rettv);
10583 tv_clear(&rettv);
10584 return true1;
10585}
10586
10587// Compare "typ1" and "typ2". Put the result in "typ1".
10588int typval_compare(
10589 typval_T *typ1, // first operand
10590 typval_T *typ2, // second operand
10591 exprtype_T type, // operator
10592 bool_Bool ic // ignore case
10593)
10594 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
10595{
10596 varnumber_T n1, n2;
10597 const bool_Bool type_is = type == EXPR_IS || type == EXPR_ISNOT;
10598
10599 if (type_is && typ1->v_type != typ2->v_type) {
10600 // For "is" a different type always means false, for "notis"
10601 // it means true.
10602 n1 = type == EXPR_ISNOT;
10603 } else if (typ1->v_type == VAR_LIST || typ2->v_type == VAR_LIST) {
10604 if (type_is) {
10605 n1 = typ1->v_type == typ2->v_type
10606 && typ1->vval.v_list == typ2->vval.v_list;
10607 if (type == EXPR_ISNOT) {
10608 n1 = !n1;
10609 }
10610 } else if (typ1->v_type != typ2->v_type
10611 || (type != EXPR_EQUAL && type != EXPR_NEQUAL)) {
10612 if (typ1->v_type != typ2->v_type) {
10613 EMSG(_("E691: Can only compare List with List"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E691: Can only compare List with List"
))));
10614 } else {
10615 EMSG(_("E692: Invalid operation for List"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E692: Invalid operation for List"
))));
10616 }
10617 tv_clear(typ1);
10618 return FAIL0;
10619 } else {
10620 // Compare two Lists for being equal or unequal.
10621 n1 = tv_list_equal(typ1->vval.v_list, typ2->vval.v_list, ic, false0);
10622 if (type == EXPR_NEQUAL) {
10623 n1 = !n1;
10624 }
10625 }
10626 } else if (typ1->v_type == VAR_DICT || typ2->v_type == VAR_DICT) {
10627 if (type_is) {
10628 n1 = typ1->v_type == typ2->v_type
10629 && typ1->vval.v_dict == typ2->vval.v_dict;
10630 if (type == EXPR_ISNOT) {
10631 n1 = !n1;
10632 }
10633 } else if (typ1->v_type != typ2->v_type
10634 || (type != EXPR_EQUAL && type != EXPR_NEQUAL)) {
10635 if (typ1->v_type != typ2->v_type) {
10636 EMSG(_("E735: Can only compare Dictionary with Dictionary"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E735: Can only compare Dictionary with Dictionary"
))));
10637 } else {
10638 EMSG(_("E736: Invalid operation for Dictionary"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E736: Invalid operation for Dictionary"
))));
10639 }
10640 tv_clear(typ1);
10641 return FAIL0;
10642 } else {
10643 // Compare two Dictionaries for being equal or unequal.
10644 n1 = tv_dict_equal(typ1->vval.v_dict, typ2->vval.v_dict, ic, false0);
10645 if (type == EXPR_NEQUAL) {
10646 n1 = !n1;
10647 }
10648 }
10649 } else if (tv_is_func(*typ1) || tv_is_func(*typ2)) {
10650 if (type != EXPR_EQUAL && type != EXPR_NEQUAL
10651 && type != EXPR_IS && type != EXPR_ISNOT) {
10652 EMSG(_("E694: Invalid operation for Funcrefs"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E694: Invalid operation for Funcrefs"
))));
10653 tv_clear(typ1);
10654 return FAIL0;
10655 }
10656 if ((typ1->v_type == VAR_PARTIAL && typ1->vval.v_partial == NULL((void*)0))
10657 || (typ2->v_type == VAR_PARTIAL && typ2->vval.v_partial == NULL((void*)0))) {
10658 // when a partial is NULL assume not equal
10659 n1 = false0;
10660 } else if (type_is) {
10661 if (typ1->v_type == VAR_FUNC && typ2->v_type == VAR_FUNC) {
10662 // strings are considered the same if their value is
10663 // the same
10664 n1 = tv_equal(typ1, typ2, ic, false0);
10665 } else if (typ1->v_type == VAR_PARTIAL && typ2->v_type == VAR_PARTIAL) {
10666 n1 = typ1->vval.v_partial == typ2->vval.v_partial;
10667 } else {
10668 n1 = false0;
10669 }
10670 } else {
10671 n1 = tv_equal(typ1, typ2, ic, false0);
10672 }
10673 if (type == EXPR_NEQUAL || type == EXPR_ISNOT) {
10674 n1 = !n1;
10675 }
10676 } else if ((typ1->v_type == VAR_FLOAT || typ2->v_type == VAR_FLOAT)
10677 && type != EXPR_MATCH && type != EXPR_NOMATCH) {
10678 // If one of the two variables is a float, compare as a float.
10679 // When using "=~" or "!~", always compare as string.
10680 const float_T f1 = tv_get_float(typ1);
10681 const float_T f2 = tv_get_float(typ2);
10682 n1 = false0;
10683 switch (type) {
10684 case EXPR_IS:
10685 case EXPR_EQUAL: n1 = f1 == f2; break;
10686 case EXPR_ISNOT:
10687 case EXPR_NEQUAL: n1 = f1 != f2; break;
10688 case EXPR_GREATER: n1 = f1 > f2; break;
10689 case EXPR_GEQUAL: n1 = f1 >= f2; break;
10690 case EXPR_SMALLER: n1 = f1 < f2; break;
10691 case EXPR_SEQUAL: n1 = f1 <= f2; break;
10692 case EXPR_UNKNOWN:
10693 case EXPR_MATCH:
10694 case EXPR_NOMATCH: break; // avoid gcc warning
10695 }
10696 } else if ((typ1->v_type == VAR_NUMBER || typ2->v_type == VAR_NUMBER)
10697 && type != EXPR_MATCH && type != EXPR_NOMATCH) {
10698 // If one of the two variables is a number, compare as a number.
10699 // When using "=~" or "!~", always compare as string.
10700 n1 = tv_get_number(typ1);
10701 n2 = tv_get_number(typ2);
10702 switch (type) {
10703 case EXPR_IS:
10704 case EXPR_EQUAL: n1 = n1 == n2; break;
10705 case EXPR_ISNOT:
10706 case EXPR_NEQUAL: n1 = n1 != n2; break;
10707 case EXPR_GREATER: n1 = n1 > n2; break;
10708 case EXPR_GEQUAL: n1 = n1 >= n2; break;
10709 case EXPR_SMALLER: n1 = n1 < n2; break;
10710 case EXPR_SEQUAL: n1 = n1 <= n2; break;
10711 case EXPR_UNKNOWN:
10712 case EXPR_MATCH:
10713 case EXPR_NOMATCH: break; // avoid gcc warning
10714 }
10715 } else {
10716 char buf1[NUMBUFLEN];
10717 char buf2[NUMBUFLEN];
10718 const char *const s1 = tv_get_string_buf(typ1, buf1);
10719 const char *const s2 = tv_get_string_buf(typ2, buf2);
10720 int i;
10721 if (type != EXPR_MATCH && type != EXPR_NOMATCH) {
10722 i = mb_strcmp_ic(ic, s1, s2);
10723 } else {
10724 i = 0;
10725 }
10726 n1 = false0;
10727 switch (type) {
10728 case EXPR_IS:
10729 case EXPR_EQUAL: n1 = i == 0; break;
10730 case EXPR_ISNOT:
10731 case EXPR_NEQUAL: n1 = i != 0; break;
10732 case EXPR_GREATER: n1 = i > 0; break;
10733 case EXPR_GEQUAL: n1 = i >= 0; break;
10734 case EXPR_SMALLER: n1 = i < 0; break;
10735 case EXPR_SEQUAL: n1 = i <= 0; break;
10736
10737 case EXPR_MATCH:
10738 case EXPR_NOMATCH:
10739 n1 = pattern_match((char_u *)s2, (char_u *)s1, ic);
10740 if (type == EXPR_NOMATCH) {
10741 n1 = !n1;
10742 }
10743 break;
10744 case EXPR_UNKNOWN: break; // avoid gcc warning
10745 }
10746 }
10747 tv_clear(typ1);
10748 typ1->v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
10749 typ1->vval.v_number = n1;
10750 return OK1;
10751}
10752
10753char *typval_tostring(typval_T *arg)
10754{
10755 if (arg == NULL((void*)0)) {
10756 return xstrdup("(does not exist)");
10757 }
10758 return encode_tv2string(arg, NULL((void*)0));
10759}
10760
10761bool_Bool var_exists(const char *var)
10762 FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ALL
10763{
10764 char *tofree;
10765 bool_Bool n = false0;
10766
10767 // get_name_len() takes care of expanding curly braces
10768 const char *name = var;
10769 const int len = get_name_len((const char **)&var, &tofree, true1, false0);
10770 if (len > 0) {
10771 typval_T tv;
10772
10773 if (tofree != NULL((void*)0)) {
10774 name = tofree;
10775 }
10776 n = get_var_tv(name, len, &tv, NULL((void*)0), false0, true1) == OK1;
10777 if (n) {
10778 // Handle d.key, l[idx], f(expr).
10779 n = handle_subscript(&var, &tv, true1, false0) == OK1;
10780 if (n) {
10781 tv_clear(&tv);
10782 }
10783 }
10784 }
10785 if (*var != NUL'\000') {
10786 n = false0;
10787 }
10788
10789 xfree(tofree);
10790 return n;
10791}
